string.text: I think I remember how to get inside.\nSomewhere here, in the underground there's an anomaly that can teleport you right inside the stash. I think this anomaly is where the pipe ends. You absolutely need to have an artifact activated on your belt. "Sparkler", I think.

I think I remember how to get inside.\nSomewhere here, in the underground there's an anomaly that can teleport you right inside the stash. I think this anomaly is where the pipe ends. You absolutely need to have an artifact activated on your belt. "Stone Blood", I think.

I think I remember how to get inside.\nSomewhere here, in the underground there's an anomaly that can teleport you right inside the stash. I think this anomaly is where the pipe ends. You absolutely need to have an artifact activated on your belt. "Wrenched", I think.

Buddy, I'm going underground for some time. My deputy, Ivantsov, has been constantly watching me lately. I think until he's eliminated we need to shut down our affairs. Our client remained very pleased with the last delivery and reports that fifty thousand dollars has been credited to your account. Since dollars aren't valued in the Zone, here's some local money and a small present to relax

Drank some of that concoction, they say... Haven't been this messed up in a long time. But as my head cleared, one memory surfaced so vividly and in such detail, as if it happened yesterday, though I'd swear on anything - it was long ago, definitely before Redhead found me by the truck...\nI was looking once for a place to spend the night. Wandered onto a farmstead, there was a cellar - seemed dry, didn't stink of anything, not even rats. Started looking around and discovered in the corner, behind an old rotten crate, a torn tactical vest covered with long-dried blood, worn combat boots, some other rags, and a worn officer's map case. Looked like someone had looted a soldier and thrown away what wasn't useful. Nothing valuable, of course, but inside the map case I found a photograph with writing on the back: "you'll pick up the last order in a week here". Looks like the vicinity of that checkpoint on Cordon. I remember thinking that apparently the smugglers had someone from the military on payroll there... was. There's probably a stash by that water tower. Maybe something valuable is still lying there, since the owner of the map case is apparently long dead. Should get there quietly and check... if, of course, I haven't already been there and conveniently forgotten about it.

"Order from the project leader "Truth",
 Colonel SBU Kruchelnikov V. M.

 In connection with the special conditions of the global experiment, during its conduct, block doors to potentially dangerous rooms with a special code. At the most important objects, establish permanently operating guard posts. Allow personnel entry only after complete confidence in workers' sanity. Do not show personnel the entry code...
 
 4. For entry to the central control post, code 13698...
 
 For exiting the premises, employees will need to pass a simple check in the form of a small test. The door code is the sequence of digits of correct answers.
 
 Colonel SBU Kruchelnikov V. M.
 Agreed with the person responsible for scientific work of the complex
 Doctor of Agricultural Sciences Strizh P.D."

"Order from the project leader "Truth",
 Colonel SBU Kruchelnikov V. M.

 Strengthen security measures at all levels of objects related to studying the effects of the new emitter. Remove all personnel not directly connected with ensuring the project.
 
 ...
 12. For entry to laboratory X-8, establish code 23486...
 
 ...
 Colonel SBU Kruchelnikov V. M.
 Agreed with the person responsible for scientific work of the complex
 Doctor of Agricultural Sciences Strizh P.D."
Should I take a nap?
Look through contents
Let me see what I got here.
Anyone there?
Open door
Dogs and tushkanos attacked, barely escaped! Had to drop the container.\n I remember the place - before reaching the pig farm, to the right of the road, near a distinctive stump.
Hey there... How you doing, lucky one? I see you're standing on your feet already. I wasn't hoping for it, thought we'd have another cross on our cemetery, with the inscription "Unknown stalker"!
Good health to you too. Sometimes it gets dark in my eyes, but otherwise seems normal.

Yeah... Doc worked another miracle.
Your face, between you and me, your own mother wouldn't recognize! Well, never mind, we're not in a beauty salon.
When you see Redhead - thank him! If not for him, you'd have been a good dinner for the local dogs.
What's your name?
Mine? Don't know... Don't remember a damn thing... Who am I and where is this?

Don't remember? Strange... Then you'll be Marked by the Zone, or simply Marked One for now. The Zone sure left its marks on you... Can't count them all!\nCall me Sidorovich, I trade here, help stalkers.\nI spent money on you, Marked One! So honestly speaking, you'd need to work it off. Got any strength left?
Yeah, I don't mind, I can dig a garden, bring water.

Joking? Means you're on the mend.\nYou're still too weak to dig gardens!\nThis is the ZONE, bro. Our Cordon is the Zone's anteroom, you could say. Not too dangerous, but don't get cocky. Anomalies, mutants, artifacts, monolith - do such words mean anything to you?
I think I remember... Artifacts? Money for them?

Exactly! You got to the essence! Anyway, you'll have a simple task for now.\nWhen you exit the bunker, turn left and climb up the hill. Kolyan Dove told me he saw some glint there in the fog. Maybe an artifact. Dove himself didn't go - got scared, it radiates a bit there... Bring it - then we'll think if we can do business with you.
I don't have anything, what should I do if something happens?
What could happen there? You have bolts. I'll give you a knife... a very good one.\nYes! Do you at least remember that artifacts can shock you?
How's that? Made of glass or what?

Yeah, made of glass... Your eyes will be glass when you take an artifact without protective means.\nYeah... Glass... You made the old man laugh.\nAnyway, let me remind you: an artifact is a strange thing, special, not of this world! When it appears, the energy in it is dark, you understand? And when a person takes such a "fresh" artifact, he can get hit by that same energy. Sometimes weak, sometimes more serious, and sometimes you can kick the bucket! True, right after an Emission they don't shock. Apparently they ripen. So watch it, Marked One, if you're weak in health, better rest up. Just in case!
Thanks for the warning. Sidorovich, I'm here, well... you know...
What "you know"? What are you muttering under your nose?
Stas told me you won't let me die of hunger. I'm hungry as hell - no strength left.

Oh my! Stas told him... Alright, our patient, here, have a bite, or you'll really die of starvation - did I invest in you for nothing? But remember - first and last time. This is the Zone - you have to pay for everything, literally and figuratively. That's it! Go get that artifact.
Thanks for that, I suppose. I'll go see what these artifacts are about.
Oh my! Stas told him... This isn't a free cafeteria. Go get that artifact.
I'll go see what these artifacts are about.
You're back... Where's the artifact?
I didn't find any artifact.
Found something spiky, is this it?
Ah! This is "Jellyfish", so-so artifact. Cheap. First level. And looks like it's degenerated too. That is, lost all anomalous properties. Sometimes that happens...
Degenerated? Well, okay. What does "first level" mean?
Here, found this black thing, what is it?
Ah! This is "Droplet", so-so artifact... Cheap. First level... Makes you tired, feel it?
That's why I'm looking terrible... What does "first level" mean?
Here, found this brown thing, what is it?
Ah! This is "Wrenched", so-so artifact... Cheap. First level... Bit radioactive, hope you didn't carry it in your pants?
That's why I'm looking terrible... What does "first level" mean?
Found something mangled, what is it?
Ah! This is "Stone Blood", so-so artifact... Cheap. First level... When you wear it, skin tears from the slightest damage...
That's why I'm looking terrible... What does "first level" mean?
Some kind of spike thing, what is it?
Well yes, spiky! This is "Thorn", so-so artifact... Cheap. First level... True, the prick from it is painfully strong - feeling normal?
Yeah, got scratched when I picked it up... Still bleeding... What does "first level" mean?
Here, found this little blue ball, what is it?
Ah! This "ball" is called "Sparkler", so-so artifact... Cheap. First level... It drains energy from people, are you hungry?
Exactly! I'm hungry as hell - no escape! What does "first level" mean?
Some snotty crap turned up. What's this?
Hmm... This snot is called "Slime", so-so artifact... Cheap. First level... True, God forbid you get burned with such an artifact - you'll burn up immediately.
That's why I felt terrible when I passed by the campfire... What does "first level" mean?
Found something mangled, what is it?
Oh! Nice artifact... Better than first level... For such a one I'll give you a nice pile of cash next time...
Oh my!... What does artifact "first" or whatever level mean?
Hmm, seems it's too early to do business with you, go rest up, and look some more...
Don't grumble... I'll find it.

Seems you got hit real hard in the head... "First level" means the cheapest artifacts. Like "Jellyfish", "Stone Blood", or such. You won't earn much on them, because they're found quite often, and their anomalous properties are weak. "Second level" - already better! "Meat Chunk", "Flash"... Yeah... There's also "third level" - you won't find those just like that. They only come in shells, but for them you can raise good money.\nUse your brains! If you're a Stalker, you should know all these concepts anyway. Although... you're our brain-damaged one. Here, take this interesting little book. Everything about artifacts is written here, with pictures. Take a look.
Thanks, I'll definitely look. Ah! I remembered! Artifacts deflect bullets!

Remembered, eh? Means you're definitely getting better. Artifacts have all kinds of properties. Some, as you correctly said, help protect from bullets, others make carried weight lighter, third ones let you jump further...\nBut for an artifact to "work", it needs to be sparked by an electrical discharge. For this, local craftsmen make special belts, and attach mesh cells for artifacts to them. In such a belt there's a converter that brings a spark from the battery to the artifact.\nHow many artifacts to wear at once, everyone decides for themselves. There's one catch here. Absolute protection doesn't exist, this is an ax-i-om. I don't know exactly how it works, I don't have academic degrees, but one graduate student who often drops by to get some "of this stuff" claims that the more artifacts with identical protective properties you have on your belt, the less positive effect each subsequent one will have, after reaching a certain threshold. So there... And the artifact mesh also has weight, you shouldn't forget about that either. Therefore it's not always reasonable to walk like a ballerina in such a "tutu" of artifact meshes. Two, three meshes - normal thing. But four or more are rarely hung on the belt, if you have a head on your shoulders, not a head of cabbage.
Belt with meshes? Hmm... How do you get one?
How-how... Buy, trade, earn... or take it off some stiff. A dead man doesn't need it anymore.
Off a stiff?! I'll keep that in mind.
Do you have any plans at all? What are you going to do?
I have nowhere to return to, who I am - I don't know yet. Doc said I need to look for those who can revive my memory.

That's true... Only people don't live long in the Zone, believe me - I know. I think you need to make your way to the center. There you can mainly meet those who have already walked this Zone far and wide. Maybe you'll find someone who can give answers to your questions. And maybe someone will recognize you.
Seems that's how it'll have to be.
For life in the Zone you need a lot of things, first of all - weapons. Want to earn some?
It's not about wanting - it's a necessity. What needs to be done?

One stalker, a complete newbie... they found someone to entrust it to... Anyway, a courier was carrying an artifact to me. Only he didn't deliver it! Came running to the camp, shaking all over, wet, pale. As I understood, he passed the bridge, but then... Says a bunch of monsters attacked, had to drop the container. Either near the old elevator, or near the ATP... Seems he completely lost his head from fear. One word - Butterfingers! You should go to him, maybe he'll tell you more coherently. He's around here somewhere, hiding in the village, damn him...\nThe artifact there is unique, and it's a good container - worth big money! Just don't dawdle, drag it right away when you find it. If you bring it, so be it - you'll get a gun.\nI'm giving you a medkit with bandages, just in case.
Butterfingers, you say... I'll go look for this newbie.
Listen, Sidorovich, creatures are running around there, and I don't even have weapons! And I don't feel like I have strength for heroics yet...
Yes! Wait a bit. Good advice for you. Notice, I'm giving it for free! Don't mess with the local military! We have an unspoken agreement here: we don't touch them, they don't touch us. Got it?
What the hell do I need them for?!
So, did you find the container? Is the artifact in it?
Found it, found it. This container?

Yeah... Looks like you're really still too weak to wander the Zone. You know Wolf? He's like a father figure to the newbies here. Go to him - have a chat, maybe he'll help you with a decent gun. And I'll send someone else for the container, don't bother.
Wolf? I'll go meet him.
Uh, looks like that Wolf kicked the bucket.

How's that? He was an experienced stalker! What a mess. He owed me something... You're saying you'd want a better gun? There's this one job here, left unfinished by Wolf, eternal memory to him. So, how about it? Shall we figure something out?
You'd better, respected sir, get to the point...

Hmm. Right - fewer words, more action. Need to find one document. One of Wolf's men disappeared with this document. As I was told - not very far, in a tunnel under the railway track north of here. Wolf himself wanted to go, but you see - such bad luck... So, here's the deal: there are documents from one old trader - there's an assault rifle for Marked One, no documents - no assault rifle for free... Fair enough?
Found a speed demon, alright, I'll try...
My eyes are already going dark, find someone else...
Someone else? Well then, alright. Go, sick one, get your health back...
You... don't be mad, I really feel terrible.
No container! Someone probably dragged it off.

That's, bitch... Well, never mind, Butterfingers will work that container off to me! He'll remember it forever...\nYou should get a better gun or something. Wolf is looking for a volunteer to hop over not far from here, promised some kind of assault rifle... Talk to him...
Wolf? Alright, we'll see...
But the artifact? Open it up, take a look. Otherwise who knows... Maybe it's empty.
It's there, burns like hell! Take it quick.
Huh? Open it? Wait, let me.
Container? Haven't found it yet. I'll keep looking...
What can I say... Well done, Marked One! Here, take a pistol and a couple packs of ammo for it. Honestly earned.\nGot a bit scorched, you say?\nTake some antirad - it'll get better.
Thank you, of course, only...

Stop, where are you shoving those cartridges in your backpack! By the time you get them out, they'll tear you apart and eat you ten times over. Here, take this belt with an ammo pouch. Eh, what a head! Two ears... I think you won't forget my kindness again.

Stop, where are you shoving those cartridges in your backpack! By the time you get them out, they'll tear you apart and eat you ten times over. You have an ammo pouch. Load the magazine and put it in the pouch, one, two and you're reloaded!
Yeah, somehow I... Sidorovich, the pistol isn't very serious weapon.

And I'm not the "Red Cross". If I give everyone a good gun for free, I'll go bankrupt, God forbid.\nGo to Wolf, he's the elder here, in the camp. He was looking for a man for one assignment, maybe you'll come to an agreement.
Let's see what kind of Wolf this is.
Listen, Marked One, we have a little problem here, there's a chance to distinguish yourself.
What do I care about your problems?

Judge for yourself: you help me, and I'll help you. Maybe I'll learn about someone who could have known you.\nSo far the only thread to your past is that you kept repeating Strelok's name in delirium. And about Strelok and his team there were all kinds of rumors at one time.
Here you calculated me correctly - I can't live with a "black hole" instead of memory. So what do you need from me?

So here's the thing, Marked One. One courier - called Nimble - was carrying some information to me. And disappeared. Right nearby, under our nose, because there was a message from him saying he was already on Cordon. I don't know what to think. Maybe he decided to dump the info to someone else or he's sitting drinking vodka? In short: find Nimble, alive or dead - main thing is that the flash drive is with him. Bring me the flash drive. Nimble was one of Wolf's men, ask around, maybe someone knows something.
Agreed.
Marked One, what are you doing here? I told you: go look for Nimble!
I already found him. Here's the flash drive.
Wait with the pressure, I need to stock up on some things.
Money, artifacts - what do you have?
I found him already, his corpse.
I found him already, his corpse.

What corpse? What about the flash drive? Information? Where?\nUgh... Something's been going wrong lately. Yeah. Well alright, you didn't refuse to help, here take this simple tactical vest from me. It's more convenient to run around the Zone with it. You can try to get a special forces model through the soldiers later. There are extra pockets there, and more fits in them.\nThat's it, go now. If you need anything - drop by, we'll discuss it, to mutual benefit.

What corpse? What about the flash drive? Information? Where?\nUgh... Something's been going wrong lately. Yeah.\nWell. God gave, God took. Fate. Well, and you... Anyway, if you need anything - drop by.

What corpse? What about the flash drive? Information? Where?\nUgh... Something's been going wrong lately. Yeah. Well alright, you didn't refuse to help, here take some cartridges and vodka - to relieve stress.\nIf you need anything - drop by, we'll discuss it - to mutual benefit.
Well... See ya.
Wait a second. You'll have to wander all over the Zone? Do you remember that it's not safe here?
Yeah, I can see that already. Anomalies, all sorts of creatures just trying to devour me.

Yeah, those are, so to speak, obvious dangers. At least you can somehow detect them. There are some other contagions that you can't detect at all. Like viruses. Completely invisible. Here on Cordon they don't seem to manifest very strongly, which is understandable - it's the outskirts, but the closer to the center, the worse it gets. So I'm telling you right away - without respiratory protection, it would be better for a person not to stay there long. Understand?
Constantly walk in a gas mask? Yeah...

Excellent! Now I really see - you're a worthy person.\nI see you got a tactical vest? Right. For serious business you need to equip yourself more seriously! Here take some cartridges and vodka - to relieve stress.\nYou can contact me if you need anything else.

Excellent! Now I really see - you're a worthy person.\nI see you're still walking around with one ammo pouch, for serious business you need to equip yourself more seriously! Here take this simple tactical vest from me as thanks. It's more convenient to run around the Zone with it. You can try to get a special forces model through the soldiers later. There are extra pockets there, and more fits in them.\nThat's it, go now. If you need anything - drop by, we'll discuss it, to mutual benefit.
Marked One... What did you want? Sell artifacts, buy gear or something else?
What's up, Marked One?
Just dropping by.
Here's the thing...
Eh, Marked One. I understand, of course - you hit your head and all that, but you could think a bit faster, you know.
Marked One. I warned you! I don't do business with those who break up all my commerce! Get out of here... nicely.
Well, screw you then! I'll manage without you!
Listen, do you have a conscience? Let a man sleep!
Uh...
Oh! Marked One. And I thought you rushed off to the Radar with everyone else, you haven't been showing up.
I was there. Nothing good there. Let the fools rush there if they're tired of living.
And you, it seems, finally got smarter. Or remembered something?

Hell knows... It's like the opposite - some kind of gap in memory, two weeks flew by like one day, and unclear how. Probably still some consequences from that truck ride. I don't even know what will happen next.
What, you got knocked out again? Yeah, bro, I don't envy you. You should spit on everything, live here for a month, recover, you've gotten completely thin, there's no face left on you.
I would have spat earlier, but I can't anymore. There's no point in stopping now - I need to go to the end.
So again there - to the north? Well, have a good journey... You're not the only one striving there. Vergas also seems to have gotten a bee in his bonnet. Packed his belongings and left.
Vergas went north? You're joking?

What jokes are there! Out of the blue he suddenly got ready and shuffled off. Not alone, of course. Where would he go! He went with a guide. I tell him, where are you going with your hemorrhoids, you'd sit here and know no troubles. No. Must go. They're waiting for him there, you see.
Who's waiting?
How should I know. Everyone's gone crazy recently, rushing north in herds. So you don't dawdle either, or they'll snatch everything up there.
Help with what? Or maybe you want to gear up a bit first?
I'm thinking, what should I do next?

What should you do... Head not working? You wanted to find acquaintances. Found any here, no? So you need to head to the center of the Zone, look for acquaintances. Right? So go... north. There's the Bar, and other places where you can meet those who have been trampling the Zone long enough.\nGet it? NORTH. There's no other way. Let me mark where that is for you.
Yes, there's no other way.

Only I wouldn't rush there in your place. Where will you go now - naked as a jaybird. Live here a little, get used to it, make connections, work to at least get some gear. You're walking around like a tramp.
Cheap labor needed, right?

I'm giving you advice, and you're getting all huffy. But as you wish... Ah! By the way. There, on the way to the Bar, there's a small post of the duty guys. Well, those who are trying to protect the world from the Zone. Some protectors. So now, this post is commanded by Prapor. Hell knows, maybe really a former warrant officer. He was here not long ago and promised to show me one thing that came to him by chance. Promised to send a messenger. But there's neither sight nor sound. If you see him - ask how that matter is going. Agreed?
Prapor? I'll ask, when I get the chance.
Hey. Why did you come?
I need Nimble. Can you tell me where to find him?
A bad thing happened to Nimble... Bandits took him nearby and dragged him off, he only managed to send an SOS. The bandits are now at the old ATP, beyond the road.
Don't you rescue your own from captivity? Not very friendly...

Eh, I'd punch you, but what's the use? It's not that simple. I have few men, and they're all complete newbies. I can't risk it. If we lose this camp, all normal stalkers will have a hard time. And what about you yourself? If you don't chicken out, I won't refuse help, I'm not proud. Will you help deal with the bandits?
You're suggesting going alone?
No, you won't manage that way. My scouts are real fighters. Right now they're watching those freaks. Together you have pretty good chances, in principle. Or is it still too much?
I'll try.
Not too much. But I won't go.
I might have taken it on... But I don't have a decent gun.
I respect that! A bottle's on me. I'll warn the guys about you now.
So it is too much after all... Well, get the hell out of here!

Yeah... I think there really won't be any use from you... Didn't complete my assignment, let Sidor down with the container too. No, Marked One, I don't have a gun for you. Only later, when you help rescue Nimble... Petruha with his eagles are ready to start making noise there, maybe at least you'll distract the bandits' attention or scout the approaches. In short, you'll figure it out on the spot. Drink some vodka, for courage... Ready? Or chickened out?
Alright, let's see what's there.
Don't worry! I'll warn the guys about you now.
Yeah. Alright. I'll go.
Well, how are things progressing?
Cleaned up the ATP with your boys.
Excellent, friend! This is for you - personally from me.
I cleaned out the ATP. Everything's clean there already.
Whoa! The guys say you gave them hell like nobody's business! I know - thanks doesn't gurgle! So, not counting the huge gratitude, there's something else here...
Managed to negotiate with the bandits. Nimble was freed.
Excellent! Didn't expect it, honestly. There must be something special in you... Here, take this as appreciation from the stalker community.
Thank you... In principle... Well, alright.
Great.
In progress.
Keep me posted, alright?
About ten bandits at the ATP. We won't manage on our own.

Ten? Where did so many come from? Damn... Where's Petruha looking. Said he could handle it. Can't, of course, charge in headfirst - we'll lose Nimble and many more. Listen, you're not too exposed? Let's try to find out what these freaks want. Will you take on going to them?
No way! I'm not putting my head in the mouth.
Could try, but what if they shoot without talking?
I'll try to send someone else. And you... Walk around...

They shouldn't. The main thing is don't rattle your gear in front of them. Go in a sweater, so they immediately see you're not hiding a gun under your clothes. If you're worried about your loot, you can leave all the valuable stuff right in the village, I'll keep an eye on it. But remember, this is only while you're helping with freeing Nimble.\nAnyway, find out there what the bandits want from him. Don't play hero too much, talk and run back. Then we'll decide what to do. Just give Petruha a heads-up not to make any moves yet.
I have bad news. Nimble is dead.
Dead? How could you! Go to hell...
Can't chat now. Beat it.
Got it, I'm not stupid.
Hey, Marked One. What brings you here?
What do you need, guy?
Sidorovich said you can help with normal weapons.
Help... I can. Only need to run somewhere.
Hello there, Marked One.
Drop by Sidorovich, maybe he needs something.
Already going.
Well, "hero"! Showed off? What the hell did you need that for? We were living just fine... We don't touch the soldiers, they don't touch us. Get out of here! There's no trust for you.
But... They started it first!
Did you want something? Or just so.
What else? Conscience awakened? Get lost...
What are you talking about?
What else? "Passenger"... Get lost... On your "own" business...
Ugh...
Ah! It's you... Go sleep.. Why are you wandering around...
I've got business...
So what, sucker... Got scared? Go on, shoot the breeze with the boss.
You'll get scared here.
Scram, before we smack you in the gut.
No noise.
Don't sneak up behind me! I'll blow your head off - you'll spread out like horse shit... Get lost, go rinse the boss's brains.
I need your ass...
You about this - rat-faced one? So go on, make a deal with the boss. We ain't too eager to dirty our hands on him.
Yeah, I'm going already.
You're completely empty... Should've at least brought some crappy little artifact or sumthin'... Borov, fo' real threatened to tear heads off for this business.
What business?
Why you sniffin' around here? You'll catch a beating in the gut. Go on, up on the second floor the authority sits, have your discussions with him.
Yeah, going already.
Passage is forbidden here, stalker.
Sorry, but I really need to get to the other side.
Got vodka? Give two bottles - then you'll pass.
Two bottles! Alright, here...
Two bottles - that's too much. Maybe we can make a deal some other way?
Excellent! Come on, run quick, or the brass might show up.
What are you, a fag? We don't deal in that business. Heh-heh...
Running, running...
Yeah, screw you... joker.
Passage is forbidden here, stalker.
Greetings, comrade major. I was told that we could make some kind of deal?
Were told? Hmm... And what did you want?
Nothing for now. Just cross to the other side.
Cartridges for the Kalash, for example.
Couple bottles - and run along...
If you can get vodka - we'll make a deal.
I don't have vodka.
Here, take this, saved it for myself.
Come on, run quick, who knows what brass might show up.
Got it, already running.
Ah! It's you, stalker. What do you want?
Want to cross.
Job's done!
What job? Why are you so pleased?
Well, the rate's set - two bottles.
I remember, here, take it.
I thought it would be cheaper.
Yeah, come on, fly by like a fly.
Already flying.
Well hello there, Marked One. How's it going?
Still alive, how about you?
Not complaining. What did you want?

Bad business. My classmate, Seryoga, was killed. They say you were seen there, in Dark Valley. If I knew for sure it was your work - I'd shoot you right away. But as it is - get the hell out of here while I'm being nice.
Uh...
Want to pass.
Got business... Want to get some gear.
See for yourself... I'm no fortune teller.
Give me a bottle and fly like a bullet.
Here. Good vodka.
Vodka's finished, I'll drop by later.
Good? Well run, or someone from the command might see.
Yeah I'm quick. Need something else.
Come on quick - what else?
Don't loiter here without business! Go on, if there's no vodka.
I'd like to...
What else? Don't be shy, get out what you have!
Marked One, hey there! Want to pass?
Yeah, I want to trade something.
See for yourself...
Yes, need to pass through.
Go ahead, no question! Just make it quick.
See ya, I'm running off.
Marked One, hey there! Want to pass?
Yes, need to pass through.
Go ahead, no question! Just make it quick.
You want to pass?
Hmm... Well yeah...
Got vodka, snacks? Command seems to have cleared out for now...
Vodka? How much?
A bottle's enough, with a couple cans... And pass through... Or just a couple bottles. Well, at least four cans.
Here take the cans, don't burst...
Got vodka, couple bottles...
Here's a bottle and couple cans...
Eh, service. I don't have vodka...
Aha... You can go, just faster.
Got it! See ya...
Pass faster, or some officer might show up.
Already running.
Want to pass, stalker?
Yeah, I need to get beyond the embankment.
Got grub? We're sitting here like idiots...
What specifically do you need? And how much?

Can of meat or couple sausages... Only normal ones, imported, not that crap the locals smoke here. That stuff bloats your stomach for the whole day. If there's trouble with food, then I'll take local rubles - a thousand will do.
Here's a can, was saving it for myself.
For sausage, get some strength.
Here's your thousand.
I don't have anything right now.
Thanks! Pass through quick.
Got it! See ya.
Is that you, Marked One?
That's me, why?
Orders to let you through... without inspection.
Then I'm going.
Pass faster, or some officer might show up...
Alright, running.
Passage is forbidden here, stalker.
Where's Kuznetsov? He should be here...
Kuznetsov? He was relieved, now it's my shift, Lieutenant Kovalchuk's! Got it? And I keep it short - turn around and get out of here! All sorts walking around here.
Cool it, lieutenant... Maybe some vodka? For the mood?
I don't drink! You got used to this...
Well, as you wish... Then... They're probably waiting for you beyond the perimeter. They think you'll return, help your relatives. So I can throw in some money, for you and your loved ones.
I know about your money. What good are they to me? What's your name, stalker?

Marked One... And this money can later be converted to more significant currency - dollars for example. Ask your replacement, he'll paint you a picture. There's one old coot in the village, he easily converts these rubles into decent money. And you'll leave the Zone limits with big bucks. How about this: I give you... two thousand, and you and your eagles see nothing for ten minutes?
Uh... Currency you say, dollars? Then, exceptionally... three thousand from you. Deal?
Hmm... Take the rubles.
You got a taste for it quick. Don't have that much.
Pass through... Just quickly.
Running, running...
Marked One! It's you again?
How's service, lieutenant, everything good? Need to pass.
Mmm, got money, three thousand? Hand it over, then you'll pass.
I do, take it.
Haven't saved up yet.
Hey! You there! Come on, pass quickly.
Passing.
Marked One! Still running around?
Good health to you too, lieutenant. Need to pass.
They already brought me orders to let you through without delay. Only I can't figure out, for what merits.
Maybe I'm a secret agent... Work in intelligence.
Always joking... spy.
And don't you be sad. Or do you feel sorry for my blood rubles? Don't be down. If not me, someone else will pay. So... can I pass?
Go, I won't delay you.
That's better, stay healthy.
You again? What did you want?
Need to pass...
Wish you health and all that.
Why ask if you know I'll let you through? Go.
Just for order, army after all...
Get out of here, stalker...
Already gone...
Stalker, turn around, while we're being nice...
Look at that...
Stas the guard
Stop stalker! Why are you here?
Well I'm stopping. What's next?
Word went around - Sidorovich was marked for death... So he asked to keep an eye on you stalkers. Just in case...
Sidorovich? Who's that?

Fell from the moon? Ah! You're that one... Deadman...\nSidorovich is the local merchant... Trader, but with principles. He'll throw you work, won't let you starve, help with advice. Not for free, of course. You have to pay for everything in this world!
And what currency does he prefer? Pounds? Dollars? Hryvnias?
He'll tell you himself... If he's in the mood.\nSo what did you want?
Don't know. Makes me sick. Doc said to come here. Like I owe something.

Well yeah, you owe. If Sidor hadn't been interested in a living corpse, the good doggies would be gnawing your bones. So be grateful and don't get uppity. Deal?\nAnd here's something else. If you need to leave something valuable in storage, come to me. I'll keep watch for a small fee.
Alright... I need to see Sidorovich.
Go in... Watch it there....
Hey there... Going to Sidorovich?
Yes, to Sidorovich, will you let me?
No, to you...
Well go in... Don't forget, I'm watching everyone...
Alright, alright...
It's late already, Sidorovich went to sleep.
He won't be here for a couple days...
It's you... Why can't you sleep...
Where's Sidorovich?
Man's sleeping. Resting. You should go too... Rest...
Hey, Marked One... What did you want?
What are you doing here? I wanted to visit Sidorovich...
Sidorovich left on business, promised to return in a couple days.
It's you... Why can't you sleep...
I need Sidorovich, will he be here in the morning?
Sidorovich left on business, promised to return in a couple days...
To me? What's the occasion?
How long will you keep loitering here?
It's you... Not allowed to let you in! Go away!
Screw you!
Need to store some loot.
No problem. Got any artifact for me? Three days you can use the safe anytime. Keep in mind, the capacity of the provided storage depends on your reputation in stalker circles.
Well, your safe usage time hasn't expired yet. Maybe need to extend? Artifact - and three days access.
No, just open it, we'll see then.
It's night, come in the morning...
Can't do anything now, Sidorovich left for a couple days and locked the door.
Well here, take "Jellyfish"...
Giving "Wrenched"...
Can give "Stone Blood"...
Artifact "Droplet"...
"Sparkler" here...
Take "Slime"...
Will you take "Thorn"?
Artifacts are in short supply with me, maybe you'll take money?
Where would I use those papers... Well fine... Exceptionally.
Thanks! Take the money.
Man, you set some price...
Excellent! Hide the loot in the box in the cabinet. I won't look...
Stop stalker! Why are you here?
Uh... Well I'm stopping. What's next?
Just don't twitch... Now carefully give me all your guns.
What for? I've been here a hundred times! Where's Stas?

Stas was killed. Haven't you heard about it? Couple thugs broke in... As Sidorovich says - came on a tip. One of the stalkers apparently had the richest loot stored here with Stas. So he kept storing it. Sidor, while the matter was being sorted out, grabbed his legs and rushed through his underground passage for help.
Did they catch the thugs?
What do you mean. I'm saying - it was a tip. They only robbed one safe quickly. Artifacts, they say, were countless there! So they left with those artifacts...
And is it known whose safe was robbed?
Yeah, there's one here, lucky one... And why, you ask, hoard without measure?\nGreed is a mortal sin!\nNo... They'll choke on it, but grab and grab... Marked One is his handle... Haven't met him?
Uh... That's me...
You? Because of you, greedy idiot, Stas got whacked...\nAlright. Maybe it's not because of you. I got heated.\nIn short, want to enter - hand over your guns!
Hey there... Going to Sidorovich?
Yeah to him, on business.
No. Changed my mind... See ya.
Hand over your guns. I don't trust anyone.
Alright, alright... Here take this.
You'll get them on the way out. You can go in.
No way! I'll do without Sidor.
It's night already, Sidorovich went to sleep.
He left, on his business for a couple days...
It's you... Why can't you sleep...
Where's Sidorovich?
Man's sleeping. Resting. You should go too... Rest...
Marked One... What did you want?
Sidor left again? Or just locked himself in?
Left, left... You go on..
It's you... Why can't you sleep...
I need Sidorovich, will he be here in the morning?
Sidorovich left on business, promised to return in a couple days...
So? Done trading?
Yeah, give me the weapons, I'm going.
Wait a sec... Follow me.
It's you... Not allowed to let you in! Go away!
Screw you!
It's you... Why can't you sleep...
I need Sidorovich, will he be here in the morning?
Sidorovich left on business, promised to return in a couple days...
So? Done trading?
Yeah, give me the weapons, I'm going.
Take it. See ya...
It's you... Not allowed to let you in! Go away!
Screw you!
I heard you have a new "Pernach" pistol...
Ha, what gossips! Everyone knows everything. Well yes, there is. They sent a couple of such guns from Kiev. Only the use of these popguns is zero! What did you want?
I'd like to test this "popgun" in action. Can I get it somehow?
Of course you can! You seem to know my interest. Will you run to Sidor, bring some vodka? A little, ten bottles... no, let's make it a dozen.
Yeah I got some, here, take it.
Alright, I'll be right back...
Nah, this peashooter ain't worth it.
That's good. Take it, use it.
Brought vodka as promised...
Vodka? That's good. Did we have a deal? I don't remember something...
How could you not? For the new "Pernach" pistol. We agreed on a dozen bottles...
Don't shout so loud! I remember everything, I remember... Come on, unload the white stuff here, just quietly. You never know, an inspector might show up. Everything's been restless lately.
Alright, as you say.
Yeah, everything's good. Take this popgun and get out of here quick. I still need to give the boys a lecture...
Can I ask? About your announcements.
Announcements? What kind? What do you need?
Can I leave some things with you for safekeeping?
In principle, yes... But as you understand, this service isn't free.
I understand - not my first day in the Zone... What do you need for it?
Artifacts, of course! Not very valuable, but still... Give a second level artifact and you have access to the stash anytime for three days.
Good, if I need it, I'll come to you...
Want to store some loot.
Well, you pay honestly, we store honestly. Go downstairs and put your stuff.\nMaybe you want to extend the time?
No, I'll just put what I wanted.
Probably really time to extend.
Second level artifact and you don't have to worry about your stuff for three days. Anytime day or night you can take everything you stored.
Second level artifact from you and you don't have to worry about your stuff for three days. Anytime day or night you can take everything you stored.
Here, got "Stone Flower".
Can give "Gravi".
Got "Meat Chunk".
Can offer "Flash".
Will "Fireball" do?
Will you take "Slug"?
"Crystal Thorn" in stock.
Trouble with artifacts! Maybe I'll pay some other way?
I understand. Artifacts are important... Let's do this: you leave me purely symbolic payment, and we'll keep your loot until better times for you. Deal?
Purely symbolic payment - how much is that?
For you. Today only. Uh...
Well yes... Funny... Here, take this.
For one time? No, I'd rather hide it myself!
Don't have anything yet, I'll come back later.
Alright! On the first floor in the armory you can put everything. The guard will open the safe.
Want to ask about something.
Yeah? Well, start talkin'.
Yeah? First explain to me in one go. Borov sent boys to Cordon, to settle some matters. My pal was the foreman - Benya Zaporozhsky. Haven't met such a guy?
Got some loot together and afraid it'll disappear...
Don't recall. Why?
Give me your loot, I'll take it for safekeeping. Not one mutt will touch it - they respect me here.\nBut you owe me!
Because people pointed at you. You were hanging around ATP when our guys were there. And they also say you stood up for some stalker, you had some kind of deal with Benya. Was that so?
Maybe a bit later. What will you take for storage?
Ah! Now I remember. Well, yeah. We parted peacefully. Everyone got what they wanted.
We got problems with normal grub, so bring decent chow. For a couple cans or two bottles of energy drink - we'll be completely satisfied.
Peacefully? But they whacked both Benya and the boys when they were returning to the Valley. They whispered to me, this was your handiwork. What you got to say?
Food, then... Cans or energy drink. Clear, noted!

Wanna take it on pure bluff? Ask your whisperers about their rotten talk. Don't throw baseless accusations at me. Someone's word against mine. In short, don't know who wasted all your guys, but it definitely wasn't me.
How do you know it was all of them? You're a shady type, Marked One, and there's no trust for you. But you're right about one thing - I got no real proof, so... Roll away with your questions, got it?
Hey there, Veins, will you take loot for safekeeping?
Let's see... Got grub, drinks?
Got a couple cans.
Water - couple bottles.
Ate it all myself.
A deal's worth more than money! Put it in that cabinet, not one scumbag will get in.
Good day, I have a request.
Good day. What kind of request? I hope nothing like that...
No no, I want to leave loot for safekeeping. To be sure it won't disappear...

Well what can I say... Nobody's complained yet!\nAs you understand - security isn't cheap, so you need to pay up for storage access. Just keep in mind, your loot won't be stored forever. If the owner doesn't show up for a long time, the contents go to Duty. This is the Zone, those are the rules.
I see. How much will access cost?
For one time - only about five thousand rubles...\nCan arrange for three days - unlimited access will cost around fifteen thousand...
Understood, I'll keep it in mind.
Please accept something for storage.
Let me remind you, haven't you forgotten? You owe... Double for that time, and this time another sum... Won't count - you know yourself. So? Haven't lost the desire yet?
Yeah I remember. Here's the money. That all?
Alright, pay for one time? Or for three days? Got money with you?
Rental period hasn't expired yet, you can use it... But maybe extend?
Of course, no problem! I understand - we let you down... Won't happen again... Word of DUTY!
No, won't extend for now...
I'll pay for one-time access.
I'll take three days, here's the money.
I got a situation. No money in the account right now. Maybe you'll trust me?
On trust? Hmm... Alright, I'm trusting, apparently... So here's how - I give you access now, and you pay double later. So, deal?
Alright, deal... I'll pay double...
I'll think about it... Don't really need it for now.
Well then, go to the armory, the cabinet's open. Put your stuff in storage. Don't worry - we guarantee safekeeping! Word of "Duty"!
Can I leave something with you for a while?
Things are material substance, that is - short-lived... Giving this amorphous component of being practicality tears away mental energy...
Yeah... So what? If I leave it, will you watch it? I can give something for watching. Well, artifacts.
Fruits of otherworld do not inspire interest in beings...
What does inspire?
Mind seeks and finds... Mortal flesh binds to material being. For human flesh needs aids known to people. Which help preserve flesh in this piece of universe... You, humans, call them medicines...
I see, so - medkits.
Leave loot for safekeeping? Just say it simpler!
You can leave your inanimate entities... Support human flesh of seekers with healing elements...
My own flesh is in suffering. Damn devil, I'm starting to talk like him! What exactly do you need? Please just - say it humanly!
Ehh... Healing sets of simple name - paired essence or singular other appearances...
Here are simple medkits. Think I'll manage.
I got military medkit, here...
Just got scientific medkit. Take it.
Here are antirad. You really need them here!
Essence accepted... Information coordinated... You can store what you have...
Hmm... No. I'll wait for now...
I need to pass the night, eyes are closing.
You are still weak in flesh, human. Only one who perceives with inner sight the openness of mind can...
Yes-yes. So can I lie down here?
Yes... Time of darkness brings danger, forces of simple humans cannot resist it. You can lay down the mortality of your body near brother who gives nourishment. Let his Gift be revealed to you...
Yeah, let it. At least I'll get some sleep.
Day is not yet finished, which means revelation has not come to you. Seek it! Gain strength of thought and open mind to his Gift...
What?..
Hmm, I see - lights are on, sausage with bread... Where from?
Mind of seekers, understanding ones, enlightened... Common mentality in cloud of consciousness can influence... And reach...
Don't understand anything! What does consciousness have to do with it?

Difficult with you... Humans. Walking in darkness. But there is hope for initiation. I will try. To say. Simpler.\nBrother "Enlightened" immerses his consciousness into common field of mentality. Envelops with thought informational likeness of physical entities. And carries through barrier separating spiritual and physical. And physical substance establishes itself in world. And becomes likeness. So it happens.
I understand that all this food is made to appear by power of thought by that guy nodding his head? And this only works on food? Or on something else too?
There is no limit for "Enlightened"... Depth of retention and brain limitations of flesh - bring boundaries for given individual... Common mind can more... Much more...
Damn... Thought a little - and here's a snack, frowned - gun with ammo... Would be interesting... Although no. Not interesting...
Wolf, you're an experienced stalker, explain one thing to me...
What thing?
I exit the village, and someone hits me on the head, I come to in a house basement...
And double vision? And head cracks like from a hangover?
Yeah, serious withdrawal...

You got caught in an anomaly, we call it "Bungee" among ourselves. The eggheads, of course, say it differently - "Spatial-teleportation tunnel, with instant transfer effect"... Can break your tongue! Recently such anomalies started appearing, some are clearly visible, others audible, and the third ones - the most vicious, can't be detected at all.
And how do they work?

If I knew HOW, I wouldn't be sitting here, but in some Western university making serious cash. But generally, we noticed - it only throws humans, completely ignores bolts or animals. Can carry you anywhere - that's what makes these "Bungees" dangerous.
Just what we needed...
Stalker... I'm in bad shape... You...
Fox? Sidorovich sent me.
I... Feel like shit, bro, got a medkit?
Sure, here... Well, how is it?
Sorry, I don't have a medkit, barely holding on myself.
Thanks! Need a doctor... They said he's somewhere here, on Cordon. But I didn't make it.\nWho are you anyway? Where are you going?

Don't know. I lost my memory. Sidorovich dubbed me Marked One. Going north for now, will look for acquaintances or familiar places... You, they say, might know something about Strelok, and he seems to be a thread to my past. Will you tell me about him?

Marked One, then. Alright.\nI heard about Strelok and his group, can even say I "communicated" with them - once his group fired at my boys. Nobody got hurt - they were clearly waiting for others, so we parted peacefully after that. Cursed each other across the ravine and went separate ways. Seriy, a stalker I know, he's at Garbage now I think, he should know more about Strelok.\nListen, there's a pack of dogs following my trail. Need to deal with them, then we'll continue talking, okay?
Can you handle it yourself? Or help?
I can barely stand, vision's doubled. But where can I go. They'll tear me apart otherwise.
Alright, I'll try to help you.
Well, I have my own path, good luck.
Watch your sides, friend! They'll come running again now.
Yeah.
Thanks a lot, Marked One. I probably wouldn't have managed alone: you saw what a pack it was.\nTake some ammo. Just right for dogs.
Come on, I helped you, you help me...
If you can, help another person.
Greetings, Marked One!
Wanted to go, so go.
Alright, don't get worked up.
Oh! And I was just thinking about you. People are telling tales about Marked One - like such a sneaky one...\nMeaning been everywhere normal stalkers don't go.
Yeah, had to run around.

We talked it over with the guys, and with sound reasoning, decided to get out. Good that you came by. I remembered there's one unfinished business, it might concern you too. Think I'll tell Marked One, let him decide what to do with it.
Yeah? What kind of business?

We were sitting out at Tesla with Hermit once, waiting out an emission. And under "this business" conversation turned to Zone wonders and more. And among other things there was talk that everything that ever was, it doesn't disappear without trace, but gets recorded in some field. And that those who pretend to be clairvoyants actually can just connect to this field.
Well, and?

In short. Hermit said he knew one brainy stalker who had the gift of clairvoyance. And that stalker told him there are places in the Zone that allow ordinary person to get into this information field and get practically any knowledge. There you go.
Interesting. What's this Hermit about? And what's your "unfinished" business, you didn't bring this up for nothing?

Don't know about Hermit? Actually more often he's called Brainiac Ilya. Made himself a burrow near bunker at Tesla. He's a bit, you know. What am I saying "a bit". He's totally nuts, but knows so much that neither you nor I can even imagine. If you're there, tell him that Fox is getting out, but remembers his promise, and left what he promised in that same place where the gravitrap is. Deal?
Gravitrap? Some nonsense. Alright, if I happen to meet him, I'll pass it on.
How are you, friend? Any success?
Well, hello. People know me as Fox. Who are you, where from, where to?

Hello to you too. I'm Marked One. Sidorovich dubbed me that, I remember almost nothing about myself. Looking for those who know me. You, as I heard, might know something about Strelok, and he seems to be a thread to my past. Will you tell me about him?

Marked One, then. Alright.\nI heard about Strelok and his group, can even say I "communicated": once his group fired at my boys. Nobody got hurt - they were clearly waiting for others, so we parted peacefully after that. Cursed each other across the ravine and went separate ways. Actually, that's all.
Hello again. How's the head? Remember anything?
Hello, hello. No changes so far.
I see. Well, sit down and rest, have a drink. You're always running around, fussing.
Help? Who?

Three of us came from Yantar: me, Redhead and Mole. We were carrying some loot, planning to sell to Sidorovich. Already at Agroprom we got ambushed by either bandits or mercenaries - I didn't have time to figure out. While Redhead was running for cover, he flew into "Witch's Jelly" anomaly and got badly injured. Had to drop the loot, of course. Mole started distracting the attackers, and I rushed to Redhead and managed to drag him to a collapsed tunnel, left him there. Me, as you see, immediately ran to Cordon - looking for Doc. Nobody treats "Witch's Jelly" burns better than him. And I almost reached the embankment, but dogs attacked, tore me all up.\nRedhead won't last long... Find Doc, he should be somewhere beyond the embankment, explain the situation. And please - hurry!
Redhead? Sidorovich said he found me unconscious and carried me to the village on his back, practically saved me from death. Of course I'll help him.
I need to deal with my own problems.
Thanks. I'll rest up for a couple days and head to Redhead too. Ah, if only I could get some medkits.
Marked One, get medicine from Doc.
Yeah I remember.
Help Redhead out, Marked One. I'll recover a bit and head there too.
Greetings, Marked One. Thanks for helping Redhead.

Fox asked to help Redhead - the stalker who found me at the "death truck" and dragged me to camp. Fox said Redhead was badly hurt by "Witch's Jelly", so need to ask Swamp Doctor to prepare special medicine
Doc, Fox says Redhead needs some special medicine, he got into "Witch's Jelly" anomaly.
Fox? Where is he? As for Redhead... Yeah... Familiar situation. Those who get into that anomaly, their legs turn to mush, simple remedies won't do...
Fox is in bad shape himself, not far from here, resting in a house on the other side of the railroad. What specifically do you need? I owe Redhead.

Need to prepare special ointment and soak bandages with it. Then carefully bandage legs with these bandages. To make the ointment need extract from bloodsucker flesh, which allows bloodsucker to regenerate so fast. I have tentacle from which this extract can be made, but it oxidizes quickly. For stabilization need mixture of two blind dog tails and two tushkano heads...
Doc, maybe you can make some potion for me too, to help restore memory?
I understand you want to swallow a "miracle pill" and remember everything at once. But I don't know such miracle remedy. I already told you: some external impulse might help.
Yes, you said... But what if there's some remedy... Alright, let's talk about Redhead. So you need two dog tails and two tushkano heads?
Exactly. You'll have to run around a bit, you know that you can't take needed part from every monster.
Yeah I know, already heard. I'll try not to damage the "hide".
Why not from every one?

Strange thing, but monsters have their weak spots, which are precisely what's valued. Dogs have tails, tushkanos heads, others - other things. These parts suffer the most, either fall off or wear out during lifetime, unclear... Highly radioactive ones also don't have properties that are needed... So not every dog has tail suitable for the job. And you won't get every tushkano with needed head.
I see. I'll try not to damage the "hide".
Try. I'd go hunting myself, but I'll go check on Fox, can't leave him for long...
If that's all, I'll get everything quickly...
Will also need a bottle of vodka...
Well vodka's no problem, wait...
To prepare medicine Doc additionally needs two blind dog tails, two tushkano heads and bottle of vodka
Doc, I gathered everything needed for the medicine.
That's good. I'll take care of Fox now, and you walk around for 20 minutes, medicine will be ready, then come back...\nI'll be near Fox, understood?
Good, understood.
So, Doc, is the medicine ready?
Yes, ready. Here, take it. Don't forget to soak the bandages...
Got it, going to look for Redhead...
Marked One, hurry up, Fox is in bad shape...
So what about the ingredients for Redhead's medicine?
Haven't collected everything yet...
Well collect them, why are you running around here? The dogs are over there...
Yeah, here, seems I got them already...
What are you mumbling about?! Speak clearly...
How are you?..
Thanks, everything's fine...
I'm planning to head to my Thicket for now, but don't know when I'll get there... If something urgent comes up, I'll let you know, or we'll meet sooner...
Thicket? Where's that?
I'd be glad to tell you, but I already told you, I don't want my hints to become instructions for you. Ask around, maybe something will give you an idea. But most likely, I'll find you first myself.
Alright... Good luck.
One minute... What did you want? Marked One, make it quick...
Marked One... Wait five, ten minutes. And don't go far!
Alright, alright...
Healing compound
Swamp Doctor prepared special compound for healing chemical burns. This compound must be applied to bandages and Redhead's legs bandaged with them
So how are things? Everything alright?
Marked One, where have you been wandering?
So how are things?
Everything's fine... Thanks.
You look unwell... Rest more. Don't fuss around. Running, running. Running away from yourself...
Hello. How do you feel? Remembered anything?
Hello. Seems everything's fine. Head's empty, like a dried up well... What are you looking out for here?

I'm waiting for an old friend. He walked the Zone a lot, knows much. The youngsters don't even call him by name - they call him Guide. Promised to come by. So I'm waiting. Got an idea, want to check it...\nWell, you try to get to the Bar, there'll be more experienced stalkers, maybe you'll see someone who will fill your "well"... That's to the north, if you don't remember... Just be more careful, as they say - "measure seven times...".
North? Yeah. Familiar phrase... Alright, I'll try.
Good luck on your journey...
Head to the Bar. I think there's no other path for you yet...
Yeah, that's where I'm heading.
Safe travels...
Listen, man! Who are ya? What's yer handle?
What?
Nickname, I'm sayin', what's yers?
What am I, a dog to you?! I got a name - Marked One.
Marked One, so Marked One... Seems like I heard about ya somewhere already.
You again? I need to shoot the breeze with the boys, and you're here warmin' yer ears. Get the hint?
Got it, ain't stupid.
What, ready? Or how?
Let's settle the business... Or how?
So how is it? Got news?
Whatcha want?
Either talk, or scram.
You should get outta here.
Get outta here while you're alive.
What's goin' on, guys?
What's it to ya? You see, people... are chattin'. Go your own way.
He seems to have yelled something about bandits... or am I imagining things?

If ya think so, then go to Father Diodor. He'll sprinkle ya, cross ya, and give ya communion too. In short, man, get outta here, this ain't yer talk... We'll have a quiet chat ourselves here, maybe it'll work itself out. If not - we'll whack the kid, so others learn their lesson.
Come on guys, you really gonna shoot him?

Yeah, right now! And who's gonna return the debt to Baldy? We'll teach him a lesson now... But first gotta shake down this dummy, maybe he stashed somethin' somewhere.\nAnd why'd ya butt in anyway?! Wanna stand up for him, so buy him out, if you're so kind. Don't wanna take extra sin on ourselves either. And from this sucker you can collect later yourself. We don't give a damn who pays. Long as it's fast.
Baldy - who's that?

Baldy?! Ya really don't know or playin' dumb? There's this dude in the Bar, local card shark. Sly bastard, no matter how many times I played "Blackjack" with him, always lost. Though I heard recently someone burned him big time, serves the goat right.\nAnd this little bitch lost to Baldy and ran off. Debt ain't big, but ya understand, gotta pay back. So if ya wanna stand up for this sucker, then hand over an artifact, "Jellyfish" or some "Wrenched"... That'll be enough for Baldy, and we'll have some for bread.
Just happens I got one! Will this work?
Got nothin' like that.
Yeah! Just right. Deal... Then there'll be another job for ya.
Then give us cash... Ten grand... just right.
He ain't worth that much.
Ten grand?! Fine, take it.
I'll pay for the kid, give me time.
Then get outta here! We're finishing the green one...
Yeah! Just right. Deal... Got another job for ya.
When ya got artifacts or cash - come by. Twenty-four hours time, otherwise we'll bash his head in, that's final.
I'll be quick.
Ya talkin' about what?
He's still askin'? No wonder people say yer head's full of holes. Ya owe us, for the sniveling sucker, remember? You signed up for it yourself.
Oh, that's what ya mean.
Yeah, that. He's sittin' there like an orphan, in the hollow, nose runnin', tryin' to get pity.
Haven't gotten any artifacts yet.
Will this artifact work?
Will ya take cash?
Ya better hustle. Won't wait long, we'll finish the brat and that's it. We ain't got reason to hang around here long. Business calls. Ya got twenty-four hours, if ya forgot.
Yer a good man, Marked One. Got another little job for ya.
Wait a bit more.
What kinda job?
Some goat swiped a good thing from me. Can ya get it back?
First, what thing? And second, what "goat"?

Goat's a goat. Bastard ate and drank with us... I dozed off, opened my eyes - no gun! Got used to my little rifle, got attached to it, ya could say... Fang himself gave it to me! Before he went to the center with Strelok.
Strelok?! I heard about him... Where was this?
Ya get my gun back... Then we'll have our talks.
And where do I look for this goat of yours?
He was headin' through Duty checkpoint, the one by the Bar passage, to the valley. Lapot, damn, that's his handle... Asshole.
What about yourselves? Chickened out?
We got some friction with Duty, don't wanna show our faces to them more than necessary...
Alright, we'll see.
Screw ya... blockheads.

One guy at Garbage, nicknamed Walnut, says he knows Fang - Strelok's companion. He's ready to tell where he saw him, if I manage to return unique rifle that Walnut claims was taken by some stalker named Lapot. The latter should be looked for somewhere near Duty checkpoint
Walked past when I was asking for help with those lawless bastards, and now you come with talks? Get lost, got enough problems without you.
Well then sit in your pile of... problems.
Thanks, friend, you helped me a lot. They call you Marked One?
For now, temporarily. What happened here?

Got in deep shit. Wanted to try serious business. Got tired of sitting on Cordon, running errands for Wolf. Thought I'd gather some artifacts, shoot some mutants and generally see how things are there... Well, you see how it all turned out. One stalker often visited Sidor, cool guy, always had loot. I begged him to guide me to the Bar through Duty checkpoint. They're grim dudes, don't let just anyone through. And messing with them costs more than it's worth. But with a guide I got through. On the way I thought maybe some loot would come my way.
To the Bar, as I understand, you made it.

Yeah, got there. Bar, I tell ya - that's something! Seasoned stalkers gather there, dump loot after raids, lick wounds, party around the clock. People always got money. Some remember friends, some get wasted with joy, all kinds... many treat others. And there's this Baldy: what's up, youngster, maybe we'll play for small stakes? I was tipsy and tempted, plus on credit... You know the rest.
You're no pretty girl to be tempted. What do people say about north? How is it, beyond the Bar?

Beyond the Bar? They tell scary stories about monsters, anomalies. Death at every step. Can't get through without good gear. Need suit with gas mask, air's poisoned with something there. And without decent weapons won't manage either. Going in with PM or sawed-off is a dead number. As I see it, no point for a loner to go north at all.
Alright, first gotta deal with your creditors.
Alright, head back to the village.
Maybe talk to Wolf? He's a good man. Will advise something or help somehow...
You ran from the village, got in trouble, dragged me in, and Wolf should help you? I doubt it...
Ask him, Marked One. Got nobody else to turn to. They'll kill me...
We'll see... Maybe it'll work itself out.
Thanks, Marked One. Won't forget it ever.
Alright, forget it.
I'm left completely without a gun, these robin hoods made sure of that...\nYou're a tough guy, maybe you can get me one special submachine gun?
How's Wolf, agreed to help?
Agreed, agreed.
Haven't been to Cordon yet.
Don't abandon me, Marked One.
Got tangled up with you.
Hello, friend! How are things with my request?
Brother, can't you help me a bit more?
Again?! What else?
Well, I really need it... Please...
Hi, haven't gotten burer hand yet?
Hmm... Yurik, I got something, what do you think?
Marked One... Really?!
I told you: if I run into one - I'll bring it, you could try yourself...
How's life, Marked One, always busy?
You could also use some business.
Yeah, as usual. And I see you've organized a checkpoint here. All the cream of Cordon gathered. A mouse won't slip through.
If only there was business...

You're joking... There will be. Just sick of hanging around the village. Now Fanatic's there instead of Wolf. That one wasn't sweet, but this one's even... better. Completely militarized us, no escape. Either guard duty or work detail, organized maintenance days. Like in the army, with all that follows. Otherwise, we're our own commanders. Sometimes we even raid Garbage if some veteran goes there. Haven't gone past the hangar yet. Don't wanna mess with Duty guys.
Well now... At this rate you'll reach the Bar soon, and then north.

No, Marked One, north isn't for us yet. Need good gear there, weapons, decent medicine, not Sidorovich's iodine and brilliant green. That's tons of artifacts needed, and we don't have them yet. Too early for us to think about north.
Sitting by the fire telling stories won't earn money or find artifacts.
Why not. Slowly some loot comes our way. Just after the last Emission got couple artifacts. Traded one for food, ammo and various small stuff, and put the second away, in common fund.
Two artifacts?! Lucky guys. And you're the senior here? After all, you've been to the Bar.
No, we decide everything together. As for the Bar, don't remind me. Won't fall for such persuasion again. Learned my lesson. If not for you...
Well... Good luck in stalker life.
Marked One, sit down. Nothing to drink though, so let's just talk.
What do you want from me, eh, man?
Nothing much. Just came to see who's sitting by the fire.
M-a-a-an, get lost...
Get lost yourself... M-a-a-an...
M-a-r-k-e-d O-n-e, n-n-not now...
Don't strain yourself...
Ah, it's you... Go on.
Already gone.
Talk to Walnut, he's the boss with us.
Alright, I'll talk to your Coconut.
Why ya standin', Marked One? Sit down.
I need Walnut. Where'd he go?
What ya need him for? Gone is gone.
Got business with him... Actually - he's got business with me.

He went to Swamps. Says he's got a pal there, offered some deal. Also said he wants to get hides from Ignat, to order new coat from Stepanych. There's such craftsman.\nOnly seems to me he just went to get wasted, relax. Local hunters brew good moonshine. So he decided to test it. Heh-heh... Lost big loot, just crumbs left, only enough for booze. Eh...
Where to look for him? Swamps are big.
Not far from railway bridge there's old farmstead. Look there. If ya hear someone howling songs, that's definitely him. He's a fan, when drunk... of singing sad ones.
Why didn't you go with him?
Those are his deals, not mine. We're pals and all, but our paths split. Hanging around here for now. Maybe some smart idea will come to mind.
I see you're all busy? Here boredom's eating at me. Eh...

Hey stalker, heard our call? We really need help now. Bandit scum is trying to get control over Garbage. There was a fight here recently. We laid down three freaks. The other bros retreated, but they'll be back with reinforcements. We're few, and I'm afraid without backup we won't handle it. Plus a gang settled at the collapsed railway tunnel.
Continue.

Punks will most likely show up by evening, around five. Me and the boys will try to set up ambush for them. Could you find a few more decent guys? To teach this criminal scum a lesson once and for all.

Today these punks already got theirs, but tomorrow evening, around five they'll show up. Me and the boys will try to set up ambush for them. Could you find a few more decent guys? To teach this criminal scum a lesson once and for all.
Alright, I'll try to find someone.
Excellent.
This isn't my business, and I won't interfere.
As you wish, later you'll bite your elbows when you pay toll to thugs.
What do you want? Get going while you're whole.
Yeah right...
So how is it, brother, found anyone? Will there be help?
Not yet. But I'll try.
I talked to Seriy. He went to Dark Valley.
Did you tell him I should be here for now? About me needing help?
He doesn't want to. Says you should also drop everything and head to Valley. There's bandit nest there and it needs cleaning. Nothing to catch here.
Some... comrade. Frol disappeared in swamps, he would've definitely helped. Real friend. But this one... I'll remember this. Still got time, maybe talk to people some more?
Alright, alright, I'll talk.
So how is it, brother, found anyone? Will there be help?
No, people refuse.

Only think about themselves. What kind of people! These thugs will kill everyone.\nNo time left at all, soon I think the bastards will come...\nWhat about you? Will you help? Or like the rest - sit in bushes?
Not that type. I'll try to help.
Sort it out yourselves, I got enough problems.
They'll come soon, let's wait...
Alright.
Thanks, friend, you helped us a lot. I got "Gravi" artifact... Take it for helping. What's your name?
Thanks... Call me Marked One, don't remember my real name.
Yeah, sucks when there's nothing in your head, but you shoot well.
Job's not done yet, we'll talk later.
Hello, Marked One.
Hello, Marked One. Good to see you...
What do you know about Strelok?

Interested in Strelok?\nLess than a year ago many talked about him... Guys from "Clear Sky" group hunted for him... Searched everywhere...\nHe stirred up some commotion in Zone center. I haven't seen him myself, but knew stalker nicknamed Ghost. According to him, Strelok is a fighter blessed by God.
Where did you see Ghost? And who might know where Strelok is now?

Ghost and I did couple runs to Yantar, he wasn't much of a talker...\nBut he communicated a lot with Sakharov, head of science folks at Yantar. So I think Sakharov can tell you more about Ghost.\nPity that "Clear Sky" group broke up... They should have had their intelligence on Strelok.
Who are you? How did you get here?

My name is Demon. I came here three years ago. Like many here - a fugitive. Got two murders and grievous bodily harm hanging over me. Few years ago my friend got badly beaten in foreign district. They put him back together piece by piece in intensive care. Had to pay a courtesy visit. When cops came to arrest me, it so happened that I shot one of them and jumped from third floor. Since then I dwell here. Increased both my score and set of charges considerably. And here I fight lawlessness to the best of my ability. Like on the mainland. Train and organize youngsters, teach them to survive here.
Probably needed work, what are you planning to do now?
Bandits got completely brazen, I'll go to Dark Valley, they got something like a lair there.\nI'll observe, maybe some ideas will come up on how to teach this scum a final lesson...
I see, do you need anything?
Yeah, in principle, everything needed can be gotten from traders. Though...\nIf you got spare ammo - bring some...
What kind of place is this?

Garbage. Place where we belong most. See piles of all kinds of junk? Better not go there, radioactive waste there, Geiger counter sings like nightingale. This is the only convenient passage deep into Zone. And lately bandits started getting active here. Further, where experienced stalkers go, where Duty territory is, they're afraid to stick their noses. But here jackaling, fleecing youngsters, sweet business. So if everyone doesn't care, have to take up arms again.
You're too "righteous"... Doesn't it strain you?
This is my life position. Everywhere, especially here, it's necessary to remain human, not cattle whose only goal is thirst for profit.
What do you know about "Clear Sky"?

Not much... They sat somewhere in Swamps, these Clear Sky guys. Supposedly studied Zone, tried to find balance between man and this bedlam. Don't understand - either just fools, or up to something... In short, their leader got it in his head that Strelok disrupts this very balance and needs to be killed. So they searched for him.
Where are they now?

Seems like they all died, well, maybe not all. But their leaders disappeared somewhere near center approaches. Individual loners from the group still meet from time to time... Their base was in Swamps, where exactly, I - and probably almost nobody - know. Generally, their time passed...
Yo, dude, what the hell whistling?! Only bullets will be whistling here now. Help fight them off, then we'll chat.
Thanks for helping, it was hot. Where did you come from anyway?
What do you mean "where from"? Heard your call for help on radio. Fox told me about you anyway. I'm looking for information about Strelok. Maybe you know something?

Honestly, nothing except stalker tales. But one of my pals might know about Strelok - former digger, Mole. Now he's with his team on run at Yantar. They're planning to return through Agroprom, area not far from here, if you don't know. Road there starts behind railway tunnel, which is visible if you exit this territory through western gates. Just keep in mind that "Bungee" often appears on that road. Don't know how it is now though, haven't been to those parts for long time.\nSo about Mole. As far as I know, quite recently he was planning to rummage in underground under Research Institute looking for your Strelok's stash. I'll send him message and ask to wait for you near eastern complex - stalkers often make camps there. He'll tell you everything on spot himself, and show you if he really managed to dig up something there.
Wow! Thanks for that!
There, at Agroprom, many dangers, so take this small gift from me - bit of grenades and write down recipe.\nBy the way, did you see Demon? Don't know where he went?
No, I haven't seen Demon.
Ah... You don't know? Bandits killed Demon...
Demon said he went to Dark Valley, to deal with local scum.
Demon? Ah, that one from camp? I saw him. They're waiting for bandit assault there. Asking for help...
What do you mean "where from"? Heard your call for help on radio. I'm looking for information about Strelok. Maybe you know something?
Pity, I'll go look for him... If you see him - tell him I'm going to Valley. He knows where.
What! Damn bastards... Demon and I were together for almost two years... Time to deal with these thugs...
Long overdue... To Dark Valley, you say?... I'll go there too, help him.

Help? Ha! Demon, as I heard, robbed couple gopniks. And they called their buddies. So he got himself in trouble, let him clean up the mess that started because of him. Nothing, he'll manage. In short, if you see him, tell him I'm going to Valley. Got one idea how to punch Borov's thugs in the face. Let him come there too. He knows where.
Hi dude, just had such fun here, it was hot. Where did you come from anyway?
Straight road to you, stalker, past anomalies through artifacts.
What interesting can be found at Garbage?

Trouble for your ass can be found in any quantities. If you're such pioneer with us, then listen. In east small forest, nothing particularly interesting there, but packs of dogs live there. Be careful. If you follow these rails, they'll lead you to tunnel. Lot of anomalies there, maybe something else interesting, don't know. I didn't particularly rummage there. About Duty checkpoint in north, I think you know. That's basically all I know about this place.
Thanks for information.
Glad to see you alive, Marked One.
Hey there, stalker! You rushed to my SOS signal? Thanks for that!
Hello to you too! Don't see any "bandits" here, just one weakling lying around...

That's me... from surprise. This bastard was hiding behind rebar, and how he fired both barrels - I even heard whistle of shot over my head. Immediately thought there's serious ambush here, they usually never go alone.
Fear has big eyes, right? Alright, good that he really hid alone here. By the way, they call me Marked One. What about you?
Call me Phil, Marked One. Or Lapot - by nickname. I owe you for "false alarm". Take some ammo here.
Marked One, let's shake hands.
You know Walnut, Diman?
That gloomy one who walks in coat? Had drinks with him few days ago... Why do you need him?
I don't need him, I need unique rifle you took from him.
He told you that? What an ass. He shoved it on me himself when drunk, as sign of friendship, he said.
Listen, I don't give a damn what you had between yourselves. Give me the gun and we'll part ways.
Don't have that gun! I traded it yesterday for couple artifacts.
Who did you trade with? Where to look for it?

Some stalker, didn't ask his name. He was walking from Bar direction with full backpack of artifacts. Said he's going to Sidor, to Cordon. He's got distinctive suit. He left quite recently, if you hurry, you'll catch up.
To Cordon then. Alright, I'll hurry.
Good luck finding the rifle!
Stop, stalker. You can't go further!
Why?

Further is our territory. Bar is base of "Duty" faction. And we're very picky choosing who we let into our home. If you don't have particularly important business with our leadership, we won't let you through.
So this is path to Bar? But I need to get to Bar, experienced stalkers go there, maybe someone will recognize me...
I'd let you through, but... who knows who you are... Prove you can be trusted.\nWhat's your name?
If I only knew! Sidorovich dubbed me Marked One, so I walk around like that now...
Alright, Marked One... So you know Sidor...\nHe promised to get us flamethrower for one good artifact.
What the hell do you need flamethrower for?
Small creatures bred like hell... Rats, tushkanos come in packs, can't stock enough ammo for them... And with flamethrower you can cover whole pack. So, will you work as courier?
Dark Valley? That's...

What, you fell off a truck? Everyone knows where Dark Valley is. It's right there behind hill from here. There's road to valley, all sorts of things sometimes come from there. So, will you work as courier?
Alright, give me your artifact, I'll go...

Not so fast, guy. One of ours, Leshy, already carried container with artifact to Cordon and vanished like through earth. Maybe some nonsense happened to him, backpack tore or twisted ankle, or maybe something more serious... Try to find him. I think he tried to cross embankment somewhere in east, near old tunnel. There, of course, area is contaminated with radiation, but away from extra eyes and no need to share with soldiers again.\nFind out what happened to our comrade and bring flamethrower - welcome to Bar.
So plow through all of Cordon? Alright, I'll try.
Another time...
So how is it, Marked One. Where's our flamethrower?
It's you, Marked One. Ready for business?
Stop, stalker. You can't go further!
Why can't I?
