Further is our territory base of "Duty" faction. And we're very picky choosing who we let into our home. If you don't have particularly important business with our leadership, we won't let you through.
Sidorovich told me he made arrangements and I'd be let through...
Sidorovich... That ferret... I can let you through, but little use to you, after last emission road to Bar is almost impassable, you'll just lose your head for nothing.\nWhat's your name?
If I only knew! Sidorovich dubbed me Marked One, so I walk around like that now...
Alright, Marked One... So you know Sidor...\nHe promised to get us flamethrower for one good artifact.
What the hell do you need flamethrower for?
Small creatures bred like hell... Rats, tushkanos come in packs, can't stock enough ammo for them... And with flamethrower you can cover whole pack. So, will you work as courier?
Alright, give me your artifact, I'll go...
No, I'll try to get to Bar...
Not so fast, guy. One of ours, Leshy, already carried this artifact, but vanished somewhere on Cordon. Where exactly, don't know... Try to find him, if we get flamethrower, then welcome to Bar.
So plow through all of Cordon? Alright, I'll try...
Another time...
Decide yourself, I'm not your mother, change your mind - come by, we'll talk...
Alright, off I go...
Marked One. Barman contacted, says you can be let through, but...
What but?
After last emission road to Bar is practically impassable, anomaly upon anomaly... My advice: wait for now.
I'll try to get through, got business in Bar.
Hi, Marked One, how's health?..
Marked One, can you fulfill one request?
What request?

We lost several people in Dark Valley. Try to find out what happened to them. There's information they might have been captured by thugs - by bandits. Check bandit base if possible.\nIf you don't know yet, not far from here starts short path that leads to Valley. Sending you coordinates.
What if they're there?
Just report to us, we'll try to get them out.
Good, if opportunity arises, I'll find out what happened to your people.
It's you! Always running around... When will you calm down...
Thanks. Can't complain...
I envy you, wish I could...
It's you... So, returning flamethrower?
Yes, don't need it anymore. Take it.
Wait, still need it.
Yeah, everything's fine. Well, go through. If anything - contact me.
Come on, don't drag it out.
It's you! Always running around... When will you calm down...
It's you! Always running around... When will you calm down...
About Dark Valley...
Been waiting for news... Did you manage to find out anything?
Yeah. Met one of yours there, called Bullet. Together we rescued his partner from bandits - Max Luber.
Yeah. Met one of yours there, called Bullet. He died unfortunately, when we tried to rescue his partner, Max Luber, from bandits together
Yeah. Met one of yours there, called Bullet. Together we tried to rescue his partner, Max Luber, from bandits. Didn't work out unfortunately. Max died.
Yeah. Met one of yours there, called Bullet. Tried to rescue his partner, Max Luber, from bandits together. Unfortunately, both ended up dying in shootout.
Well, so... Met one of yours there, called Bullet. He wanted me to help him rescue partner from bandits. But in the end situation resolved without my participation.
Yes, I already know about this pair. Thanks for standing up for the guy. Anything else?
Yes, I already know about this. Damn... Bullet was one of our best fighters. Good that at least his partner was rescued. Anything else?
Yes, I already know about this. Damn... Luber was excellent fighter. Pity we couldn't rescue the guy. Anything else?
What? Both died? Can't believe it... Damn... This pair was among our best fighters. Very sorry. Anything else to report?
Yes, I already know about this. Anything else to report?
Saw another one of yours at bandit base, they keep him in basement, under lock of course. Someone called Shaggy.
No, nothing else.
So Sergei's alive? Good news, we'll try to pull him out. This is for you, thanks for help!
Alright, in any case, thanks for responding to my request. Take some ammo here.
Wasn't difficult for me. Good luck!
Prapor's messenger - Leshy - disappeared on Cordon. Need to find him and learn why flamethrower wasn't delivered to Garbage checkpoint

Leshy died. Found hastily written note on him: "Dogs attacked with tushkanos, barely escaped! Had to drop container. Remembered place: before reaching pig farm, to right of road, near distinctive stump".\nNeed to find container!
Need to exchange found container for flamethrower from Sidorovich and bring this unique weapon to Prapor
Listen, tell me again what needs to be brought to Sidor...

Your memory... Sidorovich promised us flamethrower for rare artifact.\nThis artifact in protective container was carried by one of our guys - Leshy, but disappeared on Cordon. If you find Leshy and container with him, trade for flamethrower and bring it here. Don't doubt gratitude, won't shortchange you.
Yes, remembered, good...
Sorry, maybe later somehow.
Yeah, I wanted to say about flamethrower...
Brought it? Awesome! Give it here quick. And what about Leshy, did you find out where he disappeared?
Why so excited? Here, take your toy. As for Leshy... he's dead. Looks like dogs tore him apart when he tried to cross embankment.
Damn, you blockhead. I left it here, nearby, was heavy to carry. I'll bring it soon, wait.
Not so fast. I couldn't find your Leshy yet, but I'm still on it. Just wanted to warn that there's delay with your task...
Found Leshy, he's dead. Looks like dogs tore him apart when he tried to cross embankment. Such things.

Damn! Pity for the guy. But thanks to you, his death won't be in vain! Now we'll reliably cover this road! Here's good artifact for help - you'll run with it like deer. Just need tons of food.\nBy the way, road to Bar became bit freer, so you can move.

Damn! Pity for the guy. But thanks to you, his death won't be in vain! Now we'll reliably cover this road! Hmm... wait... Sidor and I agreed flamethrower would be fully charged. Well, alright, this is solvable. Here's good artifact for help - you'll run with it like deer. Just need tons of food.\nBy the way, road to Bar became bit freer, so you can move.

Damn! Pity for the guy. What about container with artifact? Was container with him? It needs to be delivered to Sidorovich, and from him to us - flamethrower. Finish what Leshy started, let his death not be in vain.
Container... yes, I'm working on that.
Yeah? Well then I'll dash to Barman.
Come by sometime, we'll sit, drink glass of tea...
When there's time - definitely!
I'm here on business, brought container with artifact.
What artifact?
Duty checkpoint commander sent it, for flamethrower.
Ah, Prapor? Yes, I promised him, but he said Leshy would come?
Leshy died, didn't quite reach you... Apparently dogs got him.
Pity, he was skilled stalker. Well alright, give me container, take flamethrower. Say hello to Prapor, here's present for you...
Thanks, I'm off.
How's health? I want to borrow flamethrower for a while.
Mmm, thanks, slowly. Where are you going that you want to drag such contraption with you?
There's underground here, poltergeists there - tons! Without flamethrower it'll be tough... And I need to go there on business that concerns everyone.

Well... You understand, I would help of course, but our flamethrower's charge is already at zero, and there are no spare tanks with mixture. Unless you turn to Sidor, he can get anything. Let's agree like this: I give flamethrower for free, but you return it fully charged. And until you return it - no passage to Bar for you! Deal?
Deal.
Take it. Hope you keep your word!
Won't let me? Well, I'll try to manage without flamethrower.
Not far from here bandits want to chop up stalkers...
Hmm, so what? Stalker, bandit or someone else - what difference? Main thing they don't stick their noses where they shouldn't...
Decide yourself, this Demon isn't relative to me anyway...
There are few of them - stalkers. Maybe you'll help after all?
Bandits will lay them out, then yours won't feel well either.
Demon says these bros will start wasting yours too.

You think correctly! This Demon, between us, is quite a type. Circulated here among ours wanted poster - to keep eye on him. Very often he sticks his nose in all kinds of fights for no reason. Either too "idealistic", or covering tracks... You'd better avoid such types, after whom only corpses remain, by tenth road. You'll stay healthier...
Few? Well let them get out of there. What is this - "Your motherland behind you, Moscow behind"? What habit of fools - climbing into trouble!

So?! Waste ours - waster will be wasted. "DUTY" is not bunch of ragamuffins who are looking for ways to pull some nasty thing out of Zone! What's here should be here and destroyed! On this principle "Duty" stands and will stand! And the more all kinds of idiots shoot each other, the cleaner earth will be...

Which Demon? The one who makes trouble himself? As I heard, several stalker groups with good loot disappeared. And for some reason Demon's name often came up in conversations... Maybe just coincidence. Or maybe...\nIn short - "Duty" won't spill blood for those who don't prove themselves as our people in spirit!
Listen, Walnut, wanna shoot?
What? What ya talkin' about? I'm, damn, already armed...
Demon with buddies want to beat up someone. Maybe you'll help with yours? Demon will pay in thanks...

You're somethin', bro! Signed up for that Demon! That's complete thug! Guys like him are only good in grave... They whack him - that's where he belongs! And advice for ya - spit on that bastard, he'll fool ya like sucker and won't ask yer name.
Man, you're really goin'... Alright, calm down.
Quick, there's trouble at factory complex! Our group stood up for some loner, we caught his SOS signal...
More specific? Explain properly.
No time! Let's run there!
No, I'm not getting into others' fights without understanding like this.
Alright, let's go.
No time for chatter, need to hurry to help ours!
I'm running, running...
If needed - then hurry.
Thanks for help, friend!
Come on, what's the big deal...
What?! Who is it? Doc, is that you?
Who? I'll shoot!
Easy, Fang! It's me, Marked One.
Marked One... Good to hear you.
This isn't Doc...
Only Doc and Strelok's team knew the way here, who are you?
I don't remember who I am... Call me Marked One...
Marked One? Your voice reminds me of someone... Come closer.
I'm already right next to you, gone blind or what?
Yes, blind. I can barely see anything, just some gray spots...
How did this happen to you? Who are you? What do you know about Strelok?

So many questions... They call me Fang. Or used to call me that. There were three of us - crazy artifact hunters: Strelok, Ghost and me. In past life. We went deep into Zone, hunted most unusual and valuable artifacts... I didn't go on runs often - solved all kinds of technical issues, and those two tried to break through all the way to the center! Yeah... Strelok was senior among us, not for nothing they called him that - he was fighter blessed by God! With him I wouldn't have perished...
What happened to him?

I don't know! Doc kept asking too... I went to Dark Valley on Strelok's errand, and controller got me on way back. I only remember - my head started buzzing and... everything... Doc found me couple months ago, dragged me here. I don't remember this myself, he told me later when my head cleared up a bit. Said he wanted to take me to thicket first, burrow there is more reliable and I'd be under supervision, but I was getting worse before his eyes, so had to decide something urgently. That's why he dragged me here, and barely made it in time... That's what he said anyway.
So why are you sitting here? You need to get out of Zone, to real doctors.

I can't... On surface my head immediately tears apart... Some kind of radiation there, very sensitive for zombie brains. So I sit here, Doc drops by from time to time, brings food. Says I'm here temporarily. There is... should be possibility to shield from radiation and go to surface or at least to another place closer to him somewhere. So I hope, otherwise would've put bullet in forehead long ago.
How can I help you?
I don't know. But if anyone can help, it's probably Sakharov.
Sakharov? He's one of the scientists?

Well yes. Professor Sakharov, he's head of scientific expedition. Been living here almost since Zone's emergence. At Yantar in bunker they have base. He should know everything about zombies, there are tons of them, I mean us - zombies, there...
I'll definitely find out! And even if he doesn't know, I'll still try to find way to help you.
Thanks, I'll hope...
What is this place? I feel like I know it.

That's unlikely... Our group had secret stash here. Over there on left lies Strelok's famous Kalash. With this rifle one of pioneer stalkers got into anomaly, stalker got torn to pieces, but rifle mysteriously became more rapid-firing and accurate!\nThis is reliable place! Nobody could get here! And you can exit very easily and unnoticed.
How so?

There's some tricky spatial anomaly here. Responds to artifacts. If you stand near that door and activate certain artifact on belt, it'll teleport you to exit hatch on surface... in theory. Or somewhere else. Doc told me something like that and even named specific artifacts, but I don't remember...
Spatial anomaly? Doc probably uses it to get in.
Well, probably. Though I can't see, I hear - he appears out of nowhere. He's not there, not there, and suddenly there.
Why doesn't he take you out through same anomaly?

He said many times already that it's possible to teleport to cave in Misty Thicket. But says brain won't withstand it. Teleports also pressure somehow, though not constantly, but strongly sometimes. So he can't yet. Or waiting for some opportunity.
I see... I'd advise mining the stairs - set up tripwire or something. I got here, so it's not such reliable place.
You're probably right, I'll do that.
Tell me about Strelok. I feel - he's key to my memory.

Strelok... He was unusual, not of this world. Appeared couple years ago. Ghost and I were sitting in Swamps after particularly big emission. Sitting there, drinking vodka, counting if gathered loot is enough to replenish supplies... Then he bursts through door, completely naked, eyes insane... I thought another zombie got brought in. And he goes: "Let's drink!"... Ha! Speaks Russian strangely, can't tell where from right away. Yeah...
What did he want and why was he naked in swamp?
Said he teleported, but didn't say from where. But clearly from far away. Asked what year it was... And who can show road to Monolith.
Where did he go most often? Who might know where he is now?

Most often? Most often he was closer to Zone center, kept looking for path to Monolith. Sometimes dropped loot at Bar, explored Radar. Looked for unusual teleports, had instinct for them - seeker, basically... If you found Ghost - he communicated a lot with Strelok. And me - I was just fetch and carry.
You say three of you went deep into Zone, tried to break through to center... How? There's no direct road there it seems.

No. We didn't go to very center, I definitely didn't... I'm saying, we went deep into Zone. But you're right - there's no direct road there. It was Strelok who kept striving for center, had his own ideas. Maybe Ghost went with him... Hard for me to concentrate and remember exactly now... I found flash drive here. Strelok dropped it or someone else, don't know. If you find computer, try to open it. Maybe something will become clear.
I met with Sakharov. He says he can help you.
He can?! I already didn't believe. How?
Sakharov tuned special helmet. Says it will screen radiation.
Sakharov gave special helmet. Says it will screen radiation... where did I put it... Wait, dropped it apparently.
So what's next?
Yeah, maybe it's for the better. I don't believe in all this...

Honestly, I somehow doubt this is good idea... You see, professor wants to take you under his wing. Like for treatment. Though he claimed they're not into these things at all. And then supposedly they might even transfer you to real specialists on mainland, but... all this sounded somehow unconvincing.
No, wait, I'll dash out now, find it and come back...
Aren't you being too dramatic, Marked One? Judge for yourself: what other options do I have? Better to have bad chances than none at all, right?
Listen, Fang, can you wait a bit more? I'm afraid they'll send you as test rat to some closed research institute and that's it...
What if they can really help me there? And what else to wait for? It definitely won't get better for me here.
I understand... But please, be patient little more. I think there should be other ways to help you.
Ah, screw it, you're right! At least there's some hope. Here's helmet. Put it on head and go out.
Wait, what will I do next, how will I get to Sakharov? Well, suppose I put on this helmet, suppose it even helps... But I can barely see anything. What if helmet breaks, or something else...

Sakharov said helicopter will come for you and deliver straight to camp at Yantar. Probably they can somehow detect this contraption's operation and will navigate by signal. I'd escort you, but they warned me aircraft will be military and they might react nervously to extra "passenger"... Come on, go upstairs, since you decided! No point wasting time.
Alright. Hope we'll see each other again. You still remind me of someone. Voice, manner of speech, intonations. Would like to look at you with eyes... Take care.
Wait! Wanted to ask one more thing. What do you know about Monolith?

About Monolith? There was such legend, supposedly it's special artifact that grants wishes. Seems Strelok was convinced it's not legend at all and looked for ways to reach it. But I don't know anything proper about this. Supposedly Strelok and Ghost met with some scientist, discussed this question, but what came of it - I'm not aware.\nYes, here's what else I remembered: shortly before I got screwed, Strelok asked to think how to break code locks of bunker doors that sometimes appear in Zone. I didn't really get into it then - no time, and he was rushing somewhere. Also asked to find decent computer. Said we'll figure it out, think together how to make decoder. Also mentioned some labs. Seems he wanted to rush through them quickly to north, maybe right to that Monolith...
I don't understand, how is this possible? What labs?

I didn't understand him then either. Strelok and Ghost were always abnormal, came unexpectedly, unexpectedly rushed off on another raid. Well there. Once from another run Strelok burst in on me with words "This is our chance!". He found something, apparently. Ghost later kept cursing that they barely got away from mercenaries that day. And questioned me, did Strelok give anything, and if he did, what exactly... I said: he didn't give anything useful, just instructions. So I don't know what labs he meant...
What happened then?

Nothing. I went to Valley on his errand, and got caught on way back... Find Ghost or that scientist they met with, you'll learn more. Just can't remember name of that scientist.\nYes! I kept one artifact for myself here, thought if I have to get out after all, it'll help at least scare off dogs. And now - what do I need it for?! Let it better serve good person. Well, be healthy, friend!

Nothing. I went to Valley on his errand, and got caught on way back... Find Ghost or that scientist they met with, you'll learn more. Just can't remember name of that scientist.\nYes! That "Compass" Doc left me - what do I need it for now?! Take it. Let it better serve good person. Well, be healthy, friend!
Same to you. Farewell.
Fang, can I leave some loot here with you? Will you watch it?

No problem. Just you know... Feel sick at heart, need to forget even briefly. Let's do this: bottle from you - and you can dump your stuff in that box. Everything will be safe and sound until you return, promise.
Deal. Take bottle. Maybe pour you some right away or cut some snacks?
Don't have vodka with me, sorry. Another time.
Marked One, though I can't see, my hands haven't withered yet. I'll manage myself.
Alright. As you say.
Fang has severely damaged brain. Probably only Sakharov has necessary qualification to help deal with this damage. Need to reach Sakharov and outline situation
Need to convince Fang to put on helmet, go to surface and wait for helicopter that will deliver Fang to Sakharov. Or not convince?

I remember him! Seems we drank together and he told that Borov had excellent mechanic. This mechanic usually converted ordinary MP5s for PM cartridge. Borov seems to be boss among bros. Need to ask - such gun would be useful
One of yours said here: can shoot the breeze with ya...
What the f... Who the hell are ya?!
Helped one of yours here - Mongol's his handle...

Saved Mongol, eh... Waste of time. Shit person - garbage, not a man...\nWell alright. I keep locals in my fist, like boss for them. Since you helped one, means you got respect from whole crew. If I said so, not one dog from our gang will touch you.\nWhat's your name?
I'm Marked One. Call me that...
Marked One? Marked by whom? Alright, that's humor joke...
One person directed me...
What the f... Who the hell are ya?!
Tooth. Heard of such?

Ah, Toothy... Yes, they passed me his request, while there's no trouble from you, we'll chat nicely.\nWell alright. I keep locals in my fist, like boss for them. If I said so, not one dog from our gang will touch you.\nWhat's your name?
I'm Marked One. Call me that...
Marked One? Marked by whom? Alright, that's humor joke...
Got business to talk, and it was arranged...
What the f... Who the hell are ya?!
Tooth. Heard of such? And Mongol swore he'd pass thanks to you...

Saved Mongol, eh... And Toothy spoke up for you. Real hero...\nWell alright. I keep locals in my fist, like boss for them. Since you helped one, means you got respect from whole crew. If I said so, not one dog from our gang will touch you.\nWhat's your name?
I'm Marked One. Call me that...
Marked One? Marked by whom? Alright, that's humor joke...
I heard you had skilled mechanic with weapons?
Had one, got poisoned couple months ago... Got drunk on bad vodka, beast. Fell asleep and didn't wake up. Idiot, what else to say about him.
Pity. Thought to trade HK MP5 submachine gun for PM cartridge from him, well never mind.
Hmm, actually, couple such guns remained... Due to ammo shortage many would like to get such weapon.
And? As I understand, can't just buy or trade this tech wonder?
You understand correctly. Got one job, small one. Need to verify someone's death...
I don't kill for hire! Find another hitman!

Notice, I said - verify, not kill. Thing is, one of our old accomplices got in hopeless situation. Hopeless in direct sense. Went for artifact through anomalies, grabbed radiation and couldn't get out. Died there.
So what? Lots of people kick the bucket.

Yeah, you're right. In general case. But not this one. As I said, this is old accomplice, he's been with us long time, knew many things and many people.\nAnd I'm tormented by vague doubts: did he really croak or maybe decided to sell us all out, to Duty or soldiers. Agree, very convenient - you're dead and nobody bears grudge against you. Too easily he - if it's him - got caught, doesn't seem like experienced convict.
What do you want from me?
Very simple job. You examine corpse, find certain characteristic details, report about it. Result: you get decent gun, and I sleep peacefully.\nSo, fair?
Seems fair. Where to go and what "characteristic details" to find?
Sounds simple. But have you crawled in anomalies yourself? Try it.
As you wish. My job is to offer. I'll find another willing one.

I thought so, can see right away you're seasoned guy, Marked One! Now to business:\nAccomplice, what's his name - you don't need to know, contacted from Garbage territory. Corpse supposedly his, my boys saw behind tech cemetery - in small grove. Get closer - balls failed, anomalies there everywhere. If you get through, check. This dude never parted with mouth harp, thought it saves him from all troubles. If you find this harp on stiff, means it's him. If not, means we need to tear claws from here and change all stashes.
Listen, Borov, I'm about your task, regarding accomplice...
What about the task?
Changed my mind, won't go into anomalies.
Balls failed? Alright, your business.
Repeat again, where to look for corpse?

Yeah, Marked One, and I thought you were man with brains. Alright once more:\nAccomplice contacted from Garbage territory. Corpse supposedly his, my boys saw behind tech cemetery - in small grove. Check if corpse has mouth harp.\nThat's all!
Alright, alright, can't even ask...
Found your stiff, almost croaked in anomalies myself.
Don't inflate price, not at market. Is it him or not? Was harp with him?
It's him! Here's harp - took from corpse.
How should I know - him or not? We didn't drink to brotherhood. But no harp on corpse.
Phew, damn! Thank balls! Thanks, you calmed me... I gave away all homemade guns I promised to bros, sorry. Here, take better machine instead! Plus for peace of mind small present - ammo.
Phew, damn! Thank balls! Thanks, you calmed me... Stop! What's this crap? Why is cover scratched? You went inside? Tell me, you removed casing, right?
Damn... As I sensed, some trap here! Have to fold business with... well, that's not your concern. What did I promise you for work? Ah! That homemade gun. Well, here it is.
Alright, friendly like.

I didn't remove anything. Everything was already like that. Found another Hendrix too. On accordion I could still play something, but this instrument - don't even know which side to blow into. Why you so worked up?

Too smart? I'll check what's inside now, then call bros, laugh together... Hmm... yeah it's in place... You, Marked One, this... forget what I babbled here now, mixed up some things bit. Here, take gun I promised. Step now, need to think.
Borov suspects his old accomplice faked death. To make sure, need to search corpse located in small grove behind tech cemetery at Garbage. Can get HK MP5 9x18 submachine gun as reward
Mouth harp

This mouth harp belonged to bandit who died at Garbage. Under protective casing you can find scrap of thin cigarette paper with several rows of numbers - probably cipher. One word can be read - "Raven"
Hello, friend. What's your name?
Hello to you too. They call me Marked One.
Pleased to meet you! I'm Raven, Vitek Raven. Can help get some rare gear, also share useful information or connect with right people. Not for free, of course.
Yeah? What do you want in return?

I have connections to collectors of all kinds of unusual things. Sums, of course, not big, but stable income and most importantly, there's possibility to get necessary equipment for those trying to survive in Zone. Monster parts, artifacts, unusual devices, unique stalker trinkets - circle of interests of real collectors is wide. So if you need something, contact me. As they say: you scratch my back - I scratch yours.
I see. Think I'll definitely contact you.
Marked One! What brings you to us?
You talked about various collectors there. Maybe there's some order? I'd take it on.
You're so eager! We barely know each other, and you already want personal order. I'd like to test you first in some simple matter.
No problem. What matter?
Right now I have nothing suitable to entrust you. Come by in day or two or maybe in week.

So listen carefully. There's one artist in Zone, I mean real one, by profession. Everyone called him simply Artist. Harmless person, gets along with everyone, been many places, speaks bit strangely, but his stories are very interesting and instructive to listen to. Sort of collector of local folklore. And even more interesting - to flip through his album with notes and sketches about Zone. He showed it to many, but always refused to sell or trade, though they promised him quite a lot. This guy used to visit here often, but haven't heard about him for long time. And few days ago I heard rumor that supposedly he was seen at old regional committee dacha, in Swamps, but... then mysticism starts.
I understand. See you.
Mysticism right away? Zone is full of various wonders that science doesn't even know how to approach.

What does science have to do with it?! According to stalker who saw Artist, it was like this: he was walking one evening past regional committee dacha, darkness, pouring rain. Suddenly through water noise he hears someone calling him by name. Voice immediately seemed familiar. Listened - sound comes from house attic. Guy's not timid, decided to get closer. Just then lightning flashed bright and in that light he saw motionless figure standing in attic window... It was that same Artist, could hardly mistake, they met many times. Only now Artist looked exactly like dead man, but his lips were moving, repeating stalker's name over and over. That one, no matter how brave, still - ran from there without looking back. Almost flew into nearest anomaly...
What a story. Really creepy. What do you want from me? Look for holy water? There's one church in Swamps...

I share your skepticism. Dark, rain like from bucket, anomalies humming around, various creatures prowling nearby... who knows what might seem. Anyway, I want you to go check that place. If there's really some dead man there, search him. Artist never parted with his album. Find album, means that stalker didn't imagine it, means it's Artist. If there's no album with him or no corpse at all... well, at least there'll be hope that guy's still alive.
Something tells me Artist's fate worries you much less than appeared possibility to get his album.
Just don't start song about moral side, okay? You're not taking this job on altruistic basis yourself, but want some profit. Well, so do I. Business is business.
By the way, about profit. You haven't voiced yet what it'll be for me. Testing me in work - understandable. But not for free!

Don't pay much during probation, you understand. Offer such terms: if you bring album, I give excellent second level artifact, or tip about decent stash, with guarantee. Choose later what suits you more. Well, if album's not found, then bit of medicine and that's all. I don't get anything either in this case. Fair?
No, won't do. Too big chance of running for nothing, and I got my own affairs.
Fair. Deal.
Decide yourself. Won't offer second time.
That's good. See you.

Raven asked to look at old regional committee dacha, in Swamps, for traces of missing Artist. He might have album with notes and sketches about Zone, should take it along. In any case - return and tell about everything seen
Hi, Raven! Went to Swamps on your errand, found stalker's corpse at regional committee dacha, and in his things - interesting little album.
So Zone took Artist after all. Pity, he was talented guy. Well, show me your find.
Here. By the way, if you're interested, bloodsucker made lair at regional committee dacha. Seems he finished off the guy. Corpse was like dried mummy. Turns out, no mysticism.
Moment... where is it?! Seems I dropped it somewhere. I'll be right back...
Well-well, turns out so. Alright, payment from me. Decided yet, take excellent artifact or stash tip interests you?
If artifact's really excellent, then better take it.
Artifacts are replaceable, but what's in stash... Very curious. Tell me where to look. Hope it's worth it.
For well done job should pay accordingly - such is my belief. Here's your artifact. You passed test, now I'm ready to cooperate with you regularly.

As you say. Info's verified, from one reliable middleman, but without exact directions. For exact ones he asks decent surcharge, and that's not always profitable for me.\nSo, one soldier hid stolen ammo in backpack at Agroprom. Look for it on pipe, in middle of local swamp.\nThat's all. You passed test, now I'm ready to cooperate with you regularly.

As you say. Info's verified, from one reliable middleman, but without exact directions. For exact ones he asks decent surcharge, and that's not always profitable for me.\nSo, one soldier hid stolen ammo in backpack at Agroprom. On hill, near local swamp, trail to Yantar starts. Look for it in that area.\nThat's all. You passed test, now I'm ready to cooperate with you regularly.

As you say. Info's verified, from one reliable middleman, but without exact directions. For exact ones he asks decent surcharge, and that's not always profitable for me.\nSo, one soldier hid stolen ammo in backpack at Agroprom. It should lie somewhere by power lines, on road to Forgotten Farm.\nThat's all. You passed test, now I'm ready to cooperate with you regularly.
Thanks, glad to hear it. I'll drop by from time to time.
Oh, hope won't regret not taking artifact right away. Take care, dealer. I'll drop by from time to time.
Raven, what about orders for collectors?

Got small list of wanted items, sending to your PDA now. I'll clarify right away: broken, worn to holes and other junk doesn't interest me. All things should be, if not in perfect condition, then at least in good. Payment - tip about worthy stash, same scheme as when you checked info about Artist. If no suitable stash available, I'll pay with artifact. No deadlines, but you're not only one involved in these searches. Someone might be quicker. Questions?
I already gave you wanted list, nothing new. Did you manage to find something?
Seems clear. I'll go read your little list.
Yeah. Got one interesting thing, result of dark genius work from Cordon... I mean Vergas. Look, this is his electronic notebook. Everything works, condition... excellent... probably.

You could also say "not crashed, not painted". Alright, works - already good. Now about reward. One of experienced left backpack with loot in Rookie Village, Sidor was away then. And then owner himself "went away" to other world. Hidden somewhere in attics. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.

You could also say "not crashed, not painted". Alright, works - already good. Now about reward. One of experienced left backpack with loot on Cordon, Sidor was away then. And then owner himself "went away" to other world. Hidden somewhere near locomotive by tunnel leading to Sanatorium. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.

You could also say "not crashed, not painted". Alright, works - already good. Now about reward. One of experienced left backpack with loot on Cordon, Sidor was away then. And then owner himself "went away" to other world. Hidden near old pig farm, where tushkanos constantly make lair. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.
Got coat, inherited from former Borov's buddy. Seems that same one from your list, see for yourself.

Yes, can see right away it's not mass production, tailoring clearly made to individual order, even has master's monogram. Write down stash tip, it's in Wild Territory. Mercenaries shot group of stalkers there, and hid part of loot in backpack, near unfinished building, behind railway tracks. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.

Yes, can see right away it's not mass production, tailoring clearly made to individual order, even has master's monogram. Write down stash tip, it's in Wild Territory. Mercenaries shot group of stalkers there, and hid part of loot in backpack, on slope, right by tunnel with burners. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.

Yes, can see right away it's not mass production, tailoring clearly made to individual order, even has master's monogram. Write down stash tip, it's in Wild Territory. Mercenaries shot group of stalkers there, and hid part of loot in backpack, in one of freight cars. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.
Yeah, took such vest from soldier at Yantar. This is the one you need, Berill-7MT? I heard somewhere it has special lining impregnation that speeds wound healing.

Excellent, what customer needs! Who told you about impregnation? Vest's really special, but for other reasons... But that doesn't matter. Listen where to look for stash. One of wealthy hunters in Swamps recently became prey himself for local creatures. Known that he had stash - ordinary backpack, lies in some container, near road to us, to Valley. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.

Excellent, what customer needs! Who told you about impregnation? Vest's really special, but for other reasons... But that doesn't matter. Listen where to look for stash. One of wealthy hunters in Swamps recently became prey himself for local creatures. Known that he had stash - ordinary backpack, lies in area of dried swamp, where burers often roam. There's also old KAMAZ cabin rusting. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.

Excellent, what customer needs! Who told you about impregnation? Vest's really special, but for other reasons... But that doesn't matter. Listen where to look for stash. One of wealthy hunters in Swamps recently became prey himself for local creatures. Known that he had stash - ordinary backpack, lies somewhere near asphalt road to Cordon, before transformer booth. There's also truck skeleton rotting. That's all, find something else from list - bring it.
I was descending into an underground laboratory, found a corpse in such a distinctive suit there. I'd bet it belonged to Ghost himself. He's number 4 on your list. Is it him?

Let me see... And yes - it's him! Looks like a regular "Zarya" suit, right? But in reality, the layout here is more successful, meaning you get less tired, excellent night vision is built in, and protection is significantly enhanced compared to the base model. Now listen carefully, I'll tell you about the stash. I think it's been there since the Clear Sky times. As you probably guessed, it's in the Swamps. Look for a backpack near the sunken tugboat, the military set up an outpost nearby. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

Let me see... And yes - it's him! Looks like a regular "Zarya" suit, right? But in reality, the layout here is more successful, meaning you get less tired, excellent night vision is built in, and protection is significantly enhanced compared to the base model. Now listen carefully, I'll tell you about the stash. I think it's been there since the Clear Sky times. As you probably guessed, it's in the Swamps. Look for a backpack at an old stalker camp with two fire pits, located roughly halfway between the western military outpost and the small oil refinery. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

Let me see... And yes - it's him! Looks like a regular "Zarya" suit, right? But in reality, the layout here is more successful, meaning you get less tired, excellent night vision is built in, and protection is significantly enhanced compared to the base model. Now listen carefully, I'll tell you about the stash. I think it's been there since the Clear Sky times. As you probably guessed, it's in the Swamps. Look for a backpack on a small islet opposite the northern hamlet, there's also an old water tower there. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

Believe it or not, I managed to get my hands on an experimental Gravi suit. That was quite the deal! Its protective characteristics are pretty lousy, of course, but you can really work like a dump truck, hauling 200 kg of cargo. Check it out yourself.

No way! And I wasn't even fully convinced they existed. Yeah... in something like that you could haul a whole pile of loot out of the Zone at once... or bring it in. Awesome! Remember how to find your reward. The eggheads at Yantar were conducting field research, but something went wrong for them - they bolted so fast they left all their equipment behind. Look for a backpack in a swamp with an islet in the center, where a big metal thing is lying around. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

No way! And I wasn't even fully convinced they existed. Yeah... in something like that you could haul a whole pile of loot out of the Zone at once... or bring it in. Awesome! Remember how to find your reward. The eggheads at Yantar were conducting field research, but something went wrong for them - they bolted so fast they left all their equipment behind. Look for a backpack to the left of the entrance to the factory complex territory, near a trash container. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

No way! And I wasn't even fully convinced they existed. Yeah... in something like that you could haul a whole pile of loot out of the Zone at once... or bring it in. Awesome! Remember how to find your reward. The eggheads at Yantar were conducting field research, but something went wrong for them - they bolted so fast they left all their equipment behind. Look for a backpack near the entrance to the factory complex territory, where pipes and concrete rings are dumped, up to the trench with the excavator. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.
I'd bet you've never been brought such a power suit. That's exactly what the Monolith guys strut around in. I've seen it myself personally.

Interesting, how did you manage to find an approach to those fanatics?! Though, that's a secondary question. The main thing is that you really managed to get your hands on the rarest specimen. I think a fitting reward awaits you. My middleman learned about a place where mercenaries regularly leave ammunition for their raiding groups operating deep in the Zone. Warning: think ahead about protection from electrical discharges - you'll have to trek to "Tesla". There, as usual, look for a backpack. It should be hidden in the southeastern part of that area, on a fenced territory where, according to rumors, there's a descent into some secret bunker. Look carefully around the entrance gates. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

Interesting, how did you manage to find an approach to those fanatics?! Though, that's a secondary question. The main thing is that you really managed to get your hands on the rarest specimen. I think a fitting reward awaits you. My middleman learned about a place where mercenaries regularly leave ammunition for their raiding groups operating deep in the Zone. Warning: think ahead about protection from electrical discharges - you'll have to trek to "Tesla". There, as usual, look for a backpack. It should be hidden in the remains of one of the houses of an abandoned village in the southwest of that area. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

Interesting, how did you manage to find an approach to those fanatics?! Though, that's a secondary question. The main thing is that you really managed to get your hands on the rarest specimen. I think a fitting reward awaits you. My middleman learned about a place where mercenaries regularly leave ammunition for their raiding groups operating deep in the Zone. Warning: think ahead about protection from electrical discharges - you'll have to trek to "Tesla". There, as usual, look for a backpack. It should be hidden near the construction waste dump, with a distinctive yellow trailer nearby. There should be a fallen tree next to it. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.

Both find it and restore it to working condition. This is a flamethrower made by Screw, Freedom's mechanic. It looked pretty pitiful when it first came into my hands. But now, as you can see, after being serviced by the master himself, it once again looks like a formidable weapon.

Deadly, ya say? Gotta test it on the flesh. They keep crawlin' into our camp. Maybe with this contraption I can finally drive them off for good? You did excellent work, Marked One. Let's get to the handout. Don't know how, but the middleman sniffed out a place where Sultan's punks-smugglers leave orders for some rich foreign scumbag. Like a VIP client they got, he's into sniping. Rumor has it, he's one hell of a bastard. Likes organizing hunts on people, greenhorn rookies mostly. Anyway... His orders are left at the Sanatorium. Look for a backpack in one of the halls, on the second tier. That's it, find something else from the list - bring it over.
Not yet. And nothing new, then? I'll drop by some other time.
Definitely. See ya.

%c[255,160,160,160]Raven offers info on a stash in exchange for any of these unique items in good condition:
 
%c[default] - Electronic notebook (made by Vergas)
 - Unique black cloak (rumored to belong to a bandit nicknamed Rat)
 - Beryll-7MT armor suit (such were seen on special forces at Yantar)
 - Ghost's "Zarya" jumpsuit (they say the owner disappeared in one of the underground labs)
 - Gravi suit (a couple experimental samples are held by the military)
 - Flamethrower (Freedom's craftsman made some quantity of these)
 - "Monolith" power suit (worn by some fighters of the same-named group)
Hey there, guys! You... uh... haven't happened to find a stalker's corpse around here by any chance? Or maybe someone heard strange voices?
Marked One, are you drunk or what? What corpses, what voices? Go sleep it off.
No way, I'm clear as glass! It's just that a strange story happened here recently, I want to figure it out...

Strange stories happen in the Zone every day, you'd barely keep up writing them down just so you don't forget after a week. There's one guy, everyone calls him Artist, he's an expert in this field, knows many different tales and legends. I bet he's in the know about your "strange story" too. Try him, if you can find him first, of course. Haven't heard hide nor hair of him for quite a while...
There are no such coincidences...
What? What are you talking about?
Nothing... I'm going.
Hey, protectors of humanity! Are you guys even aware that a bloodsucker has set up a lair right above your heads? Plus he drained a man dry, maybe more than one...

Tone it down before you get smacked! First of all, we don't sit here 24/7, and second, when we checked out this place, we looked all around - it was clean. Or do you think we should now peek behind every bush in the Gut daily since we've settled here?
Behind every bush you don't need to, but right under your nose...

Well, there was some unclear noise from the attic a few days ago. I went up to look, turned out an owl was settling in for the day. You can't go running to check every rustle. And in my time serving in Duty I've learned to trust my instincts. And it told me it was safe here.
I see Duty has an answer for everything, just so nothing comes back to them... I'm going. You guys... at least bury the poor guy properly.
Of course we'll bury him. He's gonna start stinking soon - don't want to smell that. Get going.
I came across something here, a harmonica...
Big deal, there's tons of those harmonicas in the Zone - every third person's got one, probably...
Don't interrupt, listen! There's a note inside, like a cipher.
A cipher? Interesting... And why to me?
There's a name here - Raven! Look for yourself...
There was a name - Raven! I made a copy, take a look...

There's plenty of Ravens roaming the Zone!\nYes, indeed, a cipher. Judging by everything, this place with words is the cipher key, I think letters represent numbers. And where it says "shift", that's the shift of alphabet letters or numbers in the cipher itself.
Hmm, familiar thing... Where'd you find it?
Took it off a bandit's corpse. So is this something important or not?
Think it's important? Can you decode it?
No bro, I can't... Need a brainy guy for this... Listen! Try getting Docent to puzzle over it! You know, the one who hangs around at the Bar with Lanky... He'll definitely crack this puzzle.

Off a corpse, you say... Yes, indeed, a cipher.\nAh! By the way, see the corner of the cipher torn off, right here, where the word "Raven" ends? So this might not be "Raven", could be, say, "Ravine" or "Ravenkov", or who knows...\nJudging by everything, this place with words is the cipher key, I think letters represent numbers. And where it says "shift", that's the shift of alphabet letters or numbers in the cipher itself.

MAGNESIUM+TANTALUM=METALS 145826+948947=1094773 067859+368362=0436221 GIVE-WATER=PASHA 10652-9067=1585 (if p=1) COW+MILKMAID+GRASS=MILK AxR=I-F=M:E=T-I=K:A FLYx8=ELEPHANT PASHA+WATER=GIVE 1585+9067=10652 (if p=1) GRANDPA+GRANDMA+TURNIP=FAIRY TALE WHISPERx5=YELL ROACHx2=ROACH LETTERx6=WORD GOATx2=HERD CROSSx2=SPORT STRIKE+STRIKE=FIGHT GLASS+GLASS=ACCIDENT 85931+85931=171862 DRAMA+DRAMA=THEATER TITx2=BIRDS FLY+FLY=ELEPHANT SEALx5=APLOMB BEEx7=BUZZING TRADExG=DART SINEx2+COSINE=TANGENT STORKx4=FLOCK ONE+ONE=MANY BALLET+BALLET=THEATER ROLLS+WERE=MANY BOOKx3=SCIENCE PERCHx8=PIKE NATASHA+TONYA=SISTERS TWO HUNDRED+THREE HUNDRED=FIVE HUNDRED SUMMERx2=FLIGHT HEDGEHOGxHEDGEHOG=RUFFE SNAKExSNAKE=BOA
Hold it, stalker! This passage is protected!
Protected? From whom and why?
Yeah, I've already heard this bullshit.
Heard? I don't recall you.
All kinds of psychos and mutants crawl out of the Gut. We, free hunters, do our best not to let this filth through to the Cordon. Who are you?
They call me Marked One, and you?
I'm Dan! Heard of me, I bet? So here's how it is, Marked One, we don't just let anyone through! Prove that you're contributing to cleaning the Zone!
How's that?
Present trophies: parts of monsters you destroyed! A couple blind dog tails, or two wild boar hoofs, and if you have other parts, we'll take those too...
Present trophies: parts of monsters you destroyed! A couple blind dog tails, or two wild boar hoofs, and if you have other parts, we'll take those too...
Ha! I already paid off your guy over there...
Hold on! You go on now, Marked One. I'll sort this out.
It's you, Marked One... How's the Zone cleanup going?
Pass through, Marked One, you're worthy of respect!
It's you, Marked One, go ahead... go ahead.
I take it you don't take my word for it?
Word is silver... But facts are gold! Present facts, then we'll talk.
Here are two blind dog tails.
Got a dog tail and boar hoof here.
Wild cat tail.
Zombie hand, very cold.
A pair of warm boar hoofs.
Good pseudodog tail.
Will a flesh eye work?
Got a bloodsucker tentacle.
Here's a burer paw.
Here's a pseudogiant chunk.
Here's a controller hand.
Chimera claw, very hard.
Take a poltergeist eye.
Will flesh hide work?
Here's a snork boot.
I don't carry all kinds of stinking stuff with me.
That's enough! Here, take some buckshot for helping with shooting this filth... and pass in peace.
That's enough! Would've given you some buckshot as encouragement, but we're almost out, barely enough for ourselves. Don't be offended, I'll hook you up some other time.
Too bad, you'll have to go back.
Seems so, since you don't take my word...
Got any buckshot to spare?
Give me a monster part, get buckshot.
Come by in the morning, you'll get buckshot.
Morning it is then.
Out of buckshot for trade, sorry. Come back tomorrow morning, there'll be more.
Whatever you say...
Here's a blind dog tail.
Here's a boar hoof.
Here's a cat tail.
Here are tushkano heads.
Here's a scrap from a corpse.
Here's a pseudodog tail.
Here's a flesh eye.
Here's a bloodsucker tentacle.
Here's a burer paw.
Here's a pseudogiant chunk.
Here's a controller hand.
Here's a chimera claw.
Here's a poltergeist eye.
Here's flesh hide.
Here's a snork boot.
For the tail, take some rounds...
Good job, here you go...
Cat tail, here you go...
Pseudodog, ya say? Alright, take it...
Flesh eye? We'll pour out some shotgun shells...
Took down a bloodsucker? Good job! Respect...
Found a burer? Haven't seen them in a while... Here, from the heart for that!
Managed to take down a pseudogiant? Take a pile of bullets!
For a controller take everything I got right now!
Chimera - that's one hell of a pest! Take what I got right now...
Poltergeist eye? That's rare. Take what I got...
Flesh hide? You really helped out...
Snork boot? Sure thing...
I don't carry all kinds of stinking stuff with me.
Then you won't get any rounds.
Where ya headed, bro...
Just looking around... What's this you got here?
We got like a checkpoint here, don't let just anyone through...
Checkpoint? You guarding this tunnel or what? From who and why?

Ah! Dude! What, you totally green? This tunnel leads to the Gut... And there's all kinds of beasts, tons of mutants! And we, see! We're like hunters... Well.. Extr... Exterm... Anyway, we waste all this nasty stuff! So come on, cough up for moral support! One piece per mug... Well everyone, fo' real...
Bro, hand over the cash and go through.

Oh, you. Anyway, Dan here gave us a talking-to. Like "We're hunters, not gutter trash. We should be ensuring Zone cleanup..." And like more of that...\nSo - for us sweatin' here, we need to be given all kinds of mutant parts.\nSo, hand over tails, ears, paws and go through...
Marked One. Hand over proof: tails, ears, paws and go through...
Got a dog tail here.
Here's a boar hoof.
Pseudodog tail.
Here's a flesh eye.
Bloodsucker tentacle.
Burer paw, right?
Pseudogiant chunk, see?
Here's a controller hand.
Here's a chimera claw.
Chopped off a cat's tail. Here.
Ugh... Stinks. Alright. Go on.
Don't have those parts on me. Maybe we can make a deal?
Don't flash it around too much... Throw in a couple rubles?
Yeah. Here. Take the slip.
Hmm... No...
Move it faster, while we're still nice...
You've gotten tough, Marked One, move along already...
Money for you guys?
Yeah, five rubles for health improvement...
Cheapskates, here take it...
Don't have money for you guys!
Good one! Let's move...
Then turn around and get out of here...
Well, greetings, stalker! Haven't seen you around before... What's your name?
Hello to you too. I'm Marked One...
Marked One? No, haven't heard that name. New to the Zone?
Not really, I think. I don't remember! I'm looking for people who might know me or have information about Strelok.
Strelok is a legendary figure, but nothing's been heard about him for a long time. Talk to the folks around here, maybe someone will recognize you or give you some advice.
So, Marked One? Found anyone?
Not yet. I'll talk around some more...
Go ahead. Maybe you need something?

Uh... Marked One, I take it? I received a message from Sidorovich about you. The old bug didn't hesitate to even list your distinguishing features for safety's sake, and your appearance catches the eye, so don't be surprised I recognized you right away.
Yes, I'm Marked One. And I've heard about you too.
Good. Consider we've saved time on mutual pleasantries. So, I know you want to find someone and are looking to get further north, right?

Generally - yes. But not exactly. I'm looking for a stalker called Strelok, as well as those who know him or me. And I need to go north mainly because... It's just that there are higher chances of finding answers to my questions there.

I see. Look, here's the thing: we traders have long been looking for ways to penetrate beyond the Brain Scorcher. Sidorovich probably already told you about this. The papers you brought him mention a certain laboratory X-18, which by description resembles abandoned underground facilities in Dark Valley. In that laboratory, as it turned out, parts for an experimental installation were manufactured, the operating principle of which is similar to that of the Scorcher. You get what I'm driving at?
Not really. Sidorovich and I are settled, I completed his task. But what do you need from me?

What do I need... Your Strelok knew a lot of interesting things, apparently even the road to the center of the Zone. And maybe he's still somewhere out there now. I want you to go to X-18 and try to find any documentation there related to the work that was conducted there. There's a chance we can learn how to safely bypass the psi-emission fields. Then the path deep into the Zone for you... well, and for others, of course, will be open. You can ask the Monolith to restore your memory. Heh-heh. Just kidding.

Jokes aside, in my situation I'd believe even a legend if other ways to restore memory don't work. And actually Strelok might be somewhere out there... Alright, I agree. How do I get to this laboratory of yours?
You put it all so nicely, esteemed. But I'll probably refuse for now. Maybe later.

Excellent! I don't know exactly where the laboratory entrance is, but there's reliable information that this is known to Borov - the leader of the scumbag gang from Dark Valley. Try to get it out of him. If you haven't been to the Valley yet, at the Duty checkpoint on the Garbage, you'll learn how to get there quickly.
Your choice, Marked One. Just know: this is the only lead so far that will help us open the road deep into the Zone.
And how, in your opinion, should I make this bandit talk? And will he even listen to me at all? How do I avoid getting a bullet in the forehead right away in your Valley...

Everything in this world is solvable, Marked One. You're a new person, haven't particularly shown yourself... See the guy at the bar? Goes by Tooth, he has many connections with various factions. Try discussing this matter with him.
I sense this particular "solution" is gonna cost me a pretty penny. Alright, got it.
Well, good if you got it. I'll be waiting for news. Good luck!
Hey there, Marked One! I got a message from Sidorovich about you. I know you're looking for Strelok and trying to get further north, right?
Generally - yes. Except I need to go north mainly because... It's just that there are higher chances of finding answers to my questions there.

I see. Look, here's the thing: we traders have long been looking for ways to penetrate beyond the Brain Scorcher. Sidorovich probably already told you about this. The papers you brought him mention a certain laboratory X-18, which by description resembles abandoned underground facilities in Dark Valley. In that laboratory, as it turned out, parts for an experimental installation were manufactured, the operating principle of which is similar to that of the Scorcher. You get what I'm driving at?
Not really. Sidorovich and I are settled, I completed his task. But what do you need from me?

What do I need... Your Strelok knew a lot of interesting things, apparently even the road to the center of the Zone. And maybe he's still somewhere out there now. I want you to go to X-18 and try to find any documentation there related to the work that was conducted there. There's a chance we can learn how to safely bypass the psi-emission fields. Then the path deep into the Zone for you... well, and for others, of course, will be open. You can ask the Monolith to restore your memory. Heh-heh. Just kidding.

Jokes aside, in my situation I'd believe even a legend if other ways to restore memory don't work. And actually Strelok might be somewhere out there... Alright, I agree. How do I get to this laboratory of yours?
You put it all so nicely, esteemed. But I'll probably refuse for now. Maybe later.

Excellent! I don't know exactly where the laboratory entrance is, but there's reliable information that this is known to Borov - the leader of the scumbag gang from Dark Valley. Try to get it out of him. If you haven't been to the Valley yet, at the Duty checkpoint on the Garbage, you'll learn how to get there quickly.
Your choice, Marked One. Just know: this is the only lead so far that will help us open the road deep into the Zone.
And how, in your opinion, should I make this bandit talk? And will he even listen to me at all? How do I avoid getting a bullet in the forehead right away in your Valley...

Everything in this world is solvable, Marked One. You're a new person, haven't particularly shown yourself... See the guy at the bar? Goes by Tooth, he has many connections with various factions. Try discussing this matter with him.
I sense this particular "solution" is gonna cost me a pretty penny. Alright, got it.
Well, good if you got it. I'll be waiting for news. Good luck!
You were planning to head to Dark Valley, Marked One?
Need to prepare, pick up some gear...
Well, if I can help somehow...
Ah, there you are, Marked One... Been to the laboratory? Find anything?
Found a damn basement. Here's what was there.
Hmm... Seemed like there were some papers...

Let's see... Formulas, charts, blueprints... Don't breathe down my neck, need to figure this out. Go on, have a drink while I work. Ah... Here's a small present for managing to crawl through where cockroaches can't fit... Just kidding, just kidding! Relax.
Should've taken them... Instead of counting crows! Different rumors go around here about these laboratories. What to believe? Well, see for yourself. No papers - no road north...
Still fussing around? You look bad. Better get some rest.
I'll rest. Later. What's been clarified from the documents?
We're studying. When something comes up - I won't forget about you.

The situation is becoming clear. As I suspected, the Brain Scorcher is man-made. It's Kaymanov's experimental emitter, its parts were manufactured in laboratory X-18. These documents reference laboratory X-16, where the finished blocks were sent. According to fragmentary data, this laboratory is located on the territory of an industrial complex near Yantar lake.\nHmm... And I heard quite recently that someone managed to get into this X-16 from Red Forest... Strange. So, about Yantar. There's a scientists' camp nearby, they'll surely give more precise directions.
What about Red Forest and how to get there?

There was this half-mad guy here. Said his partner found some tunnel in Red Forest that leads to an underground lab. Only this talker was too scared to go there himself, and his partner never came back... No! Who knows what stalkers babble when drunk... And I won't tell you about the path to Red Forest. Ask around the warehouses, maybe someone will point you in the right direction.\nBut first, it's better to get to the scientists at Yantar and find out where exactly laboratory X-16 is located. Need to get the missing part of the documents. That's the main thing.
And why me? Look how many loafers are in the bar...

Exactly, loafers... They might not go, they'll say: "We're fed pretty well here too." Or they'll sit down somewhere halfway and get drunk, forgetting all about business. And time doesn't wait. I know you don't need this for money. You're personally invested, so only you can be relied upon.
Where does this concern for me come from and how do you know what I need?
Don't nitpick the words. You've already been noticed by many in the Zone. You yourself tell everyone you want to restore your memory... Well, are you ready?
Alright, I'm ready. But if I didn't need to go to Yantar myself, I wouldn't go.
That's excellent. I'm sending you coordinates of the crossing point to Wild Territory, beyond it is Yantar. I'll be waiting.
No, I'm not ready yet.
Get ready, Marked One. Such business can't wait long.
So, shall we begin? Ready for a trip to Yantar?
Alright, I'll try to find out what's there...
I'm not planning to go to Yantar yet...
That's excellent. I'm sending you coordinates of the crossing point to Wild Territory, beyond it is Yantar. I'll be waiting.
Get ready, Marked One. Such business can't wait long.
I thought you were already at Yantar... What's up?
So, Marked One, got the documents from X-16 with you?
Yeah, here they are.
No.
That's your business, of course, but... Without these documents our cause won't move forward!

Really been to that hellish place? Didn't expect it from you. You're lucky, or just... Well, whatever... I'll pass this to Docent now, let him think it over... Accept gratitude from all of stalkerdom! In material form. Maybe you'll relax a bit. And write down the recipe... from me personally.\nOh yes, about Docent! He was waiting for you, wanted to give you something, or return something, or tell you something... Ask him yourself.

Really been to that hellish place? Didn't expect it from you. You're lucky, or just... Well, whatever... I'll pass this to Docent now, let him think it over... Accept gratitude from all of stalkerdom! In material form. Maybe you'll relax a bit. And write down the recipe... from me personally.

Really been to that hellish place? Didn't expect it from you. You're lucky, or just... Well, whatever... I'll pass this to Docent now, let him think it over... Accept gratitude from all of stalkerdom! In material form. Maybe you'll relax a bit. And write down the recipe... from me personally.\nOh yes, about Docent! He was waiting for you, wanted to give you something, or return something, or tell you something... Ask him yourself.
Marked One, with all due respect... What did you want?
Well, Marked One, only thing left is to deal with the Scorcher and open passage to the North. Ready to head out now?
Ready.
Not yet! Let me at least catch my breath.
Rest, of course! Drink, eat... relax.

So here's the deal, Marked One. According to the documents, the Scorcher's emission is of the same nature as at Yantar... Docent scanned the data onto a flash drive, give it to Sakharov. I marked on the map exactly where stalkers died trying to break through to the center. The control bunker for the Brain Scorcher is also mentioned. I sent you the bunker coordinates. There's a reference to an entry code - 23486. Try it...\nPossibly, that's where the entire system can be shut down. So it's necessary to break through to the bunker under the antennas as quickly as possible and turn off the Scorcher. What happens next, I don't know, but I feel: it's worth it. I know one thing for sure: the Scorcher won't interfere with breaking through to the center of the Zone after this. And what's there... God knows.
Continue.
Wait, wait! Point the way with your finger! Otherwise - bunker, coordinates...
All that needs to be done is find out from Sakharov about the possibility of reaching the bunker under the antennas in sound mind and shutting them down. Everything clear?

Damn it! Well there, go through the northern checkpoint along the road north. There'll be the territory of former Army Warehouses, a village, and a stinking swamp. Keep going without paying attention to the stoned Freedomers... and there the Scorcher will soon manifest itself. Can't miss it!\nAll that needs to be done is find out from Sakharov about the possibility of reaching the bunker under the antennas and shutting them down. Everything clear?

That's clear. What's not clear is why you've dumped all this on me: X-18, X-16, now the Scorcher? What's this interest in my person? One might think there's no one else around. Maybe you're not interested in the center of the Zone, but Strelok himself?
I wouldn't mind having a chat with Strelok, of course. But somehow you got it all wrong.
Got it how I got it. In short: you showed me the way... Maybe I'll go there, but I'd advise you to find other daredevils for now.

As you wish... I'll look for them, but don't you delay either.\nOh yes, one more thing! The Duty commander needs a volunteer for some mission at Army Warehouses, if you're interested, you can visit him. If you haven't had dealings with them yet, I'll arrange with the guards, they'll let you through.
Hello, Marked One. Time goes by, but you don't change, still the same unsociable. Sit down, have a drink, maybe you'll soften up a bit.
Oh! Marked One! What brings you here?
Listen, I was in the bunker under the Scorcher. You got something mixed up! There's no control panel there! I turned everything upside down!

Ah! I sent you a message in pursuit. Didn't you get it? Turned out to be a mistake. Outdated information. I figured right away it was too easy! Well, never mind, the main thing is you stayed alive. Others managed to find a way to shut down that damn Scorcher.
Well then... How's that? And, most importantly, where?
Don't know where, I'm not the one who shut it down. But don't worry about it. You're independent now, decide for yourself what and when to do. Not noticing anything, by the way?
What should I notice? Did you pluck your eyebrows or something?

Oh, you! And you seem to have been in the Zone for more than a day. The population left is - one, two and you're done counting! They shut down the Scorcher! The guys from Ivar's group, haven't heard of them? They also call themselves "Seekers". Ivar, though, returned to the Bar alone, but none of his group can be seen.\nWell, never mind. So here it is, he found the weak spot of that damned Brain Scorcher after all. Now everyone who can throw bolts has moved toward the center, to Pripyat, and even further. It's become empty here... Now, probably, there's enough profit for everyone! It's an untouched Klondike there!

Ivar... I think I heard something about him. And who is he? Been in the Zone long? Maybe if he figured out how to turn off that radar brain-crusher, he knows other Zone secrets too? For example, about Strelok...

The questions you have, of course... Ivar is from the Baltics it seems, and they're serious people. Don't know about Strelok. Maybe they're acquainted. Try asking him yourself if you can. He's a bit out of it after Radar.
Out of it? Meaning?

Yeah, seems the radiation got to him. Don't know what happened to the others from his group, but when he came, he still spoke normally, but then each day got worse and worse. Now he mumbles something, sometimes coherently, sometimes not so much. Though sometimes his head clears up and he speaks quite decently.
So he's still here somewhere?

Here, here. Where would he go now in such a state?\nFeel bad for the guy... He was trying to treat zombified stalkers himself. They say that's why he came here. Like he was a brain doctor, treated all kinds of psychos. And here, see how it turned out. He's practically turning into a zombified stalker before our eyes...
Brain doctor, you say? Interesting... And can't he be helped anymore?

Who would help if even he couldn't de-zombify anyone? I heard he managed to bring someone to their senses temporarily, someone who hadn't been under brain-frying too much, but that's just... People talk all kinds of things, you know yourself.\nI put out a request on the network, so if anyone meets the Doctor, they'd call him to the Bar urgently. If he can't help, then probably no one can anymore.
I see. Alright, I'll try to talk with Ivar myself.
Try it. Don't rush, rest a bit, you don't look good. Like after a wild hangover. As if you too... Bah, bah.
Marked One? By the way, you never said where you've been wandering all this time.
I already told you: was crawling underground at that Scorcher. Got hearing problems?

Come on now... And honestly, between us, where were you missing for two weeks? Come on, spill it. Been drinking somewhere all this time, and then when you heard the Scorcher was turned off, remembered and showed up - like to save face, saying you were there but didn't find anything... Wanted to play hero. So, am I right? Will you tell?
What are you babbling about?! Nothing to tell you. But those two weeks... that's interesting to me too.
Well if you don't want to, as you wish...\nOh! Some guy was asking about you here a couple times, but you were nowhere to be found.
As if some woman could be asking about me here... What did he want?
Hell if I know. He's got something about Strelok for you it seems.
And who is he? Where to look?

Don't know, he didn't introduce himself. Seemed to come to Sultan. Probably one of his people. He's already gone... Can't remember where they hang out - some village, look there if you want. I thought you'd be interested, you keep asking about Strelok.

Yeah, ask anyone here and they all "know" something about Strelok. And this one's probably one of those same experts. So he'll find me himself if he really needs to... Don't have time to run around the Village looking for who knows who.
What do I care, right?\nAh, I forgot! He was talking about something with Ivar while he could still speak clearly. Don't know what they were discussing, but they parted on bad terms.
How do you know?
It happened right here in the bar in front of me. I wasn't eavesdropping - none of my business, but I definitely heard Strelok's name.
Again go there, don't know where...
What are you talking about?
Just to myself... Thinking about where to head next.

Don't think. Head north, you were striving to get there yourself. Everyone's already rushed north. The main thing in our business is loot, and they'll be dragging it in sacks soon... Only somehow they're not bringing any yet, should be time already...
How's life? Should get some rest, you look terrible.
Hey there. Why so out of breath?
Been running here from the station after barely getting your message. Just kidding. Better tell me, what's this important information you have? Why did you call me?
You're sharp as diarrhea. Also a joke.\nYou were interested in a stalker called Ghost, as I heard? He was here recently, asking about you. As I understood, he's looking to meet with you.
Really? Imagine that, I also want to have a close "chat" with him! And where is he?
At Radar. At least he asked me to tell you he'll be waiting for you there for a few more days at some crossroads. That's all. No need to thank me - Ghost paid for my intermediary services.
How's it going? Alright? Well, that's good.
I need information from Borov, can you help?
I can help arrange a meeting with him if you do something...
I was told that Borov got whacked... As for what he might have known, well...
I was told that Borov got whacked... And you were seen there. Confess, was it your doing? Probably took a big score? Yeah?
Can you be more specific?
Don't beat around the bush, let's be more specific...
Uh... I didn't take anything! I need to find out what Borov knew. Can you help?
More specific? Can be more specific...\nRecently I and several worthy people concluded a weapons and equipment supply contract. With whom, you ask? I answer: the less you know - the better you sleep.
More specific? Can be more specific...\nThere's one little guy who learned a lot of Borov's secrets. So you give me twenty grand, I give you a tip - where this rat can be found.

Playing coy? Your business. Why kill that guy if you need something from him now? Alright.\nThere's one little guy who learned a lot of Borov's secrets. So you give me a hundred grand, I give you a tip where this rat can be found.
So what's the problem?
Isn't that too much? Well alright, I'll transfer it...
Don't have that much cash right now.
Isn't that too much?! Well alright, I'll transfer it...
What?! Don't have that much cash right now.

The problem is the caravan didn't reach the meeting point. The escort, my man, reported they were attacked and he'd try to hide in a safe place. No word from him since... I'd ask you, as payment for the service, to find out what happened to our cargo.
Not much. What's money? Trash... According to my information, this Rat was seen in the Gut, skulking around the gas station somewhere. Hurry up, maybe you'll catch him alive.
Not much. What's money? Trash... According to my information, this Rat was seen in the Gut, skulking around the gas station somewhere. Hurry up, maybe you'll catch him alive.
Alright, let's see what kind of rat this is...
If I agree, where would I need to go?
Last contact with my man was from Swamp. And if he's not responding anymore, something happened.
Alright, I'll head over there... How will I recognize your man?
And how do I get there? I've heard of Swamp, but don't know the way. Only know a path to Forgotten Village, seems from there to Swamp is a stone's throw if judging by the map.
Yeah, they say there's a short road from the Village to Swamp. Go there, talk to people. Maybe someone will point the way.
I'll go... Who should I look for at Swamp?

And how do I get there? I've heard of Swamp, but don't know the way. Seems from Forgotten Village to Swamp is a stone's throw if judging by the map, but I don't know the way there either. Alright, then it didn't work out, I'll look for approaches to Borov myself.
Trudge through swamp mud? No, I'll probably do without your services. I'll try to find an approach to Borov myself.

His name is Mueller. He's a mercenary, but honest, and if he took an advance, he'll complete the job. He's hiding in a village somewhere in the northern part. I suppose he might be wounded, if not worse... So don't waste time, head out immediately.
Alright, I'm off to Swamp, and you prepare a meeting with Borov.
Missing Caravan
A weapons caravan went missing at Agroprom. Need to find Mueller, the mercenary escorting the caravan. Last known location: he's hiding in one of the villages in the northeast of Swamp
Mueller received severe radioactive exposure. Need to bring him two anti-radiation drugs within 6 hours
Mueller wrote a note with encrypted coordinates, need to give this note to Tooth
The note contains coordinates of the cargo drop location. Need to verify if this is really the caravan cargo Tooth was talking about. Need to examine the crates
The caravan cargo was found at the specified coordinates. Need to report this to Tooth as soon as possible before the military gets involved
Mueller's Note
Mueller scribbled some incomprehensible squiggles, says it's encrypted coordinates of the cargo location...
What do you want, stalker? Can't you see I'm in bad shape?
I can see. Who are you and what happened?
I'm Mueller. Me and my comrades ran into a military ambush, had to run for it... Caught radiation up to my eyeballs...
And I'm looking for you, Mueller. I'm from Tooth. Where's the weapons caravan?
Help me, brother, and I'll tell you everything, honest as hell... I feel like I got three hours left if I don't take anti-rad... Two...
I got a couple anti-rads, let me inject you...
I got a bottle of vodka, drink up, should help a little.
Damn, I don't have anti-rads, where can I find them?

Whoa, thank you... I'll remember this forever!\nAs I was saying, the soldiers attacked us. Combat escort got wiped out immediately, but I managed to escape through the radioactive swamp. Here, give Tooth this note with ambush coordinates. I think the cargo's still there. Only Tooth knows the note's cipher. Get to him, I'll back away from death's door...
Alright, recover. I'm off to the Bar.

Wait! I got nothing to give you now, but I can compensate for expenses. I got a stash nearby, at Forgotten Village. There's a house... don't know how to describe it exactly. Anyway, you'll find it yourself, there aren't many. And in the attic I hid some medical supplies.

Wait! I got nothing to give you now, but I can compensate for expenses. I got a stash nearby, at Forgotten Village. There's a house... don't know how to describe it exactly. Anyway, you'll find it yourself, there aren't many. And in the attic I hid some medical supplies.\nBy the way, if you don't know, there's one path from here that leads straight to Forgotten Village. Here... look at the map.
That'll come in handy, thanks.
Thanks... Now I'll last longer, about three hours... I got a stash nearby, at Forgotten Village... In the attic of a house, there's a box with various medicines... Hurry.
Hang in there, I'll find anti-rads...
I got a stash nearby, at Forgotten Village... In the attic of a house, there's a box with various medicines... Hurry.
At Forgotten Village? By the time I get there, how much time will pass...
There's a short path from here. Here... look at the map. Hurry, please...
I'll find anti-rads... Hang on!
Is that you? Ugh... it's dark...
Found anti-rads, let me inject you...
Hold on a little longer...

Whoa, thank you... Almost kicked the bucket! I'll remember this forever!\nAs I was saying, the soldiers attacked us. Combat escort got wiped out immediately, but I managed to escape through the radioactive swamp. Here, give Tooth this note with ambush coordinates. I think the cargo's still there.
