Only Tooth knows the note's cipher. Get to him, I'll back away from death's door...
Alright, recover. I'm off to the Bar.
Oh, it's my savior! Greetings! What's your name? I forgot to ask right away?
Hello to you too. Call me Marked One.
Thank you again, Marked One! I owe you...
Marked One? Need something? Don't forget, I'll do anything for you...
Marked One, is that you? Hey there, wanderer! Small world, and the Zone's even smaller. What brings you here?
Hey there. Yeah, just been running around here on my business...

Being secretive? Come on, your business is your business, doesn't concern me.\nListen, I never properly thanked you for saving me back then at Swamp. Here, take some ammunition. Can't give more, sorry. We don't have it like in the army, but some bookkeeping still exists.
Well, thanks. I'll be going, business doesn't wait.
Wait, Marked One. Maybe you'd agree to help me with something? Not for free, of course.
Good to see you, Marked One! You showed up at just the right time. Won't you help me with something? Not for free, of course.
If it's some wet work, that's not for me, I'll say right now.

What wet work, what's wrong with you? I need a new suit, same as the one I'm wearing. This one got torn up in several places after my misadventures, the mask cracked, and it still radiates a bit even though I washed it as best I could. I ordered it back on the mainland, but I know there's a master in the Zone who sews these too. What do you think, could you find this craftsman and pay for his work? Don't think I want to boss you around like some lackey. Would've gone myself, but the boss ordered no one leave camp - business is about to go down.\nIf you manage to get me new gear, you can choose the reward yourself: modificate recipe, the modificate itself, or a rare gun. What do you say?
Sounds good. Deal.
On one hand it's tempting, but on the other... Too much hassle, sorry Mueller, but I'll pass.
That's great. Honestly, it's embarrassing to show off in front of comrades in a torn suit...
Well, as you wish. I'll have to arrange through Tooth with someone, and he'll take his commission... Alright, not your problem.
Hey there, bro! How's it going with my suit? Any progress?
And stay healthy, Mueller. All good, you can try on the new gear.
Nothing yet. Just dropped by to say hello.

Sweet! Even better than what I had. People really know their craft! You did me a solid, Marked One, no doubt. Now, as agreed, choose how I'll thank you.\nRecently info came through our channels about a recipe for "Porcupine" modificate. One comrade - now deceased - even risked trying it... Why the long face? Ha-ha! No, don't worry, he didn't die from that "brewing" experiment. That was later. So, want to learn the recipe or prefer to feel the artifact itself? I know where the deceased stashed the resulting artifact. If neither interests you, I recommend taking payment with this gun - "FN F2000 Tactical". Gorgeous piece. They delivered a batch to us recently, everyone's pissing boiling water from joy.
Let it be the recipe. Never know what artifact might come in handy tomorrow. Some you can't find in the field with a magnifying glass.
I prefer real loot. Tell me where to look for the artifact.
What's this "FN F2000 Tactical"? Never heard of it. But if you recommend it... Here goes nothing!
Oh, these stalker complications. One moment, I'll upload everything to your PDA...

Uh... there's one snag. You see, I was never close friends with that comrade, and learned about the stash with the artifact after his death by hacking his PDA. Anyway, can't name the exact location, but judging by the records from the palmtop, should look in Limansk, in the courtyard in front of the house where Freedomers and stalkers constantly hang out.\nThe deceased didn't have the artifact on him, and before that we were together watching some goner... but that doesn't matter. What matters is he was in sight almost all the time, so couldn't have sold the artifact either. I'm sure that modificate is still lying in the stash.

Uh... there's one snag. You see, I was never close friends with that comrade, and learned about the stash with the artifact after his death by hacking his PDA. Anyway, can't name the exact location, but judging by the records from the palmtop, should look in Limansk, somewhere on the upper floors of the unfinished building that stands on the hill.\nThe deceased didn't have the artifact on him, and before that we were together watching some goner... but that doesn't matter. What matters is he was in sight almost all the time, so couldn't have sold the artifact either. I'm sure that modificate is still lying in the stash.

Uh... there's one snag. You see, I was never close friends with that comrade, and learned about the stash with the artifact after his death by hacking his PDA. Anyway, can't name the exact location, but judging by the records from the palmtop, should look in Limansk, on the square, near the watchtower.\nThe deceased didn't have the artifact on him, and before that we were together watching some goner... but that doesn't matter. What matters is he was in sight almost all the time, so couldn't have sold the artifact either. I'm sure that modificate is still lying in the stash.
There, right choice! I'd take the weapon too if I were you, when offered. Don't worry, you'll be satisfied, I guarantee it.
Yeah, got it. Alright, good luck.
Yeah, better hope it's where it should be... which still needs to be found first. Well, not the first time. Alright, good luck.
Hmm... looks unusual. Alright, I'll get used to it. Okay, good luck.
Greetings, Marked One! How are you?
Mueller, mercenary from Army Warehouses, asks to get him a new black suit with gas mask. Promises various goodies of my choice as reward.
About the caravan...
Quiet! Everything should stay between us... What did you learn?
Found your man, Mueller. But... He died.
What about the caravan?
Who knows? I did my job, what about our deal?

Tooth keeps his word. But there's one thing. You found Mueller, yes. Dead. But while you were wandering somewhere, he managed to send me a message on PDA the day after our conversation, already dying. I'm extremely dissatisfied with your sluggishness, Marked One. We didn't discuss penalties, of course, but I think it'd be fair if you give me a second-level artifact. And in excellent condition, necessarily.
You're quite the nerve... But I admit I could've acted faster. Here's the artifact.
Hmm... Let's see.
That's great. Everything's smooth on my end. You can go to the Valley. None of his boys will shoot at you before negotiations with Borov.
They say something happened to Borov - he got whacked. But there's a guy who grabbed many of Borov's secrets.\nSeemed to be seen in the Gut. Rodent is his name.
I'm here about the meeting with Borov.
Brought a second-level artifact? Can't get around compensation here.
You're quite the nerve... But I admit I could've acted faster back then. Here's the artifact.
Compensation? You'll get your compensation.
That's great. Everything's smooth on my end. You can go to the Valley. None of his boys will shoot at you before negotiations with Borov.
They say something happened to Borov - he got whacked. But there's a guy who grabbed many of Borov's secrets.\nSeemed to be seen in the Gut. Rodent is his name.
I found out about the caravan...
Quiet! Everything should stay between us... What did you learn?
Of those escorting the caravan, only Mueller survived. He gave you a note... Here it is.

Survived, you say? That's good... So, judging by the note, military attacked the caravan. They usually don't take cargo out of the Zone, afraid of radiation and other strange emissions. So most likely the cargo remained at the ambush site.
Well, I did my job, what about our deal?

Everything's in force, I talked to who I needed. You can go to the Valley. None of his boys will shoot at you before negotiations with Borov.\nMarked One, maybe we finish the caravan business? Check the ambush site, if the cargo's there, I'll send guys to haul everything out... So what do you say?

They say something happened to Borov - he got whacked. But there's a guy who grabbed many of Borov's secrets.\nMarked One, maybe we finish the caravan business? Check the ambush site, if the cargo's there, I'll send guys to haul everything out... Then I'll give you a tip on this rat, plus something else I'll throw in, got something to give you... You won't regret it!
What needs to be done?
No, I have my own path, figure it out yourself.
Check the crates at Agroprom, see if it's really our cargo. If everything's right, come back.
Alright, deal.
We'll figure it out, but you...
Boy did I get in trouble with your caravan!
What happened? No cargo?
It's there! There's a chimera lair and radiation - holy hell!
Don't whine... Thanks for the work. As reward I can offer either a recipe for a very rare artifact - called "Eye", or a container for 3 artifacts and ammo for the "VAL", won't hurt to have.

Don't whine... Thanks for the work! Take some ammo from me, won't hurt to have, and a container for 3 artifacts. They say something happened to Borov - he got whacked. But there's a guy who grabbed many of Borov's secrets.\nSeemed to be seen in the Gut. Rodent is his name.
Recipe is good, didn't run around for nothing.
I'll take the container and ammo, might come in handy.
Sent the recipe to your PDA - study it.
Then take the container and ammo.
Thank you. Be well...
Need to get to Yantar...
To Yantar? Well... What's your interest there?
Yeah, already heard. Artifacts from you. Then I'll share information...
Need to help someone. Only scientists know how it can be done...

Well? Scientists... Between us girls, these nerds don't know anything! Trust me, I haven't heard anything good about them from any stalker yet. The places there are cursed, you better not go there. You'll be safer.
Don't worry about me too much. Will you show the way?

Ever heard the saying: "Knowledge is money"? No? Then I'll say it simpler - you get me four good ones, no less than second level artifacts, and I'll tell you how to pass so your guts stay with you.\nOh, look how you winced! Well, if you can't do four second-level - give me a couple third-level. Or just one, but from the dummies...
If it weren't for... Alright. Here's four second-level.
Two artifacts! Here, take them, robber.
Here's a dummy, now talk.
Don't have that many artifacts.

Money is dust, good attitude is diamond! Remember that. Look here, you need to go a bit more to the left here - there's a "Bungee", the bastard, settled there, and here run without delay - some crap drips on your brain... Got it? Well, good luck...

Stalker, help! We were flying to Yantar when mercenaries shot down our helicopter. Pilots and three of our colleagues died in the hard landing. Another was later shot by mercenaries. We're not fighters, we're scientists... What could we do?!
Why did the mercenaries attack you?

We were researching the possibility of passage through Yantar to Radar. At Radar, rumor has it, there might be quite a lot of artifacts and possibly a direct path further to the reactor itself. The psi-emission intensity is non-uniform, and with enough observations it might be possible to create protection that would allow crossing terrain where deadly radiation operates.
So what's that to the mercenaries?

Apparently someone's eager to penetrate the center of the Zone and solve the mystery of the Monolith... if, of course, we assume it really exists. So they hire "soldiers of fortune" to capture all available information on this matter.\nSorry, I didn't introduce myself, Kruglov is my surname, and what should I call you?

Call me Marked One. I've heard something about the Monolith and the center of the Zone somewhere. What is it? Why is someone looking for information about it and why should you know anything about it? And what did you want from me?
Mercenaries, you say? By any chance, not the ones by the trailer, behind the unfinished building, feeding snorks?
What? They're... dead? All of them?
How should I know, maybe someone ran away or hid. Why did they attack you at all?
I rummaged around the mercenary camp a bit, but didn't come across any PDAs. Maybe someone really did run off and took your stuff with them.
Yeah... that's a real shame. So much time and effort wasted, ugh. Listen, Marked One, couldn't you then escort us to Yantar? You won't lose out, I promise!
Alright, it's on my way anyway. Show the route, I don't know this area well.
No, Kruglov, sorry, I'm swamped with work, not going your way.
Alright, go on then. We'll manage somehow, and Sakharov probably already alerted rescuers about our disappearance...

Marked One, I see you're an experienced stalker, but you ask too many questions. If we get out of here, I'll definitely answer all of them, but not now. Our situation is screwed. How are we going to get to our camp at Yantar?! And the worst part is that our three months of work is lost - the mercenaries took all our PDAs.
That's putting it mildly. Let's get to business then.

I'm thinking: what if there's still a chance to get at least something back?! At least my PDA, that had the most valuable information. What if you could negotiate with the mercenaries or somehow force them otherwise?
Negotiate with mercenaries? Won't they just start shooting at me the moment they see me? Pretty risky. Why should I? And where to look for them now?
Let me try to escort you to Yantar instead.
Listen, Kruglov, your problems don't concern me...

Don't worry! You won't lose out, I promise! I'll share useful information, and I have something more substantial saved for a rainy day, so to speak. As for "where to look" - I heard the mercenaries talking among themselves that they're planning to set up camp nearby, behind the unfinished building.
Huge thanks for that! But keep in mind: we're not fighters, we're useless in case of danger. And when we reach safety, I'll pay you fairly for the help, be sure of that.
Well, that's a shame. Let's hope Professor Sakharov sends rescuers to look for us.
Hell with it, here goes nothing! I'll try to negotiate.
Got it. In short, show the way, I don't know this area well.
Most certainly...
Marked One, is that you? So, any news?
Boy did I run around for your data!
I talked to their leader. Overall he agrees, but demands something in return.
In progress. Wait.
In short, it's a bust. The main mercenary kicked the bucket and your PDA wasn't on him.
About the mercenary leader's stash...
Did it work? Do you have our PDAs? Come on, don't keep me in suspense!
Their leader gave me this PDA, said it was yours. Here, take it, check it. I couldn't turn it on myself, by the way. Maybe the battery died?
Found the mercenaries' stash, and there were 3 broken PDAs and one whole one. Here, take it, check it. Is it yours? I couldn't turn it on myself, by the way. Maybe the battery died?

Definitely mine. There's special blocking here, like insurance in case of loss. Though it seems the mercenaries figured out how to bypass it. Well, at least all the data is intact. Now I can contact Sakharov to send help. Huge human thanks to you, Marked One!\nSo look, here's where the safe road from Bar to Army Warehouses begins. When you get there, turn right immediately and go along the barbed wire. You'll see a small box under a tree. I hid an artifact and medical kits there - it's rightfully yours now.\nMmm... Ah! Alright! There's another place! Behind the factory at Yantar, look under the old excavator, I also stored some things for myself there. Hope they haven't been stolen yet. By the way! I recently learned a very interesting artifact transformation method from a colleague. Write down the recipe for obtaining the "Diamond Kolobok" hypermodificate!

Definitely mine. There's special blocking here, like insurance in case of loss. Though it seems the mercenaries figured out how to bypass it. Well, at least all the data is intact. Now I can contact Sakharov to send help. Huge human thanks to you, Marked One!\nSo look, when you're at Yantar, visit the factory complex if you get a chance. Look under the old excavator there. I stored some things for myself. Take them by right. Also, I recently learned a very interesting artifact transformation method from a colleague. Write down the recipe for obtaining the "Diamond Kolobok" hypermodificate!

What luck, such luck - it's mine! There's special blocking here, like insurance in case of loss. Though it seems the mercenaries figured out how to bypass it. Well, at least all the data is intact. Now I can contact Sakharov to send help. Thanks to you, Marked One, for your help!\nSo look, here's where the safe road from Bar to Army Warehouses begins. When you get there, turn right immediately and go along the barbed wire. You'll see a small box under a tree. I hid an artifact and medical kits there - it's rightfully yours now. And I also recently learned a very interesting artifact transformation method from a colleague. Write down the recipe for obtaining the "Diamond Kolobok" hypermodificate!
Wow, worthy! Well, thank you too!
What exactly?
Doesn't matter, I'll figure it out myself. Stay here, I'll try to be quick.

Here's the situation. Wolfhound - that's their leader's nickname - agrees to give back your PDA with data in exchange for an artifact called "Mama's beads". The question is where to find these "Beads".

"Mama's beads"? I've heard of such an artifact. You can't find it in natural conditions, specific conditions are needed. As you stalkers say - a "recipe" is needed. I even had it written down somewhere, from our colleague - Docent Semyonov. But I don't know it by heart, sorry. Maybe try visiting Yantar, ask Semyonov himself?
In principle, that's possible...

Oh yes, here's something else. While you were gone, a Duty patrol squad passed by, we talked with them, and they kindly agreed to call a rescue helicopter for us. I think they'll come for us soon. If by the time you finish business with the mercenaries we're not here, be sure to find us at the camp at Yantar.
Got it, noted.
Kicked the bucket? What bucket... Ah! He died? What happened?
I'm listening carefully.
Are you ready? Then let's go!
Where did you disappear to, Marked One? We managed without you...
Hello! Thanks for the help once again!
Go your way, Marked One. We'll manage without your help somehow.
Good to see you, Marked One!
Stalker, talk to Kruglov, he's in charge here. There, in the green suit.
Alright, I'll talk to him.
Well, how's it progressing?
In progress.
Thanks for the help!
What do you want, stalker?
Yes?
Remember, you said it yourself: try to negotiate with them or force them. So... consider that I tried.
Just tell me straight: what happened? Is he dead?
Kruglov, why are you so persistent, huh? Yes, the mercenary leader died suddenly, but I don't think you need the details.
Well, damn... and he definitely didn't have our PDAs? Did you search everything there thoroughly?
Didn't dig the ground with my nose - what's true is true, but I'm not completely green in such matters either. Searching and then stashing what's found - it's in stalkers' blood, heh-heh.

Hmm... what if their leader did the same? That is, simply made a stash nearby and hid our PDAs there? Marked One, I really ask you: walk around a bit more in the vicinity of their camp. You have a trained eye, you said so yourself...
Damn... you're running me around like a rookie from the last draft.

We'll definitely find a way to compensate your time. By the way, I just remembered that their leader also had a palmtop... Didn't come across it? But that's for later. First look around once more thoroughly. Walk around there for at least an hour.
Alright, alright, I'm going...
So I wandered around the area like you asked...
That was quick. I asked you to spend at least an hour on it.
Uh... yes, you're right, I'll come back later.
And? Did you manage to find anything?
Looked under almost every bush - no stashes.

Nothing... Seems the mercenaries managed to sell your palmtops somewhere. Or maybe they found what they were looking for and just threw them into the first anomaly they came across. But I have their leader's PDA... Take a look.

Sad to hear that. Maybe you'd agree to escort us to Yantar one last time then? I'd share a worthwhile stash with you, otherwise there's nothing to give you, we're left with nothing, as you know. Unless Sakharov throws in something later...

Interesting... Could he have copied something from our research? Eh, almost all sections are password-protected, will have to crack the security. Ha, no lock on transactions, though there's only ten of them here. Anyway, transferring everything to you. Maybe you'd agree to escort us to Yantar one last time, not for free of course?
This stash better really be "worthwhile", let's go...
Alright, enough, I've run around plenty "for free" already, farewell.
Possibly, in principle. Just show the way then, I don't know this area well. Let's move.
Nah, ran around enough already. No offense, Kruglov, but I'm not going your way from here.
Listen, Marked One! There's plenty of "Burner" anomalies ahead, be careful. Our suits will protect us, but you'll turn to ash instantly... Use bolts.
Teach your wife to cook soup. Forward!
Need to hurry, might bring some monster here.

Thank you, Marked One! We'll rest a bit and move on ourselves. The places here are already familiar. Drop by Yantar, we'll be glad to see you. I think Sakharov will want to thank you too. And here's something else, look: I set up a little stash here. Was saving some things for myself. Take them by right.
Well, thank you too! Good luck to you!
Hey there, friend Marked One.
Stop! Don't move. Who are ya? Whatcha need here?
Easy, no foam. Got business with your boss.
Easy, no foam... Just need to pass through.
Cocky, eh? What's yer name? Why ya need our Wolfhound?
Cocky, eh? What's yer name?
I'm Marked One. I'll tell Wolfhound myself what I need.
I'm Marked One.
Marked One ya say, who marked ya? Just a joke like that. Put away yer gun and come on.
Come on, come on. Put away yer gun and come on.
So-o, a stalker showed up. You here on business or just looking for adventures for your ass?\nName!
No need to yell, I'm not deaf. They call me Marked One.
Well then, Marked One, voice the reason I'm observing you here.

Here's the deal. You guys shot down the scientists' helicopter, then shot someone on the ground, and most importantly - took all the data carriers with information these guys had been collecting for months. In all conscience, I think their work results should be returned, at least copies. Ideally - the PDA of a certain Professor Kruglov. Scientists, after all, risk their necks here daily for their research and that deserves respect.
I'm looking for people who know something about Strelok or anyone from his group. Won't you help?

You look here... I don't even know how to react to such a statement.\nI like this, Marked One. Not greedy, not cowardly, and you think of others. Let's make a deal: I basically completed the contract and already passed the needed data to the client. Can give back the PDA. But! As you understand, we're not a salvation army.
Why should I care? We have our own task. Ask about your acquaintances from those who've been fooling around in the Zone for a long time.
Who would doubt it...

Well, since you understand... I have an order for certain information from Agroprom Research Institute. But the military has settled there firmly. Try to scout the situation, I'm interested in patrol schemes.\nThere's a scheme - I'll return the egghead's PDA. Just keep in mind, we'll stay here at most one more day. Don't make it - your problems.
A scheme? There's a little soldier hiding in Agroprom swamp, could try to interrogate him. Though... it's a long trek: getting there through the Bar, then back, then try finding you guys.

I know there's a shorter path. Rookies from the Institute base ran to Yantar: to call home and all that. At Yantar, communications work steadily. So find out about the short road from the eggheads. And from the soldier, besides the post scheme, ask about another possibility to penetrate the base quietly. There's information that from the Agroprom catacombs, you can get straight onto Institute territory. That's it, come on - legs in hands and run.
Short path?! Then wait for me.
If you don't make it by the deadline, you'll find us at Army Warehouses. Time's ticking.
Can't it be done differently? I have bad feelings about this...
Bad feelings? We can do it differently - you bring me one artifact, and I return the PDA.
What artifact?

It's called "Mama's beads", ever heard of such? No?! Seems like you can get such an artifact if you throw regular "Mama's beads" and some other crap into an anomaly. I don't know the exact recipe. Try asking these sick ones you're standing up for. They should know.
Agreed, I'll find out the recipe from Kruglov.
I'll think about it. If anything, I'll come back later.
Perhaps I'd better go to Agroprom after all.
Well, thinker, made up your mind?
Any news?
Marked One, wanted something else?
So-o, a stalker showed up. You here on business or just looking for adventures for your ass?\nWhat should I call you?
They call me Marked One. What's going on here?
Hmm. Marked One? I've heard about you. They say you have a mark on your hand? The one you got your nickname from? Can I take a look?
Hmm. Marked One, still alive? Didn't expect that. I heard you have a mark on your hand? The one you got your nickname from? Can I take a look?
Well, yeah. So what?
I signed up to complete a task here. And it might somehow concern a person with such a mark like yours. Shall we think it over?
A task? What relation does it have to me?

A task... well, alright. So, you've heard about Monolithians? You know, those psychos who got north and south mixed up in their heads. They've recently gotten new guns, unusual ones. Accuracy almost one hundred percent, lethality - don't even worry! Some corporations abroad would very much like to "catch the wave" and outdo competitors in terms of supplying similar weapons. But here's the paradox - the gun exists, kills - it kills, but you can't pick it up! Not even with any grippers. You try to pick it up, and it goes poof, just black smoke... So we're looking for at least some clue that would allow taking such weapons out of the Zone and disassemble them, so to speak, into spare parts. Understand the principle.
Still don't understand: what's this got to do with me?

Here's where what I can't understand myself comes up. There's information that Monolithians are looking for you. Well, maybe not you specifically, but someone who has such a mark on their hand. They have something important. You get it? If you're important to them, then maybe we can build our relationship on that basis?
My brain just exploded from your logic. What exactly do you want?

Closer to the so-called Brain Scorcher, a small group of Monolithians has settled. Regular Monolithians aren't particularly bright, they moo something, but shoot well, which is surprising. But they have a senior. You can establish contact with him. I've already met with him. No results so far, but he hinted that a person with such a mark might improve understanding. You feel it?
I feel that this business stinks badly. But if they might know something about this mark, then I need to see this Monolithian.
I knew you'd understand everything correctly. I suggest you meet with them, and then tell me what they want from you. You give me information, and I give you... a path from here to Red Forest.
Walk to Radar? Rumors say it's not sweet there, I'll think about it, I'm swamped with work here.
How are you? Everything alright? When are you heading beyond the Barrier?
How are you? Everything alright? Have you been to Radar already?
Yes, managed to communicate there, if you can call it communication.
Well? What did you find out?
Strange conversation. These "superhumans" moo like bulls, only one can talk, and even then like some robot...
Who-who? Superhumans?
Well, that talkative one said they're supposedly superhumans. And looked at me like at some bug.
Let it be so. What did you talk about?

About practically nothing. If I understood correctly, they need someone marked with such a tattoo. But what exactly for... Seems they want the Brain Scorcher to be turned off. And what they get from this - hell knows.

Marked, you say. That's interesting, so it turns out you're not the only one like this. Though I haven't seen such a mark on anyone else. Well, let's suppose. Was there at least some hint about our business?

I didn't learn anything, I'm telling you! How can you learn when he cuts phrases like with an axe, you can only guess what he wants to say... As for me, you can understand him as if I can go somewhere they can't, and they desperately need to get there. And it's somewhere not here at all... Or you can understand that I can somehow get to the Scorcher and shut it down.

Well, that's already something. They need you, that's already good. If you can go somewhere there, then why can't you grab something there too, eh? You get it? But why they need to shut down the installation... Maybe if we turn off the Scorcher, they'll become more talkative?
Not sure. Says it interferes with their thinking and they can't go further somewhere because of it... Something like that.

Can't go further... hmm. Maybe it so happens that this Brain Scorcher isn't turned on against people, but against Monolithians. So it turns off, and where will these "superhumans" crawl? And why? On the other hand, this might be just the chance to pull them out from behind the Barrier. If Muhammad doesn't want to go to the mountain, then why not invite the mountain to visit him?

Listen, I don't care about your plans for these Monolithians. I'm much more interested in how I'm connected to them? What's this tattoo got to do with it? Where can I get to and what's there? Why do they need this themselves? My head is swelling. It was already unclear, and now there are only more questions.

A fool gets rich with thought. Ever heard such a saying? Alright, alright, I'm joking. The main thing is that Monolithians need you, which means I wasn't wrong about you. And something needs to be decided about the Scorcher... Thanks for the information, and the crossing to Red Forest is to the right, beyond the gates, let me put a mark on your PDA. There, use it.\nThat's all for now. Maybe later there'll be more business, but not now.
Well alright... See you.
You? What will you tell me?
Got something for you...
I'm all ears.
Remember, we had a deal about the egghead's PDA... back at Wild Territory?
Hope our deal is still valid, about the egghead's PDA?
You weren't in much hurry to fulfill it. Alright, that's all lyrics. Speak, if you have something, or don't waste my time.
Don't test my patience, Marked One. It's valid. Speak.
Found out how to get your "Mama's beads".
Managed to get the post scheme, firsthand information, as they say...
Uh... slipped my mind, I remembered while walking... I'll come back later.
But did you actually get it? I don't need words, give me the artifact.
Oh really? Well, let's take a look.
Here's the artifact, take it.
Look. Everything's described in perfect detail.
Will be soon, need something else... wait a bit.
Damn... where is it? I definitely put it in the backpack. I'll just... right now...

Excellent! I keep my word. Here's the botanist's gadget, I no longer need it. Everything necessary, we sent to the employer. Farewell, Marked One. Think we'll meet again.\nOh yes, one more thing... Recently one of my eagles went into the bushes to take a leak and vanished like through the earth. After an hour of searching, we found his body armor on a tree, intact. And no other traces. If you're not superstitious, take it. Wouldn't want good stuff to go to waste.
Yes, that'll do. Then, as we agreed. Here's the botanist's gadget, I no longer need it. Everything necessary, we sent to the employer. Farewell, Marked One. Think we'll meet again.
Well... thanks and all that.
Anything's possible...
What are you rummaging around here? Go your own way.
What? Can't sit still? Come on, come on... Move along.
You wouldn't flash around, eh? We got our own business here.
What do you need? Walk past.
Go on, better mind your own business.
Nothing for you here, get lost...
Just passing by.
Already am. Moving out.
You got business? Uh-huh...
Need something, but not from you...
Already gone.
I'll get lost when I need to.
Hello, who are you?
I'm a stalker. Marked One. Well, and you?
I am Vakhtang. Must vork. Look for people vith order. Marked One. You know vhat? You have it?
Have what? What are you looking for?

You don't know? You are stalker, yes? All stalkers know - Vakhtang looks for vhat he needs. And all stalkers can get from Vakhtang bullet-shmullet. And other thing. Vakhtang takes any broken PDA. In vhich vill find vhat he needs. You bring PDA - you get vhat you vant. Need machine gun? Have it. Need bullet? Have it. Need medicine? Also have it!
Hmm. So you collect PDAs? What do you want to find in them?
I tell you one smart thing, but you don't be offended - less you know, longer you live. Bring PDA, and don't ask questions.
Yeah, I get it, I get it.
Hello, who are you?
I'm a stalker. Marked One. Well, and you?
I am Vakhtang. Ve vill be acquainted! You have... Eh! Vait, vait! But I heard about you. They say you took out Volfhound's group single-handed, yes?
And who, I wonder, spreads such rumors? I don't know any Wolfhounds.
Eh! Don't take me for fool. I, of course, never liked that guy, but you know... You should go from here, I von't have any business vith you!
Hello, stalker. Vhat you vant? Have PDA? Give, give!
Eh, come on, go further. Nothing for me to talk about vith you. Understand, yes?
By any chance, wasn't anyone looking for me here, or maybe expecting me?
Me... you... Vakhtang remembers everyone, yes? You who?
I'm Marked One. And this... interesting tattoo I have.
Ah! Tattooed Marked One. Aha... Big man vas vaiting for you. Then vent looking himself. Said he vill return.
Soon?
Big man, many business. Boss to himself, doesn't tell anyone. Come again - vill be here.
Greetings, Marked One! Glad you wandered over to us.
Hello, science. How did you get here, what are you doing?
Everything's fine. Waiting for new equipment to be delivered. Twiddling thumbs, relieving stress, join us.

Everything's fine. Waiting for new equipment to be delivered, and for now we're relieving stress. Sucks that we have to redo all the work from scratch. Well, you remember, I told you that mercenaries took all our scientific group's data?

Everything's fine. Waiting for new equipment to be delivered. When the computer isn't heavily loaded with calculations, we try to crack the protection on the mercenary leader's PDA... well, the one you brought me, remember? And we're relieving stress with vodka. Join us!

Everything's fine. You practically brought us all the way to Yantar, for which once again - thank you! But otherwise... Waiting for new equipment to be delivered. Twiddling thumbs, relieving stress, join us.
Not in the mood somehow. Do it without me.
Yeah, sorry - I didn't manage to get anything back...
I remember, of course. And I'll say even more: I have your data...
Come on, the main thing is everyone stayed alive.
See for yourself. Or sit down!
It's nothing, I understand everything.
Oh! Honestly, we weren't hoping anymore. What a surprise!
You're right, stalker.
Here, take the PDA. It's yours, right? I couldn't turn it on myself, by the way. Maybe the battery died?
Definitely mine. There's special blocking here, like insurance in case of loss. Though it seems the mercenaries figured out how to bypass it. Well, at least all the data is intact.
Satisfied? Oh, and I ran around so much to get it...

He's still asking if I'm satisfied, ha! Huge thanks, Marked One, for your help!\nSo look, here's where the safe road from Bar to Army Warehouses begins. When you get there, turn right immediately and go along the barbed wire. You'll see a small box under a tree. I hid an artifact and medical kits there - it's rightfully yours now.\nMmm... Ah! Alright! There's another place! Behind the factory at Yantar, look under the old excavator, I also stored some things for myself there. Hope they haven't been stolen yet. By the way! I recently learned a very interesting artifact transformation method from a colleague. Write down the recipe for obtaining the "Diamond Kolobok" hypermodificate!

He's still asking if I'm satisfied, ha! Huge thanks, Marked One, for your help!\nSo look, here at Yantar, visit the factory complex if you get a chance. Look under the old excavator there. I stored some things for myself. Take them by right. Also, I recently learned a very interesting artifact transformation method from a colleague. Write down the recipe for obtaining the "Diamond Kolobok" hypermodificate!

He's still asking if I'm satisfied, ha! Huge thanks, Marked One, for your help!\nSo look, here's where the safe road from Bar to Army Warehouses begins. When you get there, turn right immediately and go along the barbed wire. You'll see a small box under a tree. I hid an artifact and medical kits there - it's rightfully yours now. And I also recently learned a very interesting artifact transformation method from a colleague. Write down the recipe for obtaining the "Diamond Kolobok" hypermodificate!
Wow, worthy! Well, thank you too, Kruglov!
Thanks, we'll see what you've got stored there.
Hello, prof! Look what I have for you!
Hello, Marked One! What brings you here?
Greetings. I'm from Kruglov, about an artifact recipe.
Who are you anyway? What recipe? I've tested many of them, most don't work of course, but there are quite interesting ones.
I'm Marked One. Kruglov said you know the recipe for getting the "Mama's beads" artifact.

"Mama's beads"? Yes, I tested a method for obtaining this artifact. Unfortunately, I've only managed to synthesize it once so far. The problem is in very rarely encountered ingredients. One component of this recipe is especially scarce - an electrochimera kidney. This organ, as our research showed, is responsible for generating the electric field around this creature. A friend got one for me from hunters in the Gut for big money.
Just tell me the recipe, and I'll find an electrochimera somewhere. I'll go to those same hunters, after all.
Hmm, let's do this: bring the kidney, and I'll give you the recipe!
Oh you professors! Agreed, I'll bring you this organ.
Holy cow! It's not for me! I wanted to help Kruglov!
What do I care about Kruglov? He has his work, I have mine. Don't want to help me, then don't expect help from me.
You live so harmoniously... Really envious... Agreed.
Go to hell! I'm sick of everything! Figure it out yourselves!
I'll think about it.
Listen, about the "Mama's beads"...
So, decided?
Yes, I agree. I'll drag you the damned electrochimera kidney.
Decided! To hell with your complications!
If I find the kidney, then we'll see.
Hey there, Semyonov! Found an electrochimera kidney!
Electrochimera? Ah! ElectroChimera! I'll have to remember... Don't keep me waiting, give it here.
Take it. Careful, sometimes it shocks... Hard.
Where is it? I lost it.
I know, got shocked myself a couple times - brain almost leaked out. Write down the recipe: to obtain anomalously transformed matter requires...
Listen, make it shorter. Without your scientific showing off.

As you wish. Throw into a "Snow" anomaly: electrochimera kidney, "Mama's beads", burer paw and bloodsucker tentacle. In 10 minutes you'll have "Mama's beads". Oh yes, one more thing... I think it'll be useful for you to know.\nA stalker came by the other day, he claimed he saw an electrochimera at Wild Territory, somewhere around the collapsed tunnel. And our colleagues from the field expedition repeatedly observed burers in the area stalkers call "the Gut" for some reason. There's a damaged overpass there, they often spot them near it. What only attracts them there?!\nAs for the required artifact, if you don't know where to get it, I'd ask around at the Bar if I were you. I heard rumors that there's often a guy there who exchanges some artifacts for others. Contact him.
Noted! And thanks for the tips. See ya, science.
They say there's a short road from here to Agroprom...
Yes, there is. Conscript soldiers often run to us from there to call home, send letters.
Could you show me? I urgently need to get to Agroprom, on important business. It costs you nothing, and I might work for the benefit of science later.

Well... we barely know each other, who knows why you're asking about this road. What if you're one of those soldiers of fortune hunting for valuable information about the Zone's nature and its secrets. I tell you about the path now, and tomorrow a whole squad of mercenaries comes here...

Don't trust me? You're doing right. I wouldn't either in your place. How can I prove I'm not a camel? You know Professor Kruglov, he's one of yours? At least ask him about me. I, by the way, contracted to help him with a problem... I'm telling you, I'll probably be useful to you guys too.
Really? If that's so, then... Alright, it's not such a secret path. I'll mark the crossing coordinates in your PDA. Use it in good health.
I'll owe you.
Excuse me, do you remember Fang?
Fang? Ah, the one who used to go with that, what's his name, Phantom?... No. Ah! Ghost! He always went with him? I remember. But he died... Long ago. Why are you interested in them?
Actually, he's alive. I met him recently in the underground, at Agroprom. Unfortunately, he's badly crippled, and most importantly, his brain is severely damaged. Consequence of zombification.

You mean to say: after zombification someone was able to regain consciousness? Incredible! Listen, my dear fellow, we absolutely must examine our acquaintance! Bring him here, we'll take care of him, and reward you materially...
Why? I didn't ask. I want to help.
Exactly for the help, the contribution, so to speak, to science. I'll definitely pick something worthy for you.
Whatever... That's not the main thing. The problem is, professor, that Fang can't come to the surface. As soon as he approaches the exit from the underground, he becomes a zombie again.

Can't? Apparently residual psi-emission is acting. I think a properly tuned protective device might help, something like a helmet. Main thing is to tune it right, otherwise the protection can be breached.
Tune? How?

Need a recording of psi-field meter readings at triangulation points of intensity along the route. As you understand, triangulation requires at least two, and even better three measurement locations. All this, of course, could be done much more accurately and quickly with the new device we recently received, but our new device disappeared somewhere. Someone's unforgivable carelessness, a completely new and very expensive device! We'll have to use what we have...\nYou say at Agroprom? So, let me mark the necessary measurement points... Here, here and here, clear? Take the device from Docent Semyonov. To accurately measure psi, you need to place the device at the indicated point and wait five to ten minutes while the meter filters parasitic interference and isolates the useful signal. When you measure at all points, bring the device, and I'll tune the protective helmet based on its readings.
Clear, I'll do just that. One more question? Fang spoke about Ghost. Tell me about him, you communicated with him?

What to tell... not much to say really. He visited here repeatedly, I even gave him some tasks. I liked working with him, very nimble stalker, could get anywhere. Brought such curious specimens that no one had seen before. But by and large I was more interested in research results. Colleague Vasilyev had closer relations with him. I think he was trying to find proof for his theory... Recently Vasilyev and Ghost were here, as if they started another of their "explorations"... Well, that's probably all.
Thanks even for that.

Professor Sakharov promised to tune a special protective helmet with which Fang can leave his refuge in the Agroprom Research Institute underground. But first I need to take psi-field measurements at three surface points, they're marked in my PDA.
I'm here about the PDA recording, from the swamp. It appears to be Vasilyev's PDA.
Oh, what a pity, so the monsters got to him. What a terrible death.

I don't think monsters devoured the body. I found an intact jumpsuit, completely zipped up. It seems like the clothes are there, but the body... When I was examining it something strange happened. Some red flash and... nothing, no body, no jumpsuit, just things. Monsters wouldn't be able to get to the body without tearing the jumpsuit to shreds. But I listened to the recording, and I'm interested in one moment. It seemed to me that Vasilyev said: "Sakharov is a coward, doesn't answer!!!", you heard the recording. Can you comment somehow?

I don't know, he was shooting back and could have said it in the heat of the moment. We argued once, he kept wanting to test his theory, and I told him it was dangerous to go without reliable protection. He probably meant that. There were no messages from him, believe me. I'll try to do everything possible to find out his fate. Won't you give me this device? There might be some scientific data there, because of which this promising scientist died.
I thought: if Vasilyev penetrated X-16 and got out to the swamp, then how? You heard the recording: he came out through some tunnels. Maybe it's easier to find these tunnels and enter from there?

Hmm... what we heard in the recording, the information is unreliable to put it mildly... Take at least his statement about me... And then... why do you think he came out in a different place, and not where he went in? Why do you think he was specifically in X-16, and not in some basement? After all, these are only his words, there's no confirmation. Finally, why are you so sure he was there at all? Perhaps he was under the influence of radiation and all this was his... uh... hallucinations. I already said I was quite skeptical about Vasilyev's venture.
You're probably right. Better to look for the entrance after all.
So will you give me this PDA? There might be important scientific data there.
Important, you say... And how much might such data cost?

Oh these stalkers! Always profit and loot... I can offer you a quite rare artifact specimen... Artifacts with similar properties, believe me, are extremely rare. Yes, Vasilyev, before making his insane act, was interested in similar artifacts. If not, then a hundred buckshot rounds would be just right. So, what do you say?
Alright, give me your artifact.
I'll take the ammo instead.
First, I'll try to find the information I need in this PDA myself.
That's a worthy act. Here's an artifact and some medical supplies.
That's a worthy act. Here's ammo and some medical supplies.
Well, that's your right... If something interesting turns up, please - let us know.
Semyonov, I need the device.
For psi-field measurement? I already gave it to you, forgot? Still haven't returned it to inventory, can't help.
What device? I don't have freebies. Go ask Sakharov.
Right, I took it for measurements here at Yantar. Need to finish this business first.
Sakharov sent me to you: go, he says, to the docent, to Semyonov, take the psi measurement device from him...
Well, should've said so right away. Here's this device, take it. At least won't have to drag it around anymore.
I'll return it soon...
Psi-field measurement point at Agroprom
Psi-field measurement point at Agroprom
Psi-field measurement point at Agroprom
Psi-emission meter
This device allows measuring the intensity coefficient of the psionic component of anomalous radiation at a selected point.
Event recorder
The device allows recording events in a limited area and saving data to memory. This data is needed by a scientist from Swamp.
Professor, I made the necessary measurements.
I beg your pardon?
Well... You said I needed to take measurements with the device at Agroprom to tune the protective helmet for Fang.
Ah, yes! Sorry, my head is occupied with another problem. So, where are the measurements?
Here's the measuring device, probably the measurements are in memory.
Uh... in the device, probably... Where did I put it...
Yes, yes, I meant the device. So, let me check what we got, and you come back in a couple hours, we'll talk about the helmet...
In a couple hours? Well alright...
I'm here about the helmet for Fang...

Ah, Marked One... We processed the results of your measurements. Honestly, didn't expect... The intensity of psychotropic radiation depends non-linearly on distance from the Zone's center! If we extrapolate the data from these measurements...
We haven't processed the measurement results yet, Marked One. Wait!
Yes, yes, of course, I'll wait...
Sorry, professor. Can I just get the helmet?

What? Ah, yes... Sorry, sometimes I get carried away. Here's the tuned helmet. Put it on the test subj... I mean, let Fang put it on and come to the surface. There's a field near the Research Institute, I'll see the signal from the helmet and call a helicopter, and it'll transport our acquaintance directly here... Oh yes, by the way, Marked One, I ask you - don't loiter there. Pilots don't like stalkers, might not take Fang if he's not alone...
But what then? Do you even have medics here? I mean specialists who could "fix" Fang's head... or restore memory, maybe...

Of course, we don't have medics here, let alone such narrow specialists. Each of us underwent certain training in providing first aid, as well as help with poisoning, bites... But if it's a serious case, we immediately call a helicopter and send the victim to the mainland. Perhaps we can arrange Fang's transportation too. What wonderful material!
What?
What?
Well you said something about material...
Did I? I misspoke, so much in my head.
Hmm... Are there any specialist medics somewhere in the Zone?

Unlikely. And why? It's easier to call a helicopter. But if you're interested, ask at Swamp, there are biologists there, they're also kind of... connected to medicine, partially... Alright. Go to Fang and don't forget what I told you.
Alright, I understand. I'll sit it out in the underground.
Yes, yes, exactly sit it out. You're constantly at risk anyway...
What's this GPS beacon you're selling? And I saw some microchips on the counter or what are those anyway?

Beacons? Most convenient thing. I get them from Sakharov. Suppose you stashed something in one cache, another, a third. Hard to remember all places and contents. But this way, you put a beacon in the stash, and it transmits its location on the map to your PDA, along with a list of loot. As for "microchips", as you called them, these are special PDA expansion modules. As you can easily guess, they serve to add new functions to your palmtop. The module I have for sale is used to connect PDA with other devices. With it, for example, you can display Geiger counter readings directly on your handheld screen.
Curious. How far progress has come! Probably really useful gadgets.
You bet! Buy up while they're in stock. Demand is high. Start haggling - they'll be snatched up.
Something strange happened to me, won't you help figure it out?
Strangeness? Our whole life is strangeness. And the Zone... Anyway, be more specific.

Some time ago I found an unknown artifact in my backpack, and don't remember ever picking it up. I try to throw it away, but soon it somehow quietly ends up back in the backpack. Also, my health has sharply deteriorated recently, and timing-wise it coincided with this thing's appearance. Though maybe it's not connected, not sure.
Ah! That's what it is. I've heard about this... "Black mark" it's called. Chances of survival for whoever gets it are practically zero. Sorry to be so blunt, but you better be prepared...
What is this curse and where did it come from? I definitely remember not picking up such an artifact, never even saw it before.

That's what everyone says. There's an opinion that "Black mark" isn't quite an artifact. Rather, a parasite artifact.\nIt can pretend to be any item just to get picked up. And then, once it settles on a new host, that's when it manifests.
"Great" news... You said chances of survival are practically zero, but something can still be tried, as I understand?

Seems so. Ask experienced stalkers, like Bes or Grey. Maybe one of them knows how to get rid of this crap. Ah! Or at least get Brom. Know Brom? Often here. He, for example, was babbling about this topic once, but not sure if it was relevant. This drunk will soon completely drink away the rest of his brains.\nMeanwhile, I advise carrying more medkits and food. Good luck!
Listen, friend, I'd like to store some loot...

No, that's not for me. I've got a thoroughfare here, as you can see! Can't watch everyone... They steal something, then try to prove you're not a camel. You better go to Voronin, the Duty commander. He has discipline and your valuables will be safer.
To Voronin? I'll try, but still, shame you can't...
Everyone and their brother pounds on my door, and someone else's soul, you understand, is in darkness... So there's no guarantee whatsoever.
Sakharov is interested in information from the helicopter crash site in Dark Valley
Professor, I found something near the crashed helicopter.
In Dark Valley? Our functioning sensors showed us there was a person near the helicopter... So that was you? Well then, tell me what was there, and... how did they die?

What happened there, I don't know. According to those who saw the helicopter fall, it was flying from the Zone's center already damaged - smoke was coming from the engine... Pilots died immediately, and two in ecologist suits managed to get out, but... There was a chimera lair there. So you understand...
Yes... Spawn of the Zone... The more we learn, the more mysteries are revealed to us. Did you manage to find anything? Something that could shed light on their work?
Here, just a container with some artifact, and documents...
I found documents from one of the scientists. Here. There was something else, but...
Container and documents, but... I don't have them with me now.
Pity... Really hope you'll manage to bring them later.

Thank you, thank you... So... Materials on research of an artifact having different phases! The container holds a sample. Very interesting! A series of additional experiments is needed!\nUnfortunately, we can't reward you with something material, we're only supplied with the most necessary equipment, but... We can help you with artifact transformation.\nAnd also... I had a new, untested anomaly detector somewhere here... Ah here it is! Please take it.

Thank you... So... Materials on research of an artifact having different phases! The sample was placed in a highest level protection container! So-so... Very sorry you couldn't investigate the crash site more thoroughly... Apparently we'll have to ask our friends from the "Duty" organization to handle this matter.\nUnfortunately, we can't reward you with something material, we're only supplied with the most necessary equipment, but...\nI had a new, untested anomaly detector somewhere here... Ah here it is! Please take it. And some medication for the road.
Professor, I'm here with the container and documents!
From Dark Valley? Excellent! Let me have them...
Here you go.

Thank you, thank you... So... Materials on research of an artifact having different phases! The container holds a sample. Very interesting! A series of additional experiments is needed!\nUnfortunately, we can't reward you with something material, we're only supplied with the most necessary equipment, but... We can help you with artifact transformation.\nAnd also... I had a new, untested anomaly detector somewhere here... Ah here it is! Please take it.
Brain, I found an interesting accordion.
What do I need your accordion for? My ears are already ringing all day from the bar music.
There was a note inside, seemed encrypted. I copied it down. Look, can you decode it?

Let's see, let's see... Yes, cipher... Pretty simple. Come back in an hour, I'll figure it out by then. Oh yes, by the way, don't forget the reward! Because every work should be rewarded! I think a simple artifact will do.
Listen, I'll try it myself then.
Alright, agreed, I was already racking my brain.
What about the cipher?
I told you, come back in an hour! Haven't figured it all out yet...
Decoded! So what are we standing for, what are we waiting for? Where's our little artifact?
Oh, people... Here's the artifact, don't keep me waiting. What's there?
Wait a bit, I'll bring it now...

So, write down:\nHello, old friend. As agreed, weapons purchased. Caravan left yesterday, prepare to meet. Client from the last job was very satisfied and sends additional bonus: as usual, everything's at Agroprom - in the coded stash, code 25648.

Hello, old friend. As agreed, weapons purchased. Caravan left yesterday, prepare to meet. Client from the last job was very satisfied and sends additional bonus: as usual, everything's at Agroprom - in the coded stash, code 25648.
I found an unusual PDA at Radar.
What do I need your PDA for?
Won't you take a look? Seems encrypted, maybe there's something interesting.
Let's see, let's see... Come back in an hour, I'll try to look at it by then. Oh yes, by the way, don't forget the reward! Because every work should be rewarded! I think a simple artifact will do.
Listen, I'll try it myself then.
Alright, agreed.
What about the PDA?
I told you, come back in an hour! Haven't figured it all out yet...
Decoded! Mmm, so what are we standing for, what are we waiting for? Where's our little artifact?
Here's the artifact, don't keep me waiting... What's there?
Wait a bit, I'll bring it now...
So here's the deal. Among the obvious stalker nonsense there's information about an artifact transformation recipe. Write it down.
Not much, thought there'd be something more interesting.
Can you pick locks? On a container.
Show me first, then I'll answer...
Here it is. Seems not quite ordinary, and the lock is tricky, can't open it.

Hmm, and where did you get this? Don't tell me you found it under a bush or traded it from a drunk stalker for a bottle. Clearly a special order... Double-protected lock... I'll fiddle with it of course, maybe pick the key. Take a walk meanwhile. Come back in a couple hours, maybe something will become clear. And... Uh... Prepare... an artifact capsule. For, so to speak, compensation for time spent and silence about your transgressions.
Artifact capsule? You sure are... Alright, I'll take a stroll to one place.
Did you manage to open the container?
I told you, come back in a couple hours! Haven't opened it yet...
Well yes, the lock turned out very complex! Awaiting appreciation of my genius and prospects of silence. Where's our capsule?
Docent! Here's the capsule, don't keep me waiting... What was in there?
I don't have a capsule with me now...

Inside there's a strange piece of crap. I heard scientists call such things "anomalous formations". What properties it has - nobody knows, but I wouldn't advise keeping it on you! Who knows what it affects...\nTake it... And the container too, out of my sight...
Inside there's a strange capsule, I wouldn't advise keeping it on you! Who knows what it affects...\nTake it... And the container too, out of my sight...
Really strange thing, and what to do with it now?
Marked One, you asked me to open the container? I opened it. Not my concern anymore. Go...
Alright... thanks even for that.
Can I get some water from you?
To drink? Better drink beer. Who knows what infection.
To wipe my mask. So, how about it?
It's all simple. You give me... a bottle of "firewater", I give you regular water.
Sakharov won't scold?
We'll do it quietly, in the evening, by the fire, with some snacks.
You tell it so nicely, mouth's watering... Deal.
Can I get some water?
You remember - regular water in exchange for firewater.
You helped me, so... in the sleeping quarters - there's some in the kettle.
At least something free.
Don't become a drunk. Here's a bottle.
Drank it all myself.
Look in the sleeping quarters - there should still be some in the kettle.
Got water? Need to wash up.
What? Water... Hungover, or what? Me too... always. Give me a bottle and you'll get water.
You're not a cook, you're a bloodsucker! Take it... How much fits in you.
What prices you have... I'll manage.
Yeah, that's me. How else? Nobody wants to work. Go look in the kitchen, it's running from the tap. Just close the faucet after yourself, or it'll all flow out, nobody to carry it.
How about some water? Got any?
Water? Is this for cleaning? Maybe there is some, but will you find something to pay with?
Nah, none left, finished... Need to bring some. If you really need it, go to the Cook, maybe he has some.
Man! Your rates. Alright, take it.
What prices you guys have... I'll manage.
To the Cook? I'll go.
Well it's the Zone, brother, here only jerboa are born for free. There in the next room in the kettle there's still water, fill up.
How about some clean water? Got any?

Yeah, there's still a little. Went to the woods, collected some. There are a couple sacred springs. They give water. But, you understand, - going to the forest is troublesome business. Expensive on supplies. So - give me a couple ten rounds for shotgun or Kalash - and we'll deal.
No problem, here's for shotgun.
Got some spare for AK-74, here.
Got 7.62, for old Kalash.
I'll manage for now. Thanks for the offer.
That's good! Go downstairs - fill up from the washbasin there. Everything like normal people, civilized...
Got water? To fill the canteen.
Have it now, don't have it later. It's that kind of business. Someone gets clean water, someone pays for it. Get it? Want to fill a canteen with water, give me a medkit or anti-rad.
Drank it all, drought's crushing everyone. Were remembering the boys.
Only got a basic medkit.
Got a military one, take it.
Scientific one should work I think...
Take the anti-rad, I got some.
We're not in medical supplies nowadays...
Alright, pour from the kettle there. And don't splash too much. It's not free.
You might as well suggest "brilliant green". Keep it for yourself.
So, Nut... Still sittin' around...
Ah! It's you, little bro. I see, I see - brought my little gun.
Don't reach out, first the info, where'd you see Fang?
Don't reach out, I found Fang without you. So, you understand...

Eh-m... That was long ago, last year even. Fang was lookin' for some parts then, and I had some after the last gig... Anyway, had some stuff. I helped him for small change... He gifted me this gun. I was hoppin' around the Valley then, used to gather evenings at the Bar with Freedomers - that was before they got kicked out from there... Listen, I'll tell ya like my own boy, there's a path to the Valley here, only ours go there. Let's do this: you return my gun, and I show you that road. Deal?

Come on, what're you... I get it, ain't stupid. Just ain't got money nowadays... Listen, I'll tell ya like my own boy, there's a path to the Valley here, only ours go there. Let's do this: you return my gun, and I show you that road. Deal?
Nut, didn't you get it? I paid artifacts for your gun, had to throw in extra on top. Why would I need that road? So your buddies on the other side would whack me?
Look at that, hole in the head but still thinks... Then, so you'd have reason to visit there, I'll give ya a tip on one little box. I hid some good stuff in it, long time ago though.
What to do with you, take the gun.
Payment's so-so. I'll keep the gun.
Deal! So look: here in the woods there's a passage, but be careful, lots of anomalies there, and all kinds of beasts. And here, in the wasteland, under a bush, my stash.
You're wrong, Marked One. Could've done some more business.
I'll look, but if there's nothing there, I'll be back.

Don't worry. And also... When you get to the Valley, turn right. There, at the old pig farm, Raven's crew settled down. Serious guys, not simple stalkers. Our brothers don't show their noses there without business, they're cautious. The guy's shady but you can do business with him, if you're smart and don't show off. Drop by, have a chat... And, uh, if we meet again, there'll be another topic for you.
What'd you decide, Nut? That gun's pretty good.

Listen, Marked One, don't mess with my brains. Stop rubbing dry soap on my belly. I'm tellin' ya about the secret path to Dark Valley and another stash, hidden for myself... And you return my gun. If it don't suit ya, then get lost. I ain't in the mood today.
Alright, show me. I'm in a good mood today...
Bottom line, no decent payment - no gun!

Deal! So look: here in the woods there's a passage, but watch out, lots of anomalies there, and all kinds of beasts. And here's my little stash... And, uh, if we meet again, there'll be another topic for you.
What brought you here?

What's the big deal? Or did you become a correspondent member? Tell him everything. Maybe I need sumthin' here. Got it? Don't make faces, I remember you bailed me out. Maybe we can - together? Well? I'll share somethin' with ya.
Mar... ked... One... Beat it... I'm bored, real bad, to the point of sadness... We'll chat later...
Look at that, got your attention. What ya sharin'?
And screw you too.

Here's the deal: if you ain't lazy - bring a couple of processed flesh hides, I'll tell ya a ter-r-rible secret! For real! You won't be sorry, you know me! About Gh-o-ost, sumthin'! Like that! Just grab an artifact too, a good one, like this... "Gravi". We partied a bit, money's tight.
Here's the deal: if you ain't lazy - bring a couple of processed flesh hides, I'll tell ya a ter-r-rible secret! For real! You won't be sorry, you know me! About Gh-o-ost, sumthin'! Like that!

Here's the deal: if you ain't lazy - bring a couple of processed flesh hides, I'll tell ya a ter-r-rible secret! For real! You won't be sorry, you know me! About Gh-o-ost, sumthin'! Like that! And this... from the local hunters, grab a jar of moonshine, for clarity in the head.
Watch it, Nut, no tricks.
Listen, sicko, spill it, what's the deal with Ghost! Got a couple hides from mature flesh.

What? What do I need those for? A-a-ah... Japanese god! Hungover, thinkin' slow. I wanted to order new threads from Stepanych.\nDamn... Memory's completely gone. Well, here's the info. Like - till death and all that... Go on.
Put away the bullshit. You promised to tell about Ghost and his secret. I'm listening.
Who promised? Me? Ah! So we agreed that you'd also bring an artifact, and it shouldn't be fake. Got one like that?

Who promised? Me? Ah! Well... That's a fact. The other day I was shootin' the breeze with one guy about our sorrowful business, and he spilled that he's got a tip on Ghost's place, but it's too scary to take alone. Well and... Don't hold back on the hides, I would've told ya anyway, but... It's better this way.

Who promised? Me? You, uh, little bro... don't be offended. Head's really like cast iron from the hangover. Vodka's all fake, damn it. Pour some moonshine for clarity in the brains, like we agreed. You brought it, right?
Here's your hides and artifact! Talk!
Don't get ahead of yourself... I'll think more about the artifact.
Better? Here's your skins. Well?
You're being shady. Think about it.
Will it really clear up? Then take the whole jar, excellent first-rate stuff. And if this don't help, I can treat ya with the rifle butt.
Moonshine for him, you understand... I didn't have time. Wait, maybe I'll bring some.

Oh! You! Can do it! Everything straight up: So basically, in early spring one of our pals grabbed some dude for a gig. Chatter-chatter, this and that and all that other stuff. The dude, turns out, was stealin' from one authority. Exactly from that same Ghost!

What kinda skins... slimy. Really from flesh? Alright. You scratch my back - I scratch yours. One pal was runnin' his mouth that he knows where Ghost's place is with rich loot. Like he found a corpse in early spring, and there was a note on him from this same Ghost to one of his buddies. It was written there where and with what supplies he set up a stash. You dig?
Come on, what're you startin'? Well, a guy had too much, happens to everyone! Or are you an ulcer patient? By the way, maybe we should have a drink right now?
And then what?
I dig, I'm not stupid. Get to the point.
I'm starting to lose patience. Talk already!

Huh? What-what... You made me lose my train of thought... Anyway! Ghost set up a place in the District Center and stored supplies there to make a run for Pripyat itself. You get it? District Center's way over there, so me and my buddies didn't bother making the trek. But for you, for your deeds, I'll spill, no question.\nOn the attic of a private house the loot's stashed, in a backpack. There's also workers' wagons on wheels abandoned nearby.\nIf you score big cash from this tip, don't forget about Nut, yeah?

Don't rush me, you're just making me lose my train of thought.\nAnyway, talk to my buddy yourself! Crowbar's his handle. Debt collectors, as I heard, nabbed him.\nThough there's people who'll vouch for him, so maybe he's already out of the slammer... Ask him about that case yourself in general.

Why you so nervous? Don't boil over, I'm being respectful! So basically, back in early spring I found this corpse. Like this dude was carrying a note from Ghost to his buddy. Well, blah-blah, Ghost described his stash in the District Center. Lots of supplies he supposedly prepared there to head to Pripyat. But where exactly - I didn't get. While I was figuring out what was scribbled there, blind dogs came, so I made tracks.\nOne thing I remembered - need to look for this loot in one of the apartments on the second floor of a half-destroyed Khrushchev building, facing Ilyich Square.\nIf you score big cash from this tip, don't forget about Nut, yeah?
Hmm... that's far. Alright, I'll check it out when I get the chance. Maybe it's really something worthwhile.
I knew it wouldn't end with just hides. Crowbar, you're saying... I'll remember that.
Hmm... that's far. Alright, I'll check it out when I get the chance. Later, boozer.
Let me through to Sidorovich.
Come in, don't be afraid, exit...\nWell, you know...
He'll open in the morning, come then.
Uh-huh... Joker on top of joker.
Rules for playing Blackjack:\nYou need to get eleven or as close to it as possible.
Hey there, little bro. Lookin' for something?
I see you made it. Alive? What're you doing here?

Yeah, alive. Entertainin' the crew and not forgettin' myself. For not being a scumbag, not leavin' me to die... Write down this recipe. One fly-by-night kid got busted during surrender, and the luck fell to me. Use it.
Hey there, well - how's it goin'? Little by little? Me too...
So how do you entertain the people?
Well, how else... It's tough here with normal fun. So, sometimes we'll shoot the breeze, sometimes play blackjack...
Blackjack? Cards?

Nah, not cards. Dice. Though the rules are the same... I throw one die, first for you. Until you say you've had enough. Then for myself. Eleven is blackjack - a win, more than eleven is a bust - a loss. That's how it goes.
Let's play. What're the stakes?

Food from you, cash from me. Against one loaf - five hundred, sausage - a grand, canned food - two grand! And for an energy drink I can bet a thousand rubles. Yeah, and keep in mind that I prefer imported sausage. The stuff from hunters... forget it. Stinks so bad the rats run away.
Alright let's go, let's see who's lucky...
What're you bettin'?
Bread.
Sausage.
Can of canned food.
Changed my mind, I need the grub myself.
Energy drink.
Deal! Let's go!
Your sausage's done for! Well, here we go...
Meat! That's in the pot! Let's roll!
I'll drink your water! Let's go...
Let's go again...
Not enough, let's go again...
Roll it, roll it, don't hesitate.
Let's see what else comes up.
Nah, that's enough...
Enough, roll for yourself...
I think that's enough! Your turn!
That's enough for me, now it's your turn.
So, my stone...
Say goodbye to your sausage, rollin'...
Where haven't we been...
A-a-and o-o-one more time!
Don't drag it out, throw!
Stop messin' with my nerves, roll...
Stop stallin'...
How long do I gotta wait?
Damn it...
Next time I'll be lucky...
Nothing, not the last time...
No luck for me in death...
Yeah! I always knew it!
And where's my hard-earned cash?
That's how you gotta play! Learn...
Skill ain't something you can drink away...
Nothing, next time I'll win!
So, where'd you put my sausage?
Give back the can, that ain't right...
Maybe I can have some water?
Don't get upset, it's not like you lost a cow...\nMaybe we'll play again?
Golden words! Well, let's go again?
You're right. Gonna try to win it back?
Lucky in love... Well, throw again?
He knew... Take your winnings!\nMaybe we'll repeat?
Don't worry, it's safe as a vault with me! Here you go.
Don't teach the teacher, too weak to repeat?
Master, damn... Well, throw again?
That's for sure!\nMaybe we'll repeat?
Take it! Let's test luck again?
You ain't gonna eat it right now, are ya? Too weak to repeat?
Here, don't choke... Well, throw again?
Come on, let's repeat!
Nah, enough... Got business to do...
Come on, come on... Stalker... Wanna try "Duty roulette"?
What do they call you? I'm - Marked One. And what's this shit - "Duty roulette"?

Everyone calls me - Pavlo Bison. What it says on my passport - I don't even remember anymore. Well, Marked One, I hope you heard about "Russian roulette"? The one where they leave one bullet in a revolver, spin the cylinder, point it at their temple and ...\nReally helps you feel life... in a new way.
I heard about that... What's the essence of the "Duty" one?

Well, it's not so "deadly" interesting here...\nYou see, behind me there are three boxes lying. Two of them are mined with weak explosives, and in the third there's some good stuff everyone needs.\nIf you want, you can test your luck and try to choose the "lucky" stash.
And what's your interest in this?
Well, for access to the body, so to speak, I take a small present... In the form of any artifact...\nSo, will you risk it?
No, I get enough normal risk in the Zone.
So, made up your mind? Come on, don't chicken out! "Duty roulette" - one against two...
Alright! I'll try my luck... Take the "Jellyfish".
Well then, I'll risk it for the "Wrenched".
I've got "Stone Blood", take it...
Take the "Droplet" artifact, I'll try...
Take the "Sparkler", I'm risking it...
Got some useless "Slime", I'll try to risk it.
I'll risk it... Take the "Thorn".
Respect! Go on then... Loot's in one of the three...
Ha! You went for it!
Listen, Pavlo! What's that door, armored?

Hell knows... Seems to lead somewhere into the catacombs. Our guys didn't open it - Lukash wouldn't let them. We take turns guarding here, watching so no kind of evil crawls out... And from time to time something bangs, knocks from inside... And howls! Gives you the creeps sometimes... Especially at night...
And Lukash, what? Does he know something? Why did he forbid opening it?

Go ask him if you're interested. I think to myself, if there's a head who makes decisions, then he knows. And I don't pry with questions about why and what for... Those who doubted the correctness of Lukash's orders, they don't doubt anything anymore, their bones lie around the Zone, white, clean...
Ye-e-es... The less you know - the better you sleep... Later... Philosopher.
I have a question. About the armored door in the tunnel.
What's it to you? Door's a door... Protects our base, you could say - our home, from all kinds of unknown creatures...
Where does it lead? Maybe there's something special there?

Where? To the underground... There's tons of monsters and other horrors! I haven't been there myself and I don't advise you to go! The soldiers blocked it for good reason! If it were up to me, I'd blow the whole damn remainder of this tunnel to hell, so you couldn't even see this door!
Who can object to you? Go blow it up!

It's not that simple, guy. Some special services have some interest here. And their representative spoke quite directly: we're only tolerated here as guards of this very passage... That's how things are... So, get it out of your head and do something useful: bloodsuckers appeared in the village again!
Wait up! What kind of representative? Where can I find him? Maybe he knows something?

Marked One! Nobody told you that you're stubborn as a mule!
Alright!
You got to me!
There's constantly one person in the Bar - everyone calls him Prapor... Though he's actually high-ranking. Talk to him. If he wants - he'll tell you.
Prapor... Got it... Well, see you later.
Where can I have some normal fun?
Go out to the bloodsucker village at night in your underwear... That's where the fun will begin...
Ha-ha-ha... Very funny... It's boring with you guys...
Go see Pavlo... He really loves to entertain those who are bored...
Who's that? Where to find him?
Gambler... Fun guy... You'll find him in the northeast corner of the base, near the collapsed tunnel...
Check backpack
I heard your guys fall from the sky?
You mean that fool? Yeah, quite a story... As I was told, appeared right out of nowhere, from thin air. Naked, muttering something like: "Ghost, ghost... wait, ghost...".
Who is it? Didn't you recognize him?

No, but doesn't seem like a stalker, too well-groomed. Muscles are flabby. We dressed him, feed him a little. He's human, after all. Been almost a month... We thought maybe some rumor would spread about someone similar going missing. But nothing so far.\nYeah, he's peaceful, sits whole days and mumbles. At first he soiled himself, but now we take him out a couple times a day.
A month? Hmm... So this isn't the one I was thinking of.
The Zone... All kinds of things happen here.
What are you talking about?
Recently a scientist went missing at Yantar, with a stalker nicknamed Ghost, so I first thought...
I'll tell you this: anything can happen in the Zone. Look, Screw, yesterday lost something in one place, and today a stalker came, said he found this thing in the Valley a week ago. That's how it is.
Yes, the Zone... So, this could really be Vasilyev. And he might know where to look for Ghost... Need to talk with Sakharov.
Begone! Begone, damn you...
Who the hell is this?! Egghead?! How'd you get here, you freak?!
So you're... normal?! And I thought... But you're human...
Who were you expecting? Hey! Are you even alive?
I'm not waiting for anyone anymore... I've been sitting here for three days, or more already... No ammo, no food... I don't know what to do...
So you came from the other side of the tunnel? Is there an exit there? Hey! Snap out of it!
I don't know, I don't care anymore... They won't come back, we'll die here anyway...
Oh! Stop whining. Who are "they"? And who are you, by the way?
What difference does it make now... Well, Mateyev's my surname, Vladimir. JR... junior researcher...
Call me Marked One. So who, you say, was here with you? And how did you get here?
A few days ago our small group tried to get to the main control panel of the installation. He said it shouldn't be difficult...
Who's this "we"?
Professor Vasilyev, me, and two stalkers - Ghost and Khokhol. Khokhol was clearing the path, Vasilyev and Ghost followed him, and I was bringing up the rear...
Well? So where are they? Come on, snap out of it, do I have to drag everything out of you?! What happened to you?
Don't want to, don't drag it out, I'm not forcing you... Leave me... like they left me.
