Alright, calm down. Everything's fine, I'm here, I'm not planning to abandon you. Let's go in order. How did you get through here? Sakharov told me about dangerous radiation.
Well... Radiation's very unstable - there are days when it practically disappears. That's when there was such a "window"... Vasilyev decided to take advantage of it. Why did I agree?!
So where did they go and why did they leave you?
I was wounded, probably, that's why... Why drag me around, just a burden...
Who wounded you?

Vasilyev was turning on some switches, we already got upstairs, everything seemed quiet, but then from somewhere behind monsters started appearing... God, what horrors... I didn't even know such things existed. And right behind me someone screamed horribly, something crashed, I was thrown and spun around... But we had to go back! Ghost yelled something about teleports, sent Vasilyev down - to turn off the controls... But Vasilyev's human too! He couldn't do it... We went forward. Khokhol started covering us, we locked ourselves in some room, but there's no exit! No exit! And... and... I passed out.
There we go... That's better. Get angrier, come on! Why did you give up?

When I came to, only Vasilyev was nearby. He said Khokhol died, and Ghost used explosives to blast a hole into some tunnel and left. Vasilyev thought he went for help, so he stayed with me himself until I came to. Ghost still wasn't back, so Vasilyev decided to go for help himself, since alone he couldn't carry me, and I couldn't walk on my own... Ghost left his suit to Khokhol before leaving, some kind of healing one he had. But it didn't help him... Khokhol must've been real bad. I had a small supply of water and food... So I lasted here three days, or more... I don't even know how much time actually passed, lost count...
I see... Got it. How are you now, can you walk on your own?
I don't think so, no strength left at all... probably I've been sitting here much longer than three days, and the wounds are making themselves known...
Alright, then here's what. I'll try to get out of here and bring help. Just hold on a little longer, they'll definitely pull you out.
Marked One... I feel like complete shit...
Come on, don't pass out. Help will be here soon.

+2 Greetings, bro!
I'm writing this letter to you from my new location with a bottle of excellent alcohol - and I sit here alone, Sparrow, with a faithful friend - and simply with my own faithful muzzle on my chest. It might be unpleasant to read. I'll tell you something "cool" if I find the strength, I won't make stuff up.
Well, and about the cop - I'm forwarding some information, need to discuss how to proceed so we don't screw up.
On the old place through a week.
P.S. Yes, don't take anyone with you to this place - the area's serious.
Bandits... b-bastards, were leading me to the old factory. Most likely they were planning to finish me there. At least one of our guys who was taken there before me, nobody saw again...
What's there at this factory? And how did you even manage to get caught by bandits?

I heard that Borov, the local watchdog, sniffed out that through the basements of this factory you can get into some secret underground. There was a laboratory there or something like that. But you can't just get in. I don't know the details, unfortunately. The crooks keep a crew of psychos there, watching over the place sort of. So I don't advise going there.\nAnd I got caught... They passed information to our group that Borov and his gang get weapons and equipment from somewhere outside the Zone. There was intel that a large weapons caravan was expected soon. Our squad was supposed to identify the meeting place on Ivantsov's orders. But apparently some scumbag is leaking our plans to Borov... Basically, they were waiting for us. Two dozen punks jumped us right at the entrance to the Valley.
What happened to the others?

They killed Sokhatyi and Krest right away, and us - me, Seryoga, Vovchik and Yurik - they took to the base. Yurik was taken away yesterday, don't know what happened to him. Seryoga and Vovchik are still with the bandits. They're keeping them in the basement... there's this building... big, unfinished. If you can, help them, okay? Or they'll also...
Let's better rush to Prapor at the Garbage for help, there'll be more chances...
Time's precious, and unknown who's selling us out, maybe a rat showed up at the checkpoint... I'll try to do something myself... Just got no strength at all, and problems with ammo... How about you?
I'll try to do something...
I have no reason to quarrel with the local bandits, sort it out yourselves.
Thanks! I'll try to assemble a squad from those I know. Listen, there's another thing...
Hey there, friend! Listen, here's the deal...
Don't be shy, speak straight.

Bandits took my PDA, and I had ammunition stash coordinates saved there. The data's encrypted, so I think these psychos won't get anything from it. I managed to turn on geolocation on the device. If you get the chance, try to track it down and find it. Then we'll have a chance to destroy this snake nest. And I won't shortchange you on the reward, I promise.
Alright, I'll try to get your PDA back.
I have my own road, so don't take offense.
Marked One, any news?
Thanks for helping, of course, but we have nothing more to talk about.
Didn't really want to anyway.
Feel sorry for my partner... was a good comrade. Sorry, I can't talk right now.
That's alright, I understand.
Come on, come on, stalker. Nice to see a new face in this local bedlam.
What's with the fancy talk?

Sorry, it gets the better of me sometimes. Not enough poetry. Let's get acquainted? Everyone here calls me Docent. Well, that's just for laughs. Actually, I didn't even finish graduate school. There I go talking again, so who do I have the honor of speaking with?
They call me Marked One.

Well then, Marked One, let's spin our Zone business. I collect information, mainly from PDAs that belonged to different stalkers. Of course, in most cases there's nothing interesting in them, pure garbage, but sometimes curious things turn up. So, if you happen to find someone's PDAs, bring them, we'll agree on the price.\nYes, condition doesn't matter. I'll take broken ones, dead ones, password-protected ones, and encrypted ones. I've got programs for decryption and bypassing various protection.
Got it. I'll keep it in mind.
What brings you here, stalker?
Hi, Marked One. Ivar came by about an hour ago, asking about you, whether you'd shown up here. Haven't met with him yet, no? He asked me to tell you to definitely stop by and see him.
What's up with him? How'd he even manage to hobble over?

He's still weak, of course, but slowly starting to get back to normal. Though he looked worried. Something's weighing on him, I think. You should go talk with him first, if you don't have anything urgent.
My business can wait. I'll go to Ivar, then come back.
Hi, Marked One. Any progress on my request or did you come about something else?
Hello, Marked One! What can I do for you?
I have a PDA, what'll you give for it?
I can give... a bottle of vodka for it.
That'll work, deal.
Nah, I changed my mind.
Well thanks, much appreciated.
Tell me, Docent, you know about different electronics, can you improve PDA performance somehow? I saw Sidorovich, for example, sells a special expansion module...

Only with such modules can you do it. You don't think that someone in Zone conditions would actually tinker with these things, solder boards, program firmware and all that? I happen to have a couple of pretty rare expansion modules lying around. One gives the ability to put your own marks right on the PDA map and make notes for them. Stalkers say it's an extremely useful function. I'll give it away for just a couple of second-level artifacts in good condition. The other can crack simple passwords that protect other PDAs. My little know-how. I trade that one for a third-level artifact. Also in good condition, accordingly.

Going for round two? I already offered you to acquire either an expansion module designed for setting user marks on the map, or a module that picks simple passwords for other PDAs. Forgot? Then let me remind you: this pleasure will cost two "fresh" second-level artifacts for the first module and one third-level artifact for the second. Fresh too, of course.
Make notes on the map and crack other people's PDAs? Need to think if I need this...
That's what I came for. I want to put marks on the map. Will these artifacts suit you?
That's what I came for. I want to crack other people's PDAs. Will these artifacts suit you?
Right, you did say that. Slipped my mind...
Now I'll take a closer look... Very nice indeed. Your module, if you please. Hope you'll figure out the installation yourself?
Yeah, I'll manage somehow.
My own PDA broke down.
Let's take a look. Maybe the battery just died?
Here, take a look.
Hell knows where I put it... Got a new one?

Hmm, yeah, it's not working... Probably something burned out in an emission. Happens sometimes. I have working ones, want one? I'll give it for a second-level artifact. If we try to revive yours, that takes time, well and work. Though.. everything's possible. I'll take it on, but for a third-level artifact. What do we decide?
Sure, why not. I'll give it for a second-level artifact. Want it?
I'll take it, here's the artifact.
Need to check how I'm doing with artifacts. I'll come back.
Here, look, almost new. Now I'll register its data to your name. Use it.
Go ahead, revive it, here's the artifact.
Give me a new one, what the hell.
I'll think it over, consult with people.
Wow, thanks. Don't worry, we'll restore it. Come back in half an hour, I think everything will be ready.
Here, look, almost new. Now I'll register its data to your name. Use it. Yes, you don't mind if I keep your old PDA, disassemble it for parts? From me - a bottle.
Consult, of course. Don't think I'm inflating the price.
Yes, please. What do I need a broken one for?!
I need a new PDA. I... lost my old one.
I have several "clean" ones, after minor repair, almost new you could say. I'll give one for a second-level artifact.
No problem. Take this one.
Whoa! I'll think about it more, do I need it for such a price...
One moment... This one won't turn on, let's try another... There, yeah. All set, I've entered you in the database, now this will be your identifier.
Colleagues, don't forget that doors lock automatically, access code to the laboratory generator room - 26359
So, stalker... What do you need here? Speak straight! Everyone here... is one of ours.
Looking for someone... Or something. What do you have here?
Know too much... I think you're aware of what happens to the overly curious. What's your name, curious one?
Marked One. And I couldn't care less about your secrets. I'm leaving.

Hold on! Marked One. A bullet might come flying, ruin such a nice suit... I'm joking... Don't be mad! I have business, personal... Let's go, talk? Otherwise some infection is hiding in the bushes, you never know... I've got a bottle ready for a heartfelt conversation... Come on, be bold.
Some other time... I've got my own business.
Heartfelt conversation?! Then let's go.
Business, you say? Well, well... Watch out, it'll come back to haunt you.
Follow me, don't lag behind.
Lead the way already.
You again! What are you doing prowling around here? Or have you matured for a proper conversation?
I have nothing to talk about with you, just passing by.
Alright, captain. I'm listening.
Not here! Follow me, to my den.
Well lead on.
Well, here's my den. How about a hundred grams each?
Let's skip it, I still have to trudge through the whole swamp.
Why just a hundred? Pour properly.
You're not a heartfelt person, Marked One. Well, suit yourself... Anyway, I have one delicate matter.
Our kind of guy! Don't mind the uniform, we're all people... Well, shall we? To us, good people!
Cap, let's skip the preambles.
To good people!

Anyway, listen. The other day I was asked to assign security to several scientists. I understand that these pampered worms need to be herded like sheep. Otherwise they'll either run off on their own, or the mon... monsters will devour them. I assigned two of my eagles. Don't know what happened there, but my little falcons vanished. And the nerds disappeared. Like they fell into water. For days now, not a word. Demian, he's in charge of security for the scientists, was really upset about this. And what can I do? Like, the Zone, mutants, anomalies... anything can happen. And everything would be fine, except a hunter I know told me he saw my boys running with crazy eyes toward the northern village.
So send soldiers, let them bring back your little soldiers.

Already sent them, they're not there. They slipped away! Bastards... And if they show up somewhere and start flapping their tongues, it's completely game over... Such a deal will be ruined because of two idiots... I'll tell you this: think we're just sitting here? Zone, artifacts... That's all bullshit! Real stable cash comes from "black gold"! Oil!\nI have a well here, pumping pure oil, it's almost like gasoline - light, almost no paraffin. The soldiers refine it using special technology.\nEvery two-three days, one way or another, a ton or more of good gasoline is produced. True, it's hard to transport out, but nothing, we manage.
Are you worried about your soldiers or your business? What do you need from me?

You're a normal guy, Marked One, experienced, can tell right away! Neighbors from the Cordon told me about you. If these goats didn't leave the perimeter, then they're holed up somewhere nearby. They need something to drink and eat. Maybe you'll look for these freaks. Just without too much noise, you understand. And if you find them, let me know. Then I'll figure out what to do myself. You won't regret it.
Maybe I'll manage to find your soldiers, maybe not. You said it yourself - the Zone.
Got anything on our business?
Still nothing, like they fell into water.
Found your little falcons. They're at Forgotten Village, sitting in the basement, eating rats and drooling. Basically... deal with them yourself.
Marked One, I believed in you! Now you can take as much gasoline as you can carry. What do the soldiers say? Did something happen?
They say that at the burned village, nearby here, scientists were conducting some experiment and something went wrong. They disappeared. Like, there's a gate to hell there and it sucked them in.
What are you talking about?!

How should I know! The soldiers say the scientists approached a bubble, took out some contraption, turned something on and... vanished. Like that bubble sucked them in. The soldiers, naturally, got scared they'd be blamed for everything, grabbed their legs and headed wherever their eyes looked. So don't celebrate too early, captain. It's a murky story. If those nerds surface somewhere, there'll be questions for sure.

Something needs to be done. I don't need extra worries... Marked One, go to that village, take an experienced look, maybe those scientists are lying under some burned wall. I don't believe in miracles.
I've been there, more than once. Nobody's there, just dogs and rats wandering around.\nI fulfilled my part of the deal, now I could use some help too.
Always, whatever we can... what do you need?
I'm tight on ammo, and you guys have supplies I think? I'd buy some... Or trade for something.

Ammo we have, sure... But let's be honest. What can you offer for it? Those paper bills of yours? They're not even good for wiping your ass. Artifacts? What do I need them for? I'll be straight: my interest is real currency. Some traders write bearer bank checks. One check - a thousand bucks. Get the checks, then we'll talk.
And what will I get for them?
A thousand bucks is... Basically, I'll supply ammo for a grand. For the AK-74, 5.45 caliber, or even for AKM - 7.62... So - bring them.
Deal, prepare the ammo.
Don't forget about the village. If you find out anything, let me know. Keep the ammo, you earned it.
You're coming here too often. On business or just?
The military captain guarding the oil drilling well asked to get rid of the scientists' bodies at the burned village. Dirty work, but the cap promised he won't shortchange me.
Listen, captain, miracles and nothing else.
What are you talking about? Maybe some vodka? You don't look like yourself.

I found the bodies at the burned village, in lab suits. Intact, not even touched by monsters. Looks like those are exactly the ones who... disappeared. And at the village, some devilry is happening, no doubt.

Found them?! How?.. You said you searched everything there? Damn... one thing after another. What now? Everything just settled down. They'll raise hell again. Oh, bad timing, bad timing... Maybe you'll make it so nobody finds these corpses, even by accident. Zone, anomalies...
Don't understand?
Well, anomalies, you understand? Help me out, I'll thank you, don't doubt it. Ammo, fuel, maybe even find something from weapons... If I send my morons again, some other nonsense will happen.
I'm not a garbage man, sort it out without me.
Alright, cap. I'll take a look. Maybe I'll think of something.
Then get lost! And watch your back... You never know!
Just don't take too long, in case someone finds them first.
I dealt with the corpses.
And how? Didn't leave traces?
They got into an anomaly! Consider they walked there themselves. Not even bones left.
You're a real man! A bottle's on me! Ha-ha... Just kidding... Nobody saw?
Nah, all clean. So, what were you offering?

Nobody... that's good. As agreed, I can pour you pistol ammo, lots, 20 packs. Or rifle rounds, 5.45 caliber, about three hundred. Or, if you want, I'll give the same amount for AKM. And a canister of gasoline as a bonus. If you don't need ammo and fuel, there are two guns to choose from: "APB" with silencer included or "AKS-74N". What'll it be?

Nobody... that's good. As agreed, I can pour you pistol ammo, lots, 20 packs. Or rifle rounds, 5.45 caliber, about three hundred. Or, if you want, I'll give the same amount for AKM. And a canister of gasoline as a bonus. Choose.
If it's a lot, give me pistol rounds!
I'll take AK ammo.
Give me the AKM rounds, caliber matters.
"APB"! Good weapons never hurt.
I'll take the "AKS-74N", you can attach all kinds of gadgets to it!
Deal! Take the ammo and canister as extra.
Deal! Take the ammo and canister as extra.
Deal! Take the ammo and canister as extra.
Deal! Take it.
Deal! Take it.
See you, captain... Maybe we'll meet again.
Here's a present from Sergeant Sherstyuk. You know him, right? Says your birthday's coming up, if so, congratulations.
Know him, sure... Birthday, you say?! Hmm... What's the present?
A barrel of foreign wine.
Booze, I see. That all?
He said verbally that supplies are delayed for now. He'll let you know later when and what. Said you'd understand.
Delayed... Yeah... If that's all, take this, for your trouble. Or maybe some wine, a glass each?
I still have to trudge back. Better on a clear head.
I have a bank check, can I get ammo?
No problem! Bucks are bucks even in Africa. What do you want? 5.45 or 7.62?
For AKM, 7.62.
I changed my mind.
Your money - became ours. Take the ammo.
Made the trade blind... Take the ammo.
Do you know Captain Sergeev?
I know lots of people. You should pour for warmth, it's getting chilly. Not manly to talk dry.
Hmm. What's your interest?
Don't have any spirits on me, we'll talk later then.

Yeah, there's interest. I found letters at Garbage, seems a clerk died there or someone dropped a bag. Army mail. I showed soldiers, some even reached their addressees. But one letter... Actually the surname - Captain Sergeev... They say he was here?
Listen, Marked One, you ask too many questions. You're not, by chance, you know? Well, not buying Slavic wardrobes? Just kidding, of course, but in every joke... You pour.
Alright... \n ... \nSo what about Sergeev?

Ehhhh, nasty stuff... Marked One, don't rush, I'll be talking to wild cats soon at this rate. For once I can drink with a normal guy.\nYour captain, the Sergeev one, was here before me... Good guy, but reckless, too desperate. Soldiers respected him, though they were scared too, he had a heavy fist. They say he came to us from military intelligence, or similar structure. His uncle or someone from his family is connected up top. But he screwed up big somewhere, so they hid him in the Zone... Well, to fix his service record, you know. But he didn't calm down here either, had ants in his pants apparently. He got involved with one stalker who was working with some nerds. According to the soldiers, he had strange eyes - transparent. They called him Ghost.\nWhat's wrong? Pour already! Eh, not Hennessy, but we're not in a bar either!
Just thinking... Let's have another one.

Good!\n ... \nSo anyway, he left a sergeant in charge and took off somewhere. Was gone about three days. Then a signal came from the Track area asking for help. The sergeant turned out to be smart, went there competently without losses with another conscript and pulled out the captain. He was in bad shape, looked like broken ribs, medium burns and a torn wound on the thigh. Was delirious, cursing that Ghost the whole time. They pulled him out of the Zone by transport to the hospital.
Hmm, something doesn't add up.

Don't get worked up, pour... If you try to leave, you won't make it!\nJoke...\nThe thing is, his relative, well not himself but through my command, asked to conduct an investigation and prepare two reports. One heroic - how Sergeev saved personnel and the facility, you know, for the service record or promotion. And the second unofficial, apparently for beating up the nephew at home or something else. And in exchange they hinted they know about my business plans and won't interfere... That's how it is.
Yeah, shame... \n ... \nSeemed like I'd meet Sergeev, maybe remember something. Let's have one last one.
Stop grieving! There are almost as many Sergeevs in our world as Ivanovs! Maybe your neighbor was Sergeev, or the gym teacher at school. Who knows. Don't be sad. And take this... for the road.
Listen, have you seen a case like this?
Like this? Hmm... I think I've seen it. Let me remember... Seems like someone brought one like this. Need to ask at the Bar. The mechanics there are great experts in this.
Alright, we'll see.
Why so gloomy, Vitaly? No customers coming?

More like the opposite. Duty guys threw me some work. Their raid group yesterday ran into a big pack of mutants at Wild Territory. Got the squad beat up bad. Heard there were casualties too. Well, and now I have to fix up their gear, naturally.
Sad occasion, sure, but work is work. They have theirs, you have yours. Or am I missing something?

The whole problem is the repair order's urgent. Don't know why they're in such a hurry, but they insistently ask to get everything in proper shape as soon as possible. Everything would be fine, I'm not afraid of work, but as luck would have it, my buddy who sends me armor plates for repairs from beyond the "perimeter" let me down. Ended up in the hospital with appendicitis. I have some stuff left in reserve, but definitely not enough for everything. And there are other orders too. Can't figure out what to do.

Hmm... if I were you, I'd try to bargain with the soldiers. They must have spare ones for their army body armor, right? The key is finding the right approach. With enough firewater available, it's not hard at all.

Listen, maybe you could handle this business? I need to find enough plates for at least three suits. Can you get that many? What would interest you...\nOh, I see your head flashlight's pretty weak, judging by the bulb. I can replace it with a more powerful one as thanks. It'll shine farther and brighter. True, you'll have to change batteries a bit more often, but I assure you, it's worth it. How's that for a deal?
That could actually be useful. Especially if I have to crawl through dark basements. Alright, I agree.
Sorry, I don't have time for this. I gave you the idea, handle the rest yourself.

The stalker equipment repair master from the Bar asks me to find him armor plates in quantities sufficient to fix three suits. The most reasonable approach would be to contact the military. For help with this matter Lanky promised to install a more powerful bulb in my flashlight.
How's business going? Haven't figured out where to get armor plates yet?

Lousy. Having to turn down even regular customers for now. Got an idea to buy all kinds of junk from the Junkman at Sanatorium and pick out more or less intact plates from it. Maybe I'll manage somehow until my supplier buddy gets back on his feet. But the Duty order is still hanging and they're very unhappy about it.
Then I have good news for you. Managed to get three army body armors. Think there'll be enough plates in them for you to close the Duty order. Here they are, take them.

Thanks a lot! You really helped out. Yeah, this'll be more than enough for the order, and there'll be some left over.\nI promised you a powerful bulb for your flashlight, right? I'll do that in a flash... where are they now. Ah, here! Just a second, just a second... There, use it. And thanks again.
Thanks to you too. Well, stay healthy!
Know who makes cases like these?

Open your eyes, Marked One, there's exactly the same one standing there. I sometimes craft them on order... For those who don't want their personal business accessible to the curious. I get these locks on special order.
Well, great! Won't you give it to me? I'll thank you!
The one on the safe? It's broken, fools tried to open it, just mangled the whole lid... But I can find you a whole one. But you'll owe me, I think you understand?
Of course! And how much do I owe?

I'd say not how much, but what! There's one craftsman nearby - at the Freedom base... Screw they call him. He knows a trick, how to prepare combustible mixture for flamethrowers. You understand yourself, it's quite troublesome business to experiment with... So you, as thanks, try to learn the exact method. Deal?
Alright, deal! Where's the case?
No other way? I'm not sure I'll find this Screw.
Probably I'll look elsewhere... Later.
I trust you. It's in the Barkeep's backroom, take a look, if he starts making trouble, tell him I'll give him another one...
Another way? Well then let's do this: there's an artifact called "Cobblestone". It has anti-gravitational properties. I want to try building it into some suit. If you come across one, bring it?
Well alright, I'll bring it if I find one.
I don't like to be in debt! What if I don't find it? Then what?
Well great! I believe you. The case is in the Barkeep's backroom, take a look, if he starts making trouble, tell him I'll give him another one...
Eh, you're so stubborn... Got money? Give me a check for a ton of western cash, and we're even...
Don't have that kind of money...
Now we're talking! Instead of go here, find that... Here's the check!
Alright, go on - it's in the Barkeep's backroom, take a look, if he starts making trouble, tell him I'll give him another one...
Well, you helped out... Later...
Well, you helped out... Later...
Stalker! Did Kuznetsov send you?
Consider that he did. I'm here for the case.
Consider that he did. But I'm empty-handed for now. Came to scout, kinda.
Did you bring vodka? They promised me... a crate!

Listen, young man, they allocated three bottles for this job, so take what you're given and hand over the case. And this one's for you to swap. Let's make it quick. I don't like it here with you guys. Someone might wake up, go to the bushes to take a leak, and here we are...
Listen, young man, they only allocated three bottles for this job... True, I forgot them. But I'll be right back, wait a bit.

Just three bottles? That's barely enough for me and the boys to sit down once, and even then... Ah, alright. Here's the case.\nListen, don't you have any more vodka with you? I heard stalkers always carry it, for radiation and all that...
You hurry up. I'll be here till morning, then only come back the next night.
Vodka in the Zone is basically currency. And just "give me some" won't work. If you have something to offer in trade, then maybe I can find a couple bottles, maybe more.

That's what I'm talking about. It's depressing here. Officers go wild, grab everything for themselves. And us simple soldiers have no life... But have a little drink, and discharge seems closer... If anything, me or someone else will come out every night. We can supply ammo for vodka. For a bottle, a couple packs for AK-74. There's also some for AK-47, but less of those, so only one pack.
Not much... Got anything else?

There's something. But different price now. Now it's scientific.\nI came across an interesting piece of paper. Our guys recently caught a stalker trying to get out of the Zone. What was valuable, the brass pocketed, and threw out the rest. I picked it up, read the papers, asked around the village - your people say it's a recipe, how to get one artifact from another. Heard stalkers pay good money for such information, so I won't give it for less than ten bottles.
At least give me a hint what's written there. I won't pay ten bottles for a pig in a poke.
Like you need to - "stand no more than two steps from 'Springboard' and throw kolobok at an angle"... What kind of kolobok? Hell knows... What comes from that kolobok I'll tell when you bring vodka.
Like you need to - "stand no more than two steps from 'Electra' and throw beads at an angle"... What kind of beads? Hell knows... What comes from those beads I'll tell when you bring vodka.

Like you need to - "stand no more than two steps from 'Electra' and throw battery at an angle"... What kind of battery? From a flashlight or what? Hell knows... What comes from that battery I'll tell when you bring vodka.
Hmm... understood. Later soldier, not saying goodbye.
Back for the case? Didn't forget to bring vodka?

Yeah. Brought both the replacement case and vodka. Take everything. And let's make it quick. I don't like it here with you guys. Someone might wake up, go to the bushes to take a leak, and here we are...
Nah, I wanted to check if you're waiting in place.
Is that you? Want something?
Interested in vodka? Trading?
For a bottle I'll give a couple packs for AK-74 or one pack for AK-47. Which do you want?
Give me bullets for AK-74.
Need ammo for AK-47.
I'll come back later.
One pack and another pack of 5.45... Maybe something else?
Your pack of 7.62... Maybe need more?
For ten bottles of vodka the soldier at the blockpost promised to give me a paper with a recipe written on it.
That precious paper didn't get lost?
Don't worry, keeping it in my inner pocket. Did you bring vodka?
Ten bottles. As agreed. Where's the recipe?
Just wondering, maybe you already smoked it.
Here, this paper. Bit worn, but you can make out the writing.
It was you who told Sidor about the unique body armor lying around here with you guys, wasn't it?
Maybe it was me. So what?
I need them. Haven't floated away yet, I hope?

Haven't floated away. I accidentally found them in the attic of our barracks. Who and when stashed them there - no clue. Judging by how much dust was there, they haven't been remembered for a very long time, but I moved them to... another place just in case. Ready to go get them right now, if you have a crate of white stuff for me.
What are you, soldier?! A crate of vodka for him... won't you puke? Ten bottles - that's my limit.

Nope. I'm educated now, know that in stalker circles vodka is the most important currency, and everyone has so much stocked that ten people could get wasted. Won't give for less than a crate. Judge for yourself: what if someone still figures out to look for these suits? There'll be hell to pay. Nobody counts ammo, but this... Anyway, I'm taking a risk.
Damn... And who fed you such nonsense? Probably Sidor? Alright, you'll get your crate.
Sweet! I'll dash there and back now, about half an hour. If I don't make it back by morning or you don't have time to get vodka, then paddle over next night.
Deal.
For a crate of vodka the soldier at the blockpost promised to get two gravity suits.
Where's the promised armor?
Did you bring vodka?
I haven't gone for the suits yet. Wait.
Twenty bottles. Watch you don't break them while carrying.
Soon. Wanted to make sure everything's good with you.
Eh, now me and the guys...
Don't drink yourselves to death celebrating. I'll drop by again sometime.
Marked One, judging by everything?
You know me? From where? What else is known about me?

For now - I emphasize - for now, nothing particularly important. They found you recently at Cordon. Don't remember anything. Fyodor Sidorovich Kulebaka nursed you back and gave that name. You're good at surviving in the Zone. All correct?
Well... Yes. And who are you?

Just call me Prapor. For the especially dense - this isn't a rank, it's, so to speak, an operational pseudonym. For now I'm handling my business here at the Bar. If there's any interest in you, I'll contact you, don't doubt it. And for now seek, Marked One, what you were seeking. I'll even wish you luck.
Thanks for the kind word... Prapor.
Marked One, why do you keep hanging around here? Got something to say - say it, if not - move along...
You could be softer, or something...
The priest's wife's ass is softer. I don't have time to flap my tongue for nothing!
Everyone's so business-like...
Yeah, and I advise you to do something useful instead of wasting my time.
So, brother? Did you find what you were looking for? Or what?
Marked One, judging by everything?
You know me? From where? What else is known about me?

For now - I emphasize - for now, nothing particularly important. They found you recently at Cordon. Don't remember anything. Fyodor Sidorovich Kulebaka nursed you back and gave that name. You're good at surviving in the Zone. All correct?
Well... Yes. And who are you?

Just call me Prapor. For the especially dense - this isn't a rank, it's, so to speak, an operational pseudonym. For now I'm handling my business here at the Bar. If there's any interest in you, I'll contact you, don't doubt it. And for now seek, Marked One, what you were seeking. I'll even wish you luck.
Thanks for the kind word... Prapor.
Marked One... I'll see how you prove yourself. Maybe there'll be some business. For now take care of your own affairs.
Better help me, maybe you know something about Strelok or Ghost?

Maybe I do...
Strelok...
Strelok is a legendary figure, something like Semetsky. Some say they've seen him, others... Others are hard to believe...
Haven't met Vasyan Ryaboi? Not long ago he was flapping his tongue at the Bar that Strelok took him as a partner for some job.
But for now I don't see any interest in laying out more. Let's see what you do next.
So, brother? Did you find what you were looking for? Or what?
Oh! You scared me, stalker, why are you prowling in the dark?
Got business...
Business... Everyone's got business. You better not show yourself. Better go get some sleep. You look - I've seen the dead looking better. What's your name?
Marked One. And who are you?
Baldy. Just Baldy, everyone here knows me. Come to the bar in the morning, we'll throw some dice, check your luck.
Alright, if I have time - I'll drop by.
Well later, I'm walking on - keeping watch.
Marked One... Still bustling around, I see.
Baldy, have you heard anything about Strelok or Ghost?
Who hasn't heard about them... But let's talk later, closer to noon, at the bar. I'm busy with business here, if you hadn't noticed.
I'm on patrol now, can't talk, but as soon as I'm relieved - straight to the Bar. We'll chat there over a glass or two, deal?
Deal.
Oh... Look how the Zone mangled you. Want a drink?
Don't want to for now. Haven't we met before? Maybe heard something about Strelok?
What's your name, curious one?
Marked One... Yes. And who are you?

Right on the nose. As in, Marked One. They know me here as Baron. Lost a friend recently. Bastard. There are people like that... Went through so much with him, and he got greedy over a lousy rifle... E-eh... Sure you don't want a drink? What kind of people...
No, I have business. I'll come back later...
You again... My soul burns, you understand!
Better help me, maybe you know something about Strelok or Ghost?
Strelok, Ghost... What's the difference. We'll all be there.
So-so. Well hey there, little bro. Your face looks familiar somehow.
Oh really? So what? What's this business here?
Well like this. Duty guys kinda made tracks. And now we're heroically defendin' the white and fluffy little stalkers from scary monsters. Yeah! And like we deserve a reward for this. You dig?
Oh really? What if Borov finds out about this?
Lots of you types, lovers of freebies...

Borov - Shmorov, who... Ah! So I'm lookin' - familiar face! I saw how you had beef with the boys. Damn, what was your name... There! Marked One! Yeah? I got eagle eyes!\nBorov moved the gang to another hideout. But the brothers are afraid that after that hideout they won't be able to get up with a jack... You know what I mean. So me and my pals will wait for now before chargin' somewhere. We got it good here for now.\nYou chatty devil! You got me talkin'... Anyway, give us cash, then we'll let you pass right here. I remember - you're tough, you got it.

We ain't amateurs! We're professionals! And who are you, hotshot, who... Ah! So I'm lookin' - familiar face! I saw how you had beef with the boys. Damn, what was your name... There! Marked One! Yeah? I got eagle eyes!\nBorov kinda went and croaked completely. So what - now we're the bosses here. Yeah!\nYou chatty devil! You got me talkin'... Anyway, give us cash, then we'll let you pass right here. I remember - you're tough, you got it.
Cash? How much? And most importantly - why should I?

Come on! We're being fair... A grand in bucks, just one little paper... That ain't much, is it? Look - the boys are steamin', tired of holdin' their pieces.\nAnd about your interest... Heard your head ain't all right? And you're lookin' for one pal. Like Strelok was his handle? Yeah? Well I can tell ya where he made tracks straight there, to the center of this very Zone.\nI was still a green rookie then, standin' watch, when he with his pal, what was his name... Ah! Hook! Yeah. Well they went. Into those dungeons...
You saw Strelok? What did he look like?
Well you, uh, you fork over the cash, and I'll paint ya the whole picture. What and how...
Opa-nopa! Marked One! Well what, everything good? A grand in Baku money - and we'll part like ships in the sea, to our own pleasures.
Alright, here's your check... Come on, talk.
I need to think it over...

Oh! Damn... Should've asked for more. But my word is harder than stone! Said a grand - means a grand. You can walk around here for now. Well and then, who knows. Just don't wave your piece and don't mess with the boys.
Too much talk, tell me about Strelok - where, how, what...

Why you so harsh... Could've shot the breeze about life...\nAlright, alright, don't grind your teeth at me... I'm bein' respectful.\nAnyway, it was last summer. This same Strelok wanted to haul a bunch of heavy junk, so he made a deal with our boss, what he gave him, Strelok to the boss I mean, I dunno. But the boss gave us, four pals, a job - to help. So we hauled Strelok's boxes right to the entrance to the underground. We didn't go further - screw that. The two of them went with his buddy.
What's he like - Strelok? Who does he look like?

E-e-eh... Well you asked. A guy like any guy... He was wearin' a mask. Not very tall, maybe your height. So much time's passed, here you don't remember who you mugged yesterday, let alone back then...
What kind of underground? Where did he go...

Well I heard with half an ear how this same Strelok with his buddy were chatterin' about how this underground would lead underneath straight to the catafalque... Or no, well something like that. I figured then - what they need a catafalque for? Here monsters'll eat ya without any funeral...
Catafalque? Maybe sarcophagus? And where's the underground?

Maybe sarcophagus, what's the difference... And the underground's there. There's this thick door. Well in the basement, where our hideout used to be. But from there constantly some roarin' and bangin' hard. Borov ordered to block that door just in case. Well the pals blocked it with boxes. Wanted to blow it up completely, but Borov wouldn't let 'em, said maybe we'd need to leave ourselves if they press us. And then one asshole said to pour cement over the whole entrance to that basement, so it'd be for sure. Guess his own ass got scared.
Pal! How's it goin'? You can pass, you're our guy, brother!
Wow! Look who's in Hollywood! Why you hoppin' around here and there?
On my business. What else?
Well like this. Don't get worked up, brother - everything's cool! We respect those who follow the code. Need to - then walk. No hard feelings, yeah?
Respected sir, could you show me a safe path?
Listen to how you talk! Where are you heading? Maybe I'll need something there too?
Sakharov said there's a scientists' camp somewhere in the Swamps... Don't happen to know how to get there?

Heard something with half an ear... Mmmm... Yeah!
To be honest, it's not my rule to hand out information for free... But as an exception...
Basically, when you leave me, turn left, cross the ravine, near the barbed wire there's a trailer lying around - through it you'll get to an abandoned village... We call it "Southern" among ourselves. And there along the path straight south... In those parts was that base.
I hope you won't forget about me if you find something interesting...
I'll try not to forget.
Well, hello!
You're Butterfingers? I have a question about the container you were supposed to deliver.
Well, I am. What's it to you? Sidor already chewed my ear off! Am I to blame?! These creatures attacked me, had to stay alive... Should I pay with my life for a damn box?
Don't boil over... Sidor told me to find it. Where'd you lose it?
Where? M-m-m... Listen, after these "adventures" I'm still shaking. I need to take something "calming" inside. Got any?
Want some fresh milk too? What am I, a kid? You screwed up, I gotta clean up after you, and now bring you booze too. Can't you just tell me for free?

What hints?! And anyway: who are you? I'm seeing you for the first time and don't even know if you're a stalker or just a thug looking for easy pickings. All kinds wander around here sometimes... You look, to put it frankly, lousy: your suit's torn, no weapon. Where'd you come from?
Where from and who - I don't remember. Recently woke up in this very basement. Sidorovich called me Marked One. Nice to meet you.

Marked One... haven't heard of you. Newbie, eh? Wouldn't tell by looking. Don't be surprised, I know about many veteran stalkers, collect stories about them, write them down. Interesting people come here sometimes. What's true in their stories and what isn't, that's beside the point, but people like to listen to such tales. That's mainly how I live. Going after loot somehow doesn't work out. Always get into something. Tried so many times. And this time... screwed up again.
Better tell me where to look for the container. Sidorovich is waiting.
I could really use a hundred grams, huh? My hands are shaking and my head's foggy. You don't have any? We could have a drink for getting acquainted too.
My own head's like cast iron, and I don't have any vodka. Maybe later.
Hell with it, I do have a bottle. Come on, to getting acquainted!

This... here, if anything, you can search around the village, folks sometimes leave stashes, for hangovers and such. Or there's Stas, Sidor's guard, he always has vodka. He "quarters" in the last house on the left side, when he's not on duty...
Alright, I'll take a look.
Hello, stalker! We don't seem to know each other... They call me Kostik, and what's your name?
Yeah, if only I knew... I have memory problems. The local trader dubbed me Marked One, that's what I go by for now.

Marked One? Haven't heard that handle. Newbie, eh? Wouldn't tell by looking. Don't be surprised, I know about many veteran stalkers, collect stories about them, write them down. Interesting people come here sometimes. What's true in their stories and what isn't, that's beside the point, but people like to listen to such tales. That's mainly how I live. Going after loot somehow doesn't work out. Always get into something.
Well, nice to meet you. Maybe I'll drop by sometime to listen to your stories.
Well, did you bring her, the "darling"?
Yep, here you go, pour it out.
Haven't found it yet...

Oh! Awesome! We'll get patched up too... \nYou asked about the container. Basically, look: I was coming from the direction of Garbage, settled up with the soldiers under the destroyed bridge. They always ask for grub as payment for passage, in case you didn't know. And I keep sausage for such occasions in the old house by the road, in the attic. There should still be something left there, help yourself.
Got it, thanks! What happened next, where'd you lose the container?

So here's what... From the checkpoint I slowly moved toward the village. Thought I'd be able to carefully go around the beasts, but it didn't work out. Right about here, come on, I'll mark it on your PDA, these creatures attacked me. Basically, there's both boars nearby and mole rats, and the container's heavy as hell! So I had to drop it... I don't remember the exact spot, but definitely somewhere in that area.\nBy the way, just so you know, these handhelds glitch sometimes. It happens that markers disappear from the map. So try to at least roughly remember the important places.
Everything's clear with you... Alright, see ya.
Listen! Everything I knew, I already told you! Don't waste my time.
Calm down, I just have some kind of glitch with my PDA - the marker you placed disappeared. Can you orient me again?
Damn it! Alright, come on, so be it.
Thanks!
Everything I knew, I already told you! Don't waste my time.
Yeah, I found that damn box. I'll go make... the benefactor happy.
Marked One, I hope you didn't come to blow my brains out about that damn container again?
Relax, the matter's resolved. Sidorovich isn't holding a grudge.
Relax, the matter's resolved. Well, you'll work a little for free for Sidorovich... nothing terrible.

Phew! What a relief, I thought he'd make me work it off completely. Thanks, buddy! Too bad I can't really repay you - I'm totally broke. Except, here, I can give you a couple cans. Just bought some for myself the other day as reserves, got a small stock.
Easy for you to say. You still don't know that bastard well: he'll work me to death with all kinds of penny errands...
Won't refuse, thanks. I'm going, see you around.
Nothing, you'll make up for it later. Main thing is you stayed alive and unharmed back then.
Glad to see you, Marked One!
Hello, Marked One!
And no illness to you.
Decided to leave your cozy spot and go out among people? Why can't you sit still in the village, with your luck? Dangerous...

Not more dangerous than standing guard at night. Fanat's gone wild, introduced army discipline. Can't really sit by the fire anymore. You know my trade. How can I do it if there's no time to talk with visiting stalkers. The guys decided to break away, so I'm with them. A lot of interesting people pass through here during the day. And when we get out to Garbage, we can also learn a lot of curious and unusual stuff.
When you collect all kinds of tall tales, will you share them? Honestly interesting.
You helped us all here. So you're always a welcome guest.
And that little suit I brought you, what'd you do with it?
Well when we were gathering here, I traded it with one stalker for ammo and provisions, to somehow get by at first. Now we've settled in. We earn our own way. Can't complain.
You've got a good group here. Next time, if I'm passing by, you won't kick me out?
You're always a welcome guest.
Marked One! Come to the fire.
Well what you sniffin' around here for? Got any junk?
Got nothing on me. I got business with you.
Well fo' real... Let's chat. Damn what a mug you got! If ya dream about it - you'll piss your pants. What should I call ya, sickly?
Marked One. I'm from the stalkers. About the prisoner, Nimble.

That bastard? He's a rat. Stuck his ratty mug into our common fund! If we didn't need to get sumthin' back - we'd have zeroed him no questions asked. Yeah, the scum won't admit guilt... But we can twist tongues around stakes...
Maybe I'll have a word with him? Find out what and how.
Yeah, chat away. Just don't bullshit me, got it? One more stiff means more for me... You dig?
I dig.
Well, what? Had a chat?
Not yet, just looking around.
Yeah. I think Nimble's telling the truth.
I don't give a damn! Where's the PDA? He'll tell me everything! Otherwise Borov will wrap my own guts around my mug and leave me hangin' on a branch.
I'll find out, go talk to someone who can help.
So what? I'm supposed to wait for you here? Do I need this? Now we'll have a smoke and deal with your Nimble... he'll say everything himself, no need to run around anywhere.

Well, wait a little bit more. He definitely didn't take your PDA, but I can search in the place where you saw Nimble. Just gotta make some inquiries first... An extra hour or two won't make a difference, and he's unlikely to tell you anything new anyway, but I'd quickly dash over and check everything. Deal?
Screw it with you. Get movin' then, but make it fast!
Well what? Fo' real! Had a chat? Where's that PDA?
Be patient! We're looking! Think there'll be something!
Basically, found something there where Nimble was talking about.
Well where is it?!
Here it is, take it.

A-a-ah!.. That's the one! Borov copied it just right! Well you're... Awesome in general! Here, take a bottle. And that rat-faced one, let him scram! Didn't wanna get our hands dirty. But if needed - we'll bury him! Tell him what got him lucky today.
Got a question.
Speak up, while I'm still in a good mood.
Borov - who's that? What's all the fuss about his beat-up PDA?

Borov's our authority, big man. Consider that he holds the whole Zone in his fist. Everyone here owes him something. But he don't go overboard, follows the code. Right now our gang's settled in Dark Valley. If you're a stand-up guy, you'll find a way to get acquainted with Borov. And this PDA - he needs it and that's all. Now beat it, sickly.
Got it... I'll go make Nimble happy.
What else now? Beat it, while I'm still in a good mood.
Already beat it.
What else now?
Hello. They call me Marked One. I'm from Wolf.
From Wolf? Listen, help me! These guys want some PDA from me, but I don't know anything about it! I swear!
Hello. They call me Marked One. I'm from Sidorovich.
From Sidor? Listen, help me! These guys want some PDA from me, but I don't know anything about it! I swear!
Calm down, let's go in order: what happened?

Right. So basically, I went to the Valley on business. Then decided to visit Sidor. Just passed the gas station in the Gut, I look - a boar carcass, but kinda dried up, and next to it something green, metallic. Watched from afar - quiet! Got closer and from the tracks understood that a bloodsucker "dried" it and apparently recently! I only had a PM and a simple knife, no chance against a bloodsucker. And the green metal turned out to be a box, with an almost knocked-off lid, slightly dented, looks like when the sucker grabbed the piglet, it knocked the box over, or the boar hit it with its hoof. Quickly looked - there's a jacket inside, with chainmail instead of lining. I tucked it under my arm and got out of there! Wanted to go through the tunnel first, but Dan the hunter got stubborn there - said he won't let me pass without providing a monster part! I spat and headed through the railway tunnel, where there's still a breach leading to the Sanatorium. As soon as I came out of that tunnel - the dogs started howling, and the village was already close! I dropped the jacket I found so it wouldn't get in the way, grabbed my feet and...
What next?

Just crossed the embankment, and here these guys caught me by the locomotive. Someone supposedly saw me hanging around the gas station in the Gut and found a jacket there. And there somewhere, turns out, there was a bandit stash. And in it a PDA with important information, only it went missing. Well, these guys think it's me now, like I stole it. I already told them everything honestly - never saw that PDA! They don't believe me, the bastards.
Yeah. You're in deep, guy. You say you tried to negotiate with Dan first? Who's that?

Dan? He heads up the hunters here. They set up recently near the tunnel that leads to the Gut. Say they're protecting Cordon from monsters, and demand all kinds of monster parts from passers-by, as proof that you're cleansing the Zone. A dirt road from ATP leads straight to them. Seems like a normal person, but too idealistic. Talk to Wolf, maybe he'll advise something.
Alright, I'll try to talk to Wolf.

Dan? He kinda heads up the hunters here. They set up recently near the tunnel that leads to the Gut. Say they're protecting Cordon from monsters, and demand all kinds of monster parts from passers-by, as proof that you're cleansing the Zone. A dirt road from ATP leads straight to them. Seems like a normal person, but too idealistic. Talk to Sidorovich, maybe he'll advise something.
Alright, I'll try to talk to Sidorovich.
Marked One?!...
Wait!
How are you here, alive? I found that crap these thugs lost.
For the rest of my life! I thought - I'm done for! What next?
What next? Grab your feet and... Ah! Sidor has a job...

Shh! About the flash drive? Here it is. Take it. I'd rather not deal with Sidor for now, I lingered with the guys at the sawmill, they were celebrating someone's birthday there. They were distilling moonshine - amazing stuff. That's why they managed to catch me. But there's a bright side to this business. I overheard something about a way to transform artifacts. Maybe later I'll try to brew something. But for now - sleep! There's tons of sand in my eyes!
Hello, friend!
I talked to Nimble.
Is he free already? How's it going?

Not yet. Here's the deal. The bandits say Nimble appropriated some important thing of theirs. In the Gut, supposedly he robbed some stash of theirs. Nimble himself says he didn't take anything, only found a jacket. Basically, I blurted out, without thinking, that I could dash over and check the place where they saw Nimble lurking around the bandit stash, but now I don't even know...
In the Gut, you say? That's what we call the area to the east of here among ourselves. And where exactly was he prowling? The Gut's not small...
Yeah he outlined it in general terms. Gas station... Where's that?

Gas station? Pretty far. When you exit the tunnel - straight down the road, don't turn anywhere, you'll reach it.
Listen, Marked One, try to get there, eh? Look for this "important thing". It's not my business, but I hope you at least know what exactly to look for?
I'll try to contact a mediator here. Maybe I can buy Nimble out. We don't abandon our own.
Or we'll gather more guys and try to free him by storm. That's the worst option for all of us, as you understand...
Running around somewhere else... Maybe we should storm it right now? I'm ready to help.
You handle your own business, I don't want to get involved in this.
Trek to the Gut? I'll give it a try, I guess...

You know the road to the tunnel? It starts behind ATP. When you go past ATP itself - don't show yourself. Better go around it, just in case. If the thugs see you with weapons - they might go crazy. Basically, try to be quiet there, on tiptoes. Less chance to stir up mutants too.
Take some money, you'll pay the hunters by the tunnel for passage if needed. Just don't try to throw your weight around.
In the Gut itself try to stick to the paved road, or at least don't stray far from it. Otherwise you'll catch radiation or end up as monster snacks. The road itself seems relatively clean. It was at least, last time.
That's it, go. Come back as soon as possible, who knows what those psychos might think up...
Alright, I'll go around. And I'll hurry.
Talk to Petruha. The situation's not very clear to me from here. Let him decide. Take some grenades. Just be careful there - don't hit our guys.
Alright. Got it.
Fine, beat it. What else to expect from a "passenger"...
What "passenger"?
I talked to Nimble...
Really now? As I said - he was lying drunk somewhere? Did he bring the flash drive?
Not yet. Here's the deal. The bandits grabbed him, say he took some important device. In the Gut somewhere, in a stash. He says he only took some jacket. Basically, I don't know how to help him out.
In the Gut... That's what stalkers call the place to the east of here among themselves. But what specifically? And where? Did he say? The Gut's not small...
Yeah he outlined the place, gas station... Where's that?

Gas station? Not close... When you exit the tunnel - straight down the road, don't turn anywhere, you'll reach it.
Listen, Marked One, won't you dash to that gas station? Take a look at what's going on there. Maybe there'll be a clue at least.
I'll try to contact a mediator here. Maybe I can buy out this fool.
Or we'll gather more guys and try to free him by storm.
I can try to rescue Nimble.
You handle your own business, I don't want to get involved in this.
Trek to the Gut? I'll give it a try, I guess...

You know the road to the tunnel? Don't show yourself around ATP. Better go around just in case. If they see you with weapons - they'll go nuts. And you can't go there without weapons. Who knows what monsters you'll run into...
Well go on. Try to be more careful there.
Don't stray far from the road, radiation washed down there from the slopes, you'll step in it - you're done for, but the road seems clean. It was at least, as they said.
Come back faster, who knows what and how things will be here...
Alright, I'll go around. And I'll hurry.
Alone? Hmm... Well try it. Main thing - secure that flash drive for me!
Alright. Got it.
Hmm, well look... It's your business, of course. Don't be surprised later about what and how it turns out.
Come on, don't scare me...
I'm about the measurements.
For the device, you mean? But I already gave it to you, forgot? Still haven't returned it to inventory, can't help with anything.

You've worn me out! I'm not going anywhere! What am I - the fall guy? Vlasyuk went - disappeared, Fedorov - disappeared, looks like snorks tore them apart. Kryukov dissolved completely in an anomaly and the newest protective suit didn't help. No money is worth dying here like a dog!
Right, I took it for measurements at Agroprom. Need to finish with this business first.
I'll go myself. Just give me the device and show me where to measure.
Yourself? What's wrong with your head? Well... Alright. Here's the device. You place it on the ground here, here and here, see? Just don't touch it until this light turns green and beeps. Clear?
Yeah, I'm off.
I'm about the "Brain Scorcher".
"Brain Scorcher"? And what exactly do you need?
Barkeep sent me to you, said you'll tell me everything here. Here's a flash drive with scanned documents. Take a look.

Alright, let's see... What do we have here... Test run report, reports on changes made... This isn't complete information.\nAnd what's this? "Marks of death sites or presumed places where people go insane"... Who's such an eloquent fellow? Ah... Barkeep.\nJudging by everything, indeed, the radiation parameters are similar to those we have here at Yantar.
And how can you shut down this "Scorcher"?

My good man, how hasty you are - "shut down". First you need to get close to the central part of the "Scorcher" sphere. If we assume the basic parameters of the installation are identical, then the radiation should have brief periods of decline. We can only say for certain after getting measured values in direct proximity to the emitter's sphere of action. Better yet, even inside the sphere itself. Will you take on this job? Though I think only someone who completely doesn't value their life is capable of this.
And how do you conduct measurements inside the sphere of action? People go insane there, right?

Yes, they go insane, as far as I've heard. Based on tests conducted, we've developed a certain prototype that can temporarily protect a person from the emitter's effects. I won't explain the physical principles, I think they're useless to you. Actually, you won't have to measure anything. The necessary equipment is already installed - we don't just "drink tea" either, you know. Your task is to insert the power cell and start the device. After some time, remove the card with the measurement recording. The only thing you must firmly grasp - this prototype can protect you for a maximum of 25-30 minutes, and then desynchronization occurs and radiation breaks through. And since you won't have much time, you can even do this in two stages - first turn on, and collect the results later. Clear?
Clear. Thirty minutes and... that's it... Can I get this, what's it called, prototype?

Certainly. This thing is a protective suit, to be precise. Only, you understand, it's on our balance sheet. With you, no offense, anything could happen. I wouldn't want to explain to auditing inspectors where I put such expensive equipment. Therefore I'll ask you to leave as collateral any third-level artifact in perfect condition, or one of the dummy-class artifacts. Such will do in any degree of preservation. Agreed?
Agreed. I'll rummage through my stash.
About the suit for the "Brain Scorcher".
Excuse me? "Suit"? Ah! The suit with partial protection from the emitter. Yes-yes... You wanted to bring an artifact as collateral, I believe?
Yes, I have a 3rd level artifact.
I have a dummy-class one. Will it work?
I don't have such artifacts.

Good, take the suit. Just don't forget - protection for thirty minutes maximum! Better play it safe and count on twenty to twenty-five minutes. Don't forget to monitor time. Let me mark the places where we need measurements. Here, here and... here!\nThese are power cells. Nothing complicated there. Inserts simply, you won't make a mistake. Main thing is not to mix up polarity and don't forget to remove the recording card... Good luck!
Three places. On Radar. What was I thinking...
Had a mishap - the batteries disappeared.

Batteries? Which ones?\nAh! The ones meant for installation in the scanning oscillators? How did you manage that, my good man? I don't have a horn of plenty here either. Delivery of any equipment involves known risks. Again justification, reporting.\nWe have a few more pieces. But... What if these "disappear" too? I'd ask you to leave some artifact for them. No less than second level. Agreed?
Where else to go. Here, take it.
I don't have such artifacts.

Please don't take offense... Take the power cells, nothing complicated there - inserts simply, you won't make a mistake. Main thing is not to mix up polarity. And don't forget to remove the recording card... Good luck!
I'm not offended. See you later.
Can I get another special suit?

Special suit? The one that can protect from the "Brain Scorcher"? Hmm... What happened to the one I gave you? These are experimental samples, we have... Well, very few of them. Ready to issue you another one in exchange for a dummy-class artifact in perfect condition. Does that work?
Where else to go. Here, take it.
I don't have any dummies with me.
Oh! Curious specimen. Uh... Yes. Try not to lose this suit too, I ask you.
Of course. See you later.
I managed to get the measurement results in the "Brain Scorcher" area!

Marked One, incredible! I understand that stalking doesn't tolerate weaklings, but still... How little must one value their life... Forgive me. I'm continuing a mental debate with one of my opponents. Where's the data?
The devices, in those places you indicated, gave me these cards. One each, total - three.
Data? Which? I turned on the devices, they started working...
Yes-yes, those are the ones. I need to process what you brought. Let's see, let's see...

Hmm... Yes. You see, dear fellow. Working devices save obtained data to removable media, colloquially - electronic memory cards. Those are what we need. All the necessary parameters are located there. Understand?
Wait! And how long will this take?
What? This? Trek back there again?
What? Ah... Don't worry, twenty minutes - no more. You can rest in the meantime. And I simply must reward you with something. Write down this artifact transformation method...
Alright, I understand.
Well, how's it going with the "Brain Scorcher" data?
We processed the measurement results. Strange as it may seem, lately the "Brain Scorcher's" work rhythm is quite stable, and minimal risk
Marked One, you were told - twenty minutes.
Minimal risk?
Yes, at this time, plus-minus an hour, maybe hour and a half, when switching the emitter's operating modes, a safe "window" will guaranteed appear.
Plus-minus an hour or even hour and a half... Doesn't sound too convincing. Alright, I'll figure it out on site.
Marked One, since you're planning to risk yourself again, may I ask you for one favor? It would be right on your way.
I'm listening.

Somewhere over Radar a helicopter crashed, aboard which was a group of our colleagues. The pilot went for an emergency landing and managed to safely land the aircraft. For some time we received a weak, distorted by interference, signal from the emergency beacon, but soon it disappeared. Several weeks have passed and I fully understand that hardly anyone could have survived, considering the specifics of the area where this incident occurred, but still... I'd like to reliably clarify the fate of the missing. If it's no trouble, could you look for their traces on Radar?
Oh, I don't even know. Only if I notice something along my route. I won't have time to specifically search for them.
Sakharov asked me to find out the fate of a group of scientists whose helicopter made an emergency landing somewhere on Radar, if possible.
I got copies of scientific documents here, would you take a look?
I have a few minutes of free time. But why did you come to me specifically with this?
I understand they belonged to one scientist who possibly worked with you...

Is that so? Ah! Dr. Perelman's research. Interesting... So that's what he wanted our measuring device for, which, by the way, he still hasn't returned to this day... You see, Marked One, we involved Perelman in scientific work several times as an independent consultant, but our views on some issues differed radically and eventually we stopped cooperating, although we remained on good terms with him. However, I see that he made significant progress in collecting evidence base confirming one very promising theory. I admit, I'd be extremely curious to work with this data. Uh... You don't happen to know where their author is?

Seems he hastily left the Zone... Yeah, apparently flew somewhere. Judging by the fact that you weren't aware, asking whether you know anything about the guide Dr. Perelman worked with is pointless, yes?

Sorry, my good man, but I have no idea who you're talking about. Let's do this: since Perelman returned to the big land without returning valuable property to us, for which I, by the way, bear material responsibility, and didn't even bother to inform me of his departure, then I have full moral right to thoroughly familiarize myself with the results of his research. What do you think? What would you say if I asked you to give me this flash drive for appropriate compensation? I don't know what I could offer you though... Perhaps you'd be interested in a method of obtaining a modified artifact, which in our nomenclature goes under the code "KDB"?
Why not? Let at least someone benefit from this info, since I spent my time and money getting it. Agreed.

Wonderful! I understand that my proposal might have seemed not entirely ethical and therefore I'm glad you didn't resist. Now I'll transfer to your PDA a memo on converting one hypermodificate to absolute.

Wonderful! I understand that my proposal might have seemed not entirely ethical and therefore I'm glad you didn't resist. Now I'll transfer to your PDA a memo on converting one hypermodificate to absolute. And here, please accept as a gift some medical supplies from our stocks.
Thanks. Goodbye, Ivan Sergeyevich.
Sidorovich, I came across this flash drive.
Throw it away. I don't need junk.
I'm not offering it. What do you think, if a flash drive's been lying around for a long time, can anything be read from it? Can you check what's on it for me? You've got a computer handy.

Don't you get it? I said: don't need junk. And this isn't a computer, it's also junk - Chinese crap. Vergas looked at it, says some port burned out there. I also needed to urgently read a flash drive from Nimble - looked for it, but couldn't... Had to send a reliable messenger to the Swamps. So this isn't for me.
Sorry, I wasn't aware.
I found a flash drive, can you look at what's on it.
I'm not interested in any small stuff.
I'm not offering it either. I'm just curious if everything that was on it is readable? How can I find out?
Go to Docent. He's our guy for this stuff. Just like little children! Show them everything and tell them everything. What's your own head for?
Don't grumble...
I have a flash drive here. Here it is.
Well it's a flash drive, so what? What do you need?
If you can - check if it's readable, and copy what's on it to my PDA...\nWhat would you take for such a trivial service?
What's there to charge for this... Let's see... So-so, seems visible... Some text in notepad... What kind of crap do you have here? You into Stephen King? Some nonsense, better read Simak...
What are you talking about?
Yeah, this crap of yours - some stories about crazy people... Don't understand what you found here. Anyway, I copied it to you, and I'm deleting it from mine, no time to read this crap...
Hmm... I thought there was something important there. So I was wrong, it's not his flash drive... Alright, I'll look through it and delete it too. Thanks.
Ivan Sergeyich, I have this flash drive here.
Flash drive, I see. And what?
Maybe it's possible to read what's there and copy the data? I'll pay whatever's needed.
What to charge you... Let's see - trivial matter... So. That's all, take it back. Hmm... what's this you have there, some kind of excerpt from medical history. Your case?
What? I seem healthy... I found this flash drive, seemed to me it belonged to one person, but I thought it wasn't readable...

Oh, sorry... And your person seems to be a psychiatrist or somehow connected to this field. Interested in this matter? It's your business, but with your permission I'll delete this - little space to store unnecessary records...
No... I just wanted to look through it, then delete it myself... Thanks.
I found this flash drive... Take a look?
Hmm, and what do you want?
Can you copy the contents to me from it, if it's readable, of course?
I'll try... Yes, it's readable. Hmm... what brought you into such wilds? It seems to me your amnesia has nothing to do with this field.
What field? I actually thought the flash drive belonged to one person important to me...

The field of psychiatry. Who is this person to you?.. But actually, I won't pry into your soul. Here's the data, figure it out if you're interested, and I don't have time - I'm deleting this from mine.
Psychiatry, you say... Yeah, probably I was wrong, it's not his flash drive...
You have a guy here who fell from the sky. Did he say anything coherent?
Did I interrogate him? They say he was mooing something. About like now. Who cared - there's plenty of psychos in the Zone...
Was he definitely naked?
Definitely. Like he just jumped out of a steam bath. Naked and red...
Hmm... interesting. I was just reading about a similar case recently. Maybe there's some connection...
Who's that wandering around your barracks?
Ah... don't pay attention. He's harmless. Lost something, can't find it.
And what did he lose?
Won't say. Just mutters something. Like some stone, meteorite fragment or something...
Hmm... interesting. I was just reading about a similar case recently. Maybe there's some connection...
I saw one of yours there, on Radar.

One of ours? A fellow scientist? Yes-yes! I told you about the helicopter crash. They asked me to connect local resources to search for the missing. So did you find a survivor or... What about the others?

Don't know about the others, but this one - Prikhodko was his surname - was alive at the time of our meeting, but... I couldn't get him out. He was seriously wounded, and time was pressing. I doubt he got out of there on his own afterward. And here's another strange thing: this scientist thought he was at Yantar. Maybe, of course, he lost his mind because of the "Scorcher", or maybe he wasn't from the helicopter at all.

Prikhodko? Vasily? But... how? He disappeared almost three months ago! Right in one of the insane attempts to break through to the control panel of the local installation. Where exactly did you find him? Can you describe the place?

It was some technical room on the upper level of the overpass. Inside there was various equipment, of unknown purpose to me, and two doors. I first thought he got there through one of them, but it turned out they were completely blocked.\nOh, yes! Prikhodko asked me to give you these papers. Seemed it was important to him, since he was thinking about it on death's doorstep...

Is that so? Curious... what do we have here? Hmm... Preservation leaves much to be desired. We'll have to scan and run through a special recognition program - otherwise can't make it out properly. If you don't mind, I'd ask you to come back in an hour and then we'll continue the conversation. Alright?
Actually I'd... Ah, though, alright. In an hour, so in an hour.
How's it going, have you figured out Prikhodko's papers yet?
Partially. Some things, I'm afraid, we'll never be able to read, but... Marked One, didn't Vasily tell you where he got them?
Not so fast, Marked One. Be patient.
I explained to you, we didn't have time for chit-chat. I myself barely managed to slip through under the radiation...

Well, first, allow me to express our gratitude. Though we couldn't save our fellow scientist, you delivered very valuable documents. I'll immediately credit your special account, you'll be able to pick something to your taste from our exchange fund, if you wish.
Thanks. You said "first", what's second?

Second, I want to propose another risky venture to you, connected with visiting an underground complex located under the area called by stalkers the "Tesla" zone. In the papers it goes under index "X-6". Have you been there before?
In the bunker under "Tesla"? Been there. When I remember it, I shudder. And for what reason should I go there again?
Not yet, but something tells me sooner or later my searches might lead there too.

Wait, stop! I'll refuse right away before I hear anything unnecessary. No offense, professor, but I'm quite tired of all these "risky ventures" that don't bring me closer to my main goal at all, but rather the opposite, just make me waste time.

You see, I didn't ask you about the origin of Vasily Prikhodko's documents without reason. Can't figure out how they got to him, but apparently they were originally supposed to be in the underground laboratory I mentioned. I know that some such complexes are connected by a whole network of tunnels, so it's quite possible there's no mysticism here. Now to the main point. The documents are almost entirely devoted to the laboratory's material and technical base. Among other things, data storage devices for conducted research are indicated. According to emergency protocols that must have gone into effect when the Zone appeared, all information was subject to destruction or removal. However, something could have remained on personal devices of employees, which security confiscated at the end of the work day and placed in a special safe. Its code is known - No..... Your task - find it and deliver the contents to us. Can you handle it? As a reward I'll share with you one little-known method of converting a rare artifact.

Well, all the better. You'll kill two birds with one stone right away. So, to the essence.\nI didn't ask you about the origin of Vasily Prikhodko's documents without reason. Can't figure out how they got to him, but apparently they were originally supposed to be in the underground laboratory I mentioned. I know that some such complexes are connected by a whole network of tunnels, so it's quite possible there's no mysticism here. Now to the main point. The documents are almost entirely devoted to the laboratory's material and technical base. Among other things, data storage devices for conducted research are indicated. According to emergency protocols that must have gone into effect when the Zone appeared, all information was subject to destruction or removal. However, something could have remained on personal devices of employees, which security confiscated at the end of the work day and placed in a special safe. Its code is known - No..... Your task - find it and deliver the contents to us. Can you handle it? As a reward I'll share with you one little-known method of converting a rare artifact.
I understand you. I don't like working on small stuff myself. It's just that what seems like some trifle to you, but to me... Alright, you don't want to, you don't want to.
Do I even need this? Though... rummaging around such places one more time can be useful. I've dragged so much stuff from various dungeons. I agree.
Sakharov promises to tell about a little-known method of converting some rare artifact if I bring him the contents of a safe from the bunker under "Tesla", whose code is - No.....
I searched the underground at your request... The one under "Tesla". Supposedly "X-6", right?
Exactly so. Did you find the safe? Manage to open it? I admit, I had some concerns regarding the relevance of information gleaned from those documents...
As always, it's pleasant to learn about such "concerns" after the fact. Fortunately for you, they weren't confirmed. The safe was found, and the code fit. And here's what was inside.
That's what we were fighting for, as they say. You did excellent work, Marked One! If I'm not mistaken, I promised to help you with artifact conversion, right? Sending data to your PDA.
Call on us again.
Ivan Sergeyich, I told you about Professor Vasilev, remember? He was found.
Yes-yes, they already informed me. Sad story...
I wanted to ask, what would happen if, let's say, a person was thrown back in time? Could it be that he'd lose his mind... Well or memory?
Hmm. The very possibility of traveling through time is already on the border of fantasy, and if we also fantasize about what would happen to a person, then we'll pile up such nonsense...
Well still. You must have some thoughts about this... As a scientist.

How to say... Time is a mysterious phenomenon. But I suppose, whatever time is, it's deeply woven into ourselves. All of us have a built-in "clockwork" with its own course. For some reason I'm sure that if even slightly these internal clocks desynchronize with the real course of time - this could lead to serious mental disorder. I think that schizophrenia at its core might have a disturbance of time perception. Imagine that you don't understand whether your actions happen before or after you feel them. The result of such deviation would be fragmentation in the ability to cognize, you wouldn't know what your actions caused and what they didn't.
