A person performs an action and says, it wasn't me, I don't remember doing this... Such thoughts.
So memory loss could also be a time lapse... Or schizophrenia?

I understand your concern. In your case, most likely not. After all, then you'd remember things in fragments... And you, as far as I know, have memory that's... how to put it... Like it was cut off from a certain moment.
Well yes... And if suddenly there's another lapse, and I'll remember in fragments? Could this serve as a sign... Professor, is schizophrenia treatable at all?
Don't be so paranoid. From everything I can see, you're quite mentally healthy... Just, there's some amnesia, and its causes are unknown. I think it's temporary.
Yeah right... You really "cheered" me up. Let's hope...
Professor, tell me, if a person lost their memory, can it be restored somehow?
Hmm... Young man, this isn't my field at all, but as far as I know, no one can give you a definitive answer. It all depends on many factors. What are your symptoms? What do you remember at all?

Little by little something surfaces from the past, most often about places where I've been before. Sometimes I remember some secrets, peculiarities, but the main thing keeps slipping away, and there are strange dreams, as if from another life.

It seems to me you either came under a controller's influence, or didn't manage to hide from an emission. Or possibly the cause was an event before your appearance in the Zone at all. To restore memory, remember even insignificant details. Try to analyze and understand your dreams. Our subconscious, you know, stores answers to many questions that are inaccessible to normal perception, but can be interpreted through the prism of dreams.

Really? I sometimes dream of a shining black stone and a person trying to reach it with his hand... I've heard stories about the Monolith, of course, but what could such a thing mean to dream about periodically?

Most likely these are just "echoes" of those stories, though... who knows, who knows. Remember the story about the helicopter that crashed in Dark Valley? You brought documents and a container found at the crash site. So, in the container was transported a unique anomalous formation, one of its working names - "Pendulum". The accompanying documents claim that it's a kind of "conductor" for connecting living biosystems with an external information field. With its help one can try to connect to the noosphere, to a certain "supercomputer", if you will, storing imprints of thoughts and memory of all currently living, and all ever-living intelligent beings. By the way, several of my, so to speak, "colleagues" suggested that the very Monolith is nothing other than an entrance gateway or access terminal to the "supercomputer" I mentioned. Of course, all this in a metaphysical sense. You shouldn't take my words literally, as if somewhere in the Zone you can find a screen with a keyboard, type a command and get omniscience or something like that.

Most likely these are just "echoes" of those stories, though... who knows, who knows. There are such special anomalous formations, they're also called "Pendulums". There's a hypothesis that they are a kind of "conductors" for connecting living biosystems with an external information field. With the help of a "Pendulum" one can try to connect to the noosphere, to a certain "supercomputer", if you will, storing imprints of thoughts and memory of all currently living, and all ever-living intelligent beings. By the way, several of my, so to speak, "colleagues" suggested that the very Monolith is nothing other than an entrance gateway or access terminal to the "supercomputer" I mentioned. Of course, all this in a metaphysical sense. You shouldn't take my words literally, as if somewhere in the Zone you can find a screen with a keyboard, type a command and get omniscience or something like that.
My head's spinning from all these complexities. Tell me straight, Professor, is there any practical benefit for my situation in what you told me?

I won't give you false hope. All this looks more like fairy tales from science charlatans, but not like conscientiously done research work. Perhaps, if you managed to get the artifact we talked about - "Pendulum", we could conduct a series of experiments with your participation... Even then, serious preparation is needed, which would require additional costs of both time and resources. We're unlikely to go for such a thing in the near future, but the idea itself is perhaps worth attention and I won't forget about you, my dear fellow.
But surely you don't have a suitable artifact right now? After all, I could even buy it from you or trade for something.
That's just it, we don't. These anomalous formations are very rare and it seems inappropriate to me to use specimens obtained with such difficulty for experiments of an openly adventurous nature.
I see many people have tactical vests? Where can you get one?

Well... It's not such a scarce item. Some trade with soldiers, others buy from traders. And take them from bodies, naturally. Sometimes they bring them for repair or give as payment for services. I've got a couple lying around. Not special forces quality, of course, and they're used, but still quite decent.
Maybe you'll share?
I'll share, not for free, of course. Got money in your account? I'll give it for twenty thousand. Almost for nothing...
Twenty? You're asking too much. But alright - here, take it.
I don't have that kind of money...

Well, it's not that much... A tactical vest saves lives, and that's much more valuable than a measly twenty, right? Here, take it. Don't mind that it's patched and stained, at least the pocket clasps don't jam...
Alright, thanks.
Don't mention it. Drop by if you need anything.
Twenty? You're asking too much. I don't even have anything...
Well it's not that much... A tactical vest saves lives, and that's much more valuable than a measly twenty, right? Alright, as a fellow unfortunate - ten. Final word.
Agreed, here's the money.
Here, take it. Don't mind that it's patched and stained, at least the pocket clasps don't jam...
Hey there, pal. You here to see us? Come to the fire.
Don't wave that gun around, relax - everyone here's friendly...
How's life? Sit down, let's chat...
You should go your own way.
Why are you loitering here? Got business - speak up, don't - then move along.
I don't know you somehow. Newbie? Where from, where to, what for?
Hey, I'm just here for a minute.
Friendly? Yeah right...
No time for me. Though... Maybe I'll sit down...
I'll leave when I need to.
Already left, smartass.
You work for the authorities? Report to him...
Oh! You're Vlad?
Well, I am, seems like we've met already...
Ivan Sergeyevich, were you acquainted with Professor Vasilev?

Vladimir Valentinovich? Of course, I know him. He somehow greatly supported one of my wild ideas at a symposium. There was a lot of noise, but I think we managed to defend our point of view... He works on a similar problem, only goes a somewhat different way... More radical, if you will...
Did he discuss anything with you about laboratory X-16, the one at Yantar?
Mmm... There was something, I don't recall what exactly. Why do you need this?
I need to get there. I can't properly explain why right now. But I have information that Vasilev specifically knew how to penetrate there.

Wait, wait... We once had a purely theoretical conversation about interesting anomalies in different points of the Zone, at Yantar including. Someone suggested... I don't remember... that their intensity might somehow be connected with psi-radiation intensity. This radiation, you know, isn't constant in nature, but changes all the time, so we have to periodically take measurements to identify some pattern of changes. Ah, yes! Dr. Petrov suggested this. He told about his very interesting expedition through the Zone and about conclusions regarding psi-radiation correlation with various functions. So, according to his conclusions, no connection is observed, complete chaos, from which it's clear to understand... Uh... I got distracted, sorry. So what about Yantar?

Nothing good so far... Professor Vasilev disappeared somewhere, no one knows how to penetrate X-16, Sakharov doesn't want to spare people for this. I thought you should have known something, since you already had such a conversation. Well then, I'll have to go to Dr. Petrov. Better talk with him then.

To my great regret, Petrov recently died. He was conducting research in sector 82. Stalkers call this area "the Gut". And about the conversation, you're right, I remembered that about half a year ago I even jotted down some thoughts about these "variable" wandering anomalies. I'll rummage through my notes, in the computer, maybe a draft remained. And regarding laboratory X-16, somewhere there should be a transcript of our conversation with Dr. Petrov on this topic. Come back in half an hour.

He conducts research in sector 82. "The Gut", that's what stalkers call this area. He wasn't at our base for long. He had some problems - his recent measurement records disappeared, well and... financial difficulties. I helped him a little...\nAnd about the conversation, you're right, I remembered that about half a year ago I even jotted down some thoughts about these "variable" wandering anomalies. I'll rummage through my notes, in the computer, maybe a draft remained. Come back in half an hour...\nMeanwhile, if it's no trouble, go to our supply manager. I asked him to put together a little package for Petrov. Want to treat my colleague. You're planning to visit him anyway.
Got it. Won't bother you.
I'll go meet your supply manager. See you later, Ivan Sergeyevich.
Then I'm off to Pakhom. See you later, Ivan Sergeyevich.
Did you search for the drafts, find anything?
No, haven't gotten to it yet. Come back a bit later.
Alright.

Something, I don't know if this will give you anything... I'm afraid I gave this draft of mine to the guide along with other notes... Oh, by the way! I've become quite absent-minded and missed what you said last time about Professor Vasilev. Where is he?
I said he disappeared somewhere, and no one knows where. Most likely, he went to that very laboratory.

Hmm... what strange coincidences. Dr. Petrov said that his graduate student saw Professor Vasilev in completely the wrong place and at the wrong time, where he could physically be. The graduate student, of course, could have confused something himself, but the thing is, he also disappeared. A group of three employees left and all vanished. How much time has passed without any word from them. I asked stalkers to help, organized a search, but no results so far. And now you say Vasilev disappeared. Very strange disappearances...
The Zone, one word... So what about your notes?

Yes-yes... Here, please. Might be a bit chaotic, but these are just small notes, more precisely a draft of notes, and not everything at that. What I can offer, don't judge harshly... What? Not what you expected? Probably I gave those notes to the guide after all...
About X-16, is there something?

According to Dr. Petrov, Vasilev mentioned in his last message that a certain stalker with a strange handle - Ghost - told him about it. There exists a method of instantaneous controlled transfer through space, and possibly time. For this, simultaneous activation of three unique artifacts is necessary. A scheme was given for teleportation two-three meters in the direction of Earth's center. In my opinion - very, very dangerous experiments.
Dangerous, that's for sure. What artifacts? Didn't mention?
These are artifacts of the so-called "emerald" group. "Wrenched", "Jellyfish" and "Stone Blood". Testing this hypothesis probably won't be possible - these artifacts are too rare.
Probably it was still possible, since Vasilev and those who were with him managed to get into this mysterious underground laboratory... And where is it located? Specific place?

Hmm... According to Petrov's story, Vasilev was sure he knew. Even marked it on the map for him. Here, in the basement of this building at the Yantar factory. Mark it for yourself, if you're interested.
In the basement? And you say another two-three meters toward Earth's center, where could it get any lower? And how to use these "emeralds"? Maybe throw them on the ground or arrange in a triangle?

I think you shouldn't engage in magic and build triangles from artifacts. I suppose the method of application is somehow simple, obvious... Stalkers use homemade belts for carrying artifacts, though they don't even understand what this might lead to. Try hanging them on a belt. Only I don't advise mindlessly experimenting with such dangerous things. If you do decide, then only at the indicated point, or God knows where you might end up.
Yes, dangerous, of course. But need to check. "Emerald" artifacts, then... three pieces. Hmm, this means I need a belt for three artifacts... We'll search.
Professor, I found a document in the Swamps, only it's hard to understand. Take a look?
Let's see, let's see. Hmm... amusing. I'll study these materials a bit. Come back in some time, alright? A few hours, I hope, will be enough for me.
As you say.
I'm about the notes from the Swamps.
Come back a bit later.

I familiarized myself with the records. A collection of graphomaniacal scribbles - that's how I'd evaluate what I read, but to be fair, there are several places worthy of attention. For example, some reasoning about the nature of the Zone and the part where it talks about so-called "Pendulums". Are you sure you really want to cram your head with scientific theories?
Well, alright.
Would be curious to listen. We already talked about "Pendulums", remember? Only, if possible, without your scientific complexities. Simpler, for "dummies", as they say.

To tell the truth, overall I don't share the views expressed in the essays you brought. Though something definitely deserves attention and coincides with my conclusions. There are quite a few fantasies in the records, but to put it simply, there's a supposition that in some places of the Zone under certain conditions, for certain actions, you can get a specific response. That is, by doing something, get a reaction back. Everything is built around theorizing that through experience one can establish such a combination of factors, the reaction to which could be partial disappearance of Zone manifestations, or even the entire Zone altogether. The probability of such an event seems vanishingly small to me personally, though I agree that an insignificant reaction is possible, at least in the form of an energy impulse...
This is called simpler? I seem to have grasped the essence, but what do "Pendulums" have to do with it? They give the possibility to get a response, yes?

If I knew the exact answer, I'd surely already have received an invitation to the annual reception from the London Royal Society... I already told you that all this is extremely speculative and doesn't even qualify as theory. Hypothesis - at most. But we can reason a bit in this direction, since there is some grain of truth here. Take you, for instance. You supposedly have partial memory loss, right? Something like retrograde amnesia. Suppose you really want to remember something. And suppose you find yourself in such a place where your... uh... mental impulse, message, your intention to remember, can be somehow structured and transmitted to some addressee in the form of an abstract info-packet. Transmitted to whom? Well, at least to that same Monolith. We already talked about this: noosphere and Monolith as a connection point to it... So, if following the law of energy conservation, one can expect that by sending a certain energy charge with an info-packet query, you can get back an identical charge in characteristics, but already with different content - an answer, response.
It's that simple? Mentally asked a question and got an answer, that's all?

What are you saying, young man, of course not! Here it's very important to correctly select... let's call it a query key or password, if such analogy is more understandable to you. Consequences from incorrectly formulated query, as well as wrongly selected key, can be completely unpredictable. Perhaps something has long been answering us with mutant waves, uncontrolled psi-field, emissions, spatial anomalies and God knows what else, precisely because we literally can't find a common language with this entity.

And how do we find it, do you have ideas? And I also didn't quite understand about Zone disappearance or its manifestations due to response. How is such a thing even possible? You yourself mentioned the law of energy conservation...

I'll answer the second question first, with your permission. I didn't say for nothing that the probability of such outcome seems to me if not zero, then close to it. The author of notes provides some curious data about peculiarities of "Pendulums", particularly about periodicity of properties they manifest, about phases. Considering continuous growth of information entropy of the Zone as a dynamic system, and accepting on faith that Monolith actually serves as a "terminal" for communication with it by the same principle as with noosphere, "Pendulum", due to its properties, can act as the strongest resonator. Purely hypothetically, this way one can "shake" and unbalance all Zone systems to such degree that they, transitioning to non-equilibrium state, will partially cease to influence our familiar world, or even completely lose integrity. And everything would be fine, if not for one very significant "but". Even quite approximate approximation shows that the level of energy costs necessary for successful realization of such plan exceeds by several times all combined capacities available on the continent.
Holy shit! Seems this method is indeed from the realm of fantasy. What about my first question?

Here everything is both simpler and more complex at the same time. Data available to us about "Pendulums", as well as confirming information gleaned from notes you brought, allow us to assume with high probability that the ideal key in your situation could be the anomalous field that created this artifact - "Labyrinth". Have you encountered such phenomena before? We classify them as fourth-order wandering anomalies...
Stop, stop! Are you saying I'll have to climb into an anomaly or what?

Uh... that's exactly the complex part of such a plan. Not just into the anomaly, but into its epicenter. Right there, as calculations show, the chance of getting the response you need is highest. However, there's nothing impossible in this. The zones of space nonlinearity that fill most of the "Labyrinth" have gaps. With certain skill, good protective equipment and a bit of luck, getting to the anomaly's center won't be such a difficult task. And there, having a "Pendulum" with you, it will be enough to concentrate well and carefully formulate your mental "query", that is, the desire to remember some time period from your life.
Sounds like pure magic. And what else can be "requested" this way? Maybe it'll be possible to make a wish to the Monolith, so to speak, remotely? Would be amusing...

Jokes aside, but I suppose this is far from the only way available to us for interaction using "Pendulums", both with information environments in general and the Zone entity in particular. Oh, I see huge potential in these artifacts! Of course, provided that all these hypotheses are at least partially confirmed.
Professor, I was just thinking... could there be such a response that... how to say... wouldn't add knowledge, but on the contrary - take it away?
Hmm... why not? Even slight electromagnetic influence on certain brain areas can lead to "erasing" information stored there. Do you suppose something similar happened to you?

After your stories, I'd start supposing even stranger things. And in general... I don't know. How would I have known before everything you just told me? Or... someone else knew and decided to conduct a live experiment on me?! Damn, you can think up anything! Either way, if nothing else helps me restore my memory, I might quite possibly risk trying this method with the "Pendulum". If only I could get the artifact itself?! You don't happen to know, maybe there exists a recipe for brewing... uh... transformation - that's the correct scientific term? - of this type?
Let's do without your stalker kitchen terminology. In any case, I can't help you here. We don't have such information.

Let's do without your stalker kitchen terminology. Ask Colonel Petrenko at the Bar. We cooperate quite closely with him and he was just recently interested in this topic too. As for the artifact, though it's against my rules, I can offer for these purposes the specimen you delivered to us along with documents from Dark Valley. But not before we finish our planned research with it.
Thanks for that. An informative conversation. Goodbye.
Professor, I found out how to penetrate X-16.
Really? And how?

Your professor, Petrov, says you can use three emerald artifacts and they can somehow teleport a person several meters down. And even marked a point - where, which Vasilev himself supposedly indicated to him.
Well, well... Interesting... And you're planning to test this?
I am, but it's kind of scary. What if there's no laboratory there, where would I fall then? And how would I get out?

Reasonable concerns. Where exactly did you say this place is? Aha... well, with high probability we can say there should be more levels below this point... There is risk, of course. But anyway, it's up to you to decide, but I'm curious myself to see how you'll get down there...
I might get there. But how do I get out?

If there really are underground facilities, they must have an exit and even more than one. Possibly even not in the Yantar area... After all, if Professor Vasilev entered the same way you're planning to, he somehow got out.
Well yeah... got out he did, but where is he now? Risky, of course...
Professor, I have some more interesting notes here, from Ivan Sergeyevich. Take a look...

Let's take a look... So. Ah, well I'm already familiar with this hypothesis. We discussed this once with... wait, with whom? Well yes, with Dr. Petrov. He somehow latched onto it, even got funding for an experiment. Rather dubious idea...
What's the essence? Something about teleports there. I understood little, though I know some stalkers somehow manage to use them...
One locksmith at our institute also somehow managed to use an incredibly expensive newest microscope for lack of a hammer at hand...
Yeah, as they manage... So what's the theory, something interesting?

Don't bother with it, young man. Well if you want... Uh, how to explain... The essence is that when something enters our world from outside, the space-time continuum might somehow get stirred up. Like a pebble thrown into calm water creates a splash and subsequent waves. Most likely it will be a microsplash, but the probability of stable oscillations and even subsequent resonance isn't excluded.
Too complicated for me...

You asked for it yourself. To put it briefly, these reflections lead to an unpleasant conclusion: won't these microdeviations in time and space eventually become so large that they'll influence cause-and-effect relationships in our world so much that... it's even hard to imagine what will happen to our world. According to these assumptions, the probability of such outcome turns out to be quite large... Personally, I didn't like the groundless fear-mongering and prediction of some apocalypse in this hypothesis. It looks more like some mysticism rather than a scientific hypothesis. So sleep peacefully.
I saw one of yours there, in the tunnels under the laboratory.
Ours? Who? Is there still someone left there? Alive?
Yes, still alive... Matveev is his surname.
Vladimir? Did you come out with him? Where is he? How is he? We thought he died together with Vasilev. Why are you silent?
He's not quite himself and also wounded, possibly shell-shocked. I couldn't get him out alone. You understand, not in that place.

Too much extraordinary stuff is happening here... The Zone... The more we try to understand what it is, the more we get tangled up. It seems - there's already a thread to understanding, but it leads into such wilds that human logic can't accept... \nCan I ask you for another favor? Would you agree to return there, to Vladimir, and mark his location with a special beacon? We're expecting a group of people prepared for such situations any moment, and they'll be able to get him out of there.\nWell, and we'll find something to thank you with.
Hmm, no. I think your people won't get lost. The entrance is there, behind the lake.
Well, expecting humanity from a stalker. Yeah. You've already done a lot, you can go...
Well. I'll try. In principle, it's not that far...
Huge thanks to you! Take this beacon device. Using it is extremely simple, press the button and that's it... Thanks again.
I'm about the rifle of that guy over there.

Ha! He got to you too... Whines and whines like a woman. "My little rifle, inherited." Isn't he like a woman? Everything's fair, put it at stake, lost it. I offered him a rematch, but this wo-o-onder managed to drink away everything he had. And I sold the little rifle to a decent man.
To whom? Maybe I'll make a deal with him. Feel sorry for this weirdo.

Feeling sorry? Look, in the Zone you can't pity anyone! Today you'll pity someone, and tomorrow you'll regret that you pitied. I'm telling you straight! So think hard before signing up for all kinds of fools. And I sold the rifle for a couple artifacts to a hunter, Nazar's his name. He does business somewhere in the Gut.

Feeling sorry? Look, in the Zone you can't pity anyone! Today you'll pity someone, and tomorrow you'll regret that you pitied... I'm telling you straight! So think hard before signing up for all kinds of fools... And I sold the rifle for a couple artifacts to a hunter.
Nazar, I know him.
And who was it?
Well you asked... What was his name... Ah! I remember!

Hey there... O-o-oh!.. Listen, what's that stench coming from you... You should at least look under your feet sometimes... Where did you manage to get so much shit stuck on yourself? What if pseudodogs catch the scent? They're partial to flesh, and you stink of it from a kilometer away. Alright, what did you want?
Come on, so I stepped in it, happens to everyone... When you grab your feet and run - you don't notice what shit's under your feet...\nDid you buy a little rifle from Baldy?
Hmm, well there was such a thing. Gave him a "Flash" and "Meat Chunk" for it. Everything fair and square, but why the sudden interest? Our fragrant one. Heh-heh...
Well, cool it. Or a careless word will fly out - a hard one will fly back... And I have my own interest in that rifle.

Don't puff up - you'll burst. You need to appreciate a joke, otherwise you won't want to live. And about the rifle - between us, it's nothing special, that's why I don't use it. Gave away artifacts for nothing, got tempted because it seemed to be from a good brand. If you need it, return what I lost - and it's yours.
Do you specifically need "Flash" and "Meat Chunk"?
No. Why would I. Any two artifacts of this level will do for me. Or one of a higher level. Got such with you?
Don't have any on me.
Well when you do, then we'll talk. And clean off those shit-stompers. You'll feel calmer yourself...
How's life, friend Marked One? Still searching for your path?
Something like that...
Still interested in the rifle? Brought artifacts?
Not yet. Haven't gotten to my stashes...
Here, a couple good artifacts... Take them.
I have a very good artifact here. I'm giving it.

Hmm. Alright. Will do. I hid that little rifle in a stash. In the railway bridge watchman's house. Well, the one at the turn from the main road to the dirt road that leads to our sawmill. Behind the little sofa there's a chest that's still quite sturdy, shoved that junk in there...

Hmm. Alright. Will do. I hid that little rifle in a stash. Heard about the regional committee dacha? Well not far from here - east of our sawmill. I was hiding in the attic there, waiting for the zombies to calm down. That's where I put this thing in a little box...

Hmm. Alright. Will do. I hid that little rifle in a stash. Not far from the tunnel that leads to Cordon, on the road in a bus I was hiding from boars. That's where I wrapped this piece of crap in an old backpack...

Hmm. Alright. Will do. I hid that little rifle in a stash. During a thunderstorm I spent the night in the tunnel that's behind the gas station. You know about the gas station, right? Well there. I wrapped this relic in an old jacket and shoved it under a rock. Probably still lying there...
I'll try to find it. Hope I won't have to come back - to beat your face in...
Hello. How's it going?
There's interest in you. They say you fly around the Zone instead of walking. You're everywhere, get everything done... How do you manage it?
They say a lot of things... They say your face is like that because you're too curious, ask too many questions...
Easy there! Or some birds will get their beaks bent... I'm talking to you stalker-style, like a normal man... Maybe I want to be everywhere too. So what's your secret?
Secrets cost money...
How much?

Oh! Perked up right away. Now I'll write down for you right here on paper... Sparrow's hu-u-uge secret. Ha! That's it, bro, Sparrow's done, no longer flies, crawls like everyone else. He has no secrets left...
How's that?

How-how... I had this chemistry, some Chinese stuff. An acquaintance supplied it - also one of the "flyers". And recently he flew into an anomaly, and took the secret of where he got the chemistry with him. So that's it - I would've shown you my high flight, but you're too late.
Yeah. Too bad...
Here, look. I have some Chinese stuff. Seems to be medicine...
Chinese chemistry? I've come across some bottles with hieroglyph inscriptions. Maybe that's it? Where did I put them? I'll bring them, then we'll talk more.
Bro! You'll save me - I'll be grateful! I'm burning up!..
Opa! That's the one, darling! Give it here, quickly...
Wait, why are you reaching out your paws. Look how your little hands are shaking. Tell me first what you do with this.
Well... this... Just give it to me, I'll show you. You'll see everything yourself now... Come on, faster! I have no strength left to endure...
Whoa, guy! You're hooked on chemistry, I see. Here you go. Show me, but don't spill it, watch out.
Right now, right now... we take an energy drink, drink a little and add exactly... sixteen drops. Now salt it a bit, shake it up and! Ahhh, good...
Uh...

Wait! Let's be quiet for a bit, or you'll scare away the high... That's it... it's going through the system... So! For demonstrating the secret, I'm taking the rest of the bottle from you. Will last another week. And... give me everything you have.
Hold on! Dream on! Look how your eyes lit up... There's nothing else. But I'll come by if I find more. We'll make a deal.
Bring it! I'll take everything! Good price.
Later. Junkie...
Suffering? I'm about the Chinese bottles.
Not suffering... Dying. What do you have there?
Uh, nothing much. See ya...
Here, look. I have some Chinese stuff. Nobody knows what it is or what for...
Will you buy the mixture? What do you offer?
Well, I have a bunch of small stuff and some other things...
Alright, give me the cash, I'll stock up at the bar.
Grenades will come in handy, take your booze.
Nah, I'll keep it for myself for now, might be useful.
Deal, take the cash... If there's more - come by, we'll make a deal.
Deal, here are the little grenades... If there's more mixture - come by, we'll make a deal.
I found Sparrow after all. And learned his "secret".
Well?! Tell me - what's there, how is it?

Basically, there's no special secret. Sparrow mixes some chemistry with an energy drink, and that supposedly gives him strength. He runs around a bit, then needs to refuel again. He can't do without it anymore - he's a drug addict, in short. I doubt there'll be any benefit from this for stalkers. He'll burn out his body soon... already looks bad - pale as death, with circles under his eyes.
Bah, bah, bah... may you be empty! Don't mention the bony one in this house... And what kind of chemistry?
Some Chinese crap.
Do you have it with you? Well then give it here... let's try it.
Here, brought with me... a sample.
I had it, might have dropped it on the way. I won't be long, wait, I'll bring it.
It's a small bottle. Maybe you'll try it. Eh? Here's a snack too.

Listen, Mikhalych, I'm not going to try this. And don't stray from the topic. You asked me to find out the secret... Did I find out? I did. Did I tell you? I did. Now it's your turn to tell secrets. So what about the installation?

What's there to say... They found some device nearby, only it probably doesn't work. On the other side of the square you'll see a structure, and doors in the basement. The basement is quite big, somewhere deep inside there's a whole hall - that's where it stands. One smart fellow told me that it repairs brains - from that, what's it called, from magnesia... or this - from amnesia. There, damn it.
Why did you decide it restores memory then?
Hmm... and why did you decide the chemistry works? And that it's Chinese? Or do you understand Chinese? Maybe it's Japanese...
Listen, don't you have explosives?
What do you need it for? Decided to make a boom for the old man?
Basically, I was in that basement you told me about. The door's jammed there, won't open. I'm thinking, maybe blow it up?

What a fool you are! To blow up in the basement - that's making trouble for yourself. The ceiling will fall on your head? Or you'll be crushed by a wall. Or worse, it'll bury me here and they won't dig me out. You, don't mess with such business! There's a crawlway from the other side. Not from the basement - but near the bridge somewhere, near that forest... the enchanted one. Who told me this... Damn it, I don't remember... I've started forgetting things lately.
Won't a good artifact help you remember?

Oh?! What are you?! Think the old man is like that grabber from the market? I want to help you. Well, wait - it's on the tip of my tongue... Ah! I remembered!\nDo you know Sanka Shatun? Such a stalker, experienced. He used to do big business here. But at some point, something happened to him. Went to the Swamps, to the scientists. Said it's quieter there. Now he works as a guide there. Haven't seen him for about six months. But people said he's fine, alive, only became silent, unsociable.\nHe told me he climbed into that basement. Wanted to palm off some crap on me, supposedly something valuable, but I didn't take it. If you see him, ask. He definitely should know where and what's there. And forget about your boom, we'll be healthier.
Sanka Shatun... Maybe I've already met him.
Mikhalych advised to find a guide in the Swamps. His name is Sanka Shatun. He supposedly knows the code for the room in Limansk
I'm from Mikhalych, to talk with you.
From Limanych, you say? Well how's that old bastard doing? Still shaking down our stalker brothers? Give him my regards if you see him again.

He said you managed to crawl into the little basement. The one that's nearby, right across the road from Mikhalych's storage. This basement reminded me of something, but I can't quite grasp what exactly.
Reminded you? Hmm...
Can you tell me how to get in? There's a hint that there's a clever installation there that can restore memory.

Clever installation? Well, maybe... Only I'll tell you this - don't go there. I was there just a little bit, but it feels like my whole life flew by. The cold there is terrible and it reeks of death. There's something there that's better not to know or see. I've seen a lot in the Zone, but after that basement, it's like I was replaced. There's constantly someone's voice in my head - calling, calling, calling... At first I thought it was fatigue, but then I realized... It takes people's will away.
Maybe so, but I feel I need to go there, really need to.

Here, in solitude, I've thought a lot. Decided - enough, time to leave. I'm slowly collecting some loot. Want my own little house, a garden, I'll get a dog. I love dogs. As long as I remember myself, I've always fussed with dogs.\nAnd I'll tell you the codes, only you, if you don't mind, throw in a couple second-level artifacts or one third-level. Agreed?
So that's how it is? You need artifacts. I'll think about it myself. Maybe I'll pick the code.
Need to run to my stash for artifacts. Won't be long.
Think, if your brain works. Only you know yourself - today they ask you for help, and tomorrow...
And I'm not in a hurry.
Sanka Shatun, guide from the Swamps, for a couple second-level artifacts or one third-level, is ready to share the door code for the room in Limansk
I'm again about the codes, for the doors in Limansk...
We agreed: two second-level artifacts or one third-level. Did you bring them?
Yes, here's a pair of second-level, as promised.
Of course. Third level, one piece. Take it.
Yeah, forgot... somewhere.
I thought about it... I'll manage with that code lock myself somehow.

Then listen:\nWhen you enter Limansk, well, through the bridge from Red Forest, there, if you go left, there's a door. Behind it is a tunnel, goes uphill. At the end of the tunnel is an iron door. There:
As you wish...

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 59685 
For exit - 85621

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 86954 
For exit - 75698

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 12389 
For exit - 85412

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 53631 
For exit - 23895

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 78569 
For exit - 45612

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 87524 
For exit - 36521

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 42367 
For exit - 89512

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 75963 
For exit - 65213

Code for entering the basement in Limansk 
Entry from Red Forest side - 78524 
For exit - 16379
Oh! Marked One. What wind brings you? I heard you went north, toward the center...
Yeah, the path north turned out to be quite winding. And what are you doing here? What about Cordon, bandits, ATP?

Screw it all! What am I - a redhead? We're walking on a razor's edge as it is, and here's all kinds of riffraff with guns at the ready. They get high on all kinds of dope and charge. I told Wolf straight up, I'm fed up! Everyone else like normal people - grabbed loot and left for warm places. And here neither loot nor profit, just talk about great purpose: "protect newcomers", "defend Cordon", "cover Sidor's ass"...
Come on, don't get worked up. Here too - I haven't seen artifacts...

Hmm. Haven't seen, you say? Well... Well alright... Here's what I think, Wolf, he's an experienced stalker? Well why ask - even a blind man can see he's roamed the Zone more than once. And he should have loot not like some dying newbie, right?\nSo where's this loot? That's just it - nobody knows... But I'll find it. And I'll get out of here. Because I'm fed up to here... Got it?!
Alright, alright...
Yeah, I'm just venting. It's all built up. Got tired of everything. Don't pay attention...
Well? How's it in the Zone?
Ah. You again.
Greetings, Petruha. How are you doing?
What's wrong with me, good company, warm, some loot comes my way. Money rustles in my pocket, and my soul feels warm.
I can see your face is puffy and your eyes are cloudy. Got anything left for the hangover?
Have you seen your mug in a mirror lately? Some cover boy... I got a little sick.
Don't get worked up, I'm being friendly. They were looking for you.

Who? Wolf, I bet... Worried about his loot, I guess. I got loaded with Stas once to the point of unconsciousness and he let slip that Wolf's stash is somewhere here, at the Forgotten Hamlet! He said Wolf mentioned that whoever tries to find his loot will wash themselves in shit up to their ears.\nTrue, it's all been in vain so far. He dropped it here, I'm sure of it. Where though? Did he really bury it in shit. Nothing, nothing. I'll get better a bit and turn the whole hamlet upside down, but I'll find it. Just watch it, this is my loot.
Yours, yours. And why did you decide it's Wolf specifically? Maybe you... Sidorovich needs you.

Don't bullshit me, Marked One. Who am I to Sidorovich? Just a fetch-and-carry. He has a whole village of people like me. And you can tell Wolf that if it got hot, let him come here himself, if he still finds me.
Well, see ya. What couldn't you guys divide...
Found loot? No? Yeah, nothing, I'm just asking.
I see you have a "Clear Sky" suit?
Yeah. Not bad. Good protection, not too heavy. But why the sudden interest? I'm not planning to sell it, and it's not your size anyway.
I'm looking for Strelok, heard of him probably? And someone said that guys from the "Clear Sky" faction were also looking for him. So I thought: maybe you know something?

Well-l-l-l... I don't think I've heard about Strelok. I won this suit playing dice in the Bar from one stalker. And I've heard about "Clear Sky" of course. Supposedly they had a base in the Swamps, highly classified. Few could visit there. They had good supplies, they say - like these armor vests, not some homemade stuff, but factory assembly. Only where it was made and who paid for it - mystery shrouded in darkness.
In the Swamps? Where exactly?

I don't know. I've never been there. Ask around with people. There are plenty wandering around - "clear sky guys". Maybe someone will show you the way. And if they were looking for this Strelok of yours, I think something should remain at the base. Well - God help you...

I don't know. I've never been there. Ask around with people. There are plenty wandering around - "clear sky guys". Maybe someone will show you the way. And if they were looking for this Strelok of yours, I think something should remain at the base. Well - God help you...
Hello.
Hi. What do you do? I mean what science?
Science? I'm a biologist by specialty, but lately I've been doing more chemistry. Why do you ask, are you a scientist?
No... I'm just trying to start a conversation... Chemist, then... Has chemistry advanced far in drug production? Maybe they've already invented something for memory restoration too?
I don't understand what you're talking about... There are developments, only I'm afraid if we start a discussion now, we won't understand each other.
That's true... So what are these medicines called, you say? Probably foreign again, some Chinese ones, ours can't invent anything decent...
I didn't say anything to you about medicines... Why would I? And anyway, you should get out of here...
I was just asking. Thought you really were a chemist. Well, I'm going then...
It's you again, I won't discuss anything with you.
Don't really need to. Some chemist you are... and you don't know anything about medicines...
Hello...
What do you want, are you here on business?
Nothing really... I wanted to find out what science says about zombies? They say they're hard to kill because their bodies aren't made of flesh, well after they rise from graves...

Science has nothing to do with this. It's all fiction and fairy tales. And you stalkers spread this and believe in all kinds of nonsense... There are no zombies, in the sense of risen from the dead, but there are dummies created by the Zone, understand... dum-mies, that is imprints, poorly made copies.
Have you even seen one such dummy yourself? Scientist, for fuck's sake... you just scribble theories, but what about practice?
I don't even want to talk to you in that tone...
Fine then. Go scribble your dissertations...
It's you again, I won't discuss anything with you.
Don't really need to. Let a "dummy" shoot at you, then you'll understand what it is...
Greetings... Science doesn't stand still, does it?
What do you care about science?
Nothing really... I heard recently they invented such a device, like they put it on your head and a person remembers everything that happened to them in life, at any given moment. True?
Umm... There was something like that in "American Scientists". Are you talking about a specific article? Remind me...
What article... I'm just talking in general, about the device.
Ah... So you're just... How do they say in your circles - shooting the breeze?
Well yeah... Only can't talk with you guys, all too smart.
It's you again, I won't discuss anything with you.
Don't really need to.
What are you doing here? Studying what?
Studying, studying... You go your way, as you were going...
What, can't even ask anymore? Maybe I want to help. Do you need volunteers for experiments? For example, on memory restoration.
Memory? No, that's definitely not needed. But we can discuss testing a vaccine...
No... I'm not sick, I don't need a vaccine...
So what do you need? You're just in the way...
I don't need anything from you... Study your vaccine, I won't interfere.
It's you again, I won't discuss anything with you.
Fine then...
What are we studying this time?
What? Are we even acquainted?
I'm asking, what are you cooking up? Someone told me that you can get memory restoration medicines here.
Memory restoration? There's no such medicine, at least I don't have it... Someone played a joke on you.
Jokers... So there's really nothing?
That's what I'm telling you!.. You should step away, such a stench coming from you...
What? Ah... you mean the smell... Well yeah, we don't sit in offices. I'm leaving already.
It's you again?
Alright, alright... He doesn't like smells... intellectual...
What are you studying?
Mmm... What are we studying?.. How can I put it...
I'm asking, what are you studying?! Are you deaf or what... Someone told me that you can get memory restoration medicines here!
Why are you yelling? What memory? We don't have medicines at all, only first aid kits. And don't yell like that.
I thought you couldn't hear...
I can hear everything perfectly, you're just preventing me from thinking... Go your way, don't interfere.
I'm leaving already... thinker.
It's you again? Go away, don't interfere.
Alright, alright... I'm leaving...
Greetings to science... How are the successes?
Little by little... Are you on an errand?
What kind? Ah... no, I'm just here to chat. Maybe at least you'll tell me, is it true that a person who lost their memory can turn into a zombie eventually?

I can't say anything about memory loss, but the idea that someone can just become like a zombie because of amnesia - that's unlikely. A person can be not quite sane, but not to the extent your stalker community talks about zombies...
Not sane... How's that?
Well, doesn't understand where they are, who they are, doesn't recognize surroundings, isn't "here and now", to put it briefly.
Ah... and if I'm talking normally with you, that means I'm still sane for now? Then alright, you reassured me...
It's you again, I don't have time to talk with you.
Alright, alright... Keep working...
What are we doing? Inventing or what?
What? Who are you even addressing?
I was just passing by here... I see a person who looks like a scientist, so I thought I'd talk about science...
And what should we talk about? About so-called artifacts? You guys don't want to know about anything except them.
Oh, come on... not everyone's obsessed with artifacts. I, for example, respect science, I'm always interested in chatting with smart intellectual people.
Right... the word "chatting" shows that you're a true intellectual. So what's this "chat" about?
I approach him with my whole soul, and he's mocking me. Smart guy... I don't want to talk anymore either.
It's you again? There won't be any "chat".
I already figured out that you can't connect with for an intelligent conversation.
How's the progress in the direction of improvement?
What? Who are you addressing now?
Yeah... you scientists are always flying somewhere and don't understand simple human phrases anymore. I'm just saying, instead of a greeting...
Sorry, but what you said - those aren't "human phrases".
Damn it... Can't really talk with you guys, everyone thinks they're such... such... what's the word... Anyway, trick question: do you know how amnesia is treated?
No. And I'm afraid to disappoint you, hardly anyone knows. Is that all? Can I continue my work?
Should've said right away that you don't know... Instead of being an intellectual scientist... and "excuse me", and "I'm afraid to tell you", and the phrases aren't right for him... Go work then...
It's you again? I won't converse with you.
I don't want to either...
Well, how are things here?
What exactly? Who are you from?
I'm on my own.
And what do you want? Looking for something?
I'm looking, but not finding yet... I want to learn... the meaning of my life. I want to get to the truth.
Yes, that's a worthy goal of search. Only we don't have this "truth" here, the meaning of life, like "truth" itself, stalkers usually find at the bar.
Where? Ah... you're joking. You didn't understand anything, I don't need a drinking buddy... Alright, I see I'm in the way, leaving already.
You again? Still searching for truth?
It's funny to you... I'd like to see you...
Can I ask a little question?
Why not... Go ahead.
What do you think, can zombies be cured, their memory returned, brought to their senses? So they become human again...

I doubt it. You see, so-called zombies - they're not people. Many are confused by their "human" appearance. But zombies are just like... shells. Sort of walking bio-machines without a driver inside. Understand?
Machines? Who starts them up and where do they drive? To a gas station?

No... machines - not in the sense of mechanisms... I was speaking figuratively. How can I explain this simpler... A person - the person himself, his personality, individuality, his selfhood - he is not his body. Understand? He's in his body and controls it, though not even realizing it. Like a driver in a car - control is automatic. But you can accelerate the car and jump out of it, or something can suddenly push the driver out of the car, and it will still keep going by inertia, as if someone is still controlling it... I see you don't quite understand. Let me explain differently...
No... don't bother... All these complex theories make me nauseous. Something in my stomach... I'll drop by sometime later, we'll talk more.
You again? Want to talk about zombies?
Not now, maybe later...
May I trouble you?
Is it business? From Ivan Sergeyevich?

No... not from Sergeyich, but it's business. And here's the deal: if, let's say, someone lost their memory, how can it be restored? Who deals with this anyway? Maybe there are methods or even medicines?

So many questions and all "business"... Let's go in order. How to restore memory, I can't tell you. I think psychiatry deals with that. Methods... well, let's say, hypnosis is widely used, for example, the method of regression or "returning" to the past and, by the way, about medicines - some psychotropic drugs can be used to induce a hypnotic trance. Have I answered your questions?
Not entirely. In general it's clear, but what and how in practice? Do you know hypnosis yourself?

I haven't practiced hypnosis, but I have some understanding. For example, the patient is given a drug based on sodium salts... though you don't necessarily need to know that. Then an experienced psychotherapist, skilled in hypnosis techniques, can ask the patient to return to the past and tell what he sees, what he hears, that is, to relive that moment... and the patient speaks, tells as if he's in that past. Unfortunately, the patient himself, upon returning to the present, doesn't remember what he said or what he "saw" and "heard" while in a trance... But this helps the psychotherapist understand the causes of his mental disorder or psychological trauma.
Doesn't remember... Then what's the point of digging through someone else's memories if the "patient" won't remember anyway... No, that's not it...
It's you again? Want to discuss hypnosis techniques?
Forget them... just cluttering my head.
Greetings... What's new in science?
You're no longer interested in the old stuff?
Alright, don't needle me... Maybe you can answer: how much are dreams connected to a person's past?
Hmm... I don't quite understand. What kind of dreams, what person? Do you mean yourself?
Does it matter... I'm speaking generally - is there a connection or not?
I don't know... a very complex and very vague question.
Well yeah... complex question... If I could say something definite, maybe I'd understand something myself. Forget it.
It's you again? Unfortunately, I don't have time to discuss dreams.
I wasn't going to...
What are you doing here?
Working... Or are you interested in specifics?
What ethics? I thought you could answer a couple of questions for me...
Questions... couple... so, this doesn't add up... Uhh, excuse me, what?
Questions, I'm saying... just a couple. I'd like to know the answers.
Uh-huh... here like this... You know, come back later, I'm busy right now.
You're all always busy...
Who do you need? Come back a bit later, I'm busy right now.
Yeah I got it already...
What interesting stuff are you studying this time?
The influence of electromagnetic fields on Zone objects, so-called artifacts, which possess exceptionally anisotropic properties...
Do they really have fractional properties?
What? Fractional? Hmm... Indeed, why not use narrow discrete impulses, the spectrum would be much wider... You came at a good time.
Huh?
Yes, yes... and correlate this with the Fourier function...
What?.. I'm outta here...
It's you again? Want to discuss methods of affecting artifacts?
Not really feeling like it...
Can I distract you with a couple questions?
What kind exactly?
They say hypnosis helps remember the past. What do you say about that?
That's your question? Let's hear the second one right away.
How?

Well... As far as I know - and I'm no hypnosis expert - it helps sort of "return" to a moment in the past. About whether the hypnotized person will remember this 100%, I can't say for certain. I think there are methods where he not only remembers everything, but even fully realizes himself "there". But since I'm not an expert on this matter, as I already said, I can hardly answer the "how" question.
So it's still possible... That's good enough.
It's you again... I'd ask you not to disturb me now.
Alright... I'm leaving...
Greetings to science! I figured, why not say hello, especially since you surely know the answer.
And greetings to you! What answer? To what?

Is it true, they say, that a person can be outside their body and still be aware of everything? Someone told me recently that during death or during surgery, consciousness, or maybe the soul itself, can hang under the ceiling and observe what they're doing to his body, and then decide whether it's worth returning or not?

Yes, such cases of clinical death have been described many times. I'm, of course, quite skeptical about the idea that a person as "consciousness" (or as "soul") and his body are a symbiosis, not a unified whole... This is generally more of a theological question than an academic one... Why did you even bring this up?

One thought won't give me peace... They say zombies are a "body" without a "soul", well or without "mind", without memory, what's the difference... So maybe, like with clinical death - his consciousness is hanging somewhere above him and thinking: "should I return to the body or not". And the body wanders and knows no peace, because consciousness left it, but hasn't departed completely yet... And this means you can still cure zombies, if you return consciousness to the body...
What questions occupy you though... I didn't think such... lovers of philosophical conversations could be found among stalkers.
What's philosophy got to do with it... For some this is a vital question. If I see myself, that is my body, from the side, it means... Ah!.. Indeed, better not think about such things.
Ah, it's you? Want to philosophize?
Not now...
What are we doing?
Who did you say that to?
To you, I think... You, that is.
Why? You stalkers obviously have a lot of free time... Just barging in like that, tearing me away from thoughts, just to "chatter" about nothing.
Why about nothing? We talk about life, about what's important... for survival. You're the one floating around in the clouds somewhere.
Is that all? Or will we "chatter" some more?
Alright, no offense... It's not like you have a sign hanging on you - whether he's thinking or just sitting. I'm leaving.
It's you again, we won't "chatter".
I already figured that out...
How about discussing a couple thoughts?
What? What thoughts?
Well, I'm speaking figuratively... Crack open a bottle, that's all there is to it. And thoughts will appear right away, ones we can discuss...
Excuse me, crack open what?
There you go... Well, a couple drops on the chest, science. And intelligent conversation will flow. Eh?
Ah, that's what it is. No. And please, go crush your drops somewhere else.
I see... got an uncommunicative one... I'm leaving.
It's you again? I'm not planning to drink with you.
I don't have anything anyway...
What's new?
Hard to say... Sometimes new stuff is messier than old.
Oh! You can tell right away this is an intelligent person. So what, shall we take a small swig, for science?
I wouldn't mind, but... I can't today. We're running an experiment, need to be in shape.
What, is management strict? The Docent doesn't allow it, or whoever you have there...
No. That's not the issue. It's just, as they say, "work time - play time". Today happens to be time for work. So...
Yeah... "So don't bother me". Got it, I'm not stupid.
Is that you? Go away, don't bother me.
I'm leaving already...
Greetings to the scientific workers.
Do you have a package?
No... I'm just here casually. What kind of package - instruments, test tubes, flasks?
Doesn't matter. And don't be a smartass, we're not collecting mutant fecal samples here, by the way.
You don't understand jokes... Can you answer a simple question: how long can amnesia last in a person?
Maximum duration - for the rest of their life. Well, what else do you have?
Nothing... Talking to you is just one frustration.
It's you again? I won't discuss anything with you.
I won't either...
Hello... How's progress?
What do you mean? The latest experiment... Though, you're not...
Well yeah, yeah... I'm not one of yours. I thought you study radiation, what presses on the brain, so I asked...
I think you just have nothing to do. We don't study radiation, we have other tasks.
What kind, if it's not a secret?
That's exactly the secret. And I'll ask you to step away... please.
Don't trouble yourself, I'll step away. Be so kind as to write that down...
It's you again? I don't have time to shoot the breeze with you.
Shoot the breeze... Well fine...
Greetings...
Same to you.
What do you say about zombies? Can a person who lost their memory suddenly become one of them?

I don't think so. And in general, the concept of "zombie" only exists in the Zone. I'm not counting various Hollywood nonsense. After all, not a single person outside the Zone - with amnesia or without - became a zombie. And there are no cases of zombification at all, in the form we see it in the Zone. So... turning into a zombie out of nowhere is just your imagination.

Yeah... Sometimes you wake up, remember what happened recently, and think to yourself: did this happen to me, or is it just imagination, or was it a dream, or did someone tell me yesterday... And haven't I already turned into one... You pinch yourself - seems I still feel it. So you think like this every morning, you think, but what's the point...

Yes, in the Zone people often become withdrawn, introverted, turn inward... how to put it gently, they become inadequate in the end. But don't wind yourself up, be extroverted and accept the Zone's world as it is...
You scientists always talk with some theories... You should just say: "Forget it, man, don't sweat it!", and everything's immediately clear and understandable.
Is that you? Are you looking at the Zone more positively now?
I'm trying...
What are you doing here?
Studying the Zone, to put it briefly...
Yeah... The Zone... Is there any point in studying it? It seems to me you won't understand anything in the end.
There's always a point in studying, even if you're surrounded by complete mysteries and miracles.
Exactly "miracles". Today you're walking around, collecting loot, shooting zombies, and tomorrow at one beautiful moment in your head - bzzt - and you're already one of them... Nature's miracle.
You have very pessimistic thoughts.

It's easy for you, you dug in here and don't go anywhere, just scribbling articles. You try walking through the Zone and seeing these miracles with your own eyes, touching them with your hands, then we'll see...
You're back with your pessimistic thoughts?
Don't worry, my thoughts don't concern you...
So what? Got scared? Get lost, go shoot the breeze with the boss...
You'd get scared here...
You should scram, we're restin' here...
Cool it...
Don't sneak up behind me! I'll light up your melon - you'll spread out like horse shit... Beat it, go rinse the boss's brain.
I need your ass...
All kinds wander around here. And then, damn, food goes missin'... Get going peacefully!
Yeah I'm goin' already...
Share some loot, bro. Maybe folks'll warm up to you.
Fat chance already.
What're you snoopin' around here for? Wanna share some grub - then do it. My gut's rumblin' from hunger...
Your gut - you feed it.
Let's shake hands, bro! What's your name, haven't seen you around yet?
Marked One. We guardin' everything?
Shake hands, Marked One. Yeah we're guardin'. You never know what and how.
How about keepin' an eye on the goods? While I take care of business...
Well uh... That's possible actually. Just not for long. Not more than a week. You know yourself, the Zone... Can't trust it.
But you'll vouch for a week? And what do you want for it?

Generally, yeah. I'll watch for a week or my buddy will. So there's no unnecessary fuss, you'll give us fifty rounds for the Kalash or NATO peashooter for the stash, and same amount to pick it up. Seems we're not askin' too much, everything's fair, stalker-style... And... Don't put too much, I don't wanna risk my head for someone else's loot, you get it? You gonna stash your loot?
Fifty Kalash rounds, here you go... Just don't breathe in my ear...
NATO ones lying around here, take 'em... And turn away a bit...
Nah, not now. Maybe later...
You offend me! I don't give a damn what you're hidin' there... There, opened it, put your loot...
Hey there, bro! How's it goin'? You here on business or just flyin' by?
And no coughin' to you too... Thinkin' about leavin' some loot.

Well... As we agreed - fifty rounds for the Kalash or NATO and for a week you don't need to worry about someone stickin' their nose in someone else's business... If you don't stash too much, of course. People, you know yourself, are crafty...
Ah! It's you. I heard you stirred up the military? So who are you after that? What the hell did you show off for? Now the military won't give anyone peace... Scram! Beat it!
Uh...
You, give me back my stuff!
Take your trinkets, nobody could care less about them.
What kind of people...
Ah!.. Oh! Mother! ...
Why you moanin'? Should I give you a med kit?
Mmm! No... won't help anymore... they gave... did what they could. Thanks, didn't throw me over the fence... Who are you, friend? ...
Maybe a friend... I'm a stalker. What happened to you? I'd help you, but I'm no doctor...

If you're a stalker, then you're a friend... one of ours... I'd like to get to my people, to stalkers... I'm a burden here for everyone... Won't last long, I can feel it...\nBastard ... He'll get what's comin' to him there...
What can I do... The Zone, brother, will take everyone in the end.
Ah! Mother!
I see you're really getting worse. Hang in there, maybe you'll pull through...
What's with that wounded stalker lying in the barracks?

Ah... that one? A patrol found him at dawn not far from base. None of ours knows him. I don't understand how he managed to crawl here, the state he was in - just horrifying. He was holding on pure spite, seems like. We helped as we could, of course, but you can see he's not long for this world...
Did he fly into an anomaly or what?

Who knows? Maybe so, maybe not. We questioned him, but he doesn't speak very coherently. Everything's mixed up in the man's head - he's delirious while awake, seems like. From what we managed to make out, someone robbed him, some scum. Took everything from him and shoved him into an anomaly to cover tracks. Whether it's true or not - we'll hardly find out. In any case, he doesn't have long left, that's clear. And you can't just throw him out like a dog... We bring him food, but he doesn't eat at all, only asks for water. And even then, only when he's conscious.
That's what I thought, he mentioned some bastard... Probably really was delirious. And even if not - how would you find leads now?

Actually, you should try - you'd do a good deed. No harm in trying. I'd strangle such scumbags with my bare hands. Since that bastard took everything from the stalker, maybe he hasn't sold his PDA yet. And if so, then he can be found by signal, right? This all happened quite recently, there's a chance. In the Bar, I heard, one brainy guy makes his living with such services. And anyway, there's always lots of people there. Ask around, maybe someone will recognize the bastard by description. He's supposedly dark-haired, as I understood. With a mustache... or beard.\nWhat was his name... Ah! Vasyan. Yeah, Vasyan. Something like... Red, or what... No, not that. Pockmarked! That's it!
Who-who?!
Are you deaf or something? Why are you staring? Is he your acquaintance? I'd keep away from such acquaintances.

I don't know... It seems to me I've heard this name before, but I can't remember where and when. In the Bar, maybe... or not? And also... hard to explain, but I got the feeling this might be very important for me... Listen, you don't know if this Pockmarked guy was connected with Strelok?
Well, you're asking! And if he is connected, then I'd take out that Strelok along with this Pockmarked. Looks like one gang!
No... that's not the point. I'll really try to make inquiries in the Bar. The chance is small, of course, but it exists.
Go ahead, go ahead. Lots of scum hangs around there. They've gotten cozy under the wing of those dutiers...

At the Freedom base, in one of the barracks, lies a severely mutilated stalker. No one really knows what happened to him, they couldn't even find out his name. One thing is clear - he's definitely not long for this world and won't last much longer. From confused, half-delirious stories, the Freedomers learned the nickname of the stalker who is most likely involved in what happened - Vasya Pockmarked. I've already heard this name before, but can't remember where and under what circumstances. For some reason this seems important to me. I can't grasp the edge of the memory, but I have a feeling this person could help shed light on my past. It's worth trying to find him. It makes sense to start by asking people in the Bar.
Haven't you seen a stalker here?.. Dark-haired like that, about my height, probably. Seems to have a mustache... or beard.

You should attach a mugshot to this description and hang it on a board. What are you babbling about? What kind of dark-haired? You guys walk around here - one's dark-haired, another has an unwashed face and they're all unshaven... Why do you need him?
Doesn't matter to you? But you're right, can't find anyone with such a description...
What's his name at least?
Ah! Yeah... Vasyan. Pockmarked. Something like that.
But you said dark-haired... Pockmarked, cross-eyed... I don't remember such a guy, but that's already something. Drop by the Docent, maybe he can help.
Yeah that's obvious... but the Docent searches by PDA.
Well then ask people around like that, what am I - supposed to teach you? All the time you're looking for some lame, cross-eyed, pockmarked guys... I'm tired of it, frankly.
I need to track down a specific PDA again. Shall we do it?
Let's try it, why not? Get 5 PDAs of any kind and data on the person...
I don't have that many PDAs! Maybe we can make a different deal?
Here are the PDAs, the guy's called Pockmarked. Vasyan.
Well... Only kittens are born for free, you understand. Give me a couple simple artifacts, I'll run it through the database.

Vasyan Pockmarked... He's in the database. Or rather - two such pockmarked ones. But one is Vaso. Not him? No? Let's look at the marks that came from Vasyan's number... Voila! There is one. He showed up in the Red Forest recently. Though the signal's weak. Here, look. I'm sending the mark to your PDA. Remember the place right away, because these markers sometimes glitch and disappear by themselves.
Here you go, the guy's called Pockmarked. Vasyan...
Alright, I'll go to my stash and back.
Don't rush, or Yurko Lisaped got in a hurry - aged...
About my request, to find Vasyan Pockmarked...
Did you bring payment? 5 PDAs or a couple simple artifacts.
Here are the PDAs, so what do the instruments say?
Take the artifacts... So what's there?
Not yet, but I'll bring them soon.
Listen, I wanna ask somethin'...
What you want? You askin' where to put artifacts? We'll find somewhere real quick... Heh...
Heh... I lost somethin' the other day. PDA. The Docent at the bar put a marker on it, so it led here... You don't have it, by chance?
P-D-A... You're bein' real shady, boy... Lost it, you say. And trudged here lookin' for it... Ain't you afraid of losin' your head? I could put a marker on your forehead...

Don't get all worked up... Looks like someone snatched it from me. I don't even need it anymore, I got myself a new one. Just had some photos there - classy chicks, brunettes, blondes... Thought I'd transfer 'em. And I trudged here on my own business, decided to ask while I'm at it.

Babes? I'd take a look... I had about five different ones, collected 'em. But they're all broken already. Only one was working... But there were no chicks. I think. Yours or not yours, I don't know. I took it off a corpse myself. What the hell do I need them here without charging - sold it right away. So calm down - you're out of luck with the busty ones, go read magazines at the bar.
From what corpse?

Yeah there in the forest... In one tunnel. He's probably been eaten by monsters already. But don't you go there. We three barely got our legs out of there. I grabbed it on the run. I see the corpse is grinning and something's shining next to him, so I grabbed it. And ran for it, didn't even look at what it was. Only saw later. A controller set up house there... Lucky I still had my head. I won't go there again, not even for junk...
Why do you... Grab whatever you find? Alright then... Sold it - don't regret it. I'll have to look at Playboy...\nListen, better tell me, haven't you met a stalker - Vasyan Pockmarked?

Nah, don't know... You keep lookin' for someone, first you need to find one guy, then another, but you can't meet up somehow... You didn't work in investigations, by chance? Pockmarked, red-haired, lame, hunchbacked... There's plenty like that...
I was advised - to make my way north... Can you tell me?

To the North? The pole's pretty far, though...\nJoking, joking...\nThe north of the Zone... Everyone needs it. Only it's hard to get there for now. Heard about the Brain Scorcher? Terrible thing. There was a person - and bam! Only appearance remained. So, friendly advice - don't rush to become a vegetable.
I'm already a vegetable. But how do you get through?

Get through? Well... Seems like a path's been beaten, though by rumors, it's gotten tougher lately - you have to jump between anomalies, otherwise you won't even reach the Freedom base. You'll need a guide if you try to go further. Or a proper map, if you're not afraid to trust it. There, ask Tooth or catch Sanya Banker, he often goes there, to those anarchists. The dutiers are glad that such a maze formed between the Bar and the Freedomers - now the Freedomers won't make it here easily...
They say you know the path north?
Who says? People talk all kinds of nonsense! The north is closed! You should know yourself. The Brain Scorcher's there. Turns you into a zombie...
Not that far. Barman said you go there, to the base of those, the Freedomers.

Ah? Well yeah, I go. Sometimes. But you, friend. Sorry. I don't want to get involved in disputes between dutiers and Freedomers. I already have to look over my shoulder constantly. And if I start leading people around... No! Sorry, you're on your own, and I'm on my own. I'll trade artifacts, but find your own paths...
Can you show the road north?
North - you mean to the reactor itself? Or just figuratively? You should formulate things more correctly. Otherwise - "north"...
I said I'd show! What's with you! Alright. Got a decent artifact?
Well, they say there are people to the north of here. Some kind of army base, warehouses...

Ah? Decided to go to Lukash? Well fine, what do I care, it's your business. The path there's a bit crooked now though, anomalies poured in like... Anyway, lots.\nBut I can tell and show you how it is. For a small reward. In the form of a good artifact. A Dummy, or a couple third-level ones, if you have them.
Decided to go to Lukash? Come back in a week or two, maybe something will become clear about the cherished path. Heh-heh.
Yeah I have one, here's a Dummy.
I have two very good artifacts.
Hmm. I'll think about it...
Oh! Good. Look here, remember carefully or write it down...
Oh! I wish you good health. What brings you here? A stalker, I presume? One of those who try to profit from the gifts of the anomalous zone - from artifacts?
And good health to you too. And you must be those very ones because of whom the Zone appeared: scientist botanists.

Well, speaking purely practically, you'd be hard pressed to find botanists here... But I understand what you mean. Many around the world think this anomalous formation appeared as a result of activities by certain groups of scientists. I don't know the facts... But of course, anything's possible. Though unlikely.\nForgive me, what's your name? And... I didn't introduce myself - Shatunov is my surname, Konstantin Georgievich. Physicist.
Marked One is my name. Physicists won't help me... I need to restore my memory.
Well yes, well yes. Memory - that's for a psychiatrist. Probably. I'm quite far from that topic, forgive me.
That's fine. What are you doing here? Watching dogs? Aren't you scared?

Dogs? No, why such an assumption? Ah! You see that these mutants don't come close? Well, we have a certain device here that allows us to scare away these representatives of fauna.\nProfessor Grigorovich developed and tested a mechanism for affecting specific areas of the brain of mutated organisms. I have a vague idea of the theory, but in practice, as you can see, the beasts experience panic terror when approaching the emitters. So, answering your question: no, it's not scary. At least, the Zone's spawn aren't scary. But such a beast as "man"... That one, yes, inspires certain fears.
You again, Marked One? Apparently you stalkers have nine lives, like a cat. So much death around...
The grim reaper's passing me by for now... Probably has other plans for me...
Do you believe in fate? Well... The more secrets of nature we uncover, the more often we ask ourselves: who controls this?
What do you need, respected sir? We have no supplies.
Why so "affectionate"? And what kind of respected am I?! I'm a simple stalker, Marked One. Not even an authority of any kind.
I see. Here you only meet authorities, bosses, rembos.
Yeah. And you sit here... Aren't you scared? Look how the doggies are clicking their teeth.

We have nothing to fear from these brainless representatives of this anomalous zone region's fauna. The devices developed under Professor Grigorovich's guidance quite effectively repel mutants. It's just a pity that other beasts, called "humans", have to be repelled differently...
Ah, it's you, Marked One. What are we looking out for? There's not much to profit from here.
Marked One? I have very little time.
Is there anyone further north? From your brotherhood... or from the "human beasts".

I don't know who you classify as our brotherhood, but our expedition isn't designed for going somewhere further north. Everything becomes too dangerous and unpredictable there, the risk is colossal, and the expected return is negligible. I doubt anyone would invest funds in such a dubious enterprise.
How do you know? Have you been there?

To know something it's completely unnecessary to be there. We know much about the Sun, can predict its behavior with sufficient probability, understand the processes occurring in it, and we know it's dangerous and there's no life there. Yet no one has been there personally.\nI, for example, from many indirect data know exactly that from the eastern side of this town one could pass somewhere toward the Pripyat area. But I also know exactly that I won't go there and don't intend to engage in such stupidity. For what?
What about the Monolith, well, that they talk about? Make a wish - and it comes true. Many would go for that.

Yeah... What won't they come up with out of fear or ignorance.\nThe Monolith is just a hypothesis used to explain things strange for our universe. Presumably - it's some entity of incomprehensible nature. There's a theory that it's the result of a breakthrough or merger of our world with some other. Naturally, this entity is incomprehensible to anyone. How the Monolith appeared, when and from where, and whether it's there at all - is a mystery shrouded in darkness.\nThat's how it is. All at the level of speculation, fantasies and assumptions.
Why then does it appear in dreams, and some even hear it... And many identically. Did they all conspire and invent the Monolith for themselves?

Oh! You're a stalker. Right? You wear all kinds of things on your belt. Right? Do you even understand what this is, how it affects the organism, the psyche in the end? You only feel that some of these objects provides visible help for some reason. And you think: oh yes, this is good! Because when you noticeably feel better, it's immediately clear to you - good thing. But the fact that I started sleeping worse, wake up hungry and sick, my head is buzzing, some call appears, draws me somewhere to hell knows where for no clear reason... well that's all from vodka, probably. Had too much yesterday - that's your stalker explanation. Simple and understandable. And you don't even try to connect one with the other, to compare facts.\nYou should go about your stalker business...
So I'm going. I need to find out where the Brain Scorcher control is located. Any idea?
Brain Scorcher? You mean "Rainbow"? You're too late, Marked One, they already turned it off.

I know. But because of this people are now going crazy differently. Either incredible laziness comes over them, or depression - only no one even wants to move. Looks like this "Rainbow" didn't work just like that. And now, if it's not turned back on, all people will die out in the Zone...
