You're really acting like Cassandra. They'll die out, they won't die out, what's the difference? Only criminals make their living here. It'll be easier for us to expand our level of knowledge without looking back at another idiot with an assault rifle.
Only criminals? Well... And Ivar said you could do business with.

You know Ivar? Hmm. He's probably the only person with normal psyche among everyone here. Helped us at first. Maybe you're made of normal stuff too...\nYou talk to Sergei Fedotov. He knows more about "Rainbow". And he and Ivar discussed this topic, by the way. But he's now on the other side of town conducting an experiment.\nAnd this - don't be offended. There were a couple "tough" stalkers here recently. They swept all our supplies. Bandits - in a word.
I'm not offended. To the other side of town then? I'll go look for your Fedotov.\nAh! I want to ask something else about Ivar. Do you know him well?
Well so... I'm telling you, he helped us, we sometimes discussed various topics with him. Why?

So he's at the Bar now. Not quite himself. Seems when he was turning off this "Rainbow", something went wrong... And he now says he did it in vain, that it shouldn't have been turned off. What do you think, why?
So was he not quite himself or did he speak coherently after all? That depends on how to understand this.

Well when he's himself - coherently, when not himself - not coherently... I'm saying that he turned it off, but now thinks it wasn't worth doing. Says that wasn't the point. And he's eager to turn everything back on. I don't understand. You met, maybe you can explain what he meant?

How would I know? Ivar, it seems, was studying the problem of mass madness outside the Zone. For some reason he decided that the surge of mental disorders lately is related to the Zone, and that the answer to the question "why is this happening?" should be sought right here. And I have nothing more to say. This isn't my topic, forgive me.
Didn't he tell you anything about a certain Strelok? For example, that he could have turned on the Scorcher?
No. He didn't say anything like that in my presence. Do you think someone turned it on deliberately? Then he's a complete psycho... this... what did you call him, Strelok?

Strelok, Strelok... But something doesn't add up here. No, he wasn't a psycho by any means. Where would Strelok get all kinds of communication plans, schemes, blueprints of underground tunnels and such? And how would a psycho figure all this out?

By the way, "Rainbow" is a secret facility. It was before, and now it probably still remains. There's practically no information about it in open sources. Much less plans and blueprints. Maybe in special archives. Either your Strelok was bluffing, or Ivar misunderstood him - one or the other. You say yourself - he's not himself.

Himself, not himself... I understood him as I understood. Strelok gave him some papers. Could Ivar have turned it off without knowing how and where? After all, the facility's secret, you just said so yourself.

What are you pestering me for? Such a secret archive no one will open for at least 50 years. This is only possible if he showed up from... from the future, where everything's long been declassified. In any case, go talk to Fedotov, and I have nothing more to tell you.
Alright, alright... Indeed, why did I pester you?! Well, farewell.

Greetings, stalker... Interested in our "repellers"? Well-well, it's obvious... Every stalker would like to pocket one of these. All kinds of creatures scatter in terror, almost without fail. Only here's the thing - size and weight... Weighs almost a ton. And if you count the battery compartment too!
Good day. Want something? We don't really have anything... We're engaged in scientific research, not collecting curiosities... Well you understand, I think?

Hello. Apparently you have some interest here? Or just - wandered in by accident? The place is quite dangerous, but thanks to the "repellers" we feel almost safe here. Only for you stalkers they're useless, they weigh too much...

Greetings to you. Looking for something in this godforsaken place? If not for the hope of interesting discoveries, I'd never agree to come here... Monsters, anomalies, types with unstable psyche - brr... Horror!
Uh... Greetings. Sorry, I'm not in the mood for idle chatter...
Interested in artifacts? We don't have any. Sometimes you can see them appearing, but we don't risk going outside the repellers' range... And we don't need it.
C...come here...
Need a medkit? I'll help now, hang on.
Sorry, can't help with anything, I don't have any medicine.
What... what happened? Where is... everyone?
Hang in there, man. No time for me to mess with you, need to get the hell out. How'd you even end up here? Get up!
I can't... can't feel my legs and my head... Everything's buzzing... What about communications? Where's Colonel Yarygin? Sakharov's not responding... Why is it so dark?
Later, all later. Our brains are gonna get fried here. Come on already, pull yourself together! Can you even hear me? What's your name?
I can hear you, but I can't see... can't see anything... My surname's Prikhodko... Where am I? Are you from the second group?
What second group?! If we don't get out of here right now, we're toast. This is Radar!
Radar? That can't be! We were going to the complex at Yantar... Listen, my backpack should be somewhere around here... There are papers in the secret compartment... Take them to Sakharov...
Alright, I'll take a quick look around and... Sorry I can't do anything more for you, but time's running out... I need to keep moving.
Ah... Ugh...
Damn it!
Who are you, brother? Do you have the gift of understanding? Do you wish to accept the truth?
Brother? Hmm... I'm Marked One. A stalker. And you?
Marked One, I see. You may call my individuality Brother Swan the Binding.
Swan? You wouldn't happen to be related to Lebedev, the one who commanded the "Clear Sky" base?

That is my past essence. Now I am the Binding. It called me, and I came. Joining the unified mind cannot happen without consequences. But those like me - the Binding ones, can help humans step across the chasm of misunderstanding.
Yeah, chasm... I have no strength at all...

No strength? That's understandable. "It" gathers its power. Surrounds, suppresses. Transforms everything, turns it into a plant, into stone, into nothing... Soon it will empty all thinking beings, and there will only be gray haze.
I don't understand anything at all! Who is "it"? What haze? I'm just tired... Need to rest.

Yes. You don't understand... Only one who can touch the informational field of the universe with their mind can see what is happening. It's a pity that our bodily shells are extremely vulnerable, but our mind cannot free itself from the body. It comes from there, through the tear in the fabric of our universe. It absorbs thoughts, extinguishes desires, seizes will and drains strength. Even we, the enlightened, cannot withstand this pressure. And therefore ahead lies only complete informational grayness, meaningless noise. So it will be...
"Informational grayness" wasn't enough for me alone, so now everyone gets it? Why wasn't it there before? What happened?

It's hard for me to explain. There was radiation that prevented the destructive field from spreading... But this radiation disappeared. Not long ago. And now It has no obstacles. And It will erase everything, grind it up and send it into oblivion...
Radiation? That's the one from the "Brain Scorcher", right? Don't think anything else like that was turned off.
Perhaps we don't know the specific designation. That radiation destroyed connection, and now the information itself is being destroyed.
You say you touch the informational field... How's that? Do you pray? Like to some deity. I've seen some like that here.

Not everyone can touch immediately and merge into the flow. Nothing happens instantly. Their mind resists and grasps at familiar images. Therefore they must recognize themselves and It, each in their own way. If it's easier for someone through faith, they do it that way. But the outcome is one. Everyone will come to It and It will absorb everyone.

I don't understand. So is this good or bad for you? You say it will erase everything because the field was turned off, but you yourselves strive toward it, toward knowledge... well, or whatever... toward the informational field... I'm getting confused. It's hard here. Walking is hard, breathing is hard, and thoughts get jumbled...

There was a field. And It was focused with attention here, brothers strived toward It, received answers from It... Now there is no field, and It breaks out, directs its gaze to the rest of the world and forgets about its children. Brothers lose connection with It, they feel miserable without its attention... And It devours the world... You should feel this, for you too are marked with Its sign.
What? What sign?
It has already called you more than once. You should remember. I feel this, you have been here. But I don't sense Its seal on you now, don't see it... But there was a sign...
Seal... was... I don't remember.
Marked One, brother. Every moment loses meaning before what's coming. Calm your mind.
No. I don't need peace. I'm not giving up.
What then? What desire do you still have within you?
Can I also take something from this informational field? I want to remember who I was...
The informational essence of each individual cannot be lost forever... And this means - one must find the mental path to the area of your essence.
Mental... You mean imaginary or what? Can you explain for simple people? I'm not yet this, not "enlightened"...

Simplicity lies in understanding of the mind. Now, in this interval of eternity, the destruction of the information carrier, the matrix of creation, is taking place. Entropic energy consumes everything. Until there is protection from that other, formless, all-consuming and destructive...
Well, can you put it simply?

Be patient and listen. It remembers you, if you bore Its seal. The entire matrix of your essence is already within It. And you are here, almost next to It. But It ceases to see what is close, for It directs its gaze far away. There is no barrier now. It strives to expand its boundaries, and therefore must absorb the informational essences of others, farther and farther from here, so that the energy balance is maintained. And this will continue all the time, It will strive farther and farther outward and less and less attention will be given to what is near, but more to what is distant. But until It absorbs everything, our brothers are deprived of Its support, and they are unhappy about this. As are you.

That's simpler, right? How to digest all this now... \nSo I understand that until this installation, the "Brain Scorcher", is restarted, I won't be able to get a sensible answer? Its attention is too scattered? Or something like that... So It ignores you now too. Well, and I don't stand a chance...
You are on the path to true understanding... Do what you understood, and you will have what you want to receive...
Understanding of what?! \nFor you, probably, turning the "Brain Scorcher" on and off is simple, like two fingers on asphalt...

Oh... Hello there, man. Haven't seen new faces in a while. Two months already. Good thing the shift's coming soon, otherwise I'm sick of everything - this damn wildlife. I'm called Sergey. Fedotov's the surname. And what's your name?
Hello. I'm Marked One. Got business with you about this, what's it called, "Rainbow".
Rainbow? What rainbow? We're working with "repellers" here. Or is this some kind of drink? We have almost a dry law here...
No. Ivar told me - you know him, right? - that you know about the installation that fries brains. Well, and it's supposedly called "Rainbow".

Ah! That's the wave emitter... And I somehow didn't get it right away. Ivar wanted to turn off that installation. Said that way you could radically solve the problem with the zombified. And I heard that they managed to turn it off, but the zombified didn't decrease because of it, which is very strange.

Yes, strange. Anyway, because the "Scorcher" doesn't work now, from the center of the Zone, maybe from the ChNPP itself, comes some field that takes people's will away. Nobody will even lift a finger, even when monsters are eating them. That's how things are.
Are you sure?
Well, not exactly sure... But Ivar thinks we need to bring back the radiation. It was a mistake, supposedly.

Strange. I always thought that the emitter's effect was just someone's oversight or a malfunctioning unit that wasn't working in the right phase. Or maybe it was specially configured that way? But who and why?
What difference does it make now? I need to find out where and how to turn everything back on.

I roughly know where the control point for this installation is located. We, together with one of the former technicians who serviced it, were improving our health at our departmental resort. He, of course, didn't elaborate much. And I wasn't up to that. I was then after contamination... Well, that's not interesting.\nIvar also asked and compared this with some plans, schemes, and kept being surprised, like, exactly, it should be there. I still can't figure out where he got them from... You should talk to him.
It's hard to talk to him, he's not himself right now. So where is this control panel?

As my acquaintance said, "Rainbow" is a huge complex, including both above-ground and underground structures, and it was originally built for completely different tasks. After that big emission, they started converting it for something else, but then abandoned it. Everything is powered by its own reactors. I'm somewhat familiar with the operating principle of such systems. When shutting down the installation, automation should shut down the reactors, and restarting them can be quite problematic. It's easier to switch to backup power generation sources - yes, such facilities can have several. But how specifically to do this in your case - I can't advise, because I don't know.\nNow, regarding the place from where everything is controlled. The main entrance there, as I understood, is located in sector 73. Uh, well, let me show you on the map - here the road runs straight into the hillside. That's where the entrance is located. It's definitely not the only one, but where the others are, I have no idea. I also know that somewhere in the area called Dark Valley by stalkers, there was an underground base where technicians from "Rainbow" lived. Surely some systems were controlled from there too. That's basically it.
Alright, I got it. Need to find out about backup power, and the entrance to the control point is at Radar, then. And something else in the Valley. Need to check that too.
Marked One, what is it?
I don't even know if it's worth it... Tell me, do you remember anything from your life? I mean, you remember, of course, I meant to say, how accurately do you remember everything?
Uh... what are you getting at?

You see, I've been in the Zone recently, that is, maybe for a long time, but I've been conscious recently. I lost my memory. But from time to time something like that surfaces. I'll see something in the Zone, and bam - some connection with something, as if from the past. And pictures in my head - like a familiar place, and here's someone familiar... But everything's somehow dim. I'm not sure it was exactly like that... and whether it was really with me. Ah! Well, this is about me, you won't understand... Forget it.

Why not... I understand you. Actually, not every person can guaranteed recall the exact time and place of any event, even if reminded about it. A person is not a machine, he doesn't store everything in memory so that it's always "at hand" and you can take any data from the shelf at any moment. He doesn't go through episodes sequentially in memory, but rather remembers associatively, in connection with something. There's something that reminded - remembered. No - then it wasn't needed, and doesn't bother much. You may be here recently, but can you, for example, precisely recall what happened to you a week ago - exact place, time, circumstances and so on?
Well... I remember where I was, what I was doing. Approximately...

Exactly - approximately. And only a week has passed. And the farther, the more unclear the memories become. Usually people remember from the distant past only some very bright moments, and even then vaguely. There's only a feeling that yes - this happened to me. But the memories themselves are at the level of an unclear idea of what really was there.
At the level of an idea? Imagination, you mean? So this maybe didn't happen to me, but I made it up?

Well, I just put it that way... At the level of thoughts, sensations and impressions, without awareness of exact phrases, place, time. Approximately where, approximately when, approximately how. I think it's the same with you. Something suddenly reminds you of something, some connection arises, and something surfaces in the mind, resembling events in the present. Some bright association.
So you're saying that even you don't remember everything exactly?

Nobody can remember everything-everything exactly. Of course, it depends on the person. Someone remembers more, someone less. Well, consider that I remember about myself a bit more than you about yourself, that's all. Look at it more simply.
Marked One, wanted something else?
No, just decided to say hello.
It's me again...
Oh! What else now?
Do you know anything about teleporters in the Zone?
Teleporters? An interesting hypothesis and seems not without logic, though it doesn't really agree with academic science... But what's this to you?
I thought you were just observing a teleporter here. Thought there, in the center of the city it is...
No, we have other, more down-to-earth tasks here. We, of course, observe that anomaly too, but what made you decide it's a teleporter? Did you teleport here through it?

No... Just walked here. Someone told me about teleporters... including specifically about the local one. And I thought you were studying exactly that here. They say the Zone sometimes lets some people through to the center. If he fits somehow...
What-what? You think that the Zone can somehow make decisions, that it does something consciously?

Well... I don't know. But they sometimes say that it kind of "breathes", or as you'd put it - changes energy flows back and forth. Well, simply put it "breathes". Stalkers generally treat the Zone with respect, like something living... Again, all kinds of monsters, where do they come from, from what parallel world? Someone creates and launches them here. Through all their passages, wormholes... You can't help but think that it's alive and thinks something about us. And records everything somewhere in its memory... in this, what's it called - noosphere.

How you stalkers love to fantasize! Noosphere, parallel worlds, time loop - how it sounds! You make up tales and amuse yourselves with them. However, some of our scientific minds are no better, they also have plenty of fantasies... It's enough to simply say - SOMETHING happened. You can strain your throat trying to impose your vision of this something, but it doesn't make it more understandable and safe.
What about you? You're studying something here, trying to understand this something... Even though it's dangerous.

I'm saying - we have more trivial, practical goals. We're not theorists, and do we need to understand everything thoroughly? In nature, identical beings are stamped without anyone's intention based on genetic code. And the vast majority of people don't even strain to understand anything about it. They just live with it. Just live, stamp their own kind and that's it... But even without understanding something as a whole, some part of it can be learned to use practically, in everyday life.

That's what I'm talking about! You have your practical task, I have mine. I don't care, of course, whether the Zone breathes or not, whether it's alive or not... But if it's currently "exhaling", for example, and not letting people through to the center, then I'd practically like to understand how to make it "inhale". Maybe then it would be possible to pass, eh? Not necessarily here, maybe in some other place, but the Zone would still let you through to the center.

Yeah... Well, let's reason for interest's sake. I think to turn the force vector in another direction, you need to apply some force from outside. That is, you need some serious energy push. But I don't know what it could be. There was the "Rainbow" installation, probably it could provoke such a vector change... Does such a theory suit you?
Hmm... Well, yeah. No matter how you turn it, we need to turn on that "Rainbow".
Well-well... I wish you luck.
Same to you.
When I was unconscious here, did I say anything?
No, not really, mostly just groaned. And like that, incoherent something. I didn't particularly care. What's up? Remembered something?
How to put it... Something seems to be coming back. I'm even writing it down in my PDA just in case.
Really?! Let me read it.
Sidorovich, this is personal. None of your business.
Well then tell me, in general terms. I did nurse you back to health... like my own son.
Yeah... Next you'll say you raised me from diapers, nursed me with your breast. And then gave me a knife and sent me out into the world.
Stop remembering the bad stuff. Better tell me what good you remembered. I'm curious who you are, where you're from.
Who I am... I haven't properly realized myself, haven't digested what I remembered.
Ah... well digest-digest. Only you watch out, whoever digests inside themselves for too long, their brain might boil over. Better tell, share with people.
Alright then... I'll share. Sometime later...
Docent, can you help find someone?
Track someone?! Not my specialty. I'm more about the electronic side.
That's exactly the side I need. Is it true what they say, that you can find a person in the Zone through their PDA?

In principle, we track all unencoded beacons from personal PDAs, and I can put a mark of a specific handheld on your map.\nNot for free, of course... You've probably already heard that I mainly work with information. Quite often, stalkers' personal PDAs contain unique data that looks like complete gibberish to a non-specialist.\nBring me 10 any PDAs and I'll give you access to tracking devices you're interested in directly from my laptop... for a reasonable fee. And I'll throw in something extra as a bonus.
Good. I happen to have ten PDAs with me, here you go.
I see. We'll return to this topic later.

Excellent! See the laptop on the table? Now it's at your disposal anytime, you just need to connect your PDA.
When the target is found, a certain amount of rubles will be charged from your device.
Keep in mind that real-time movement tracking won't work, at most - you'll find out where the target last went online, and from there it's up to circumstances... use your head.

Most importantly: when you type a search query - look, I recently spilled coffee on the keyboard, so I had to temporarily reassign some keys in the driver. Instead of "ё" type "/", and instead of BACKSPACE, to delete excess or wrong symbols - DEL. For those who aren't friends with technology at all, symbol deletion is duplicated with the "left arrow" key, and you can restart the search program by pressing "right arrow". If anything, I've attached a memo at the bottom of the laptop screen.
Everything seems clear. What about the bonus?

Just a moment... now... where did I put it?! Ah, here! Stalker belt, for two slots. Some guy ordered it from me, but hasn't shown up since, it's been the second month already. And his PDA hasn't been seen on the network for a long time. Everything points to - the customer perished. Anyway, it's yours.
Well... thanks.
Docent, I'm about finding people.
Brought 10 PDAs?
Yes, here...
No, but I'll bring them soon. Wait.

Excellent! See the laptop on the table? Now it's at your disposal anytime, you just need to connect your PDA.
When the target is found, a certain amount of rubles will be charged from your device.
Keep in mind that real-time movement tracking won't work, at most - you'll find out where the target last went online, and from there it's up to circumstances... use your head.

Most importantly: when you type a search query - look, I recently spilled coffee on the keyboard, so I had to temporarily reassign some keys in the driver. Instead of "ё" type "/", and instead of BACKSPACE, to delete excess or wrong symbols - DEL. For those who aren't friends with technology at all, symbol deletion is duplicated with the "left arrow" key, and you can restart the search program by pressing "right arrow". If anything, I've attached a memo at the bottom of the laptop screen.
Everything seems clear. I remember you promised some kind of bonus...
I'm looking for someone here. Won't you help?

Marked One, are you having memory lapses again? There's the laptop: take it and use it. Reminder: when the target is found, a certain amount of rubles will be charged from your device.
Keep in mind that real-time movement tracking won't work, at most - you'll find out where the target last went online, and from there it's up to circumstances... use your head.

Most importantly: when you type a search query - look, I recently spilled coffee on the keyboard, so I had to temporarily reassign some keys in the driver. Instead of "ё" type "/", and instead of BACKSPACE, to delete excess or wrong symbols - DEL. For those who aren't friends with technology at all, symbol deletion is duplicated with the "left arrow" key, and you can restart the search program by pressing "right arrow".

Marked One, are you having memory lapses again? There's the laptop: take it and use it. You really helped me out then with money, so I put your PDA number on the VIP list, no fee will be charged from you.
Keep in mind that real-time movement tracking won't work, at most - you'll find out where the target last went online, and from there it's up to circumstances... use your head.

Most importantly: when you type a search query - look, I recently spilled coffee on the keyboard, so I had to temporarily reassign some keys in the driver. Instead of "ё" type "/", and instead of BACKSPACE, to delete excess or wrong symbols - DEL. For those who aren't friends with technology at all, symbol deletion is duplicated with the "left arrow" key, and you can restart the search program by pressing "right arrow".
Really, what's wrong with me?!
What do you want to know, Doctor?
So what did you understand about yourself? Did you remember everything?
Can anyone remember everything? Nobody can remember every moment in life... Yes, I remembered some things, but that's not the main thing, the main thing is I understood who I am.
Tell me.

Why do you need this? This is my life, I needed to understand this, not you... You wanted me to understand myself, I understood... But anyway, if you want to know, I'll tell you...
In childhood we lived in a small town in the middle belt. Well, childhood is childhood, almost like everyone's - a carefree time. I remember some episodes. I remember how a dog bit me, I remember how I almost drowned, though that probably just seemed that way to me from fear - how could you drown in that puddle. True, I remembered the offense, that I was drowning and nobody paid attention to me...
With my parents I had normal relations, only they were constantly busy with work. Father - a big boss, all the time in some meetings, mother - in shifts at the factory. We also had grandmother lying at home, seemingly paralyzed. I constantly had to take care of her. Consider that all my childhood passed in caring for granny...
At school everything was also like everyone's - ordinary. Like all teenagers, I wanted to stand out in something and was proud later when they noticed me. I studied normally it seems, as far as I can remember. At least chemistry, anatomy, biology I liked, mathematics and other exact sciences not so much... In short, what's there to tell...
Continue, I'm interested.

Well then I decided to study to be a doctor. The choice was quite understandable - I didn't suppose anything else by that time. Institute, studies, internship... I liked it. From my very first working day I stood out, I remember I immediately saved some woman. And then there were various such "heroic" acts, when nobody could but I could... Somehow during one operation I had to substitute for the chief surgeon. Everything went successfully, they even noted me. Funny, found something to be proud of - my direct duties...\nI wasn't in the army, but I worked for some time in a hospital at a military town - all sorts of things happened there too, there was routine and memorable cases, for example when I miraculously survived an accident while saving some soldier. Later I returned to my city and got a job at the hospital there... I was in good standing, someone even said: "golden hands". Maybe they were right about something... I remember once I helped a neighbor, not quite legally got her expensive medicine - there's your "golden hands" for you... I got off normally then, but acquired the fame of a "wonderful doctor" in the city... Later I got married there, like everyone. And then... this tragedy with my son...
What happened to him?

We wanted a child, but it didn't work out. And finally he was born, but with a birth defect. But somehow I managed to pull him through. How could I not - I'm doctor "golden hands"!.. He lasted much longer than the term marked by doctors. There was hope, but... I would have given everything then to find some magical artifact that resurrects the dead, if it existed... Then I thought about the Zone. I knew something, rumors reached me, but I didn't pay attention to all this. Where's the Zone and where am I? What connection could there be? But then I felt this connection, the Zone called me to itself... I had some ridiculous confidence that I was above death, that I was stronger than it, and there was a desire to show that I could save my son... or rather, that I could bring him back, could cheat death. That's how I came to the Zone, exactly for this... How stupid.
Don't blame yourself, the main thing is you finally remembered who you are...
You think what I just told you is the main thing? You think this has some meaning for me now? This is all not the main thing.
I don't understand... This is what you were striving for...

You wouldn't understand. I wasn't striving to remember, I was striving to realize myself. Now I understand this clearly. All these personal details - where I was born, where I studied, where I got married - unimportant. What's important is that I finally realized who I really am, what I'm like...\nAnd the conclusion isn't joyful: my whole life I was driven by some stupid vanity, which eventually grew into real pride. I imagined myself equal to God, imagined that I could defeat death, that everything was under my power... My wife didn't understand me then, and nobody understood when I left for the Zone. They thought I was a stubborn idiot, made up a fairy tale for myself and believed it, they probably thought I lost my mind after my son's death... They didn't understand, I didn't understand myself then either. But finally I understood everything. I wasn't driven by stubbornness, but by excessive PRIDE, as in everything in life...

You're greatly exaggerating because you're too demanding of yourself. From your story I see that you helped people, saved them, tried to avert trouble from them with all your strength. What's bad about that? You had positive qualities - compassion, desire to help, but for some reason you made such a strange conclusion.

What difference does it make why this conclusion? Maybe I'm too self-critical, maybe I'm too suspicious and made this up for myself, maybe Monolith suggested this to me, maybe I dreamed this... You still understood nothing. I could have pretended, deceived myself, told myself that it's not me, that I'm not like that, it's not mine. But why? For me CERTAINTY about myself is important. Before I was constantly uncertain, didn't understand what from "memories" was mine and what wasn't, wasn't sure what I was like, what drove me... Now I know. And it doesn't matter why this feeling appeared, and whether it corresponds to what YOU see in me. The main thing - I'm now certain who I am and what I'm like. I finally understood MYSELF.
Well, so be it, if such understanding is important to you...\nAnd what now? Where are you going? Rest here, you're completely exhausted...
I don't know. I no longer want to return to the past, and I have nowhere to go. My place is here, in the Zone. So... I'll rest and head to Cordon, and we'll see from there...

I don't even know... What I'm certain about is that I can't return to ordinary human life anymore, and there's simply nowhere to go. My place is here, in the Zone. There's one idea about going to Monolith. I want to work through all options to the end, since I've started. So I'll head to Bar first, need to talk with someone there.

I don't even know... What I'm certain about is that I can't return to ordinary human life anymore, and there's simply nowhere to go. My place is here, in the Zone. Moreover, something tells me - Monolith won't let me go so easily. It's not for nothing that I have its "seal" on my hand, which the weirdos from Pripyat recognize. And it seems to me this mark is just the external manifestation of its connection with me. So I want to test one idea. Therefore I'll head to Yantar first, need to talk with someone there.
Good.\nWait! You still haven't said your real name. What should I call you now?
Call me - Marked One.
What do you want to know, Doctor?
So what did you understand about yourself? Did you remember everything?
Can anyone remember everything? Nobody can remember every moment in life... Yes, I remembered some things, but that's not the main thing, the main thing is I understood who I am.
Tell me.

Why do you need this? This is my life, I needed to understand this, not you... You wanted me to understand myself, I understood... But anyway, if you want to know, I'll tell you...\nIn childhood I stuttered a bit or spoke poorly, something like that. Until about 6, probably. They teased me because of my tongue-tied speech... Some offenses come to mind, now it's all not so important, but then it mattered. Then I started speaking normally, but for some time I was afraid that I wouldn't be able to express something in words, and more often stayed quiet. I remember in school one girl I liked, but I was afraid to talk to her... Nonsense, in general, then she was dating another guy anyway. But this unwillingness to talk much made me read a lot, write, think, which later affected my life...\nMy parents loved me. Father was a leading specialist at a closed enterprise. Mother worked as a teacher. So they were even glad that I read a lot and didn't hang around the streets much. I was in libraries more often than in the yard with the kids... In short, what's there to tell...
Continue, I'm interested.

Of course, I already wanted to become a scientist in school. And not just a scientist, but an outstanding one... Childhood dreams. I entered university and though with great difficulty, I got into a serious faculty where you could engage in science from the first courses, well or be involved in it... Now I think that probably I alone was a bookworm and workaholic, constantly in libraries and laboratories. Others took life more simply. So be it. The only thing I regret is that many things characteristic of youth somehow imperceptibly passed by me while I pored over textbooks. Others, of course, didn't miss their chance... Well, that's not the point...\nAs it was, I still managed to get married. I can't say it was for love - it had to be done, it was proper. Only it didn't work out for us. I never had time to deal with family life, science interested me more than my wife. And one day I caught her with another... with some nobody. I left myself, was even glad about it - now nothing bound me or distracted me from science...
What did you do?

The field? First pure chemistry, then biochemistry became interesting. For a time I worked for the military industry. I didn't care then what would come out in the end - a harmless pesticide or poisonous substances, I was engaged in pure science. I wanted to make it, wanted to take a position in the scientific world, achieve something worthwhile. However you look around - everywhere grabbers and mediocrities, hiding behind scientific titles!.. Well, alright. Then I worked at one decent polymer production company, did a little side work at a scientific journal as a consultant...\nThere were cushy spots and quiet ones, all kinds. But I left everywhere. There was no scientific perspective there. Of course, those who chase money or handouts, not results, are like cheese in butter there. But not me. I remember how I left my last place. Someone tried to persuade me, someone sympathized, but mostly they didn't understand. And what do they understand! I always believed that a real scientist can achieve real results only through continuous work, not through connections...\nThat's how I ended up in the Zone. I asked for it myself. They organized everything for me and arranged for me as a scientific worker at a field laboratory in the exclusion zone. I was expecting great success. I simply had to prove to myself and others that I too could do something. That not only connections, stolen academic degrees and cushy spots lead to success, that one's own work also means something, one's own mind, one's own discoveries too... Now I see that all this heroism, these deprivations and ordeals lead to nothing... How stupid.
Don't blame yourself, the main thing is you finally remembered who you are...
You think what I just told you is the main thing? You think this has some meaning for me now? This is all not the main thing.
I don't understand... This is what you were striving for...

You wouldn't understand. I wasn't striving to remember, I was striving to realize myself. Now I understand this clearly. All these personal details - where I was born, where I studied, where I got married - unimportant. What's important is that I finally realized who I really am, what I'm like...\nAnd the conclusion isn't joyful: my whole life I was driven by some stupid resentment. Resentment towards others who managed to grasp, do, say, write something faster than me... This grew into ordinary envy. I couldn't accept that someone was smarter than me, more agile, more inquisitive... I couldn't accept that my wife preferred me to some office rat, he wasn't worth my little finger! I thought that everyone around were mediocrities and those with connections, that I alone achieved everything through my work, that I worked only for science. But finally I understood everything. In life I was driven only by resentment and ENVY...

You're greatly exaggerating because you're too demanding of yourself. From your story I see that you worked a lot, studied a lot, achieved good results. What's bad about that? You had positive qualities - hard work, thirst for knowledge, but for some reason you made such a strange conclusion.

What difference does it make why this conclusion? Maybe I'm too self-critical, maybe I'm too suspicious and made this up for myself, maybe Monolith suggested this to me, maybe I dreamed this... You still understood nothing. I could have pretended, deceived myself, told myself that it's not me, that I'm not like that, it's not mine. But why? For me CERTAINTY about myself is important. Before I was constantly uncertain, didn't understand what from "memories" was mine and what wasn't, wasn't sure what I was like, what drove me... Now I know. And it doesn't matter why this feeling appeared, and whether it corresponds to what YOU see in me. The main thing - I'm now certain who I am and what I'm like. I finally understood MYSELF.
What do you want to know, Doctor?
So what did you understand about yourself? Did you remember everything?
Can anyone remember everything? Nobody can remember every moment in life... Yes, I remembered some things, but that's not the main thing, the main thing is I understood who I am.
Tell me.

Why do you need this? This is my life, I needed to understand this, not you... You wanted me to understand myself, I understood... But anyway, if you want to know, I'll tell you...
In childhood we lived in the south in a small village. For some reason I only remember summer - apple orchards around, the fragrant smell of apples... I remember how we gathered them every year. Pleasant pastime, you climb trees and eat your fill...
Well, what else is there? Ordinary children's games, we all played together - we had no division into "you're from our neighborhood, and you're not from ours" - all equal. One school and practically one street for the village - the main road. That's where we played, now tag, now "cops and robbers". I loved being a cop, it gave some advantages - you could take part of the "loot"... Childhood, in a word.
Then I went to sports school, even went to competitions. Used to travel all over the Union... or Russia, I don't remember what it was then. Once I almost missed competitions - father got sick, I had to go to him, and the starts were the same days. Good thing the coach sorted everything out... And I was glad - actually I felt sorry for the money for the ticket, I was planning to buy equipment. I was always economical, saved for all sorts of trinkets - saved every penny, didn't spend for nothing. They even sometimes called me a tightwad for this... In short, what's there to tell...
Continue, I'm interested.

Then service. I didn't get to any hot spots. Quietly and peacefully served my 2 years in the northwest, between Pskov and Novgorod. True, there I got addicted to vodka. Service was quiet, no control, glass after glass, that's how I got hooked. But then the infection let go. Not immediately, but thank God I quit...\nAfter the army there was nowhere to go, but money was needed, you have to live. In the army just before demobilization they recruited us for police, so I signed up. Then police school. I wanted to get into traffic police after it. They said that if you have a head, you can do well in traffic police - not by position, of course, but "on the side"... But fate arranged that I got into criminal investigation. You can't really profit much there, but also not bad, you can let someone off, on the contrary threaten someone, take confiscated goods somewhere - enough for life...\nThen I got married, of course. I didn't throw a loud wedding - expensive. Just among our own... I remember how I met with my guys just before the wedding. We were planning a wild vacation with the guys, well I had to take back my share - wedding was coming up, not enough money. The guys didn't understand then, got offended...
And then?

Well what then - work, mostly routine... had to spin around. Sometimes we did not quite legal things, slipped bribes somewhere... I took them. And always justified myself that everyone does this, that everyone has long been mired in bribes, if I don't take, others will... Just excuses. But such is the system, in a pack of wolves a sheep is quickly driven out, and even faster eaten. Their own will eat them. That's what happened to me...\nSomeone at the very top of the region embezzled and got caught. They pulled the thread, well checks began in all police departments. Something surfaced connected to me, insignificant, but still. Later I realized it didn't just surface, somehow they needed someone for show. Someone had to have "measures taken" against them. They simply chose me and set me up. They reminded me how I once didn't want to share. That's how they squeezed me out of the system... By that time I was acquainted with one stalker, he was involved in our case. I wanted to shake things up, and money was needed - loans, credits. And that stalker told about the Zone and about good, fast loot... I listened with open ears, fool.
Don't blame yourself, the main thing is you finally remembered who you are...
You think what I just told you is the main thing? You think this has some meaning for me now? This is all not the main thing.
I don't understand... This is what you were striving for...

You wouldn't understand. I wasn't striving to remember, I was striving to realize myself. Now I understand this clearly. All these personal details - where I was born, where I studied, where I got married - unimportant. What's important is that I finally realized who I really am, what I'm like...\nAnd the conclusion isn't joyful: my whole life I was driven by greed, which eventually grew into real avarice. I was always short of money, saved, saved, but what for? To put aside for the future and save again, save... I didn't miss any opportunity to grab somewhere, where they give or where in my opinion you can take yourself. This grew into some kind of mania... My wife no longer understood this, said that I would get into trouble with this grabbing someday, that our own cops would arrest me... She was right, but didn't understand that we were all long tied to each other, that one principle operates in our organs: "one hand washes the other" or "one crow won't peck out another's eye". Unless you yourself get too carried away... Which happened to me, which led here. And all because of my AVARICE...

You're greatly exaggerating because you're too demanding of yourself. From your story I see that you fought crime, tried to improve our world. Yes, maybe sometimes the ends justified the means. But you had positive qualities - rejection of injustice, dishonesty, desire to make the world cleaner, but for some reason you made such a strange conclusion.

What difference does it make why this conclusion? Maybe I'm too self-critical, maybe I'm too suspicious and made this up for myself, maybe Monolith suggested this to me, maybe I dreamed this... You still understood nothing. I could have pretended, deceived myself, told myself that it's not me, that I'm not like that, it's not mine. But why? For me CERTAINTY about myself is important. Before I was constantly uncertain, didn't understand what from "memories" was mine and what wasn't, wasn't sure what I was like, what drove me... Now I know. And it doesn't matter why this feeling appeared, and whether it corresponds to what YOU see in me. The main thing - I'm now certain who I am and what I'm like. I finally understood MYSELF.
What do you want to know, Doctor?
So what did you understand about yourself? Did you remember everything?
Can anyone remember everything? Nobody can remember every moment in life... Yes, I remembered some things, but that's not the main thing, the main thing is I understood who I am.
Tell me.

Why do you need this? This is my life, I needed to understand this, not you... You wanted me to understand myself, I understood... But anyway, if you want to know, I'll tell you...\nIn childhood I was short, but brazen to the limit. Could go at any tall guy like a pug at an elephant. This brazenness I even liked, it gave me something - candy, sweets, gum. And also authority, probably just as small as I was. Even funny... But what else did you need in childhood?..\nI don't even want to remember my parents. Father was a plumber, a drunk, dragged everything out of the house. Mother was some painter, eternally worn out by work, life, father, me, fate... You wouldn't get a penny from them, if they bought something, it was such crap that it would've been better if they hadn't wasted money... Had to take something from life myself. We grabbed everything that wasn't nailed down. I remember at the communications depot nearby, we dragged away so much cable that you could've wired up a whole city. We burned and sold the copper. At least some of our own money. In general, we spun around as we could... In short, what's there to tell...
Continue, I'm interested.

Everything already pissed me off by then. After school what to do? Working at a machine wasn't for me - that's for suckers. Army? Well screw that - I dodged it as much as I could. And I didn't want to seriously steal either, I wasn't planning to get into adult crime. We thought up then with a buddy to bolt abroad and stay there... But then some check came to the depot, they started digging who was swiping copper and cable. There were enough of their own thieves there, but they had to blame someone for all the losses... In short, the choice was simple - either slip away to the army, and without having a scapegoat handy they'd find someone else, or get arrested and pinned with embezzlement. I, of course, chose the first. That's how I ended up in the construction battalion...\nIn that construction battalion, service wasn't service. More like pastime. I coasted through the first year, and in the second I gave up on everything. On commanders, on service, on these "fellow soldiers". Just waited for discharge. And after the army what to do? No work, and no desire to slave away... But I got lucky. Former buddies set me up. Easy job - watch over girls while they're at work, shake up or threaten a client if he starts acting tough. Like that, mostly just putting on a show... You could live, but appetites were bigger than what that "work" gave...\nSo that's how I "moonlighted", sometimes as a pimp, sometimes we covered a club, sometimes went to a meeting with someone, sometimes threatened someone... I myself didn't stick my head deep into crime - didn't want to get burned. I had buddies, of course, who were already doing time, but I spun around so that I didn't even have any arrests. I was clean.
What happened next?

I shacked up with a broad. We weren't married, just - cohabitating. What a slut she was... But the main thing for me was to have a pad and always have somewhere to crash. I myself wasn't too ceremonious with broads either - took any, soon as something stirred. Went left and right. Kids... hell knows, maybe there were some, I didn't give a damn honestly, I wasn't gonna saddle myself with anyone anyway...\nThen lived with others too... Generally, I tried not to get into serious business. Well it happened, yeah, we quietly took apartments, stole cars if the opportunity arose. But everything like that - not serious, didn't take anything from known people. That's why I got away with everything. I wasn't some hardened criminal in life, I just always knew how to cleverly work everything so I wouldn't show up anywhere. I managed to set up deals so that I didn't even have a single arrest. But... Even old women stumble sometimes. The devil made me get mixed up with drugs! If only I'd known right away what I was getting into! I told myself - don't get into this business... But it turned out that I both lost the goods and pissed away the money. Stupidly. If I'd known right away what they had me carrying, I'd never have taken it. But now... Had to tear claws to the Zone, because they surrounded me from all sides, nowhere to go. Some demand money, others the goods, and cops got on my tail, and if they arrest me, they'll pin so much dealing on me that I'd spend the rest of my life in the zone... So I chose a different Zone. Had to choose...
Don't blame yourself, the main thing is you finally remembered who you are...
You think what I just told you is the main thing? You think this has some meaning for me now? This is all not the main thing.
I don't understand... This is what you were striving for...

You wouldn't understand. I wasn't striving to remember, I was striving to realize myself. Now I understand this clearly. All these personal details - where I was born, where I studied, where I got married - unimportant. What's important is that I finally realized who I really am, what I'm like...\nAnd the conclusion isn't joyful: my whole life is some kind of complete debauchery and revelry. I spent money not earned by me, I wore things not bought by me, I had women not belonging to me... I lived like a parasite, in my whole life I created nothing at all, I only used others' stuff - stolen, taken quietly or grabbed by force. I thought that sleeping with another's woman was normal, that squandering another's was normal, that taking another's was also normal... My whole life - revelry and DEBAUCHERY... And nothing more. This is a stupid life.

I think you're exaggerating because you're probably too demanding of yourself. From your story I see that you weren't planning to live a debauched life, there wasn't this in you originally. You didn't sink so low as to consider crime normal. You understood that living like this was wrong, meaning something in you was bright. And you were ready to get on the right path. But for some reason you made such a strange conclusion.

What difference does it make why this conclusion? Maybe I'm too self-critical, maybe I'm too suspicious and made this up for myself, maybe Monolith suggested this to me, maybe I dreamed this... You still understood nothing. I could have pretended, deceived myself, told myself that it's not me, that I'm not like that, it's not mine. But why? For me CERTAINTY about myself is important. Before I was constantly uncertain, didn't understand what from "memories" was mine and what wasn't, wasn't sure what I was like, what drove me... Now I know. And it doesn't matter why this feeling appeared, and whether it corresponds to what YOU see in me. The main thing - I'm now certain who I am and what I'm like. I finally understood MYSELF.
What do you want to know, Doctor?
So what did you understand about yourself? Did you remember everything?
Can anyone remember everything? Nobody can remember every moment in life... Yes, I remembered some things, but that's not the main thing, the main thing is I understood who I am.
Tell me.

Why do you need this? This is my life, I needed to understand this, not you... You wanted me to understand myself, I understood... But anyway, if you want to know, I'll tell you...\nWe lived with my parents on the outskirts of the city - in a private sector. Father was practically a non-drinking man, he was from somewhere in the Baltics. Mother from Siberia. They worked together at some company. My parents spoiled me too much, and all because they rarely saw me. Either they had a joint business trip, or they had a joint tourist trip, or something else joint, and I was in the care of grandmothers and grandfathers. And from their side complete lack of control - do what you want, so I was an independent kid...\nI loved very much in childhood to go to the shooting gallery - father often took me when he was home. I also loved school trips. Our town was small, half an hour walk - and you're already in the forest outside town... And later in life I walked a lot on foot. So from childhood I was used to long marches, to Spartan camping conditions, to independence... Well, and I loved weapons. In childhood I didn't need anything, no cars, no toys - just a new pistol. I collected all kinds of postcards, stamps with weapons. I carved very similar copies from wood by pictures. I liked holding "weapons" in my hands, even if toy ones... In short, what's there to tell...
Continue, I'm interested.

Then I remember applying to maritime college, wanted to sail. But my independence didn't allow me then to accept barracks life and I quickly quit... Even funny, I later in life chose exactly barracks. In the army I got into special forces. To say that they drove us hard would be to say nothing. They just kept us in black body. But I liked it. I liked the uniform, I liked this languid fatigue by the end of the day when you fall asleep like dead, I liked showing off in front of others. And I liked strength, I liked flexing muscles and showing what you are...\nAfter the army I, of course, signed a contract. This wasn't surprising. I learned a lot in the army, could do a lot, knew a lot. But all this knowledge wasn't for peaceful measured life. Well then training in camps - that's what we called them - we asserted ourselves there in our own way, sometimes with fistfights, couldn't do without it. I already perfectly understood that strength decides everything. And then service. I was in hot spots, was in "peaceful dispersal" of protesters, and hostage liberation, all kinds of things...\nWith family it didn't work out. All women are fools. At least those who crossed my path. I got married, of course, to one, but then we scattered. She also turned out to be a brainless chicken...
What's next?

Well what's next... Service, assignments. Should I tell you all cases or what? And then I left. There was mass reduction of units, well I also got "reduced" under this deal. I wanted it myself, got tired of everything. I still preferred independent loner life. Got a job at a private security firm, and then... Then someone "raised" my cases, dug into the past and realized I could do something. They met with me and offered to take on one not very legal business... The first couple of clients were handled cleanly - no noise, no dust. I knew my business. Moral principles didn't worry me much - work is work, everything in this world costs something, and everyone costs something...\nAnd then the last "order". I don't even know why I agreed. Got greedy for a big score, or maybe wanted something "spicy", to play cat and mouse? Or finally use to the fullest everything I knew how to do. The job wasn't simple - the target was too noticeable a figure, constantly under guard, getting to him wasn't simple. But I managed... And at some moment I suddenly realized that I also "cost" something. I understood it with my gut, sixth sense... I was forced to go somewhere, dissolve somewhere. I chose the Zone... Now I think that wasn't the best choice...
Don't blame yourself, the main thing is you finally remembered who you are...
You think what I just told you is the main thing? You think this has some meaning for me now? This is all not the main thing.
I don't understand... This is what you were striving for...

You wouldn't understand. I wasn't striving to remember, I was striving to realize myself. Now I understand this clearly. All these personal details - where I was born, where I studied, where I got married - unimportant. What's important is that I finally realized who I really am, what I'm like...\nAnd the conclusion isn't joyful: my whole life I was driven by cruelty, which eventually grew into uncontrolled anger. I always believed that strength decides everything. But how to have strength and not use it? Of course, I used it, I demonstrated strength, I showed myself as I could... Now I see that this was stupid, foolish violence, causeless cruelty and hatred. I didn't just perform my work, I hated those who were against me, who contradicted me, who stood in my way. But this was stupid causeless hatred, causeless cruelty. My whole life I was controlled by some kind of stupid senseless ANGER, and nothing more...

You're greatly exaggerating because you're too demanding of yourself. From your story I see that you were always independent, you strived to achieve results at any cost, you never gave up. What's bad about that? You had positive qualities - determination, desire to win no matter what, but for some reason you made such a strange conclusion.

What difference does it make why this conclusion? Maybe I'm too self-critical, maybe I'm too suspicious and made this up for myself, maybe Monolith suggested this to me, maybe I dreamed this... You still understood nothing. I could have pretended, deceived myself, told myself that it's not me, that I'm not like that, it's not mine. But why? For me CERTAINTY about myself is important. Before I was constantly uncertain, didn't understand what from "memories" was mine and what wasn't, wasn't sure what I was like, what drove me... Now I know. And it doesn't matter why this feeling appeared, and whether it corresponds to what YOU see in me. The main thing - I'm now certain who I am and what I'm like. I finally understood MYSELF.
What do you want to know, Doctor?
So what did you understand about yourself? Did you remember everything?
Can anyone remember everything? Nobody can remember every moment in life... Yes, I remembered some things, but that's not the main thing, the main thing is I understood who I am.
Tell me.

Why do you need this? This is my life, I needed to understand this, not you... You wanted me to understand myself, I understood... But anyway, if you want to know, I'll tell you...\nIn childhood we lived in the north. Around the city was forest, and we always went to that forest for blueberries, for cranberries, for mushrooms. And if you went farther somewhere, there were really remote places - taiga. You could easily meet a bear nose to nose. I even remember such a case from childhood. My father and I were gathering some berries, well we met a bear. But he had no time for us then - we parted ways...\nI loved the forest, loved going for mushrooms, loved going fishing. I loved different children's camps too, there you could go somewhere on a hike. Well and generally life there wasn't like with parents. I remember, often went to my uncle's logging site, went hunting with him, he taught me everything. And for my 18th birthday he gave me my first rifle. True, then I rarely went to him, and then stopped altogether. He was offended at me for leaving his favorite dog in the forest, and wolves tore her apart... In short, what's there to tell...
Continue, I'm interested.

Then went to the army. I consider that I didn't spend time there in vain, especially since I didn't serve just anywhere, but in "ranger" units. But they just called us rangers. Actually we weren't any rangers - ordinary army, but for historical reasons some regiment was very famous. Normal service, at that time they just started checking all units for hazing. I remember a case when they demoted one sergeant to private for this and sent him to the supply unit. And deservedly so, to be honest...\nWell then. Then worked as a game warden in one reserve. True, not for long, I didn't get along there, well and one accident happened - shot a comrade in the leg, in general, everyone turned against me then, had to leave... I generally didn't get along with people somehow. My wife also left on her own, together with daughter. True, first she threw me out, supposedly kicked me out of the house for cheating. And what cheating, well I fooled around on the side, happens to everyone. But she's very principled, uncompromising... But I'm principled too - the apartment's in my name, why should I leave, if they don't like it - let them leave. So we scattered, and I won the apartment in court...\nThen worked in the north at a procurement office, and in the east in the Ussuri taiga. I wandered around Russia to my heart's content... What else to do. I'm alone, sitting in one place is boring. Well and I couldn't work long in one collective either, either you don't get along with one, or with another. So I wandered...
And then?

What then? Everything got tiresome, to be honest. Boring - everything in life became. Both in the city boring, and in the forest already not the same. You sit half a year alone in a one-room Khrushchev apartment and just wait for hunting season to open... Then half a year in the forest, also alone - I don't like partners, everyone's always dissatisfied with something, this isn't right, that isn't right. Better alone, but sometimes boring. Everything bored me, I needed to somehow shake myself up, start some new business, try myself in something extraordinary. Otherwise you can drink yourself to death or hang yourself from boredom. And here they were recruiting hunters to work in the Zone. I learned later - some institutes and private clinics sponsored an unusual project. They needed diverse genetic material, and such that you can't find in an ordinary forest. For very unusual genetic material they need very unusual little beasts that live in a very unusual zone. And hunters were needed who weren't simple either. In general, just for me something new, interesting, unexplored before. Only this could dispel my boredom. And of course, I signed up... Fool. If I'd known what I was getting into, I'd never have gotten involved in such "hunting"...
Don't blame yourself, the main thing is you finally remembered who you are...
You think what I just told you is the main thing? You think this has some meaning for me now? This is all not the main thing.
I don't understand... This is what you were striving for...

You wouldn't understand. I wasn't striving to remember, I was striving to realize myself. Now I understand this clearly. All these personal details - where I was born, where I studied, where I got married - unimportant. What's important is that I finally realized who I really am, what I'm like...\nAnd the conclusion isn't joyful: my whole life is essentially a series of deceptions and betrayals. Everyone who had dealings with me, I deceived one way or another. I cheated even on the closest people. Everyone eventually turned away from me - and rightly so, how can you live with a deceiver who screws you over at every step and justifies it every time with "circumstances". Nobody wanted to deal with me. Because my life credo is BETRAYAL.

You're greatly exaggerating because you're too demanding of yourself. From your story I see that you loved nature, traveled a lot, didn't waste life in idleness. What's bad about that? You had positive qualities - thirst for adventure, desire to learn new things, love of nature, but for some reason you made such a strange conclusion.

What difference does it make why this conclusion? Maybe I'm too self-critical, maybe I'm too suspicious and made this up for myself, maybe Monolith suggested this to me, maybe I dreamed this... You still understood nothing. I could have pretended, deceived myself, told myself that it's not me, that I'm not like that, it's not mine. But why? For me CERTAINTY about myself is important. Before I was constantly uncertain, didn't understand what from "memories" was mine and what wasn't, wasn't sure what I was like, what drove me... Now I know. And it doesn't matter why this feeling appeared, and whether it corresponds to what YOU see in me. The main thing - I'm now certain who I am and what I'm like. I finally understood MYSELF.
What do you want to know, Doctor?
So what did you understand about yourself? Did you remember everything?
Can anyone remember everything? Nobody can remember every moment in life... Yes, I remembered some things, but that's not the main thing, the main thing is I understood who I am.
Tell me.

Why do you need this? This is my life, I needed to understand this, not you... You wanted me to understand myself, I understood... But anyway, if you want to know, I'll tell you...\nI spent my childhood in one southern town. We all played together in the yard. I remember we baked potatoes in bonfires in the yards... Normal childhood in general. Only my parents interested me little. Mother kept trying to raise me. I don't remember father at all. Mother said he never existed. She then tried to somehow arrange her life, well and stepfather appeared. I was afraid of him. He was a man of harsh temper, slightest thing wrong - a cuff to the head. Then he left us and seemingly drank himself to death...\nIn those times they started installing all kinds of gaming machines in every store, we still called them scam machines. And then they even organized a real gaming club. I went in somehow... and never came out, so to speak. The game captivated me, possessed me so much that I didn't think about anything else. I always liked the game, liked this anticipation of luck, this fortune... Though the first big loss strongly shook my consciousness. I couldn't understand how such a thing was possible. I always wanted to be financially independent, and here I started getting into debt. And what debt - I seriously thought about where I could steal money. And for what? To spend on the game... In short, what's there to tell...
Continue, I'm interested.

But thank God I didn't sink to theft - got drafted into the army. Not service, but boredom and bonded life. Good thing at least I didn't have to think about where to get money for the game. One entertainment - shooting twice a month. I even invented a game then - who faster, more accurately and technically puts down all targets. We played among ourselves, between squads, pair by pair, young against old... Different ways. In general, the only good memory about the army...\nThen I married foolishly. But family life didn't work out. Wife and her sisters, and more the mother-in-law, nagged every day that I bring nothing to the house, that I lose all money in the machines... Not a family, but a sawmill. I left them...\nLater computer clubs already appeared in our shabby town. There I understood that you can not just play, you can earn with your mind. This isn't just stupid hope for chance, for a lucky combination. No. Poker or preference - this is strategy, this is a thinking process, well and plus luck. I never considered myself a fool, whatever mother-in-law said. So I switched to card games...
And then what?

Same thing. In streaks - sometimes lucky, sometimes not. Either you hit the jackpot and live it up, or you borrow, beg, pawn something... And so in waves. But I was waiting for my chance, I was always sure that sooner or later the bird of luck would sit on my shoulder too. And then I'd grab it and never let it out of my hands...\nAnd one day I hit the "jackpot". That's what I thought then. After some raid on our club in a garden nearby I found a suitcase stuffed with bucks. The raid wasn't for nothing - someone gave a tip that the club was covered by drug dealers. Understanding and connecting the events wasn't difficult, I perfectly understood what this money was and why so much in one place, but there was no strength to refuse it. But how to live with money and not playing? Of course, they noticed me, noticed what stakes I was making, connected events and facts and understood that this money didn't fall from heaven... Then a black streak began. There was a serious conversation with serious people, they demanded to return "someone else's", otherwise... By that time I had less than a quarter of that sum left. And I decided to win it back. And then I bet everything on the bank... But I lost...\nWhat was the point of killing me? You can't get anything from the dead. And they just sent me to the Zone. To work off the debt. Everything was like in a fog there, so I don't remember how they arranged everything, probably they pumped me with something then, because I "gifted" them the apartment, and all remaining savings... everything I had. Such an idiotic life of an ordinary idiot...
Don't blame yourself, the main thing is you finally remembered who you are...
You think what I just told you is the main thing? You think this has some meaning for me now? This is all not the main thing.
I don't understand... This is what you were striving for...

You wouldn't understand. I wasn't striving to remember, I was striving to realize myself. Now I understand this clearly. All these personal details - where I was born, where I studied, where I got married - unimportant. What's important is that I finally realized who I really am, what I'm like...\nAnd the conclusion isn't joyful: in my whole life I never worked anywhere. Laziness and idleness - that's my life motto. I never thought about work, about honest labor. I always strived for easy money and easy life. I easily spent sums that I didn't earn myself, I didn't even think that money doesn't come for free, but for some kind of labor. It seemed to me that money was obligated to fall at my feet just like that. I wasn't planning to work for it somehow, I just made bets and waited for a miracle... In my whole life I never lifted a finger. My life is IDLENESS and nothing more.

You're greatly exaggerating because you're too demanding of yourself. From your story I see that hope never left you, you never gave up - even in a difficult situation, you strived for success by the shortest path. What's bad about that? You had positive qualities - faith in yourself, hope for success, but for some reason you made such a strange conclusion.

What difference does it make why this conclusion? Maybe I'm too self-critical, maybe I'm too suspicious and made this up for myself, maybe Monolith suggested this to me, maybe I dreamed this... You still understood nothing. I could have pretended, deceived myself, told myself that it's not me, that I'm not like that, it's not mine. But why? For me CERTAINTY about myself is important. Before I was constantly uncertain, didn't understand what from "memories" was mine and what wasn't, wasn't sure what I was like, what drove me... Now I know. And it doesn't matter why this feeling appeared, and whether it corresponds to what YOU see in me. The main thing - I'm now certain who I am and what I'm like. I finally understood MYSELF.
I heard you're looking for people for some business?
Exactly, I'm looking. Or rather, we're looking. And you're probably the first this concerns. In all senses.
You shouldn't beat around the bush, say it like it is.

Alright, alright... Anyway, about those document fragments you dragged from the laboratory in Dark Valley.\nWe consulted with smart people here and came to the conclusion that we might be able to make some protection from the "Brain Scorcher's" effect. Like a helmet. Only not everything's clear.
So what? Make it. What's the problem?

Not enough data! You only brought one volume out of several. Judging by existing references in this volume, the data we need is in others. Only where are they, all these papers? Also, fragmentary data is reported in documents that got to stalkers from the destroyed evacuation convoy. Several sheets from there you also brought to Sidorovich along with some album, remember?
Yeah. And why the hell do you need me? You've got a whole spetsnaz nearby, all kinds of generals with colonels... Let them search.

They did search! Sent two groups of guys armed to the teeth! One in Dark Valley fell in a skirmish with bandits, the other... Nothing known about the other. Somewhere in the Gut they vanished into thin air. But it would be logical to comb through all surroundings of the destroyed convoy once more...\nIt's not force that's needed in this business, but skill. Skill to survive, skill to assess the situation, skill to find a way to negotiate.\nYou managed to get into the underground, into that very X-18 where this whole mess was cooked up. Try once more. Docent says that if computer blocks remained there, you can check the hard drives in them.
Whether there were computers there or not, I don't remember...
You search there carefully, these things look like:\n
That's if I go there.

So go. Try it. According to Docent, there were at least three computers there that could have the information we're interested in. And definitely drop by the Gut. I feel in my gut, not everything's been carted away there yet.\nIf it works out, we'll be able to make protection - then opportunities will open up for everyone! For us, for stalkers, and for you.
If I agree, then I need equipment. And this... in that X-18 a flamethrower would be very useful. You wouldn't happen to have one?
A flamethrower?! What the hell do you need it for?
There are dozens of those flying creatures there, poltergeists, about ten per level. Fire against such evil is just the thing, isn't it?

Ah... I don't know, I don't know. One stalker dropped by here once, long time ago though. He had this... lighter. He bragged - monsters burn from it like matches. In a drunken frenzy he chased rats around the bar, almost started a fire. He said that Screw, a Freedom drunk, personally cobbled this thing for him. And later a rumor went around that on Wild Territory a bloodsucker finished off this flamethrower guy, along with that piece of iron. Apparently not all monsters burn equally well. Heh-heh...
On Wild... Well, throw me some gear anyway.

Everyone needs something. You're not the only clever one. I already sent ten volunteers searching. And I'll send many more. So think - should I shower each one with goods without being sure that these goods will be put to use?\nFind something useful, then we'll talk more specifically about reward. Well if not - then not. Understand? Anyway, I've said everything, whether to go somewhere and search for something is for you to decide.
About documents from the convoy that's in the Gut.
Got something worthwhile? Otherwise one wise guy here tried to foist old accounting files on me under the guise of something interesting... I hope you don't take me for a fool?
Haven't given you reason so far. Joke. Anyway, I think I found what you need. Here, see for yourself.
Nothing yet... I'll go take another look, perhaps.

Yes, looks like it. To say for sure, I need time.\nWhat else? Ah, yes... I owe you a treat. Here: drinks, snacks, and water, in case you get thirsty. Just make sure no drunken brawls here at my place.
Go on, go on. Go... We're doing common business after all.
About hard drives from the underground.
Found something or what?
I went down into that lab once more. Look what I managed to find.
Nothing yet, but I remember your request. I'll get your drives for sure... later.

Hmm... Yeah, brought all three pieces. That's good. Now I need time to figure out what's what there. We'll think it over.\nI owe you a glass of red... Just kidding, kidding. I promised a reward - choose. Want a recipe? Very useful artifact comes out. Or give you an artifact... a very good one?
Don't drag it out, Marked One, with this business. What if someone else wants to rummage in the lab after you? They might take out the last thing of any value...
Give me the recipe. I'll see what useful comes out there.
Give me the artifact. I'll see how good it is.
I'll upload the information to your PDA.
Good one, don't doubt it.
Oh, hello. How's life treating you... What hurts?
Hmm. Hurts? Well, it aches. Why suddenly?
Suddenly? First time here or what? I'm Boryan. Everyone knows me. I help with all kinds of ailments. What's your name?
I'm Marked One. Boryan? Doctor? Swamp? Another one?

You mean him, the Swamp Doctor? No. He showed me some things, gave advice. He wasn't here, not in our swamp - somewhere on the other side, from the Belarusian sector of the Zone. And I'm like - gathering herbs, drying them. Good tinctures come from them. For hemorrhoids, boils... Also so the guts work normally. Otherwise, from the local life, as they say, if not diarrhea, then scrofula... Helps people, so they thank me with what they can.
Well. I don't know. Boils don't seem to bother me and everything's fine with my stomach. But I'll keep it in mind.
Keep it, keep it. If anything - come to me. And if you're ever nearby on business - drop by, sometimes need to pass herbs to someone sick. You take them - you'll be thanked. You'll earn something.
What wind brought you to our Swamps? Health in order? Well okay...
Well, what do you usually need?
Me? Hmm... Nothing, I guess. I mean from what stalkers could offer.\nThough...\nThere's something I sometimes need. You heard about the local hunters' sausage?
Uh... Yeah, smells pretty strong...
Yeah, that's right. But for some healer recipes I invented, I need a broth from such sausage. So if you have their sausage, bring it, it'll be useful.
Really? And what in exchange?
