I have a small supply of medicine. The soldiers here, nearby, by the tower, often drop by. Sometimes bloating, sometimes constipation, and sometimes diarrhea happens. I brew them decoctions, and they throw me some drugs. Drop by them if you haven't been yet, they're tight on food. Maybe you can help each other somehow.\nSo I'll trade sausage for medicine. Bring a couple sausages - get antirad or I'll give you an army medical kit. Agreed?
Hmm, I'll think about it. Maybe.
I have hunting sausage...
Yeah, that's good. Medkit or antirad? What will you take?
Here's a couple sausages, I'll take the medkit.
I'll take antirad, here's a couple sausages.
I'll think about it for now. Maybe later.
Well, here, take the medkit. Maybe you have more sausages? Will you take medicine?
Yeah, here you go. I have more drugs. Well? Trading?
You said you'd push PDAs for money?
For a thousand bucks - I'll give five. For two grand, wholesale - a dozen. And for four grand - twenty-five devices.
Alright, here's a check for a thousand.
Wholesale? Here are checks for two thousand bucks.
Wow! Then here are the checks. Four thousand.
I'll wait. Maybe later.
Well, man! Here you go - one, two, three, four, five... A woodpecker went out for a walk... If you need more - come by...
You're quite the dealer... Here, as I said, all twelve. If you need more - drop by.
You're a banker, as I see... Money to burn! Why even sit in the Zone with such cash? Silent? Well, your business. Here, take it, as promised.
Woodpecker? Well, well...
Yeah, I'll drop by...
I need to. That's why I'm here.
Need an electrochimera kidney, urgently.

Wow, look at you getting worked up! Urgently! Kidney! Eh... You know how hard it is to take down an electrochimera? A couple brave souls, the rest already - greased their heels to the heavens... On the mainland you can get bi-i-ig money for such a kidney.
Well... Since we're talking money: how much?
Let's say... If we figure it out. Anyway... Alright! Just for you and just today! An attraction of unseen generosity: one thousand bucks! Can you handle it?
I already said: a thousand in currency! Deal?
Alright, need the kidney. Here's the check.
Hold onto it for now, I'll come back with a check for that amount.
Yeah. I undersold it, however. Alright. A man said it - a man did it! Take it, got it by chance. Don't mind that it's a bit wilted...
I'll hold it. But not for long! I have a couple enthusiasts for this business, just don't feel like going anywhere right now...
Hey there. Why so ruffled?
You'd be ruffled here too... Listen, Marked One, help me out a bit with one thing. You're a nimble guy, shouldn't be any problems.
What are you talking about?

Well, see, I'm defending this checkpoint, but I don't have serious weapons. Right now there's no "heavy artillery" in the warehouse, and mutants, you see yourself, come in packs... Lately they've gone completely crazy. Look, last night a pack of pseudodogs almost broke through, barely stayed alive...
I understand... And what do you suggest?

Get an RPK machine gun. With this baby even a mouse won't slip through here, we'll mow down all this scum from a kilometer away. And you won't be at a loss either, the road here will become cleaner. Including for you. Well, and don't worry about the reward, of course. So how about it, will you get the machine gun?
And where am I supposed to get you an RPK?

At Agroprom there's a warrant officer, called Sherstyuk. You can get proper gear from him, military stuff, straight from the warehouse. He really respects vodka. Try to make a deal with him. Just don't drag it out too long. As reward I'll give you medicine and grenades. We have plenty of that stuff.
Alright, we'll see. If it works out, I'll bring the machine gun.
No, I won't get involved in this business.
Plichko, a Duty member at the Bar, asked to find him an RPK machine gun to more effectively hold the approaches to the Bar
So, still defending everything? Got you a machine gun. This baby's a beast!
Thanks, Marked One. You really helped me out! Let's get it over here quickly. Now we won't let the enemy through and you'll walk more peacefully on the road.
And where are the bullets? I bet there were armor-piercing ones too, you kept them for yourself? What am I supposed to shoot with?
In your joy, you didn't forget about the reward?
Here's what was promised. As we agreed.
Ten grenades and five medkits for a new RPK?!
Also write down the recipe, Duty pays its debts.
This, of course, changes things, but next time I'll think... Is it even worth it?
Don't get worked up, we'll load it now.
\nSidorovich asked to bring a package from the pig farm behind the embankment
Maybe I can go somewhere else, bring what's needed?

There's one trivial little matter. At the farm behind the embankment, my guys left me a batch of goods. The young punks from the village didn't come close, got scared, the youth. Recently fleshes settled there. But you, I see, are a risky guy, would go take a look. Will you take it on, or should I look for someone else?
I'll take it. I'm not in a hurry anywhere for now.
No, ask others.
That's settled then. And I'll figure out in the meantime how to reward you.
I was at the farm, found your goods.
And how is it there?
Fleshes tore your courier apart. And you could have warned me about a whole crate. Barely managed to carry it.
Well-well, what are you complaining about, sickly... Here's for the work...
Could have shared a couple cans. Otherwise here you'll stretch your legs from hunger without any fleshes.

Want to eat? Fine, you convinced me, otherwise really... you'll die before your time. And here, take this sawed-off too, it's just lying under the table doing nothing. I used it here at first, when I was still setting up this little room, chased rats with it, been lying there since then.
\nSidorovich asked to bring some sausage for testing from Ignat, who is in the Gut
Sidorovich, maybe throw me another easy job?
Hmm... Look at you, "easy". Have you been to the "Gut"? Talked with the hunters at the old sawmill?
Hmm... Look at you, "easy". Heard about the "Gut", the local hunters, the sawmill?
Nimble mentioned that it was because of this "Gut" that he had all his troubles.
Should eat less crap. Troubles he has... Got the whole area up in arms. Anyway... So, now about the "Gut", listen carefully.
Sidorovich, I'm listening, don't drag it out.

The boss at that sawmill is Ignat, go to him. They, the hunters, set up sausage production there, should bring some for testing. Nobody decent will dare eat it anyway for now, but we can test the "excrement" on Wolf's loafers. They don't give a damn what to chase vodka with.
Well, yes. Ignat is their boss there.
Just to this Ignat I have business. They set up sausage production there, should bring some for testing. We'll test the "excrement" on Wolf's loafers. They don't give a damn what to chase vodka with.
Sidorovich, didn't you think that from indigestion they might mess up your whole bunker? I don't see any other latrines around here.
You, Marked One, watch your tongue. I'm still being nice, that's why I'm having conversations with you. Otherwise Stasik there can instantly instill respect for elders.
Yeah, don't get worked up. What needs to be done?

I'll give you a good artifact, and you try to trade it for sausage. How you make a deal with Ignat is your business. Just keep in mind: if you decide to pocket the artifact and go about your business, spitting on my task - you'll regret it. I'm waiting for news for two days, and then... I'm not the "UN", of course, but sanctions will follow, don't doubt it. Do such conditions suit you?
I don't like being rushed. What if something goes wrong and I don't meet the deadline?! No way, look for others.
Alright, I agree. Only they probably demand payment for passage to the "Gut". And back too.
Marked One, you can shoot dog tails on the way yourself. Or should I run there?
You convinced me, give me your artifact.
No way, let your potential test subjects chase the mutts.
Take the artifact and medicine for the road. Just look - don't lose the artifact. We'll talk about reward later. And remember: you have two days. Time's ticking.
How businesslike we are. You'll get your sausage.
Ignat, I'm here on business, from Sidorovich.
And what does that old geezer want?
He wants to take some of your sausage for testing. Arrange a belly feast for the boys in the village. Heh-heh...
Why such generosity? The sausage isn't cheap... Or something else?
Don't know, he asked me to find out about a batch. I came to ask. Where he puts it is his business. So what do you want for the sausage?
What do I want? And what does he offer? Huh?
He told me to give you an artifact as payment.
He said you'd figure it out on the spot. Says you surely have some task. I do for you, you do for me. Well, you get it.
Really? Well, show me what that miser spent on.
Here, take it.
Actually, you know... I could use this artifact myself. Any other options? Sidor hinted that you might have some task. I'd help you, you'd help me. How about it?
Well, the artifact's not bad. I'll give ten sausages for testing. And tell Sidor that if he decides to take a bigger batch, the payment will be appropriate, he won't get away with just artifacts.
Alright, I'll pass it on. See you.

What an old schemer. Well... I have one matter. At the northern station, not far from here, a group of our hunters is keeping watch. Need to take them a package, buckshot, food, and some vodka. And bring me some monster stuff from them. If you take it on, I'll give Sidor ten sausages for testing. So, how about it?
Something doesn't appeal to me about this idea. How about the artifact? Look what Sidorovich provided me with to make you more agreeable.
If it's really not far, I'll take a walk, what the hell.
Heh-heh... Take a walk, take a walk. Ask for Kitayets there. Take this box.
Heavy, damn thing. Well, I'm off.
I'm from Ignat, brought a package.
Yeah, we've been waiting, give it here.
Take the box. Ignat said you'd have a package for him too.
Yes, there's something, shot a bit. Will you manage to carry it?
I'll manage, don't worry.
Ignat, you bastard!
Why are you yelling for the whole area to hear?
You could have warned me that there are monsters there like sardines in a can!
Get used to it, Marked One, this is the Zone, not some "taking a walk"...
Alright, never mind. Here's the package, give me the sausage... I'm going.
I'll give ten sausages for testing. And tell Sidor that if he decides to take a bigger batch, the payment will be appropriate, need to discuss it separately.
Alright, I'll pass it on. See you.
I was at Ignat's. He gave ten sausages.
You showed up, didn't get dusty. I was already thinking they chopped you up for sausage yourself. Why so few? Or did you already kill all the monsters in the Gut, huh?
There are plenty of monsters there. Ignat said this is for testing, if you order a batch, the payment will need to be discussed separately. Take your sausage.
Look how everyone's become so enterprising. Penny-pinchers.
Look who's talking. You didn't forget about the reward?
I remember, take it, everything's useful in the Zone.
I remember, take it, everything's useful in the Zone.
You know Brom? There's such a wayward Duty member.
How can you remember everyone... So, what about your Brom?

He's not mine, but I have an interest in him. He's asking for help. Says only your tinctures are his remaining hope. He drinks heavily, doesn't know moderation. Any moment now they'll kick him out of Duty, if they haven't already...
There are those without moderation, like half the Zone. It seems to give relief, but many stalkers die doing drunk things. Yes, it's trouble... And what do you need from me?
Well, maybe some decoction or tincture? I don't know, you're the healer.

You say you have an interest in him? Then like this: for now go to Pakhom, well, the one who's the supply manager for the scientists. Take a container from him, collect some jellyfish, and I'll gather the necessary herbs in the meantime... Agreed?
Hmm, I'll think about it. Maybe.
I brought a jar with jellyfish.

Yeah, good. Here's a packet with herbs... How to brew what, how much to take - I wrote it on paper, it's inside. Let him drink it for ten days, then either he'll come himself, or send someone... Well, if he's still alive.
I see. And for memory, from amnesia, you don't have anything?
I deal more with bodily ailments, and memory is a delicate matter, you need a serious specialist for that.
Well, thanks for that too. I'll go make the drunk happy.
In exchange for the "Electrobus" recipe, Semenov asks to get an electrochimera kidney
The bartender asked to search for missing parts of documents in the area of the convoy in the Gut. The information that may be in them will help in constructing protection from the "Brain Scorcher"

The bartender asked to get at least three hard drives from computer blocks in laboratory X-18. Presumably, the information stored on them will help in constructing protection from the "Brain Scorcher"
To repair Strelok's AK, Lisaped needs: AKM assault rifle, SIG SG 552 Commando assault rifle, a check for one thousand dollars. The weapons must be in good condition.
I got this rifle here, they say it's Strelok's own.
Can't be! Come on, let me see.
Look.
Yeah... interesting, interesting, only this is no longer, you could say, a rifle, but a pile of rusty parts.
That's why I came to you. Maybe you'll take on repairing it?
Maybe I will. Honestly, I'm interested to tinker with it myself. By the way, where did you find it?
In some underground.
Then it's clear why it's in such condition.
So, should I throw it out?
There's always time for that. Give me time to figure it out, think about it, maybe I'll come up with something. I mostly work with standard weapons, and this is such a cannon.
So when should I come by?
Come by tomorrow, about the same time.
I won't bother you, get to work.
So what about Strelok's rifle, figured it out?
I told you how much time I'd need. Not ready to give an answer yet.
I took a look, complex construction. You can tell right away that a skilled master made it.
I know that already. Can you fix it?

I already told you that I mainly work with standard weapons, and this rifle has a lot of non-standard parts. There's both our stuff and western. I can try to restore everything, but I need spare parts and mechanisms. I don't have those right now. Bring them, then we'll discuss.
What do you need? I hope I won't have to rob a military depot.
No. I'll need just a couple rifles. One - AK for 7.62, and the second... something foreign, with a different automation scheme.
More specifically, what exactly?

Then write it down. I need an AKM and... let's say, SIG SG 552 Commando. Practically the same Kalashnikov, only Swiss. Of course, everything must be in good condition. From junk only junk will come out. And my advice to you: don't use Strelok's rifle for now if you hope to fix it. Everything's held together by spit right now. Start shooting - you'll ruin it completely.
Clear. That's all?
For parts - yes. And for the work - a thousand bucks. Check to bearer. You can get one through traders, if you don't know. How's that, suits you?
Lisaped, haven't you lost your mind asking such prices?! Screw such repair. Give back the piece of iron.
You really went overboard! Alright, you'll have both guns and money. I hope it's worth it.
Take it back, could have been a good specimen.
For now take back your scrap metal, and when you gather everything, then come again.
Deal.
Got it, I'll come by later.
I gathered everything on the list, as you asked.
What are you talking about?
For repairing Strelok's rifle, we agreed. Here.
And the payment?
Do the job - you'll get paid.
Well... alright, I'll trust you. Come by in a couple days, I think I'll manage.
I won't bother you, get to work.
How's the repair going, making progress?
It's progressing. And it'll progress faster if I'm not distracted by trivialities. Come by later.
I'm just... just checking, maybe you need something else.
What about payment?
Tight on cash, won't you believe in debt?
They only believe in debt in "Duty", but you need to keep your word! We agreed - a check for a thousand bucks for the work.
Alright, don't stress, you'll get your check...
Here you go, Kulibina.

Yeah, all good. Look what a beauty came out. High rate of fire, accurate, you can put this "Eotech" collimator sight on the sight rail. Comes free in the package - appreciate my kindness. I'm also giving several upgraded magazines with a clever spring of my own design. They fit five more rounds. And take some rounds too, left over from test firing. You can try it out right away.
Looks gorgeous, thanks! Let's see how it performs in action.
